loans.name: Noung

texts.en:
Mrs. Noung P. is a married 36 year old mother of three schoolgoing children. She runs a store selling grocery products and meat (pork and fish) in her community. Her store enables her to earn about $5 a day. Her husband (pictured here) works as a motor-taxi driver and also earns approximately $5 each day.

Mrs. Noung P. is requesting a $500 loan to increase her inventory by adding more grocery items and meat, which she hopes will help her increase her earnings.

loans.use: To increase her inventory by adding more grocery items.

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Mrs. Sou H. is 48 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Her husband is a landlord and earns about $8 each day. To supplement his income, she runs a small laundry shop in her area, making about $3 a day. Two of her children work in a garment factory and the other two are in secondary school.

Due to an increase in the number of their tenants, this couple hopes to use this $1,000 loan to build additional rooms. By doing so, they will be able to cater to their growing tenant base and earn more with which to support their family.

loans.use: To build more rooms to accommodate more tenants.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John Kadonge is married man, with seven children.
He has a business sellling menswear in a rented shop. Because of the high competition in this type of business, John is planning to increase his sales by using an outdoor selling strategy (selling at kiosks on the street). To do this, he needs to buy a second-hand mini truck to transport the clothes to the different kiosks. John has saved some money which he will add to a loan of  $1200  to purchase the truck. He plans to repay the loan in a period of 8 months

loans.use: Purchase of a truck

loans.name: Naim

texts.ru:
Naim has been selling canned goods for 10 years. He is married with 2 children and has a secondary school education. Naim’s wife helps him in his business and his children study in school. He started his business by selling glass canning jars.

Naim became a client of MicroInvest in 2004. Back then his inventory was worth $350. Slowly after getting a loan he added canned goods to his product selection (juice, tomato paste, jam, etc.) and got a new business location. Today he has increased his inventory to $1200. He plans to use the new loan to open a store.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ахмедов Наим вот уже 10лет занимается продажей консервных изделий. Женат, имеет двоих детей. Жена помогает ему в торговле, дети учатся в школе. Образование у Наима среднее. Начал свою деятельность с продажи стеклянных банок для консервирования. Клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» стал в 2004году, тогда его товарооборот составлял 350$. Постепенно после получения займа он добавил в свой ассортимент консервные изделия (сок, томатная паста, варенье и т.д.), приобрел новое место деятельности. Сейчас он увеличил товарооборот до 1200$. На будущее планирует открыть магазин.

loans.use: to open a store

loans.name: Najhminiso

texts.ru:
Najhminiso has been selling children’s clothing and women’s lingerie for 12 years. She is 48 years old, is widowed and has 2 children. She has a secondary education. Both of her sons work and each has their own family. After her husband died, life was hard and she started selling children’s clothing to improve her quality of life.

Najhminiso became a client of MicroInvest in 2007. After getting a loan she expanded her inventory, and added women’s lingerie to her product selection. She plans to use this loan to improve her business location and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ёкубова Начминисо вот уже 12лет занимается продажей детской одеждой и женским нижним бельем. Ей 48лет, вдова, мать двоих детей. Образование среднее. Оба сыновья работают и каждый имеет отдельную семью. После смерти мужа, поскольку жить стало тяжело она начала заниматься торговлей детской одежды, для улучшения уровня жизни. Начала она кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест» в 2007году. После получения займа она расширила ассортимент товара, добавила в свой ассортимент и женское нижнее бельё. В будущем планирует улучшить место деятельности и улучшить уровень жизни.

loans.use: improve place of busines and quality of life

loans.name: Success

texts.en: Mrs. Success O. is a married woman of 35 years with 3 children. She has a chemist store where she sells medicines. She is  proud of her business. She needs an additional loan to buy drugs direct from the manufacture/distributor to enable her  to sell  wholesale, which will lead to an increase of her income. Success   has had this business for four years.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Bifotima

texts.ru:
Bifotima is 30 years old. She is divorced and has 2 children. Bifotima has a secondary school education, both of her sons go to school. After her divorce, Bifotima started selling children’s clothing because she was responsible for supporting her family. In the evenings, after trading she works in a candy factory.

Bifotima has been a MicroInvest client since 2003. Back then her assets were worth $100. Gradually after step by step borrowing she increased her inventory by $450 and improved the quality of her family’s life. She plans on using her next loan to purchase a store.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хайдаровой Бифотиме 30лет. Разведенная, имеет двух детей. Образование среднее. Оба сына ходят в школу. После того как развелась с мужем, начала продавать детскую одежду, поскольку вся забота о семье свалилось на ее плечи. После торговли она вечером работает в кондитерском цехе. Кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест» начала 2003году, тогда её активы составляли 100$. Постепенно после шагового кредитования она увеличила товарооборот на 450$, улучшила уровень семейной жизни. В дальнейшем после получения большой суммы займа хочет приобрести магазин.

loans.use: to open a store

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Mrs. Rita I.  lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is a 43 year old woman with 6 children.  Mrs Rita has been a leader of her union for 4 years. Drink and make up are products some people cannot do without each day says Mrs. Rita. She hopes to improve her business with a loan of $800. Mrs Rita has been in this business since 2004.

loans.use: To buy drinks & makeup for sale.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mrs. Mercy A., who lives in Goodwill Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria  is 51 years old, married with 5 children. She has been with LAPO for 4 years as a Secretary of her union and and has had her  business since 2001. She hopes to expand her business after receiving the loan.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en: Mrs. Loveth E. is 34 years old, married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She derives pleasure in fixing weavon, braiding of hair and decorating brides with beads for the wedding ceremony . Mrs. Loveth hopes to improve her business with the loan amount. She is a leader of her union and has 7 years of experience in her business.

loans.use: To buy more weavon and beads for sale.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: E. Rita is 29 years of age, single but has a child. She has been in business for 14 years. She sells drinks; hair products & sells recharge cards. She hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the requested loan to buy more recharge cards, drinks, relaxer and hair cream for sale. She equally hopes to buy a sewing machine with herloan. She has been in LAPO for 4 years as a secretary of her union.

loans.use: To buy more recharge cards, drinks, relaxer and hair cream for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary A. is a 43 year old woman  with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions & foodstuffs to her community. Mary has been with LAPO for 5 years and she is proud of being a client. She hopes to improve her business and purchase a refrigerator with the requested loan. She has been in this business since 1992.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale and to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: "People cannot do without food" says Mrs. Victoria I. who lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. A 30 year old woman Victoria is married with 3 children. She sells rice, oil, salt and beans to her community. Victoria hopes to buy more rice, oil, salt and beans for sale with the the requested  loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Mirzorahmat

texts.ru:
Mirzorahmat H. prepares and sells salads and canned foods. He has been in business for 9 years. Mirzorahmat is single and has high school education. After his father died, as the oldest son, Mirzorahmat took over responsibility for his mother, who taught him his trade. Mirzorahmat used to take orders at home. Gradually, as he acquired many clients, Mirzorahmat purchased a trading spot at a market. In 2005, when Mirzorahmat received his first loan from MicroInvest, his business assets were worth $200. At that time, he loaned the food ingredients from his suppliers. Gradually, as he invested his loan funds, Mirzorahmat began to pay upfront to his suppliers. He also purchased vats to marinate cucumbers and tomatoes. Today, the value of Mirzorahmat’s business increased to $1000. In the future, he plans to purchase wholesale the food ingredients for canning. P.S. Mirzorahmat’s mother is on the photo.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Хошимов Мирзорахмат занимается изготовлением салата и закручиванием консервированных изделий уже 9лет. Холост, образование среднее. После смерти отца так, как он старший сын в семье начал помогать матери в семейной жизни. Он научился этой профессией у матери, поскольку она помогает в торговле и изготовлении салатов. Раньше он брал заказ на дому. Постепенно приобрел много клиентов, а также место на рынке. Начал кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест» в 2005году, его активы в то время составляли 200$. Он брал сырье у поставщиков в долг. Постепенно после получения займа он начал закупать товар за наличные, приобрел бочки для маринования огурцов и помидоров. Сейчас его активы составляют 1000$. На будущее хочет оптом закупать материалы для консервирования. P.S. На фото его мать.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of food ingredients for canning

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: "I am happy to be LAPO client", says Mrs. Faith B., who lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells wood and has been in this business since 1997. She is a leader of her union and hopes to buy more wood with the requested loan. Mrs. Faith is 49 years old, married with 5 children.

loans.use: To buy more wood

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Glady A. is 42 years old, and is happily married with 3 children. She hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been with LAPO for 2 years as a member of a union that sells wooden planks. She has been in this business for 2 years & she sells planks in her community. Gladys needs a loan to buy more wood for sale.

loans.use: To buy more wood

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: "LAPO has been a source of joy to my business," says Mrs. Mercy E., who is married with 2 children, and 45 years old. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, and is secretary of her union in LAPO.  She has 6 years experience in her business. She sells planks and wishes to expand her business with the above loan

loans.use: To buy more wood

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru:
Gulnora K., 41 is married and has 3 children. Her husband has a seasonal job selling vegetables; her children are in school. Gulnora has a high school education. Gulnora’s oldest son helps her to sell. Before becoming a MicroInvest client in 2006, Gulnora relied on high-interest loans from illegal lenders. Having earned a reputation of responsible borrower and with the help of MicroInvest tiered credit program, Gulnora began to pay cash to purchase her goods and personally deliver them. She also increased the assortment of the goods sold. The value of Gulnora’s business assets grew up to $600. In the future, she plans to offer fashionable clothing for all ages.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Каримова Гулнора 41лет. Замужем, мать троих детей. Муж занимается сезонной торговлей овощей, дети учатся в школе. Образование среднее. Старший сын помогает матери в торговле. Стала клиентом “Микроинвест” в 2006 году. До этого брала средства для оборота у местных нелегальных кредиторов под большие процентные ставки. Благодаря пошаговому кредитованию и ее ответственностью перед политикой МЗФ она стала покупать товар за наличные, стала ездить за товаром сама, увеличила ассортимент товара. Сейчас ее активы достигли около 600$ . А в будущем планирует привозить модные одежды для всех поколений.

loans.use: Increase variety of goods sold

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: "LAPO has been a source of financial help to my business since 2005," says Mrs. Vero E., who lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells planks, as do the other 5 members of her community association.  She is  53 years old, and married with 5 children. She has been in this business since 1996 and needs the above loan to buy more wood for sale.

loans.use: To buy more wood for sale

loans.name: Hamira

texts.ru:
Hamira S., 45 is married mother of 3 children. Her youngest daughter helps Hamira in her business. Hamira has high school education. In the past, Hamira worked as a seamstress and her husband was a builder. They earned enough to pay for their needs. Since perestroika both Hamira and her husband began to sell. Now, while her husband is away working as a seasonal laborer in the neighboring countries, Hamira is the one responsible for providing for her family and raising her children. While taking care of her daughters, Hamira managed to expand her business. She joined MicroInvest in 2003 and took the first loan of $90. Today, Hamira’s line of credit reached $1400, which illustrates that Hamira has been a disciplined borrower since the beginning of her relationship with MicroInvest. In the future, Hamira plans to increase the assortment of goods and open a new trading spot. P.S. Hamira’s daughter is on the photo.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Сражидинова Хамира – 45 лет, замужем . Мать троих детей из которых младшая помогает ей в торговле. Образование среднее. Раньше работала на фабрике швеей а муж строителем , что позволял семье покрывать житейские финансовые расходы. После перестройки в стране, они оба стали заниматься торговлей. Сейчас муж на заработках в соседних странах, а она, приняв все тяжести жизни на свои плечи, продолжает расти дочерей и заодно увеличить товарооборот. Начала кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест» в 2003 году с 90$. А сейчас ее активы достигают 1400$ ,что показывает, что она очень дисциплинированно кредитуется в МЗФ с начинания ее деятельности. В будущем планирует расширить ассортимент и открыть еще одну торговую точку. P.S. На фото её дочь.

loans.use: Increase the assortment of goods and open a new trading spot

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: "I have benefited from LAPO and wish the above loan will be approve for me. I need the loan to buy more wood," says Mrs. Elizabeth O., who has 13 years experience in the sale of planks.  Elizabeth sells planks to her community. She has been with LAPO for 2 years. She lives in Benin City in the Edo state of Nigeria. She is married with 6 children, and is 53 years old. She will be grateful if the above loan is given to her.

loans.use: To buy more wood for sales

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia O. makes jewelry with choral beads and sells other jewelry in her business. She is 60 years old, and married with six children. She has been with LAPO for the past 3 years as a leader of a union. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Mrs. O. needs a loan of $800 to buy more coral beads and jewelry. She is optimistic that with this loan she will be able to improve her business by increasing her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more coral beads and jewelry to sell in her business

loans.name: Glady

texts.en: "People in my community call me 'Mama G' because I am able to meet their need through my provision store," says Mrs. Glady E., who lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is married with four children and hopes to expand her business with a loan of $800. She has been a leader in the community for 4 years and has 13 years experience in her business.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Mrs. Christiana A. is happily married with six children. She is 62 years old. In her store, she sells drinks, bottled water, and other provisions. She has been in this business for 19 years, also with LAPO for 3 years as an assistant leader. She needs a loan of $800 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for her store

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: "I will buy more provisions and drinks with my loan," says Mrs. Rose I.. She is 43 years old, married with a child, and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 2001. Rose sells provision, drinks and food items to her community. She is optimistic that with the loan, she will be able to improve the inventory of her business.

loans.use: To increase the provisions offered in her business

loans.name: Okpako

texts.en: Okpako U. has a video store where she sells and rents videos. She has been in the business for the past 14 years. She is married with four  children, and is 37 years of age. She comes from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She would use the $400 loan to increase the inventory of her cassettes to sell and rent.

loans.use: To buy more cassettes to sell and rent in her shop

loans.name: Halimah

texts.en:
Halimah is a 30-year-old single mom. She has a daughter who is 5 years old and attends kindergarten. Halimah lives with four relatives; two of them go to high school while the other two help her to prepare snacks like chapati and cakes, which she sells at her business. She pays part of the school fees for the two dependants who go to high school.

Halimah operates a canteen at Kawanda secondary school where she sells drinks and snacks to students. She has been in this business for 7 years. With her earnings Halimah is able to pay rent for both her residential and work place. 

Halimah wants to borrow $600 to use to restock her canteen. From the increased capital, she hopes to earn more income to complete the two-room house that she is building and pay school fees for her child and dependants.

loans.use: To restock her business, a canteen that operates at a secondary school, providing drinks and snacks to students

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed Z T. is forty-two years old.  He is married with five children. Mohamed is responsible for the family of his late father.  He started his business before the war but the business was destroyed when Mohamed was abducted by the rebels.  His previous loan from SMT enabled him to restart his business three years ago and he used the income to cover the family expenses including those of his younger brothers and sisters.  Mohamed is the sole breadwinner for his big family.  He is requesting another loan of $200 to expand his business and involve and train his younger brothers in the business.  He thinks this way he can generate more income for the family.

loans.use: Increase his grocery business

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en: Saidu C. is forty-eight years old and married with five children.  He started his business five years ago, but he is unable to diversify his business due to lack of capital.  Saidu said that with five children all in school, he needs to generate sufficient income for re-investment in the business and meet family expenses, especially school fees.  He is requesting another loan of $350 to increase his stock and plans to purchase better quality clothes to attract more customers.

loans.use: Diversify business by purchasing higher quality merchandise

loans.name: Conteh

texts.en: Conteh A. is sixty-two years old and married with nine children.  Although two of the children are now married, seven are still in school and A. needs to work hard to provide them with basic needs.  Conteh has diversified his business but in small quantities.  He said, “This is to minimize risk of business losses.”  Conteh sells second hand shoes, mattresses, paints, and palm oil.  His business was diversified through his previous loans.  He is now requesting a loan of $1200 to increase the stock of each item.

loans.use: Increase stock for his business

loans.name: Umoru

texts.en: Umoru B. is fifty-years old and married with four children.  He runs a business of selling palm oil wholesale to small retailers in the town market of Kabala in Sierra Leone.  He started his business four years ago and was been able to keep making a profit.  Umoru said with the profit generated from previous loans from SMT, he was able to purchase some land for the family and meet his family expenses.  He now wants to generate more income for re-investment and for repairing the family house.  Umoru is therefore requesting a loan of $350 to purchase twenty-two “gerri cans” of palm oil.

loans.use: Expansion of Wholesale business

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata B. started her business on a small scale in 2001.  The business has developed so much that Fatmata transferred her business to Kabala town of Sierra Leone from Fadugu village.  A forty-year old mother of four children, she is hard working and has a strong business mind.  She proudly said, “I have built a small house from the profit I got from my business.” Fatmata would like to diversify her grocery business and is requesting a loan of $1200.  Her plan is to generate more profit for building small houses in Kabala town for rent. She said this will be a source of income when she gets too old to run a business.

loans.use: Diversify her grocery business

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo has been a public service transporter for 40 years, and with the income from this activity he supports his two children and wife. He lives in the Villa Cooperativa neighborhood in the city of El Alto. His wife is a door-to-door vendor who also helps her husband with the family income.

The requested loan will be destined for the construction of a small grocery store in their neighborhood, since the door-to-door vending is very dangerous for his wife.

This will be the second loan he has requested from IMPRO; his good payment record from the first loan allows us to approve this request.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Eduardo es transportista de servicio público hace 40 años y con los ingresos de esta actividad cubre la manutención de sus dos hijos y esposa. Vive en la zona de Villa Cooperativa de la Ciudad de El Alto, la esposa es pequeña comerciante ambulante que también colabora con el esposo con los ingresos familiares.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su zona, ya que el comercio ambulante es muy peligroso para su esposa.

Este será el segundo crédito que solicita de IMPRO; el buen antecedente de pagos del primer crédito permite aprobarle la solicitud.

loans.use: Construction of a grocery store.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Jane K. is a 38-year-old business woman, selling soft drinks, flour and other commodities in her shop. She has been in this business for the 7 years. She is married, with five children. Her eldest daughter would like to attend university but remains at home because the fees are prohibitive. The two boys are in secondary school and the two girls in primary level.

Jane's husband works as a driver and earns a small salary, but it is not sufficient to pay all the school fees for their children and support the basic needs of the family.
 
To see her children through school, Jane has decided to acquire a loan to increase her stock. With the increased returns from her business, Jane will be able to pay school fees for her children. She plans to repay the loan in 8 months.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her shop

loans.name: Nemecio

texts.es:
Nemesio works as a bricklayer from Monday through Saturday. His wife takes care of the work of the home, and all his children are independent. His home is located in the Tacagua neighborhood of the city of La Paz. This is the third time he has requested a loan from IMPRO. The requested amount will be destined for the construction of stairs. As we can see in the photo, his stairs are made of wood and it is dangerous to climb them because they are deteriorating over time. His work allows him to accept this loan, since he has construction experience and he himself will build the stairs on the weekends.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Nemesio trabaja como albañil de lunes a sábado, su esposa realiza labores de casa, y todos sus hijos son independientes. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz. Es tercera vez que solicita un crédito con IMPRO. El monto solicitado será destinado para la construcción de gradas, como podemos ver en la foto sus gradas son de madera y es un peligro para poder subir ya que con el tiempo se fue deteriorando. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en construcción y será el mismo quien construya las gradas los fines de semana.

loans.use: Construction of stairs.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Ms. Paulina works from Monday through Friday in the mornings doing construction, and in the afternoons she washes laundry at home. On the weekends she sells vegetables in the Rodriguez market in the city of La Paz. This is the first time she has requested a loan. The requested amount will be destined for the construction of a wall in front of her house. As you can see in the photo, now it is made of adobe (a mix of earth, water, and straw, which, when dry, is used to make walls) and there is a risk of it slipping away. Her work and effort to improve her habitat allow approval of this loan, since she is doing various activities to gain income.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

La señora Paulina trabaja de lunes a viernes por las mañanas en construcción y por las tardes lava ropa a domicilio, y los fines de semana vende verdura en el mercado Rodríguez de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para la construcción de muro de contención en la parte frontal de su casa, que como se ve en la foto, es de adobe (adobe es una mezcla de tierra, agua y paja, que una vez seca, se usa para levantar muros o paredes) y tiene el riesgo de deslizarse. Su trabajo y esfuerzo para el mejoramiento de su habitat le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que realiza varias actividades para lograr ingresos.

loans.use: Construction of a wall.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia works doing all kinds of sewing (skirts, comforters, vests, sweatshirts, jackets, and all kinds of fabric articles). Her home and workshop are located in the Rio Seco neighborhood, 6 de Agosto area of the city of El Alto. She is separated from her husband and is the only one who is supporting her family with this sewing work.

This is the sixth time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO. The requested amount will be destined for the purchase of a sewing machine. The one she uses now is too old and is causing many problems.

Her work allows approval of this loan, since she already has experience with sewing. The five previous loans have been repaid in full on the established schedule. Her cash flow shows sufficient income to cover the loan and also her personal necessities.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Lidia realiza todo trabajo de costura (Polleras, edredones, chalecos, buzos, chamarras y toda prenda de tela) Su domicilio y Taller se encuentran ubicados en la zona de Rio Seco, villa 6 de agosto de la ciudad de El Alto; esta separada de su esposo y la única que mantiene a su familia es ella con el trabajo de costura.

Es la sexta vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de una maquina de coser ya que la maquina de coser que actualmente usa es demasiado vieja y esta causando muchos problemas.

Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en costura. Los cinco créditos anteriores han sido pagados en su totalidad y en los plazos establecidos. El flujo de caja muestra ingresos suficientes para cubrir el préstamo y también sus necesidades personales.

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
Mr. Sabino has a vehicle and he is affiliated with the Trufi #5 syndicate, where he works from Monday through Sunday. His wife is a vendor, and they have two school-age children. To clarify, a "trufi" is like a taxi, but with a fixed route.

His home is located in the Alto Tacagua neighborhood of the city of La Paz. This is the third time he has requested a loan. The requested amount will be destined for the maintenance and repair of the motor of his vehicle.

His work and credit record allow approval of this loan, since he has experience as a transporter and the routes he works have a lot of passenger demand, which will give him the income to cover the loan.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

El señor Sabino tiene una movilidad y esta afiliado al sindicato del trufi # 5 donde trabaja de lunes a domingo. Su esposa es comerciante y tienen dos hijos que en edad escolar. A manera de aclaración un trufi es un taxi pero con ruta fija.

Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Alto Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para mantenimiento y reparación de motor de su movilidad

Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en como transportista y las líneas que atiende tienen mucha demanda de pasajeros, lo cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Vehicle repair.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifanía is a vendor of fried pork and chicken. She sells these products at public street fairs in the city of El Alto, and it is her income that supports her family, since her husband does not have work and she assumes all the family obligations. She has 4 school-age children.

She lives in the Villa Ingenio neighborhood of the city of El Alto.

The loan she is now requesting will be used to buy merchandise in bulk, and in this way increase her sales and achieve sufficient income to cover the family expenses as well as the monthly payments on her loan.

This is her second loan with IMPRO. Her good credit history allows approval of another loan.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Epifanía, es comerciante de chicharrones de cerdo y pollo. Estos productos los comercializa en las ferias populares de la ciudad de El Alto es su ingreso con el que mantiene a su familia ya que su esposo no tiene trabajo y ella asume toda la obligación familiar, tiene 4 hijos en la edad escolar.

Vive en la zona Villa Ingenio de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito que ahora solicita es para comprar mercadería por cantidad, de esa forma incrementar sus ventas y así lograr suficientes ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y la cuota mensual del prestamo que solicita..

Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen historial crediticio le faculta para otorgarle otro préstamo.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana is a student at the Del Valle University. In order to pay for her studies she works selling perfumes and cosmetics at offices and universities and to friends. Her collections are every two weeks.

Her home is located in the Villa Fátima neighborhood of the city of La Paz. She is single and has over 2 years of work experience, since she used to work with her mother who was also a perfume promoter, and now she is independent.

This is the fifth time she has requested a loan from IMPRO. The requested amount will be destined to pay for her boarding and tuition at the University. She is in the final years, and the previous loans she was granted were used for payment of boarding at the University, which is private.

Viviana is a client who, with her effort and the help of IMPRO, is at the point of achieving becoming a professional. Her work allows approval of this loan and provides income to cover the loan.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Viviana es estudiante de la Universidad del Valle, y para poder pagara sus estudios se dedica a la venta de perfumes y cosméticos, en las oficinas, universidades y amigos, y sus cobros son quincenales.

Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Villa Fátima de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltera y tiene experiencia de trabajo mas de 2 años, ya que anteriormente trabajaba con su madre que también era promotora de perfumes y actualmente es independiente.

Es la Quinta vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO. El monto solicitado será destinado para el pago de pensiones y tutoría en la universidad ya que Viviana esta en los últimos años, y los anteriores créditos que se le otorgaron fueron para el pago de pensiones a la Universidad, que es Privada.

Viviana es una cliente que con su esfuerzo y la ayuda de Impro esta a punto de lograr ser profesional. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito y le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: To pay for boarding at the University.

loans.name: Adamsay

texts.en: Adamsay K. is running a small kiosk in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  She is thirty-years old and a single parent of two children.  As a single parent, she is responsible for the welfare of her children. Although Admsay started with small capital, her business improved with her previous loan from SMT.  Recently, she began producing tye and dye and successfully selling it from her kiosk. Adamsay is requesting another loan of $200 to help her increase production of her tye and dye activity.

loans.use: Increase inputs for Tye and Dye business

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en: Fanta K. is forty years old, married with five children.  Her husband is also a petty trader but his business is small and this puts Fanta in a position of taking care of the family expenses. Fanta is committed to providing her children with an education and in the future, to build a house for the family.  She runs a business of selling palm oil,  millet,  and nut oil in Kabala town of Sierra Leone.  She is requesting a loan of $275 to increase her stock

loans.use: Increase supplies for small retail business.

loans.name: Kalielu

texts.en: Kalielu J. is twenty nine years of age and married with two children.  Being the elder son of his father, Kalielu also takes care of some of his parents' expenses. He is therefore obliged to generate more income to assist those under his responsibility.  Kalielu is engaged in the selling of shoes, dresses, and handbags in Kabala town and is assisted by his younger brother.  He would like to expand his business to enable his younger brother to begin selling in the second market in Kabala.  This will enable them both to take care of their families.  He is therefore requesting a loan of $350.

loans.use: Expansion of business to add new employees.

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en: Kumba S. is twenty five years old and married with a child.  Her husband is a teacher whose salary is insufficient to meet family expenses.  Kumba takes responsibility for providing most of the family needs.  Her hope is to provide the best education for her children, and in the future, to construct a family home.  Kumba runs a cosmetics shop in the town of Kabala in Sierra Leone. She takes the stock on credit from another shop which she said is more expensive than when it is purchased with cash.  She is requesting a loan of $275 to increase her stock and have her own capital.

loans.use: Increase capital in her cosmetic shop

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret K. is thirty four years old and married with four children.  Her husband is unemployed and Margaret is the only income earner in the family.  She is engaged in selling different kinds of agricultural products and sometimes is assisted by her two of her children.   Like many women in Sierra Leone, Margaret is committed to providing for her family and continuing to send her children to school.  Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and is requesting a $275 loan for another expansion of the business.

loans.use: Expansion of her agricultural input business

loans.name: Manjula

texts.en: Manjula J. is twenty five years old and is married with two children.  She runs a small business of selling chili peppers and palm oil in addition to her main business of selling yogurt.  She buys milk from farmers and makes yogurt to sell in the town of Kabala.  Manjula plans to buy her own cows “one at a time," she said.  She is requesting for a loan of $200 to start her dream.  She also plans to build a small and clean shelter in which to sell the yogurt.

loans.use: Purchase cows for her yogurt business

loans.name: Idrise

texts.en: Idrise J. owns a small pharmacy in Kabala town.  He is thirty seven years old and married with two children.  He is assisted by his wife who is learning how to manage the business.   Mr. J. plans to increase his stock of basic medicines and would like a loan of $200.  As a family bread winner, and the elder son of his father he also takes care of his elderly parents.

loans.use: Purchase additional medicines to stock his pharmacy

loans.name: Osman

texts.en: Osman S. is thirty eight years old and married with three children. He has a small general store and his business is the sole source of income for the family.  He is requesting a loan of $200 to increase his stock.  Osman plans to expand into wholesale where he would supply the retailers in small shops with a few select items.

loans.use: Expansion and diversification of his general store

loans.name: Alusine

texts.en: Alusine K. is a petty trader, who owns a small grocery store in Kabala town of Sierra Leone.  He is married with five children and works side by side with his wife who is also selling second hand clothes. Alusine also assists other traders by providing storage service.  He would like to increase the service by renting more stores and increasing his grocery stock.  He is therefore requesting a loan of  $200.

loans.use: Purchase more stores to rent as storage and increase grocery stock.

loans.name: Umaru

texts.en: Umaru Jalloh started his business three years ago in the outskirts of Kabala town of Sierra Leone.  He is assisted by his son in running the business.  As his business is the only source of income for the family, Jalloh would like to expand the business to generate more income by extending his clothes sales business into the rural areas where there is high demand.  He is therefore requesting a loan of $200.

loans.use: Expansion of clothing business

loans.name: Rubí

texts.es:
Rubí has two children, and she is a very enterprising and enthusiastic woman. For the past four years she has been separated from her husband and has been looking for an income that will permit her to offer the necessities to her children. Rubí decided to start her own business selling clothes and shoes. Fortunately, he has succeeded in increasing the number of her customers and offering a greater quantity of products. It has not been easy for Rubí to get ahead with her children as a single woman, but the wellbeing of her children is what motivates her day after day.

In order to acquire merchandise to fulfill the requests she has from her clients, now Rubí needs a loan of $750, which she will repay in 6 months. Rubí trusts in the people who help those who need it most, and she is very grateful for the confidence and support you offer her in improving her life.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Rubí tiene dos hijos, es una mujer emprendedora y entusiasta. Desde hace cuatro años se separó de su esposo y en busca de un ingreso que le permitiera ofrecerle lo necesario a sus hijos Rubí decidió comenzar su propio negocio con la venta de ropa y zapatos, afortunadamente ha logrado incrementar su numero de clientes y ofrecer una mayor cantidad de sus productos. No ha sido fácil para Rubí sacar adelante a sus hijos ella sola pero el bienestar de sus hijos es lo que la motiva día con día.

Para adquirir mercancía y cubrir los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes, ahora Rubí necesita un crédito por $ 750 dólares que se compromete a devolver es 6 meses. Rubí confía en las personas que ayudan a quien más lo necesita y agradece mucho la confianza y apoyo que le brindas para mejorar.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana is a hard-working and responsable woman with a 27 year old son and a little girl aged 6. She is separated from her husband and does not recieve any assistance from him, so Diana much work very hard in order to continue to support her family by herself. She began by selling drinks and toast but through her hard work and good service she increased the variety of her products and began a full grocery story, with help from her eldest son.

She hopes to be able to provide the best for her family, and this thought motivates her day in and day out. Currently, Diana is asking for a loan of $200 which she promises to return in three months. With this money she would like to purchase products for her store and continue to expand it s inventory. She is very appreciate of your help and support that will help improve the life of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Diana es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, tiene un hijo de 27 años de edad y una pequeña de 6 años, está separada de su esposo y no recibe ningún tipo de ayuda de él, por lo que Diana ha tenido que trabajar mucho para sacar adelanter a su familia ella sola, inició su negocio vendiendo refrescos y tostadas pero gracias a su esfuerzo y buen servicio ahora ha logrado incrementar la variedad de productos que comercializa e instalar su tienda de abarrotes, donde recibe la ayuda de su hijo mayor.

El deseo de darle lo mejor a su familia la motivan día con día, en estos momentos Diana está solicitando un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 3 meses, con lo que espera comprar mercancía para su tienda y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora. Ella agradece mucho tu generosidad y sabe que con tu ayuda puede mejorar la vida de su familia, decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: Purchase products, expand inventory

loans.name: Maria Esthela

texts.es:
In Monterrey, Nuevo León lives Maria Esthela, married and more of two sons aged 6 and 15. In order to improve the quality of life of her family Maris began her own business by making and selling flour tortillas. Associating herself with a neighbor, she began with a few sales and little by little, through her the hard work and that of her associates, the business began to grow rapidly. Today she also sells cosmetics, with great results. Maria is a very hard working and patient worker, who likes to fight for her goals and the well being of her family is her greatest incentive.

Today Maria needs a loan of $200 which she promises to return in 3 months, which will be used to purchase inventory. The expansion of her store and the well being of her family is in your hands. If you decide to support Maris, her and her family would be very appreciate.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

En Monterrey, Nuevo León vive Maria Esthela, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos de 6 y 15 años de edad. Para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia Maria inició su propio negocio con la elaboración y venta de tortillas de harina asociándose con unas vecinas, empezó con muy pocas ventas y poco a poco con el esfuerzo de ella y sus asociadas el negocio comenzó a crecer rápidamente, ahora también ha incorporado la venta de cosméticos, obteniendo muy buenos resultados. Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora y paciente, que le gusta luchar por lo que se propone y el bienestar de su familia es su más grande incentivo.

En estos momentos Maria necesita un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía y que se compromete a regresar en 3 meses. El crecimiento de este negocio y el bienestar de esta familia esta en tus manos, decídete a apoyar a Maria, ella y su familia te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Increase inventory of the store

loans.name: Ángel Mario

texts.es:
Angel is originally from Cadereyta, Nuevo Leon. He has been raising and selling pigs since he was very young. This business was started by his grandfather and he inherited it. He receives help from his brother and father. Due to the quality of his service and products he now has several contracts with various nearby restaurants and his business has grown a lot.

To cover his clients demand he now needs a $1200 dollar loan which he will use to deliver meat and transport pig food. He offers to repay this loan within 6 months. Be an important part of this business development and help Angel. He sincerely thanks any kind of support that you can offer.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

Ángel es originario de la localidad de Cadereyta en el estado de Nuevo León, él se dedica desde muy pequeño a la cría y venta de cerdos, este negocio lo inició su abuelo y por herencia ahora Ángel es el encargado, donde recibe la ayuda de su hermano y de su padre. Gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que comercializa y a su buen servicio ahora tiene contratos con varios restaurantes de la localidad y su negocio ha crecido mucho.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes ahora necesita un préstamo de $ 1,200 dólares que empleará en la compra de un vehículo para transportar la carne y los alimentos de sus animales, él ofrece regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y decídete a ayudar a Ángel, él agradece sinceramente cualquier tipo de apoyo que puedas brindarle.

loans.use: purchase vehicle for produce transportation

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga is married and has three small children who are studying. They are the reason why Olga decided to start her own business selling cosmetics. Her husband's salary got reduced due to their home mortgage payments. In order for her family to have a better quality of life, Olga started this business two years ago. She has been slowly improving her service and incrementing sales.

Olga has a big delivery request to supply and she wants to take advantage of the opportunity to buy wholesale and get a better price. Therefore, she is requesting a $250 dollar loan, which she commits to repay in three months. You have this family's wellbeing in your hands - by contributing to this business' growth. Thank you very much.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga es casada y tiene tres pequeños hijos que están estudiando, ellos han sido el motivo por el cual Olga decidió comenzar su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos ya que el salario de su esposo se veía muy reducido por el pago de las hipotecas de su casa, y para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia Olga inició este negocio hace dos años donde poco a poco ha estado mejorando el servicio e incrementando sus ventas.

Olga tiene un pedido grande por surtir y quiere aprovechar para comprar de mayoreo y obtener un mejor precio por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares, mismos que se compromete a regresar en 3 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia contribuyendo al crecimiento de este negocio, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando is divorced and takes care of his four children. He used to work as a welder; as he was paid too little to cover household expenses, however, he decided to start his own business. Thanks to one of his friends, who invited him to work in the traveling market, he began to offer his services as a repairman. Now he buys parts from used appliances, repairs them if necessary, and then resells them.

Fortunately, Armando has been able to expand his business and increase his number of customers. Now he needs a loan of $925 so that he can purchase more appliances in order to continue to expand his business. He is committed to repaying this loan within 6 months. Armando and his family are very much in need of your help. Please help them by contributing to the success of Armando's business.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Armando es divorciado y se hace cargo de sus cuatro hijos. Anteriormente él trabajaba como soldador pero recibía un salario muy bajo y no lograba cubrir todas las necesidades de sus hijos por lo que decidió comenzar su propio negocio, gracias a la invitación de de uno de sus amigos para trabajar en el mercado ambulante, comenzó ofreciendo sus servicios de reparación de aparatos eléctricos y ahora se dedica a comprar remesas de aparatos usados y venderlos, algunas veces tiene que repararlos antes de ofrecerlos en venta.

Afortunadamente Armando ha hecho crecer su negocio y ha logrado incrementar su clientela, ahora necesita un préstamo de $ 925 dólares con los que planea comprar una remesa de aparatos para continuar creciendo con su negocio, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Esta familia necesita mucho de tu apoyo, ayúdalos a salir adelante contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
Martha is married and has a 29 year old daughter and a 20 year old son. They are from the city of Monterrey, Nuevo Leon. Because her husband's salary could not cover the costs of her childrens' schooling, Martha began a business selling cosmetics. Thanks to the high quality of her products, her number of customers and number of sales have both increased over time.

In order to cover the increased demand, Martha is requesting a loan of $200, which she will use to buy more merchandise. This will allow her to offer her customers better service. She is committed to repaying this loan within 3 months. Please deciD. to support Martha so that her children will be able to finish their studies!

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha es casada y tiene una hija D. 29 años D. edad y un hijo D. 20 años, ellos son originarios D. L. ciudad D. Monterrey, Nuevo León. Ante L. necesidad D. un ingreso extra Martha inició su negocio con L. venta D. cosméticos, porque sus hijos necesitaban cubrir los gastos D. sus estudios y con el salario que obtenía su esposo era imposible, poco a poco gracias a L. buena calidad D. los productos que comercializa y a su gusto por las ventas ha incrementado su número D. clientes así como sus ventas.

Para poder cubrir L. creciente demanda que tiene ahora Martha está solicitando un crédito D. $ 200 dólares que empleará en L. compra D. mercancía, lo que le permitirá ofrecer un mejor servicio, elL. se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Decídete a apoyar a Martha y contribuye a que estos jóvenes logren culminar sus estudios, todo esto esta en tus manos, muchas gracias por tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Faamati

texts.en:
Faamati has two children aged 2 years and 9 months respectively and her husband is unemployed. She had been running her own shop for some time before joining the SPBD programme. She faced some difficulties running her shop, especially with a family to look after. Therefore she decided to join SPBD so she would be able to have some financial assistance in running her shop. To date, Faamati has received 5 loans from SPBD.

With these loans, she has been able to to buy more goods for her shop and put her children in school. In the future she plans to extend her shop and is thinking of building a mini restaurant beside her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for her shop

loans.name: Kalameli

texts.en: Kalameli joined the programme in 2005. Her husband is unemployed and they have  7 grown up children to look after. She joined SPBD because she had nowhere else she could get financial support for her family. She started off with selling snacks such as Twisties, chewing gum, lollies and so on in the village school. She currently runs her own snack shop. In the future she hopes to extend her shop and is looking at running another business in addition to her shop.

loans.use: To assist with her shop.

loans.name: Palolo

texts.en: Palolo is married with 4 children. Her husband is unemployed and they rely on their plantation as a source of income for the family. Palolo decided to join the SPBD loan programme so she could get some money to buy a weed sprayer, cromoxone chemical and other things needed for her plantation. Palolo and her husband are working extremely hard on their plantation and hope to own a mini market to sell their crops in  future.

loans.use: To purchase a weed sprayer and Cromoxone chemical, etc. for the family's plantation.

loans.name: Faaolo

texts.en:
Faaolo is 22 years old. Her father is the only breadwinner of their family of 8 people. She comes from a poor family so she decided to join SPBD to help her to start her own elei printing business (a traditional Samoan way of printing fabrics). She's now earning good money and helps her father to support their family financially.

Faaolo is planning to have a small block in the flea market where she can sell her elei printing materials and other handicrafts like bags, weaving fans and so on.

loans.use: To start her elei printing business.

loans.name: Sunui

texts.en:
Sunui joined SPBD in April 2005. She run a small taro plantation with the help of her husband and her two sons. She has six children and the family is very poor, to the point where she sometimes cannot afford to send her children to school. She has been working hard on her farm because this is the only source of income for her family. On Saturdays, Sunui sells the taro in the market where she can earn up to US$120-160. People in her village also buy from her sometimes.

Sunui is planning to use her Kiva loan to build a small place on the road side where she can sell coconuts, pumpkins, beans, tomatoes and cabbages in addition to taro.

loans.use: To help with her plantation.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina joined SPBD on June 2007. She is married with 2 children. Her husband works at a local company in town but his salary is not enough to support their family.

Marina decided to do something to earn some money to help her husband and family. She runs a barbeque stall and enjoys it very much. Her stall has been doing well and she now plans to open a small shop beside her stall. She believes that she will always have a good supply of customers because she lives close to the main road and the airport.

loans.use: To help with her barbeque stall.

loans.name: Paletina

texts.en:
Paletina joined the programme in June 2007. She is married with four children. Her husband also works but his salary does not meet their family's daily needs. She decided to join SPBD because she deeply believed that she could earn money if she opted to do something for herself.

She now runs her own barbeque stall along the side of the road leading to the international airport. Paletina has many plans for the future but for now, she is considering setting up a small shop beside her stall.

loans.use: To  help with her barbeque stall.

loans.name: Pogisa

texts.en:
Pogisa is married with 5 children. She lives in Aleipata (a group of islands off Eastern Samoa) with her elderly parents. She comes from a poor familly and faces a lot of problems looking after her family from day to day. She used to have a plantation which formed the main source of income for her family for some time. Her husband is unemployed but he has been very supportive of his wife.

Pogisa joined SPBD in May 2007. She bought two cattle to start a cattle farm with her first loan. Now she has almost ten cattle. She has two dairy cows whose milk she plans to sell to local shops in the village and the town area as another source of income for her and her family. She is seeking a $750 loan to help her with her cattle farm.

loans.use: To assist with her cattle farm.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana G. Nuñez has two children. The older child is nine years old; the younger child is three. She has been with Pro Mujer for four years. With the aid of a friend, she works in printing. She decorates pamphlets, posters, and other relatively inexpensive items. She was able to get the business going thanks to a loan made her many years ago. Recently, she was able to repay this loan. Initially, she could barely afford to buy leftover paper sold to her a a low cost by other printers or stationary stores. She acquired the ink by way of complimentary gifts or gifts from friends. Occasionally, Lilliana still has to stay at the press all weekend simply to make enough money to feed her children and pay the rent for her business. Currently, Lilliana needs money so that she can buy a computer for graphic design. This will help her improve her products and make her work more efficient. It will thus lead to increased revenues and a higher standard of living.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Liliana G. Nuñez, separada y madre de dos hijos, la mayor tiene 9 años, y el menor apenas tiene 3, es socia de Pro Mujer hace 4 años. Ella se dedica a la imprenta, trabaja con la ayuda de una amiga en la elaboración de folletos, recetarios, cancioneros y otros de bajo costo. La imprenta la pudo adquirir gracias a un crédito bancario hace muchos años, y recientemente pudo cancelar esa deuda. A un inicio, apenas podía comprar algunos restos de resmas de papel que le vendían a bajo costo otras imprentas o papeleras, y las tintas las conseguía mediante obsequios o regalos consistentes en latas o espátulas usadas. En ocasiones y por la demanda de trabajo, Liliana debe quedarse a dormir todo el fin de semana dentro de la imprenta, todo para reunir el dinero suficiente para el alimento de sus hijos y el alquiler de su imprenta. Actualmente Liliana necesita de dinero para poder comprar una computadora de diseño gráfico, con el fin de mejorar sus productos y agilizar su trabajo. Esto representará mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase of computer for graphic design.

loans.name: Marjurie

texts.es: La Sra. L. se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos desde hace más de cinco años, con este negocio sostiene a su familia y en la actualidad está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de electrodomésticos ya que se acerca la etemporada navideña y quiere comprar los artículos antes de que suban los precios y aprovechar también grandes descuentos que le están ofreciendo sus proveedores. Nos comentó tambien que quiere ivertir parte del dinero en hacerle arreglos al local para evitar que algunas personas le roben y que sus productos estén más seguros.

loans.use: El crédito piensa invertirlo en la compra de electrodomésticos y para invertirlo en la seguridad de su local.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda M. Camargo is married to a barber and has two children. She has been a member of Pro Mujer for over 8 years, when she began the tailoring of and sale of woolen clothing. Currently, she sells used clothing and is the owner of a stand in El Alto. Yolanda is requesting this loan because she wants to change her specialty. The sale of used clothing doesn't have a future due to new laws passed by the Bolivian government. Consequently, she has registered for conversion programs and intends to dedicate herself to the tailoring of and sale of althletic clothing instead.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Yolanda M. Camargo, casada con un peluquero y madre de dos hijos, ingresa a Pro Mujer hace más de 8 años, cuando se dedicaba a la confección y venta de prendas de lana, como chompas y otros. Actualmente se dedica a la comercialización de ropa usada y es dueña de un puesto de venta en la feria 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto. Yolanda precisa de dinero para poder cambiar de rubro, puesto que la venta de ropa usada no tiene futuro a raíz de las nuevas disposiciones del gobierno boliviano. Por tal motivo, ella se ha inscrito a los programas de reconversión, y piensa dedicarse a la confección y venta de ropa deportiva.

loans.use: Changing her business from used clothing sales to athletic clothing sales.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva M. has three children and has been a part of Pro Mujer for one year. She owns a boutique that specializes in the tailoring and sale of women's clothing. Genoveva has been in this business for 18 years now and has thus acquired a lot of experience. She needs a loan so that she can purchase material and merchandise in time for the end of the year parties. The store in which her boutique is located is also for rent, which decreases her revenues. Consequently, she requires a loan so that she can expand her business, both in terms of pure materials and in terms of its products.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Genoveva M., soltera, tiene 3 hijos y es socia de Pro Mujer hace 1 año y es propietaria de una boutique en la calle Alfonso Ugarte, en plena Feria 16 de Julio. Su especialidad es la confección y venta de prendas femeninas, como ser vestidos y trajes. Son 18 años que Genoveva se encuentra en el negocio de la confección, y con la experiencia adquirida, necesita de inversión de capital con el fin de proveer de material y mercadería su tienda para las fiestas de fin de año. Actualmente la tienda donde funciona su boutique se encuentra en alquiler, por tanto esto merma cuantiosamente sus ingresos. Ella necesita dinero para poder ampliar su mercadería, tanto en material como en productos.

loans.use: Material and Merchandise Purchasing

loans.name: Jailia

texts.es: La Sra. A. es propietaria de un establecimiento donde vende electrodomésticos, goza de muy buen aceptación por parte de sus clientes ya que tiene variedad de marcas y de muy buena calidad (Sony, Samsung, LG, etc.). En la actualidad quiere el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de electrodomésticos y para pagar a sus proveedores que le están ofreciendo descuentos por pronto pago, lo cual le permitirá un mayor margen de ganancia y podrá mejorar el nivel de vida de sus familiares.

loans.use: El crédito lo ivertirá en la compra de electrodomésticos.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: El Sr. B. es propietario de una tienda donde vende una variedad de productos entre los que podemos encontrar: ropa para damas y caballeros, artículos de belleza, zapatos, fajas, etc. Está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de más productos para abastecer su tienda, ya que según sus experiencia, mientras más llena esté el negocio de productos, mayores son sus chances de vender y de obtener mayores utilidades.

loans.use: El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de productos para abastecer su minitienda.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en: Gregoria A.

loans.use: Purchase dietary supplements for resale

loans.name: Nicolasa Ambrosio

texts.en:
Nicolasa Ambrosio C. Velasco is 55 and has lived through some pretty rough times. During the violent years of the 1980’s civil war in Guatemala her house was burned to the ground and her father-in-law was tortured and killed. It still near enough that it brings tears to her eyes when she discusses the subject. But right now she’s making do with her several businesses: she raises chickens and pigs, weaves the traditional Mayan top called a huipil, and even has a little tiny store that carries sugar, soap, and other such daily necessities. She’ll use this loan to increase her animal production, adding 15 chickens and 3 pigs. The chickens will be half for laying eggs and half for later sale for meat. Nicolasa can make about US$4.00/week of profit on her eggs, a significant boost.

Nicolasa and her husband have 9 children, most grown, but with two daughters (13 and 16) still at home. Their 16-year-old is deaf, a significant challenge in a culture with no deaf-specific education. Most of the kids have received at least an elementary education. Nicolasa never did get much education, despite her dad’s best efforts. He would take her to school, but she would hide and not go in. She did get just enough to be able to read and sign her name.

Nicolasa’s husband commutes every day to Guatemala City, where he works in a flower company. The two of them do have some health problems at this time of their life; she has gastritis and he has high blood pressure. But they’re doing pretty well, and she can walk all the way up a a pretty remote road to her home far above the highway. Her dream is to develop the store into a much larger concern, with all of the items needed for daily living.

Here is a video of the paperwork meeting that Nicolasa attended to apply for this loan.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase 15 chickens, 2 pigs, and yarn for weaving

loans.name: Gloria Erlinda

texts.en:
Gloria Erlinda C. T., 26, buys and sells huipiles, the traditional Mayan women’s woven blouse. She can buy one from an individual weaver for about US$7 and sell it on market days for almost $10. She can sell about a dozen a month, making a profit approaching $36, a significant boost to her finances. She’ll use this loan to buy more huipiles for resale. (At the women’s meeting where Gloria was interviewed, it was not market day and she did not have any stock. However, the woman on the left is wearing one of Gloria’s huipiles. You see Gloria on the right.)

Gloria got her start four years ago by borrowing a little money from her brother, but now she uses the Friendship Bridge loans for working capital. What she’d love to do some day is have a big store or deposito with lots of items including drinks and the things everybody needs in daily life.

Gloria is still recovering from the devastation of Hurricane Stan, which hit the area at 8:30 am on October 5, 2005. Her house was destroyed by a landslide and she lost nearly everything she owned. Her husband’s family was killed. But life is going on, and they are in the process of rebuilding a house. Gloria has three kids aged 2, 5, and 7, and she does have the 7-year-old in school.

Here is a video of the paperwork meeting that Gloria attended to apply for this loan.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase huipiles for resale

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria X. Curacan cooks and sells menudo, the traditional soup made out of tripe, every market day in Tecpan. On Thursdays and Sundays she gets to the market at 3:00 am to start cooking the tripe that was delivered the night before, and then she sells all day to the crowd at the market. She’ll use this credit as she did the last, to buy the tripe and other ingredients for the menudo. Before starting with Friendship Bridge she couldn’t purchase enough materials at a time to maximize her profits, but now she can purchase enough that she can sell a boatload of menudo on market days.

Gregoria is 63 and single; her 32-year-old youngest son is still living with her. He’s been disabled since he was 9 years old when a disease damaged his back or spine.

The picture shows Gregoria at her loan set up meeting. It was not possible to take her picture in the market selling menudo because it was not market day.

Here is a video of the paperwork meeting that Gregoria attended to apply for this loan.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make menudo

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina G. Tucupa, 29, makes the wide woven shawls that women here use as baby carriers. She uses a mechanical weaving machine. The shawls are called trajecitos in Spanish.

With the weaving machine she and her husband can make 30 dozen in one month, making a profit of about US$.70 on each item. They deliver them to a reseller in Guatemala City for resale. She and her husband turned to Friendship Bridge for credit in order to increase their output, which is on track and they are accomplishing their objectives in this second cycle of credit. Now that they have more working capital they can purchase in bulk and have the material they need for their weaving.

Angelina and her husband have 6 children under the age of 10, and the kids that should be in school are studying. She herself completed only the second grade.

Here is a video of the paperwork meeting that Angelina attended to apply for this loan.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase yarn for her weaving machines

loans.name: Reyes

texts.en:
Reyes E. S., 50, has been a weaver of huipiles all her life, making the beautiful traditional Mayan tops that the women in the highlands of Guatemala wear. It takes her one and a half months to weave one huipil and she will make a profit of roughly US$25 after paying for the yarn.

Reyes is married and has 3 children aged 13, 16, and 18. The two youngest ones made it through elementary school, but because of the increase in costs to continue to middle school they had drop out.

Reyes has recently expanded her business into buying and selling both new and used clothing. More and more people in her community are buying less traditional "ropa americana", or used American clothing like T-shirts. She dreams of being able to keep growing her businesses to keep up with the increased costs of supporting her family.

Here is a video of the paperwork meeting that Reyes attended to apply for this loan.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase yarn for weaving and also new clothing for sale

loans.name: Elisabet

texts.en:
Elisabet Jerez Chamale is a single mother, just 26 years old with two children, aged 2 and 7. She’s struggling to make ends meet and keep the older one in school. With her first Friendship Bridge loan she was able to start her business weaving huipiles, the traditional Mayan women’s blouse, because she could finally purchase some yarn. Now she’s ready for her second loan, which she’ll use for the same purpose.

Elisabet rents her small one-room shack in the back of a parking lot for about US$20/month, plus $5/month for electricity. She’s put cardboard all around the inside walls to keep the wind out. Although yarn is fairly expensive, at about $7/pound, she is making huipiles that sell for up to $10, so is finally making a little bit of economic progress. Elisabet is also buying and reselling huipiles woven by other women. She dreams of someday having her own store, maybe a big store with woven goods.

Here is a video of the paperwork meeting that Elisabet attended to apply for this loan.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase yarn for weaving

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria C. A., 35, weaves the beautiful traditional Mayan tops that the women in the Highlands of Guatemala all wear. It takes her one month to weave one huipil, and she can sell it for about US$10. She also has a business selling furniture, and has a modest stock of furniture in a site near the major highway that runs near the town.

Maria is separated from her husband, who gives her no support either emotionally or financially. She says it has been a struggle to take care of her 5 children by herself but things are getting better. The loans from Friendship Bridge have helped her to get ahead just a bit. All of her five children have been to primary school except the 4-year-old, who’s not ready for school yet.

Maria dreams of having a real shop in the market instead of just selling on market days. She’d love to get into buying and selling, instead of just being limited by what she can produce herself.

Here is a video of the paperwork meeting that Maria attended to apply for this loan.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase yarn for weaving

loans.name: Baroatkhon

texts.en:
Baroatkhon has been selling children's clothes for 11 years. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a worker, but his salary is not enough to support the family. So she decided to help her husband.

Baroatkhon’s business is located in the open-air market in Panjshanbe. She brings her goods from Istaravshan’s wholesale market. She began her business by selling towels; gradually, she changed her type of goods to children's clothes. Baroatkhon became a client of MicroInvest in 2006. Her first loan was for 100USD. She used her loan to buy modern clothes for little girls. Soon she was able to increase the volume of her goods. Today her stall is one of the known stalls in the market. She has many clients and she always wants to meet their needs.

In future, Baroatkhon wants to expand her assortment by including seasonal clothes for autumn time. She is requesting $400 to do this.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ogiebulu

texts.en: Mr. Ogiebulu A. is 40 years old. He is married, with children. He is a farmer and specializes in the production of yam, maize and tomatoes, among other crops. He sells his farm produce to people living in his community. He is requesting the above loan to enable him to cultivate more crops to sell.

loans.use: To support my farm (Clearing, Planting & Harvesting)

loans.name: Christian

texts.en: Christian E. has been an LAPO client for 7 years. She is married with 3 children and she is 34 years old. She sells drinks and food stuffs - including melon, oil, ogbolor, and fish - to people living in her community. She has been in this business for 8 years.  She is requesting the above loan to enable her to buy more melon, oil and ogbolor to sell in her store.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks and food stuffs for sale

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline I. is 42 years old. She is married with seven children. She has been in the business of selling fairly used clothing since 1986. She has been an LAPO member for seven years. She needs this loan to buy additional used clothing to sell in her store.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing for sale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: "I am 34 years old," said Mrs. Agnes, who is married with 8 children. She has eight years of experience in her business, and has been an LAPO member for seven years. She has learnt her business form her sister. She hopes to buy more drinks, pure water, local gin, melon, ogbolor & oil with the above loan to supply her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, pure water & food stuffs

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: "I am 34 years old, married with 6 children. I have been an LAPO member for 6 years," says Mrs. Theresa, who sells drinks, garri and vegetables to those living in her community. She needs the above loan to buy more drinks, garri and vegetables to sell in her store.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, pure water & food stuffs

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna O. is 52 years old. She is widowed with 6 children. She has been in the business of selling plastic rubber, maize and drinks for six months. Additionally, she has a machine for grading tomatoes and maize, which she uses in her business. People living in her community like buying from her. She needs the above loan to buy another machine for grading and goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provision, food stuffs & machines for grading

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria O. specializes in the sales of food stuffs and drinks (local drinks). She has learnt this business from her mother-in-law. She is 30 years old and married with 3 children. She is a native of Esan. In addition she has been an LAPO client for 2 years. She needs the above loan to buy more food stuffs and drinks to sell in her local store.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & food stuffs for sale

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Mrs. Stella O. is happily married with 7 children. She sells provisions, pure water & food stuffs to those living in her community. She has 4 years of  experience in this business. She is requesting a loan of $550 to buy more food stuffs, pure water & provisions to sell in her store.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, pure water, food stuffs & provisions

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. E. Esther is 35 years old and happily married with 5 children. She has been an LAPO member for 4 years. She sells local rice and river fish to those living in her community. People living in her community love local rice, and hence they like buying from her. She hopes to buy more local rice to sell with the loan she has requested.

loans.use: To buy more local rice & river fish for sale

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Mrs. Justina O. is 41 years old and married with 6 children. She sells clothes in her community. She has 20 years of experience in her business. She is requesting the above loan to enable her to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther O. is 42 years old, and married with six children.  She sells provisions and foodstuffs.  She is in need of the funds above to buy more foodstuffs and provisions to sell.  She has been in this business since 2001.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en: Mrs. Lillian N. is 32 years old, and married with 3 children.  She sells ladies wear and plastic plates.  She has been a LAPO client for 2 years.  She also has two years experience in this business.  She is requesting a loan of $325 to enable her to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy ladies wear, coolers and additional machines

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Mrs. Joy A. is 24 years old, and married with 4 children.  She sells provisions and drinks to her community.  She has 6 years experience in her business and has been a LAPO client for 3 years.  She hopes to buy more provisions & drinks to sell with the loan above.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & drinks to sell

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Mr. Anthony Akhuemokhan sells ladies & gentlemens wears.  He has been a LAPO client for 7 years.  He is requesting for the above loan to buy more clothes & VCD’s to sell and rent.  He is 30 years old.

loans.use: To buy clothes, VCD’s to sell and rent

loans.name: Zoyir

texts.ru:
Zoyir S., 55 is a father of 3 children. He has a high school education. Zoyir has been selling plastic pipes for 7 years. His wife is a school teacher. After school, Zoyir’s youngest son helps his father to sell. In 2003, when Zoyir received his first MicroInvest loan, his business assets were only $200. After receiving and carefully investing multiple loans, Zayir increased the volume of the goods sold and began to purchase the pipes wholesale. He also began to sell brooms in addition to pipes. Now, Zayir’s business assets total $1100. In the future, he plans to expand the place of business. P.S. Zayir’s son is on the photo.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шодмонов Зойир отец троих детей. Ему 55лет, образование среднее. Вот уже 7лет занимается продажей пластиковых труб. Жена работает учительницей в средней школе, младший сын после школы помогает отцу в торговле. В 2003 году начал получать займ в МЗФ «Микроинвест», его активы в то время составляли 200$.
