После получения неоднократного займа и целевого использования он увеличил товарооборот, оптом стал закупать товар и добавил в свой ассортимент веники. Сейчас его активы составляют 1100$. В будущем хочет расширить место деятельности. P.S. На фото его сын.

loans.use: To expand the place of business

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Mr. Alexander O. learned the act of planting pawpaw from his friends.  He is 45 years old, and married with 13 children.  He is requesting a loan of $550 to enable him to produce more fruit (pawpaw) to sell.  He has been a LAPO member for 4 years.

loans.use: For planting & maintenance of pawpaw fruit

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.ru:
Mavlyuda S. is 42 years old. She is married with 3 children. She graduated from high school. Her husband is working in neighboring countries, and her children are in school.

Prior to receiving her first loan from MicroInvest, she attempted to ask for loans from local illegal creditors, but the service charges were too high. Mavlyuda took her first loan for $150 from MicroInvest in 2003. Back then, she bought and sold flour wholesale. After being very responsible with her loans and using them wisely, she was able to open a retail location where she now sells stuffed pastries. Her daughter helps with flour sales. Currently, Mavlyuda's profits are $1,150. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

Сотиболдиева Мавлюда –42года. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Образование среднее специальное. Муж на заработках в соседних странах, дети учатся в школе.

До получения займа в МЗФ «Микроинвест» кредитовалась у местных нелегальных кредиторов под большие проценты. Начала кредитоваться в МЗФ с активами на 150$ в 2003 году. Тогда она занималась оптовой куплей и продажей муки. Проходя все степы кредитования ответственно и целенаправленно она открыла точку для производства и продажи пирожков. Сейчас продажей муки помогает ей её дочь. На данное время её товарооборот составляет 1150$. В дальнейшем хочет расширить и улучшить условия место своей деятельности.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Mrs. Juliet U. sells clothes, bags & shoes.  She is 25 years old, and married with 6 children.  She started her business in 2005.  She is also a LAPO client.  She is requesting for the loan above to buy more clothes, bags and shoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, bags & shoes to sell

loans.name: Odion

texts.en: Mrs. Odion E. is 43 years old, and married with five children.  She hails from Uromi town in Edo State.  She has been in business since 1993.  She is requesting the sum of $475 to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more ladies wear & baby clothes

loans.name: Balay

texts.en: Balay M. is a 55-year-old farmer who lives with his three children in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Saatli region. Balay has 17 years of experience in raising livestock. Balay has a sheep herd and two cows. He sells sheep meat and dairy products, such as milk and yoghurt. These products are in high demand in Azerbaijan and Balay works hard to expand his business. He keeps his two cows more than four  years and he is going to sell them for meat production. Now he has applied for a loan of $800 USD to purchase one milk cow and cattle fodder for winter.

loans.use: Going to purchase one milk cow for $700 USD and fodder for $100 USD.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Mrs. Gloria Uwabor is 22 years old, and married with 2 children.  She sells motorcycle parts and has been in this business since 2002.  She is requesting a loan of $400 to enable her to buy more motorcycle parts to sell.

loans.use: To buy more motorcycle parts

loans.name: Chiwen

texts.en: Chiwen O. is 29 years old, and married with 5 children.  She is into poultry farming, a business she had for 2 years.  She has been in this business since 1994.  Mrs. Chiwen O. says she has recently trained other people on how to rear chickens as well.  She is requesting the above loan to buy more feed and a day old chicken.

loans.use: To buy more bird & feed

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Mrs. Bridget O. is a farmer and she specializes in the rearing of chickens.  She is 32 years old, and married with 6 children.  She hails from Uromi town in Edo State.  She has 4 years experience in poultry farming.  People living in her community and neighboring town depend on her for poultry products.  She is requesting a loan for $1200 to enable her to serve her customers.

loans.use: To buy more birds & feed

loans.name: Elmusa

texts.en: Elmusa M. is a 23-year-old businessman. He lives in the Azerbaijani southern Imishli region,  in Khishchibanli village. Elmusa just started his business in 2006, when he purchased a shed of sheep. He breeds the sheep and sells them for meat production. Meat is in high demand in Azerbaijan and Elmusa works very hard to expand his business. He works from early morning 'till late at night, pasturing his herd of sheep and the buffalos of his father. Now he would like to expand the business and start to sell milk products. For this purpose, he has applied for $1,200 USD to buy one cow, which costs $700 USD and fodder for $500 USD. The estimated cost for the cow is $700-800 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase one milky cow and fodder

loans.name: Yaquelin

texts.en:
Yaquelin lives with her husband, who works as a chauffer, and their one year old son in a small home they own in the Llojeta area of La Paz . She works as a maid at a home in La Paz and also sells beauty products.

She is requesting this loan to clear the lot where her small, one room home sits. Once the lot is cleared, she and her husband plan to begin adding one or two additional rooms to allow the family to live in better and more sanitary conditions.

She is a new borrower and an analysis of her family's finances has determined that they have sufficient income to fulfill the loan payment requirements as well as meet the family's basic needs.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Yaquelin vive en casa propia en la Av. Máx. Fernández Nº 2646 de la zona de Llojeta central de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene un hijo pequeño de 1 año y vive con su esposo que es chofer. Yaquelin es empleada domestica en una casa ubicada en la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz, y también comercializa productos de belleza.

El crédito que solicita es para limpiar su terreno el cual tiene una pequeña construcción de una planta; una vez que el terreno este limpio, entonces Yaquelin y su esposo tienen planeado iniciar la construcción de una o mas habitaciones que les permitan vivir en forma mas decente y en un ambiente de mayor sanidad.

Es cliente nuevo y el flujo de fondos analizado muestra ingresos suficientes como para poder acceder a un crédito y cumplir tanto con los pagos de dicho préstamo como con las necesidades de la familia.

loans.use: To clear lot for construction

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena lives with her husband and two minor children in a rented home in the Villa Fatima neighborhood of La Paz. She has been selling children's shoes in a centrally-located and very popular retail district of La Paz for the past 15 years.

She needs this loan to purchase a greater variety and expanded inventory of shoes, as she's a very well known merchant and doesn't want to lose any clients.

Her credit history with IMPRO dates back to 2002 and identifies her as a qualified borrower.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lorena vive en anticretico en la calle Final Tejada Sorzano de la zona de Villa Fátima de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposo y sus dos hijos menores; desde hace mas de 15 años se dedica a la venta de calzados de niños en la calle Huyustus, lugar comercial ubicado en una de las zonas mas populares de La Paz, donde se vende todo tipo de prendas de vestir.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar más mercadería y tener mas variedad de calzados para ofrecer a sus clientes, pues ella es muy conocida en el sector y no quiere perder clientela.

Su antecedente histórico con Impro data del año 2002 y la califica como muy buena cliente; en consecuencia ella puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

-

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en: Nataliya owns a clothing and shoe sales business in Marganets, Ukraine. She started her business nine years ago, choosing to sell clothing because it was an area she knew well. Her business has done well with a good location and exposure in the market and has had stable sales. Nataliya has developed a good reputation over the years through her personal integrity, kindness toward others, and a positive attitude. Nataliya has requested a loan to add to her working capital and enable her to open a new sales location. She looks forward to expanding her business and increasing her income.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for new location

loans.name: Vera

texts.en: Vera has requested a short term loan to help purchase additional items to sell in her book/magazine stand. Vera rents a small space at the “Voyage” store in Nikopol, Ukraine where she sells a variety of books, newspapers, magazines, and cards. The nature of Vera’s business involves a high rate of inventory turnover. Part of her product line becomes out-dated periodically and needs to be renewed. The availability of micro-credit has been a big help to Vera in her business. Since receiving her first loan from Nadiya Ukraine, her inventory and working capital have increased  10 times. We are happy for this new opportunity to help Vera continue to develop her venture.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her book/magazine stand.

loans.name: Aishe

texts.en: Aishe has had her own business selling clothing for the past five years. Her little kiosk is located at the busy City market in Novaya Kohovka, Ukraine. Aishe started her business to help support her family. She and her husband, Vadim, have two children – a 17 year old daughter and 14 year old son. Aishe likes what she does and looks forward to increasing her income. She has requested a loan of $400 to help purchase more clothing and increase the assortment and quantity of her inventory.

loans.use: Purchase clothing inventory

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en: Oksana has developed a successful clothing business selling higher quality women’s blouses. She is an experienced entrepreneur having started her venture about ten years ago. Her business has been very stable and she has built up about $6000 worth of inventory. Oksana chose to sell women’s clothing because she knew there would be good demand from women desiring to renew their wardrobes. She tries to maximize her sales by frequently updating her product selection and has requested a loan to help her purchase new supply of clothing inventory. Oksana has proven to be a hard-working entrepreneur with integrity and we are happy to further assist with her business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for clothing business

loans.name: Elencith

texts.es:
Elencith makes starch from cassava by using a small electric grater. She sells starch to snack food producers in her neighborhood, in the city of San José de Sisa, in the department of San Martín, Perú.

She began 4 years ago with her own capital of S/. 50.00, which she was able to increase little by little with the help of the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, through its “Corazón de Jesús” Communal Bank. She began with loans of S/.300 (approx. $94). She is now requesting a loan of S/.2,000 ($625) to buy more modern equipment for grating, sifting, and drying the cassava, and also for some ingredients. With the new equipment she is hoping to improve the quality of her product and increase her production.

Elencith is 26 years old and works every day along with her husband. She has two young children, 2 and 8 years old. The older child studies in a primary school in the afternoons. Elencith’s goal is to grow her business and provide good service in the neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Elencith produce almidón a base de yuca utilizando un pequeño rallador eléctrico . Ella vive y vende almidón a los productores de bocaditos de la zona en la ciudad de San José de Sisa, en el departamento de San Martín – Perú. Empezó hace 4 años con un capital propio de S/. 50.00, incrementándolo poco a poco con el apoyo económico que le brindó Manuela Ramos, a través del Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”. Ella ha recibido al inicio S/300 (aprox US$94), actualmente ha solicitado S/.2,000 (US$625) para comprar un equipo moderno para rallar y cernir la yuca, como para el secado del almidón y un poco de insumos. Con ello busca mejorar la calidad del producto e incrementar su producción . Ella tiene 26 años y empieza a trabajar todas las mañanas en compañía de su esposo tiene dos hijos pequeños de 2 y 8 años, este último estudia en una escuela primaria por las tardes, sus metas son crecer y dar un buen servicio en la zona.

loans.use: To buy equipment for making cassava starch and to buy ingredients

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Alma Rosa

texts.en:
Alma Rosa is a hard-working, enthusiastic woman. Her husband, unable to find a steady job, works as a waiter, bricklayer, or whatever other job is available. Even then, his income is often insufficient to cover the family's basic needs. Faced with this situation, Alma started her business selling cosmetics five years ago, when her children were still small and required diapers and milk. She was fortunate in that she was able to build a large clientele, thanks in part to the high quality products she sold.

She now fills large orders and is requesting this loan, which she will repay over a period of 6 months, to purchase additional inventory to meet demand. Alma and her family thank you for your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Alma Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta. Ante la falta de empleo su esposo realiza diversas actividades desde mesero hasta albañil, pero aun así el ingreso que obtiene es muy poco para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra Alma inició su negocio de venta de cosméticos desde hace cinco años, sus hijos estaban muy pequeños y requerían de leche y pañales, afortunadamente los productos que comercializa son de muy buena calidad y pronto logró incrementar su número de clientes.

Ahora ya surte grandes pedidos y para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes ahora Alma está solicitando un préstamo de $1,100 dólares, mismos que se compromete a devolver en 6 meses. Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien mas lo necesita, no lo pienses más, esta familia agradece mucho tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Nancy Guadalupe

texts.es:
Nancy lives in the San Nicolas de los G. neighborhood of Nuevo Leon. She’s a single mother of two children who are 16 and 20 years old. She has been selling cosmetics for five years, starting the business to be able to give her children the things they need, knowing that they can’t count on anyone else to help them get ahead. Little by little, she’s made a name for herself and increased her customer base. Nothing has been easy for Nancy but her love for her family has motivated her to work ever harder.

In order to meet the orders that she has and to offer a good service to her customers, Nancy is asking for a $475 loan that she will use to buy merchandise. She promises to repay the loan in 6 months. You play an important part in the development of this business and in the lives of Nancy and her family, and she thanks you for your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Nancy vive en la localidad de San Nicolás de los G. en Nuevo León, es soltera y tiene dos hijos de 16 y 20 años de edad. Desde hace cinco años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, inició este negocio para poder darle todo lo necesario a sus hijos ya que no cuenta con la ayuda de nadie más para sacar adelante a su familia. Poco a poco se ha dado a conocer y ha incrementado su número de clientes considerablemente, no ha sido fácil para Nancy pero el amor hacia su familia la motiva a esforzarse más cada día.

Para poder surtir los pedidos que tiene y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes ahora Nancy está solicitando un crédito de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía y se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, así como en la vida de Nancy y su familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for sale.

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is the single mother of one child. They are natives of the Escobedo neighborhood of Nuevo Leon. Faced with having to get the things that her son needs, Juana started a business selling cosmetics two years ago, starting with sales to her neighbors and friends, but soon managing to increase both her customer base and her sales. Juana is an entrepreneur who works hard day after day so that her son can get a good education and have a better future.

Juana now needs a $475 loan that she will use to buy merchandise so that she can offer her customers a better level of service, as well as a wider range of products. She promises to repay this amount in 6 months. You can help someone today who badly needs your help so don’t just think about it. Juana sincerely thanks you for your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana es soltera y tiene un hijo, ellos son originarios de la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León. Ante la necesidad de obtener los recursos que su hijo necesita, desde hace doce años Juana inició su negocio con la venta de cosméticos, comenzó con sus vecinos y amigos pero pronto logró incrementar sus clientes y ventas. Juana es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza día con día por sacar adelante a su hijo y desea ofrecerle una buena educación que le permita tener un mejor futuro.

En estos momentos Juana necesita de un crédito de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos así como un mejor servicio, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tú puedes hoy ayudar a quien más lo necesita, no lo pienses más, Juana agradece sinceramente tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for sale.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia is an entrepreneur and a bundle of energy. She’s married and has three children who are 13, 14 and 16 years old. Her husband works as a driver but his income is very low and there have been times when he hasn’t earned anything. To cover the family expenses, Amelia started a business, selling undergarments, eight years ago. Then, with the help of her mother who lives in Mexico City, she began to sell bed covers that her mother sent to her. She was very successful, fortunately, and now she sells sheets, towels and bedspreads too.

Because the quality of her products is very high, Amelia’s order have increased considerably, and she needs a $550 loan to stock more merchandise. She promises to repay the loan in 6 months. Amelia is very grateful for the opportunity that you are giving her to improve and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Amelia es una mujer emprendedora y muy activa, es casada y tiene tres hijos, de 13,14 y 16 años de edad. Su esposo se desempeña como chofer pero el ingreso que obtiene es muy bajo y había ocasiones en que no recibía nada, para poder cubrir los gastos familiares hace ocho años Amelia comenzó su propio negocio, inició vendiendo ropa intima pero con ayuda de su madre que vive en la cuidad de México empezó a vender cobertores que le enviaba, afortunadamente obtuvo muy buenos resultados y ahora también vende sábanas, toallas y colchas.

Como la calidad de los productos que Amelia comercializa es muy buena, sus pedidos se incrementaron considerablemente, y para poder surtir necesita un préstamo de $ 550 dólares, mismos que se compromete a devolver en 6 meses. Amelia agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Argentina

texts.es:
Argentina is single and has one daughter. She used to work as a secretary but her employer let her go when she became pregnant and she found it difficult to find other work. Unable to count on anyone else, she had to start her own business to get the things that she needed both for the birth of the baby and for what her young daughter needed later. That’s how she began her business selling tamales 21 years ago and gelatinas (gelatin-based deserts) soon afterwards. She’s done very well and can now count on the help of a sister and a sister-in-law to meet the demands of her customers.

Fortunately, the business has allowed Argentina to support her daughter and her daughter’s schooling. Now she wants to continue growing so she’s asking for a $550 loan that she will use to buy basic supplies for increasing her production. She promises to repay the loan in 6 months. You can play an important part in the life of this family by contributing towards the growth of her business. Argentina and her daughter sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Argentina es soltera y tiene una hija. Anteriormente ella trabajaba de secretaria pero al embarazarse la despidieron y le fue difícil encontrar otro empleo, no contaba con la ayuda de nadie así que tuvo que iniciar su propio negocio para obtener los recursos que necesitaba en el nacimiento de su hija y para darle todo lo necesario después, es así que desde hace 21 años Argentina se dedica a la venta de tamales y poco después incorporó la venta de gelatinas, donde le ha ido mucho mejor, para poder cubrir las demandas de sus clientes ahora cuenta con la ayuda de una de sus hermanas y una cuñada.

Afortunadamente el negocio de Argentina le ha permitido mantener y darle estudios a su hija, ahora desea continuar creciendo para lo que solicita un crédito de $ 550 dólares que destinará a la compra de insumos para incrementar su producción, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de esta familia, contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, Argentina y su hija te agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Buy ingredients and materials for food business.

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es:
Bertha Alicia is married and has four children who are19, 23, 29, and 32 years old. Her husband works as a mason, but the income he receives is very low and he missed a few seasons of work. Since Bertha is a entrepreneurial person, she began her own business 15 years ago. She began by selling tamales and a little while later one of her brothers-in-law invited her to sell clothing. This is what she does now, and, little by little and by incorporating a variety of clothing, she has been able to make her business grow.

In order to keep her business growing, Bertha needs a loan of $325.00, which she will use to buy merchandise that will help her to improve her service and increase her sales. She promises to return the loan in 3 months. Become an important part of the life of this family. They are sincerely grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Bertha Alicia es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, de 19,23, 29 y 32 años de edad. Su esposo se desempeña como albañil pero el ingreso que recibe es muy bajo y pasaba algunas temporadas sin empleo, por lo que Bertha como es una mujer emprendedora desde hace quince años inició su propio negocio, comenzó vendiendo tamales y poco después un cuñado la invitó a vender ropa, ahora solo se dedica a esto y ha hecho crecer su negocio poco a poco incorporando más variedad de ropa.

Para poder continuar creciendo con su negocio Bertha necesita un préstamo de $ 325 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía con lo que podrá mejorar su servicio e incrementar sus ventas, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en solo 3 meses. Forma parte importante en la vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is from the town of Saltillo, Coahuila. She is married and has two children, who are 8 and 10 years old. Three years ago, Juana began her own business selling linens. At that time, her husband had lost his job and the household expenses were piling up. With the financial help of a family member, Juana began to sell by catalog and she soon managed to increase her number of customers. She now has many customers and a successful business.

In order to keep her business growing, Juana needs a loan of $325.00, which she will use to buy merchandise. She promises to pay back the loan in 3 months. Become a part of Juana’s achievements. She and her family are sincerely grateful for any help you are able to give them.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana es originaria de la localidad de Saltillo, Coahuila, está casada y tiene dos hijos de 8 y 10 años de edad. Desde hace tres años Juana inició su propio negocio con la venta de blancos, en aquel momento su esposo se había quedado desempleado y los gastos de la casa comenzaron a acumularse, con ayuda financiera de un familiar Juana comenzó a vender por catálogo y pronto logró incrementar sus pedidos ahora ya tiene muchos clientes y un negocio exitoso.

En estos momentos, para continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio Juana necesita un préstamo de $ 325 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en solo 3 meses. Forma parte en los logros de Juana, ella y su familia agradecen sinceramente cualquier tipo de apoyo que puedas brindarles.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Magda Delia

texts.es:
Magda is a very hardworking woman. She is single and has three children; the older two are 6 and 12 years old, and the youngest is only 8 months old. She has had to raise her family by herself and in order to cover their basic needs and give them the time they need, she began her own business one year ago. She started by selling candies and then incorporated other grocery products. She now has a well-stocked store. She would like to be able to meet all the needs of her customers, so that she can offer good service and make sure her business remains their preferred grocery.

In order to continue growing, Magda is requesting a loan of $325.00, which she will use to buy merchandise. She is prepared to return the loan in 3 months. Be an important part of the development of this business and help improve this family’s quality of life. They will be sincerely thankful.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Magda es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos, de 6 y 12 años de edad y el más pequeño de solo 8 meses de nacido. Ella sola ha tenido que sacar adelante a su familia y para poder cubrir sus necesidades básicas y darles el tiempo que necesitan desde hace un año inició su propio negocio con la venta de dulces y poco después incorporó otros productos de abarrotes, ahora tiene una tienda bien surtida, ella desea cubrir todas las necesidades de sus clientes para ofrecer un buen servicio y continuar con su preferencia .

Para poder continuar creciendo ahora Magda está solicitando un préstamo de $ 325 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía, ella esta dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y ayuda a mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara is a hard worker, is married and has 4 children ages 8, 12, 15 and 18; all are students. Sara is dedicated to the sale of traditional arts and crafts. This business was established 25 year ago and was handed down to Sara and her husband by her in-laws. Her children help during busy times such as religious holidays. They joined a commercial union five years ago and have since acquired a stand that has helped their business grow.

During this time of the year, with holidays approaching, Sara’s sales increase considerably. Sara is requesting a loan of $ 700 that will be used for the purchase of merchandise to keep up with the increasing demand of her customers. She promises to pay off the loan in only 3 months. Please contribute to the growth of this business and the wellbeing of Sara and her family. They greatly appreciate your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Sara es muy trabajadora, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos, de 8, 12, 15 y 18 años de edad, todos ellos estudian. Sara se dedica a la venta de artesanías, este negocio ya tiene 25 años anteriormente era de sus suegros y ahora Sara y su esposo se encargan de él, y reciben ayuda de sus hijos en temporadas altas como en fiestas religiosas. Hace cinco años se adhirieron a la unión de comerciantes y lograron adquirir el puesto que ahora tienen, donde les ha ido mucho mejor con sus ventas y han crecido mucho.

En estos momentos que se aproximan fecha especiales, donde se incrementan las ventas considerablemente y Sara está solicitando un préstamo de $ 700 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en solo 3 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio y al bienestar de Sara y su familia, ellos agradecen mucho la confianza y apoyo que depositas en su negocio.

loans.use:
Merchadise Purchase

Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther is married and has three children ages 19, 23 and 25. Her husband is a mechanic and owns his own shop but often struggles to make ends meet and find enough work to support his family. For this reason, Esther began helping a neighbor sell jewelry and, eighth years ago, she decided to begin her own business. Her love of sales and the desire to better the quality of life for her family have been her incentive to make an effort every day.

Fortunately, Esther has gained a loyal following and wishes to continue with the success she has had until now. She is requesting a loan of $1100 that she will use for the purchase of additional merchandise to increase the variety available to her customers and the level of service. She promises to pay off the loan in 6 months. Become an integral part of her success and support Esther. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Esther es casada y tiene tres hijos de 19, 23 y 25 años de edad. Su esposo tiene un taller mecánico a veces pasa por malos tiempos donde no tiene nada de trabajo y no recibe ningún ingreso para a su familia, por esta razón Esther comenzó a ayudarle a una vecina con la venta de joyería y poco después decidió independizarse y comenzar su negocio hace ocho años. Su gusto por las ventas y su deseo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia la incentivan a esforzarse más cada día.

Afortunadamente Esther ha logrado tener muchos clientes y desea que su negocio continúe creciendo como hasta ahora y para darle un muevo impulso ahora esta solicitando un crédito de $ 1,100 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes y mejorar la calidad de su servicio, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte importante de sus logros y decídete a apoyar a Esther, muchas gracias.

loans.use:
Merchandise Purchase

Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the fifteen women of the Farlu Liguey association, led by Ms. Seynabou T.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“In spite of the countless social difficulties that arise from the disastrous economic situation, the village of Diourbel has kept alive its ancient tradition of producing tourgui ndiareme textiles. Although the women of Diourbel have been severely affected by the economic hardship, they jealously guard the secrets of weaving these small wrap outfits, which are highly prized by both locals and outsiders. With the recent acceleration in migration out of rural areas, women occupy a strategic position in the area of clothing production and other crafts. These products are easily marketed thanks to the numerous loumas (weekly markets) and Diourbel's proximity to the holy city of Touba, which attracts enormous crowds in its seasonal pilgrimages. This has been a boon to the women who supplement their families' incomes with local trading activities. In order to strengthen these activities, the members of our group always need to augment their available stock so that they can ensure continuous and diversified production. Since many women compete in this market, the members of our group also plan to introduce the sale of finished products purchased in other loumas.”

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Business description translated from French by Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance Fund.

«DIOURBEL malgré les multiples problèmes sociaux liés à la situation économique désastreuse a gardé une veille tradition dans le domaine du textile et de la confection (tourgui ndiarème). Les femmes mêmes très touchées par ce contexte, gardent encore jalousement les secrets du tissage des petits pagnes, bien prisés par les citadins et autres étrangers. Avec le phénomène de l’exode rural les femmes occupent une position stratégique dans le domaine de la confection du linge de corps, habits et produits artisanaux. Grâce aux nombreux loumas (marché hebdomadaires) les produits trouvent un circuit d’écoulement avec la proximité de la grande ville sainte (TOUBA) qui draine pour chaque occasion du monde fou dans la région. Pour le petit commerce comme un peu partout c’est devenu une pratique courante et très lucrative pour de nombreuses femmes du BAOL Pour renforcer les activités les membres ont toujours besoin de stock disponible pour une confection continue et diversifiées des produits. Actuellement beaucoup de femmes se dispute le marché c’est pourquoi les membres veulent développer la vente des produits finis achetés dans les autres loumas»

loans.use: Purchase of thread, needles, and cloth for  traditional garment production; purchase of finished goods and transportation for long-distance trade

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the nine women of the Takusan de Ahidjidjio association, led by Ms. Celestine D.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Context: The project is located in Oussouye in the south of Senegal. It comprises women who work together to improve their living conditions and those of their families. Oussouye is known for its tourism, which is why local commerce to provide the hotels with foodstuffs is the principal business activity.

Purpose: The objectives of the group include increasing the income of its members, alleviating the burden of the housewife, and improving the living conditions of its members.

Business activities: In order to carry out its business properly, the group is requesting a loan to allow it to purchase merchandise in the markets of nearby towns such as Ziguinchor, Bignona and Kolda, in order to satisfy the local demand for these goods.”

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Business description translated from French by Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance Fund.

«Contexte : Le projet se situ à Oussouye au sud du Sénégal ; il regroupe les femmes en en association de développement qui travail dans le but d’amélioré leurs conditions de vie et celle de leurs familles. Oussouye est réputé de tourisme et c’est pourquoi, le commerce est l’activité principale permettant aux structures hôtelières de s’approvisionner sur place.

Objectifs : Le groupement s’est fixé entre autres objectifs : - D’augmenté le revenu de ses membres - D’alléger le panier de la ménagère - D’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres

Activités : Pour mener a bien ces activités, le groupement sollicite un prêt de 500 000f qui lui permettra de pouvoir acheter de la marchandise dans les marchés les plus proche tel que Ziguinchor, Bignona, et Kolda ; afin de satisfaire la demande au niveau local.»

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for resale, transportation and storage expenses

loans.name: Assa

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the nine women of the Mouit association, led by Ms. Assa G.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“The land surrounding the village of Gandiol suffers from a serious disequilibrium in both the ecological and the economic sectors. Insufficient technical capacity and weak financial capacity of the local people as well as the absence of legitimacy of the local leadership constitute major obstacles to the development of this land.

As professional development organizations work in the area, the men and women of the land who care about their socio-economic development organize themselves into associations and launch agricultural activities, local trading, skilled crafts, herding, etc.

However, the weak level of production and organization of the various sectors such as herding is due in large part to the acceleration of desertification and degradation of the climate. But in addition, the fault of material and financial means as well as the weakness of technical support mean that livestock activity is limited to just a few traditional herders. This means that the local supply of meat is almost non-existant, so local demand is satisfied by traveling to the St. Louis market (the nearest city), which is very expensive even if you don't include transport costs.

Our business will be to fatten cattle and sell beef to the local population. We plan to buy two cows and fatten them for one month. The five- and six-year-old cows weigh about 250 kg. The cows will be bought cheaply in the markets of Djolof and will quickly be fattened. One pair of cows will be fattened every six months, and one slaughter every three months will be undertaken in coordination with demand, which will be identified in advance.”

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Business description translated from French by Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance Fund.

«Le terroir Gandiolais présente des déséquilibres importants entre les zones écologiques ainsi que les secteurs économiques. L’insuffisance des compétences techniques, la faible capacité financière des populations ainsi que l’absence de légitimité de l’institution locale constituent des contraintes majeures pour la prise en charge du développement du terroir. Autant que les groupes professionnels organisés intervenants dans la zones, des hommes et des femmes de ce terroir soucieuses de leur développement socio – économique s'organisent à travers des structures associatives et initient des activités agricole, le petit commerce, l'artisanat et l'élevage, ...ect. Cependant le faible niveau de production et d’organisation des différents secteurs tels que l’élevage est dû en grande partie à un à l’aggravation du phénomène de la désertification, à la remontée progressive du biseau salé et à la péjoration climatique entre autre. Mais aussi, le manque de moyen matériel et financier ainsi que la faiblesse de l’appui technique fond que le secteurs de l’élevage reste l’apanage de quelques éleveurs traditionnels. Du coup, l’approvisionnement du marché locale en viande reste presque inexistante. Ce qui fait que la plus part des besoins sont satisfait à partir du marché de St – louis et des fois à des coûts très élevé sans compté sur le transport. L’ activité de production sera l’engraissage et la vente de viande de bœuf aux population locales. Ils s’agit d’acheter une paire de bœuf qui a une certaine valeur bouchère et les engraisser pendant un mois. Les bœuf de 5 à 6 ans engraissés doivent peser 250 kg ou plus à l’abattage. Les bœufs seront achetés dans les foiraille du Djolof à moindre coût et seront ensuite engraisser. Une paire de bœuf sera engraissée par semestre et un abattage par trimestre se fera au bénéfice de la demande qui sera identifiée d’avance.»

loans.use: Purchase of cows, feed, scale, knives, refrigerator for beef business

loans.name: Binta

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the ten women of the Femmes de Gandiol group, led by Ms. Binta N.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“The town of Gandiol has about 13,968 inhabitants. The principal economic activities of the area are fishing, horticulture, herding, and salt production. But the recent degredation of the climate has done damage to the entire community. And this is reflected in the weak development of the local markets. One thus notes the existence of temporary markets which are insufficient to meet local demand.

In order to address this insufficiency, the members of the Femmes de Gandiol group hope to develop the local market by creating a system of acquisition and commercialization of diverse products, by giving our members the chance to use loans to develop local trade.

Our business will consist of marketing basic household foodstuffs: vegetables, fruits, fresh fish, and other foods used in daily meals. We will buy these goods at a lower cost in the markets of the nearby towns of Potou and St. Louis, and resell then in our village.”

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Business description translated from French by Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance Fund.

«La population de Gandiol s’estime à environ 13.968 habitants. Les principales activités économiques qui sont menées dans la zone sont : la pêche, le maraîchage, l’élevage, et l’extraction du sel. Cependant du fait de la péjoration climatique et des phénomènes anthropique, le niveau de dégradation et de désorganisation est ressentis par sa communauté entière. Et ceci se reflète dans le faible développement des marchés locaux. On note ainsi l’existence et de marché temporaire qui n’arrivent pas à satisfaire la demande locale. Pour palier à ces insuffisances, les membres des groupements des femmes de Gandiol , espèrent développer le marché locale par la création d’un système d’approvisionnement et de commercialisation de produits diverses à travers la mise en place pour les membres de leurs groupements des crédits pour inciter au développement du petit commerce.

L’activité consiste à la commercialisation de denrées de premier nécessité, légumes, fruits poissons frais et autres condiments utiles pour l’alimentation au quotidien. Pour cela acheter à moindres coût dans les marchés de Potou et St – louis des denrées à revendes sur les places aménagées dans les villages du Gandiol»

loans.use: Purchase of fresh fish, vegetables and fruit in nearby towns for resale in home village

loans.name: Ohunov

texts.ru:
T. Ohunov is the head accountant at the local farm. This year, he will turn 50. He is busy at work from early morning 'till the evening. The work is interesting, but it is time-consuming and it takes a lot of effort. At the same time, the salary is not enough to cover all of the family expenses. This is why T. has a small business raising cattle at home. His family, wife and 4 children, help him. T. would like to receive a $1,200 loan in order to acquire 3 small bulls and feed for them. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

Тоийр работает главным бухгалтером дехканском хозяйстве. В этом году ему исполнилось 50 лет. С утра до позднего вечера он занят на работе. Работа интересная, но в то же время трудная и требует приложения всех сил. При этом заработка не хватает на все семейный расходы и дополнительно Тоийр занимается откормом скота у себя дома. Ему помогает его семья: жена и четверо детей. Тоийр собирается получить займ в размере $1200 и потратить его на приобретение 3 бычков и корма для них. В течении 12 месяцев он собирается погашать данный займ.

loans.use: To purchase 3 bulls and feed for them

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: The family has 5 members. The father  works as a farmer who plants vegetables. His wife and two older girls work as day laborers at the green dragon plant company. Their youngest daughter is in the 4th class. They just owed $312.50 to the poor bank which they borrowed to plant 150 green dragon plants (pictured). Their average income is $12.50 per person/month. Now they want to borrow $75 to invest in planting vegetables to get more income and will pay back it over 5 months.

loans.use: To plant vegetables

loans.name: Cong

texts.en: Ms.Công is single. She lives in the same house with her mother and young sister and nephew. She takes care of her mother who is weak with a heart condition and plants vegetables. Her young sister’s income is enough to provide for herself and her son. Their average income is $10 per month/person. Now Ms. Công wants to borrow $75 to plant vegetables and will pay it back over 5 months.

loans.use: To plant vegetables

loans.name: Muyssar

texts.ru:
Muyssar B. is 34 years old. She is divorced and has 1 daughter. She has graduated from high school. She alone has to take care of her family. Her business is sale of women's clothing and shoes. She has been in retail business for 9 years.

In 2006, she took her first loan from MicroInvest. The loan was for $150 while her savings were $300. She used the loan to expand her business and add more different varieties of women's clothing and shoes to her assortment. Currently, her sales are $1,300. In the future, Muyssar plans to acquire a second retail location.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

Бобочонова Муяссар – 34года. Разведенная, имеет одну дочь. Образование среднее. Все заботы о семье лежат на её плечах. Она занимается продажей женской одежды и обуви, вот уже 9лет. Начала свою деятельность с продажи женской одежды. В 2006 году начала кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест» с 150$, тогда её активы составляли 300$. После получения займа и целевого использования она расширила товарооборот, добавила в свой ассортимент женскую обувь. Сейчас её товарооборот возрос до 1300$. В будущем планирует приобрести ещё одну торговую точку.

loans.use: To open a second retail location

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila has requested a $1000 loan to increase her working capital and purchase new clothing inventory for her attractive little clothing sales business. Ludmila’s store has a nice indoor location at the busy City market in Novaya Kohovka. An experienced entrepreneur, Ludmila has been helping meet the clothing needs of her customers for over twelve years. She enjoys having her own business and the opportunity to provide for her family. She and her husband, Sergei, have one son who is twelve years old. We are happy for this opportunity to assist Ludmila as she works to develop her business and meet her family’s needs.

loans.use: Increase working capital and purchase inventory for a clothing store.

loans.name: Victoriya

texts.en:
Victoriya owns a little clothing sales business at the City market in Navaya Kohovka, Ukraine. She has been in business for seven years. In a typical month she will make about $250 in profit. Victoriya is married and has one daughter. Her goal for her business is to be able to meet the needs of her family. 

Victoriya has requested a short term loan of $100 to boost her working capital and purchase additional clothing inventory for her business.

loans.use: Purchase clothing inventory

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.ru:
Dilrabo G. is 35 years old, she graduated from high school. She is a widow and has two children. Both are in school, and after school the older son helps with the retail business. After her husband's death 8 years ago, Dilrabo began her retail of children's clothing. She needed to have an income because, suddenly, she had to take care of everything.

In 2005, she received her first loan from MicroInvest. At that time, she obtained $90 and her savings were about $150. After receiving the microcredit loan, Gilrabo increased the variety of goods. Her current retail spot is very small, and she is planning to increase her retail space.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

Гозиева Дилрабо 35лет, образование среднее специальное. Она вдова, имеет два сына. Оба учатся в школе, после школы старший сын помогает матери в торговле. После смерти мужа начала торговать детской одеждой уже 8лет, так как все заботы и проблемы семьи свалились на её голову.

В 2005 году начала получать займ в МЗФ «Микроинвест», тогда она получила 90$, и её активы составляли 150$. После получения неоднократного займа она добавила в свой ассортимент и хозяйственные товары, но место для торговли у неё тесное и она планирует расширить место деятельности.

loans.use: To expand retail place

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira has been a seller of household goods for the past 20 years in Tadjikistan. Her business is located in the open-air market in Panjshanbe, Khujand. Munira sells different kinds of household goods. She started her business from the selling of sieves and spoons. She is the one member of her family who earns money for family needs, because she lost her husband several years ago and is the sole provider for her five children. It is very difficult to support such a big family, but Munira is a very cheerful women. She says that difficulties in her life have made her stronger and resilient. She lives for her children. She must help them to find their way in their life.

Her eldest son helps her to import goods from Istaravshan, Tadjikistan. Her eldest daughter stays at her place of business, when her mother goes on a trip to buy goods .The turnover of her goods is good, but she has one problem. It is the condition of her place of business. She plans to increase the number of her goods in order to save money to renting a little stall in a bigger shop. For this purpose she is requesting a loan of $400.

loans.use: Business development.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Matluba A. has been selling perfume for the past 9 years. She is 45 years old, has finished high school, is married, and has 4 sons. Her husband is in the retail business, the oldest son is working in Russia, and her younger sons help out with the business.

In 2003, Matluba began working with MicroInvest. Before receiving the first loan, she worked in a place that was one square meter. With the loan, she was able to expand both her business location and her assortment of perfumes. Since then, her profits doubled. With the next loan she plans to increase the assortment of her goods.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

Абдуллоева Матлюба занимается реализацией парфюмерий вот уже 9лет. Матлюбе 45 лет образование среднее специальное, замужем, имеет четверых сыновей. Муж занимается торговлей, старший сын на заработках в РФ, младшие сыновья помогают родителям в торговле.

В 2003году начала кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест». До получения кредита место её деятельности составлял один метр. После получения займа она расширила место деятельности, увеличила товарооборот. Сейчас её активы возросли в два раза больше. На будущее планирует увеличить ассортимент товаров.

loans.use: Increase assortment of goods

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en: Zakir V. is 30-year-old father of three children.  He lives with his family in Bilasuvar, the southern part of Azerbaijan. He is internally displaced person form Nagorniy Karabakh who fled to Bilasuvar during Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict.  Zakir has seven year experience in animal breeding.  He started his small business borrowing money form his friends. He purchased one milky cow. When his livestock brought him income he returned the debts and purchased one calf. He sells milk and yogurt to local people, this is his income. Children grow up and covering family needs become harder and harder, so Zakir, applied for 1200 USD to purchase one additional milky cow and a calf.

loans.use: Going to purchase one cow and one calf

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza M. has been engaged in business for the past six years. Aziza  is married and has five children. Her husband is in Russia, where he went to earn money. Her children go to school. 
Her business is to sell household goods and she has her own canteens in Chkalovsk, Khujand. She employs one seller for her business of selling household goods.(He is in the photo). Aziza buys her goods from Istaravshan. Her assortment of inventory consists of such goods as sieves, spoons and ladles. Gradually she plans to increase the number of her goods to sell and with that profit she plans to rent a little shop to sell her goods. She want to receive a loan of $400 for four months.

loans.use: Purchase  of next batch of goods.

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.ru:
Mahfirat Chaborova has been selling women's wear for 15 years. Mahfirat has high school education.She is 48, married with 3 children. Her husband works in construction, all her children have families of their own. Mahfirat sells women's footwear. She took out her first loan of $90 in 2003. Since then she has bought several trading kiosks at the main city markets and expanded her business. Her assets have grown to twice it's original size. In the future she plans to include women's clothing into assortment. She is requesting a loan of $500.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer.

Чаборова Махфират продает женскую одежду, вот уже 15лет. Её 48лет, образование среднее, замужем мать троих детей. Муж работает строителем, дети каждый имеет отдельную семью. Махфират занимается продажей женской обуви. Начала получать займ в 2003году, тогда она получила 90$. После получения займа она приобрела несколько торговых точек в больших рынках города, увеличила товарооборот. Сейчас её активы возросли в два раза, и она получает 500$. В будущем планирует добавить в свой ассортимент и женскую одежду.

loans.use: to add women's clothing to the assortment

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa S. is 56-year-old farmer, who lives with his family in Bilasuvar. Bilasuvar situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Mustafa is internally dislocated person from Nagorniy Karabakh who fled to Bilasuvar in 1993, during Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict. 

Mustafa started his small business in 1997. For money he saved he purchases his first calf and very soon this calf breeder to milkier cow. His income comes from selling milk and yoghurt. These products are in high demand in Azerbaijan, and Mustafa expand his business purchasing one additional milkier cow. There are two main products in demand: meat and dairies. Mustafa decided to try himself in selling meat production. For this purpose he applied for 1200 USD to purchase 3 calves to start selling meat production. Estimated cost for calf is 200-300.

loans.use: Going to purchase four calves for meat production

loans.name: Mutribahon

texts.ru:
Mutribahon N., 28, has high school education. She is married with 2 children. Her husband is engaged in trading, the children are at a day care. Mutribahon sells men's underwear and women's robes. She has been in trading business for 8 years. Mutribahon had started to sell men's underwear with $80 in assets. After getting her first loan of $70 from Microinvest in 2004 she has added women's robes to her assortment. The loan helped her to increase the revenue to twice it's original size. In the future she plans to open one more trading kiosk.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer.

Назирова Мутрибахон – 28лет. Образование среднее, замужем, мать двоих детей. Муж занимается торговлей, дети ходят в детский сад. Она занимается продажей мужскими нижними белями и женскими халатами. Занимается торговлей 8лет. Начала свою деятельность с 80$. Раньше до получения займа она торговала только мужскими нижними белями. После получения первого займа в сумме 70$, которое получила в «Микроинвест» в 2004году, добавила в свой ассортимент и женские халаты. С помощью займа увеличила товарооборот в два раза и в будущем планирует открыть еще одну торговую точку.

loans.use: to open another trading place

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en: Rasim S. is 45-year-old farmer who lives in Azerbaijani southern part, in Bilasuvar region. Rasim married and has four children. He is internally displaced person who fled from Nagorniy Karabakh to Bilasuvar in 1993. Rasim started his business since 1999 when he purchased one calf. Now Rasim keeps one cow and poultry. His only one income comes from selling milk and yoghurt to the local people. Since dairy products are in high demand and Rasim going to expand his business purchasing  one milkier cow for 800 USD and a calf for 400 USD. The estimated cost for cow 700-800 USD and for calf 200-400 depends on the weight of calf.

loans.use: Going to purchase one milkier cow and a calf

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru:
Mavzuna M. is a happy mother of three boys. She is 36, is married and has a college education. Because her husband is currently in Russia earning money, it's up to her to take care of the family while he is gone. The children go to school. She has been selling men's clothing for 6 years now. She became a client of MicroInvest back in 2003. She borrowed $100, which allowed her to diversify her goods as well as purchase a new sales point. Her daughter-in-law helps her out with the business by working as a salesperson. Currently her assets amount to $1300 and she is planing to open yet another sales point.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

Малабекова Мавзуна счастливая мать, у неё три сына. Ей 36лет, образование высшее, замужем. Муж на заработках в РФ, поэтому все заботы о семье пока на её голове. Дети учатся в школе. Она занимается продажей мужской одежды 6лет. Клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» стала в 2003году, тогда она получила 100$, и её активы составляли 200$. После получения неоднократного займа она увеличила ассортимент товаров и приобрела новое место деятельности. В её деятельности помогает ей как продавщица её сноха. Сейчас её активы возросли до 1300$, и в будущем она планирует приобрести еще одну торговую точку.

loans.use: to open another store

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en:
Mammadov Solmaz is 34-year-old businesswoman who lives with her husband and two children in Bilasuvar. Bilasuvar situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Solmaz is internally dislocated person who fled from Nagorniy Karabakh to Bilasuvar in 1993. Solmaz has her small sheep herd consisting of eight sheep. She has four years of experience in this field.  She sells sheep meat to the local people. Sheep meat is in high demand in Azerbaijan and also summer and autumn is wedding high season. So Solmaz purchase lambs, breed them up and only them she sells he meat. All process takes about 3-4 month. 

Now Solmaz going to expand her business and purchase fifteen sheep and fodder for them.  Estimated cost for one sheep is 70 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase fifteen sheep and fodder

loans.name: Tutiniso

texts.ru:
Tutiniso B. is 43 years old. She has a high-school education. She is married and has four children. Her husband works in sales. Her elder daughter is married. The other 3 are still in school. She has been working in sales for the past 12 years. At the beginning she was in the business of selling eggs. She became a client of MicroInvest back in 2003. After receiving her loan she proceeded to increase turnover, but because the number of people selling eggs increased, she chose to take her business in a different direction. Tutiniso purchased a different sales point and began selling office supplies and household goods. Currently her assets amount to $650. She is planing to increase the size of her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

Бобошеховой Тутинисо 43года, образование среднее специальное. Замужем, имеет четверых детей. Муж занимается торговлей, старшая дочь замужем остальные учатся в школе. Торговлей занимается 12лет. Раньше продавала оптом и в розницу куриные яйца. В МЗФ «Микроинвест» займ получила в 2003 году. После получения займа она расширила товарооборот, но так как продавцов в сфере куриных яиц стало больше, она перешла на другой вид бизнеса. Тутинисо приобрела другую точку торговли и стала продавать канцелярские и хозяйственные товары. Сейчас её активы возросли до 650$. В будущем планирует расширить место деятельности.

loans.use: to extend activity place

loans.name: Allahverdi

texts.en: Q. Allahverdi is 68-year-ol farmer who live with his 6 children in the southern town of Azerbaijan in Bilasuvar. Allahverdi  is internally displaced person from Nagorniy Karabakh since 1993, he was fled to Bilasuvar during Azerbajani-Armenian conflict. Allahverdi has 12 year of experience in sheep breeding. He sells them for meat production which i in high demand in all across Azerbaijan. Children grow up and prices are strong, so living in small region become harder and harder. Allahverdi decided to expand his business and purchase additional seven sheep and one milkier cow.  The summer and autumn is high season for weddings and meat demand double increase during this time. The estimated cost for cow is 700-800 USD and for sheep is 70 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase one milky cow and seven sheep

loans.name: Dogood

texts.en: Mr. Dogood O. specializes in the milling of rice.  This is a business he learned from his father as a child, and has been in this business since then.  He is 30 years old and married.  He is requesting the above loan amount to buy another milling machine to enable him to serve his customers better.

loans.use: To buy an additional milling machine

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Sra. Adriana Gonzalez relies on the earnings from her business selling new and used clothes in different parts of Nuevo Leon. She has built this business over the last 8 years. It has been the main source of income for Adriana, a widow, and her 5 children and a means for all of them to get ahead. She is asking for a $1,000 loan to buy merchandise for the cold-weather season.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Adriana G. cuenta con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva y usada vende en diferentes lugares de la cuidad de Nuevo Laredo. Ella se dedica ha este negoció desde mas de 8 años. Este negocio es su fuente de ingresos de su familia ya que se quedo viuda y con 5 hijos los cuales a sacado a delante con su negocio. Ella esta solicitando un préstamo de $1.000.00 Dlls. Para comprar mercancía de temporada de frió.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for the cold-weather season.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet Egieda is 27 years old, and happily married with 3 children.  She resides in Illushi village in Edo State.  She sells food items to her community and has been in this business for 4 years.  She hopes to buy more food stuffs to sell with the above funds.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn I. is 30 years old, and happily married with 4 children.  She has been selling provisions and food stuffs for the past 8 years.  She is requesting the above funds to buy more provisions and food stuffs to sell.  She currently resides in a town called Illushi in Edo State

loans.use: To buy more provisions & food stuffs to sell

loans.name: Urhobomudia Alfred

texts.en: Urhobomudia Alfred A. is 26 years old, and married with 3 children.  She has 3 years experience in her business.  She sells baby things to those in her community and other neighboring communities.  She is requesting the above funds to enable her to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more baby things to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Mrs. Gloria U. is 24 years old, and happily married with 2 children.  She is a farmer and she learned the act of farming from her mother.  She specializes in rice and yam production.  She now needs additional funds to enable her to buy more yams to sell, and chemicals for planting.  She hopes to expand her business with the above funds.

loans.use: To buy more yams & chemicals for sale & planting

loans.name: Monday

texts.en: Mr. Monday N. is 38 years, and old happily married with 3 children.  He is a farmer and he learned the act of farming from his father.  He specializes in the production of cassava, plantains and yams.  He is requesting the above funds for the production and maintainance of his farm.

loans.use:
To buy more suckers for planting & farm maintenance 
farm

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero S. sells fruit to those living in her community and neighboring town. She is 40 years old, and married with 5 children.  She hails from Uromi town in Edo State and has been in this business since 1982.  She needs $400 to enable her to buy more fruit like pawpaw, pears, etc. to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to sell

loans.name: Odion

texts.en: Odion U. is 35 years old.  She is a widow with 4 children.  She has been in business since 1996.  She sells different types of fruit such as pawpaw, pears & oranges.  These she buys on the tree in the bush, then harvests them and takes them to the market to sell.  She is requesting the loan amount above to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to sell

loans.name: Imoisili

texts.en: Mrs. Imoisili D. is 39 years old, and married with 5 children.  She has been in this business since 2002.  She is a native of Uromi in Edo state.  She is requesting for the above loan to enable her to buy more food stuffs, hair cream, hair relaxer, weavon, etc. to sell.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and hair equipment

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Mrs. Caroline O. is a Yoruba by tribe, but she stays in Uromi town in Edo State.  She is married with 4 children, and is a fashion designer.  She learned this business for 3 years.  She has also been in this business for 7 years.  She is requesting the above loan to enable her to buy more material to sell.

loans.use: To buy more material to sell

loans.name: Leyda Flor

texts.es:
Leyda Flor G. S., a widow with two school-aged children, is a member of the Community Bank "Las Amigas Zulmiritas." She sells food in a "maloca," which is a shop constructed without doors or windows that has a dry palm leave roof, in the town of Nueva Requena 38km from the city of Pucallpa.

After the death of her husband, Leyda's economic situation worsened and she saw the need to seek work. As she loves to cook, she got the idea to sell food to the loggers, farmers, teachers and doctors of her town. Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles ( approximately $94). Today the Movimiento Manuela Ramos is administering her a loan of $325 to grow her small store, equipping it with tables so that she can attend her clients as a sit-down restaurante.

The absence of her husband has been very difficult for Leyda, but owning her own small business has helped to push her forward. The earnings from her shop help to cover the needs of others in her life that are not able earn a living, such as her two children's school fees.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer

Leyda Flor G. S., viuda con dos hijos estudiantes, Socia del Banco Comunal Las Amigas Zulmiritas, vende comida en una maloca (tienda construida sin puertas ni ventanas con techo de hojas secas de palma) en el poblado de Nueva Requena a 38Km de la ciudad de Pucallpa.

Después de la muerte de su esposo su situación económica empeoró y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar y como le deleita la cocina surgió la idea de la venta de comida para los madereros, agricultores así como profesores y enfermeras. Su primer prestamo fue de S/. 300.00 (US$ 94.00 aprox.). Hoy se ha prestado US$ 325.00 aprox.para ampliar su pequeña maloca, equipándola con mesas y así atender a mas clientes del poblado.

La ausencia de su esposo le angustia mucho pero este pequeño negocio le anima a seguir adelante y saber que puede cubrir necesidades de otras personas que no pueden hacerlo, así como de cubrir los estudios de sus hijos.

loans.use: For equipment (to purchase tables)

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo has been working as a seafood and fish vendor for over thirty years. After working at a fish-packing factory when he was younger, he decided to deal directly with clients and start his own business. For most of his life, he has also worked in construction and as a handyman, using the income from his jobs to finance his business.

This is now Pablo’s second loan from Kiva and Mifex. He uses the loan capital to invest in different types of seafood, although his primary product is shrimp. The capital allows Pablo to concentrate on his business more and not have to depend on the jobs he gets as a handyman.

Pablo has five children who are already grown up. He lives with his aging mother and cares for her. They hope to be able to fix up their house with the extra profits they make.

loans.use: Invest in different types of seafood

loans.name: Antonieta Aide

texts.es:
Antonieta AiD. L. D. E. lives in the town of Nueva Requena, in the department of Ucayali, and which is located 48km from the city of Pucallpa. It is surrounded by the Aguaytia river and several lakes. Antioneta is 54 years old and is separated from her husband. She is raising two grandchildren, which has caused her to confront very difficult situations, especially economic troubles. Some friends told her about a feminist institution that gives training workshops to women. She attended a meeting and felt like a part of the family with the Las Amigas Zulmiritas Communal Bank. She later received a loan of S/. 300.00 (approximately $49 dollars), which she invested in grocery items. She then traded them for chickens, plantains, and fruits from the region, which she sold in the city of Pucallpa. Her customers are people from villages where many do not have cash.

This loan of S/. 2,500.00 (approximately $790.00) will be used to invest in more merchandise (milk, rice, noodles) and to expand her business with agricultural implements (such as lanterns, hammocks, mosquito nets). People from this area have many needs. She is very happy to be able to proviD. this service to the people from this area so that they don’t have to go to Pucallpa. Additionally, the income from the business allows her to pay for her grandchildren’s studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Antonieta AiD. L. D. E., residente del poblado D. Nueva Requena del departamento D. Ucayali, se encuentra a 48km D. la ciudad D. Pucallpa y está rodeado del río Aguaytia, D. lagos y cochas. Antonieta a sus 54 años se separó D. su esposo y tiene a su cargo dos nietos donD. tuvo que enfrentarse a situaciones muy difíciles, en especial económico, unas amigas le comentaron D. una institución feminista que daba charlas para mujeres, fue cuando asistió y se sintió ser parte D. la familia del Banco Comunal Las Amigas Zulmiritas, posteriormente recibió un prestamos D. S/. 300.00 soles (US$ 94 aprox.) que invirtió en abarrotes, los mismos que intercambia con gallinas, plátanos, frutas D. la región y los venD. en la ciudad D. Pucallpa. Sus clientes son personas D. los caseríos donD. muchos D. ellos no cuentan con efectivo. Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

El prestamos D. S/. 2,500.00 soles (US$ 790.00 aprox.) servirá para invertir en mas mercadería (leche, arroz, fideos) y ampliar su negocio con implementos para la agricultura (linternas, amacas, mosquiteros), estos pobladores tienen muchas necesidades. Está muy contenta D. poder dar facilidades a estos pobladores donD. ya no tienen la necesidad D. ir a la ciudad D. Pucallpa y además estos ingresos le permiten costear los estudios D. sus nietos.

loans.use: To buy grocery merchandise and agricultural implements

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria and her husband have had a small store in their home for 13 years. With effort, they succeeded in saving a little capital in order to sell food products from the coast and the mountains, such as rice, sugar, meats, oil, tuna, various legumes, and others. With a previous loan from Kiva, Maria was also able to begin selling cosmetics and other general store items (such as stationery and toys). They work in the store every day of the week, serving customers from 6 AM to 10 PM.

Maria is requesting her new loan so she may continue to improve her secondary business. She wants to invest in perfumes, clothing accessories like bracelets and earrings, and other types of gifts. She hopes that she will also be able to slowly start improving the appearance of her business.

Maria is married. She is 36 years old. She does not have children, but three years ago the son she had adopted when he was 1 day old died at the age of 10. Her husband supports her in everything; they are responsible people. Her desire with the loan is to generate higher earnings which will allow her to continue making improvements to her home and give her more security since it is located in a dangerous area.

loans.use: Continue investing in her new line of products

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa Q. P. makes lunches every day for the workers at a factory in her town. Each day she and her business partner (another member of the same Friendship Bridge women's group) prepare hot food for the men and then set up outside the factory gates when the men start to break for lunch. They sell a good, simple, hot lunch for about US$1.00. On a normal day they'll sell about 24 lunches. Felipa started the business just 6 months ago with her first Friendship Bridge loan. As before, she'll use the loan as working capital to buy the food she needs to prepare the lunches.

Felipa is 41 and is married with six kids aged 3 to 23. Her husband is an electrician. The kids that should be are all in school, but Felipa never went, and can't read or sign her name, so she signs the loan papers with a thumbprint. The family's health is generally good, but her husband has enormous headaches that keep him from work some of the time. Felipa's simple dream is that she wants to prosper more so she can support the kids and keep them in school.

The pictures shows Felipa with her youngest daughter. It was too late in the day to take a picture with her at her stand.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase the food needed to make lunch for the factory workers

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara Lorenzana O. is 29 and has a business selling new clothing on the street. She sells all manner of women's clothing, including pants and skirts. She also sells some beautiful posters, as shown in the picture. She says that now that she has the Friendship Bridge loans she has more to sell, and that makes her more successful. This is her second loan, and she'll use it to increase her inventory once again.

Sara is 29 and is married with four kids. Her dream is for her kids to have "careers", which means here that they'll be educated all the way through high school and then get a real job with perhaps a salary. Although almost everybody in Guatemala is self-employed, many at little tiny enterprises like Sara's, they all dream of their kids having a salary (and helping out their parents too).
