In keeping with her dream, her kids are in school, although Sara herself never did go to school at all. She can read a bit and can sign her name, but that's about it.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria D. R.

loans.use: Buy an electric machine to shave ice for granizados

loans.name: Maria Esmerelda

texts.en: Maria Esperanza

loans.use: Buy a cover for her stand to protect from the rain.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey S. is 27 years old and lives in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To earn income for her family, she runs a small grocery store at home earning around $5 each day. She and her husband have two children who are too young to attend school. Her husband (pictured here) works in his farmland growing rice and a variety of vegetables. These products enable him to earn on average $2.50 each day. 
Mrs. Srey S. is humbly requesting a loan to increase her grocery store inventory to meet her clients’ needs. She feels optimistic that the loan that will improve her business venture.

loans.use: To increase a number of her grocery products to meet her clients' needs.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Srey Sophal has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you enable entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to help finance their small businesses. 

We hope that you will continue your support by reinvesting your loan in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey S. is a 35-year-old widow with two children. She lives with her ailing mother in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To supplement her household income, Mrs. Srey S. and one of her children work together as tailors earning up to $10 each day.

This $1000 loan will be used to purchase tailoring tools and thread. Another part of the loan will be used to buy farmland to harvest crops to make additional profits. She and her family are grateful and appreciative of your trust and support.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring tools and farmland.

loans.name: Real

texts.en:
Mrs. Real Y. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a housewife and has to take care of her two pre-school-aged kids, while her other two are employed at a garment factory together, earning up to $180 a month. Additionally, her husband is self-employed as a construction foreman earning $5 each day.

Mrs Real Y. will use the loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to go to work and buy construction tools.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her husband to go to work and construction tools.

loans.name: Yesico Elizabeth

texts.en:
Yesica Elizabeth A. Q., 31, sells new clothes by either walking in the streets or going house to house knocking on doors. She goes to Guatemala City or as they call it here “Guate” to buy new clothes to sell. With this loan she will be able to restock her selection, which is very low because she has sold out of everything. The first loan was so successful in starting her new business that she's pleased to be moving on to a second loan.

She and the other members of her group just finished paying off their first 6 month loan. They all paid up in full and on time, something to be proud of and not something all groups are able to achieve.

She is married and has two children, both in school. When asked how much schooling she has had she was shy to admit that she had only finished the sixth grade. But she knows how important school is. Her dream is to continue with her own schooling to become a nurse and help her husband finish schooling as an electronics repairman in radios and televisions. Her health and her family's health are not particularly robust. Her children suffer from asthma and her own health has been only fair.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase new clothes for resale

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana N. Y. Abrego Quisgue, 21, started selling food at the local school six months ago with her first loan from Friendship Bridge. She sells tostadas, ice cream, chips, juices, hot dogs and drinks. She also makes and sells tortillas, the major staple in the everyday diet of the people of Guatemala. Guatemalans don't prefer the machine-made type but rather the ones that are made by hand by patting freshly milled corn dough and cooking them to perfection on a hot metal plate. She makes about 65 tortillas a day and sells them for about US$0.12 for 6 hand-made tortillas. Making the tortillas has been challenging for her lately because several months ago she fell at a circus and badly broke her arm and lost almost all movement of her hand. The break is evident from the 6 inch scar on her upper arm. Making tortillas can sometimes be very painful. But on the worst days she is happy to be working with a partner who helps her get through the day.

Ana is single and lives with her mom and her 5 other brothers and sisters. Her dreams are still developing and as of now she wants to make money to save for her.future.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase food to make and sell at her stand

loans.name: Maria Etelvina

texts.en: Maria Etelvina

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Hat

texts.en: Mrs. Hat N. is 34 years old and has three children. She and her husband work together making brick in a nearby factory earning around $7 each day. This couple hopes to use a loan to purchase farmland to grow crops and buy a motorcycle so that her husband can operate a motor-taxi during the time he is free from his work.

loans.use: To buy a farmland and a motorcycle to operate a motor-taxi when her husband is free from work.

loans.name: Sheyli

texts.en: Sheyli N. P.

loans.use: Purchase inventory: Half for shoes, half for cosmetics

loans.name: Miriam Michelle

texts.en: Miriam Michelle S.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business stock

loans.name: Dora Maricela

texts.en:
Dora Maricela C. Avila, 20, does what she can do to help out her family. She works along with her mother, sisters and brothers to make ends meet. For the past 20 years the whole family has been making masks and papier-mâché's for the special festivals in the area. (The picture shows the whole family with some of their masks. Dora is the second from the left in the red shirt.) She took out her first loan to buy materials to make more papier-mâché characters and also to stock the little school supply store she has in front of her house. Before she opened the store the children in the neighborhood had to cross the extremely dangerous Pan-American highway to buy school supplies. Now they can stay safe and visit little store.

With this loan, Dora will expand her business into making tortillas. She will buy firewood for cooking, and corn and lime to make the tortillas twice a day.

Dora graduated from high school by working during the day and attending school at night. She wants to continue with schooling to become the equivalent of a registered nurse, but she does not have the money to buy the required equipment and pay the US$30 a month she would need to finish the two years of schooling.

The members of her tightly knit family all pitch in either to work their corn fields (a two hour walk away) or make masks or to make tortillas. Dora's father is seriously ill and can't work so it is even more important for all the others to pull their load. Dora does not hesitate to work to help support the family even if it means she may not be able to realize her own dreams.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase supplies and wood to expand into making tortillas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her clothes selling business

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mr. Phan N. is 32 years old and married and lives with his wife in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. He is self-employed as a blacksmith earning around $4 each day, while his wife works in a rice paddy earning only a meager sum. He and his wife have three children. Two of them are students, and the third is too young to attend school. Mr. Phan N. is currently requesting a loan to purchase tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his blacksmith business.

loans.name: Hay

texts.en:
Mrs. Hay S. is a 35-year-old married woman with 4 children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province. Her main business is raising pigs. She earns around $6 each day, while her husband (pictured here because S. is unavailable) works as a motor-taxi driver earning about $3 per day. Three of her children now attend school.

Mrs. Hay S. is humbly requesting a loan to increase the number of her pigs and buy pig feed for her livestock.

loans.use: To increase the number of her livestock by adding more pigs and purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Sharifchon

texts.en:
For seven years T. Sharifchon has been actively engaged in selling different locks, handles for doors and latches. He is married and has completed secondary education. Since 2005, he has been financed by MFI «Мicroinvest». Back then his assets reached nearly $500 and he traded on the streets without any specific activity place. Step by step, gradually receiving credit, he has increased the assortment of goods and started to make his own trips to buy them, while paying in cash, which allowed him to obtain the goods at much lower cost.

His wife helps him in trade as well; he leaves certain quantity of the goods at home, so that all members of his family can make their own contribution to the improvement of their standards of living. Sharifchon’s parents live in the neighborhood and the location of their house allows them to raise the cattle. Therefore, apart from trade, in their leisure time, they are busy with breeding domestic livestock, which constitutes a big part of the family budget.

Now Sharifchon’s assets total $ 1100. In the future, he plans to increase the assortment and to buy one more point of sale (market outlet).

Translated from Russian by Elena Klimenko, Kiva Volunteer.

Темуров Шарифчон вот уже 7лет занимается продажей разных замков, ручек для дверей и шпингалетов. Женат, образование среднее. Кредитуется в МЗФ «Микроинвест» с 2005 года. Тогда у него активы достигали около 500$ и он торговал на улице без определенного место деятельности. Постепенно кредитуясь, шаг за шагом, он увеличил ассортимент товара, стал ездить за товаром сам и покупает за наличные деньги, что позволяет ему приобрести товар подешевле.

Жена тоже ему помогает в торговле, так как определенное количество товара он оставляет дома, чтобы члены семьи тоже имели свой вклад в улучшении уровни жизни. Родители Шарифчона живут по соседству, и место расположенность их дома позволяет откармливать крупно рогатый скот. Поэтому в свободное время от торговли в качестве досуга они занимаются животноводством, что занимает не малую часть в семейном бюджете.

Сейчас его активы составляют 1100 $ .В будущем планирует увеличить ассортимент и приобрести еще одну торговую точку.

loans.use: increase assortment and open another activity place (point of sale)

loans.name: Poeun

texts.en: Mrs. Poeun S. M. is 25 years old, married, and has two children. She and her husband work in a rice paddy growing vegetables, and they sell them in their community or sometimes in a market. With this business activity, they can earn up to $7.30 each day. This loan will be used to purchase more seeds and to buy a plot of land to expand their crops.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and a plot of land to expand her crops.

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.ru:
Abdurasul B. is 26 years old, is married and has three children. He has a high-school education. He sells household goods. He owns and raises cattle with the help of his wife. He became a client of MicroInvest in 2005. Back then he had $400 in assets and had to borrow money from illegal creditors in order to achieve a higher turnover. Gradually, over the course of 2 years during which he systematically borrowed money, he became a knowledgeable and successful client. He was able to open another sales outlet and can now go buy goods at wholesale prices. Currently his assets amount to $800, not counting the cattle that he raises at home. In the future he'd like to open a store in one of the main city markets.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer.

Бобочонов Абдурсаул – 26 лет, женат отец троих детей. Образование среднее. Занимается продажей хозяйственных товаров. Дома имеет крупно рогатый скот, и жена помогает ему откармливать скот дома. Клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» стал в 2005 году. В то время его активы составляли 400$, и чтобы увеличить товарооборот кредитовался у местных нелегальных кредиторов. Постепенно в течении 2 лет систематического кредитования он стал информированным и успешным клиентом, что позволило ему приобрести еще одну торговую точку и ездить за товаром, закупать товар оптом. Сейчас его активы составляют 800$ кроме несколько голов скота, которые откармливаются дома. В будущем хочет открыть магазин в одном из крупных рынков города.

loans.use: To open a shop in the central market

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en: Vusal J. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwest Azerbaijan. He is 26 years old and wants to start a family soon. Vusal sells men’s clothes in the Beylagan city bazaar. Vusal would like to buy more fine clothing from the capital city, Baku, as people in Beylagan want to dress more like people in the capital. He doesn’t have more money to re-invest in his business. He has successfully taken out and paid 3 loans in the recent past. He needs $1000 to purchase a range of inventory from the capital.

loans.use: To buy inventory

loans.name: Tuhtaboy

texts.ru:
Tuhtaboy N. is 67, is married and has 9 children. He has a high-school education. He made hajj (pilgrimage) to Mecca, which proves that he is an honest and god-fearing tradesman and a client that respects the rules and policies of MicroInvest. He borrowed his first loan in 2007 and over a short period of time became an active and disciplined client. The loan allowed him to increase turnover of his goods. Previously he had to by goods from local suppliers and pay for them in several installments with high mark-ups. Currently he is able to pay for the goods in cash as well as loan money to people who are only starting out in this business. He is planing to purchase a store in the future.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer.

Неъматов Тухтабой –67 лет, женат, имеет 9 детей. Образование среднее. Совершил “Хадж” в Мекку, что показывает, что он является честным и богобоязным клиентом по отношению к торговле и к политике организации МЗФ «Микроинвест». Начал кредитоваться в 2007 году и за короткий период стал одним из активных и дисциплинированных клиентов и тем самым увеличил товарооборот. Раньше приобретал товар на рассрочку у местных поставщиков с большой наценкой, а в настоящее время, кроме того, что покупает товар за наличные, а также дает на рассрочку начинающим свое дело людям в этой деятельности. В будущем планирует приобрести магазин.

loans.use: to open a shop

loans.name: Minaya

texts.en: Minaya S. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwest Azerbaijan. She is married and has 2 children. Minaya owns a small stand near her home where she and her son sell household products and vegetables (some of which she grows in her own garden such as melons, tomatoes, etc.) to many people in her neighborhood. Although her stand is very old and not in good shape, she has many loyal customers. However, she is caught in a cycle in which she can only re-stock the products that she sells. She needs $700 in order to fully stock her inventory, maximize sales, and expand her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Mrs. Nhem Chheng V. is 40 years old, married, and has five children. To supplement her household income, she is self-employed as a garment worker earning around $3 each day, while her husband works as a security guard and typically makes about $3 each day. Two of her children are employed at a garment factory, and the rest of them attend school. This couple hopes a loan will help them to purchase seeds and a plot of farmland to harvest crops.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and a plot of farmland to harvest crops.

loans.name: Musharafhon

texts.ru:
Musharafhon S. is 50 years old, is a widow and has a son. She has a college education. Her son sells flatbread. After her husband passed away, it was up to her to take care of the family. She took care of raising her son and making sure that he has a good education. She has been selling soap, shampoo and dish soap for the past 7 years. She became a client of MicroInvest back in 2004. The loan allowed her to secure a bigger and better sales point location as well as double her turnover. Currently her assets amount to $600. She is planing to open another sales point.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

Шукурова Мушарафхон – 50лет, вдова, имеет одного сына. Образование высшее. Сын занимается продажей лепешек. После смерти мужа все заботы о семье легли на её голову, она одна растила сына, дала ему образование. Занимается продажей мыла, шампуня и средства для мытья посуды 7лет. Начала кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест» в 2004году. После получения займа и целевого использования она расширила и улучшила место для деятельности, увеличила товарооборот в два раза. Сейчас её активы возросли до 600$. На будущее она планирует приобрести еще одну торговую точку.

loans.use: to open another sales point

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
A single mother of two, Svetlana opened her business selling footwear nine years ago to support her family. Sacrificial and hardworking, Svetlana supports not only her two daughters, but her elderly parents as well. Over the past nine years, Svetlana has invested countless hours and efforts to develop her business and establish a strong clientele base. Determined and optimistic, Svetlana aspires to open a second kiosk in the markets of Melitopol.

Svetlana has requested a loan for $500 to increase her inventory. With the additional profits, she hopes to continue growing her business and approach her goal of opening a second kiosk.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
A single mother of two sons, Irina began selling women’s clothing to support her family. For the past fifteen years, Irina has built her business and clientele base with determination and dedication. In that time, she managed to secure a vending facility in a favorable location at the central market in her city. Irina is kind and provides outstanding customer service, attracting new clients with her individualized attention to each one and her desire to build their confidence in selecting and wearing clothes.

Irina is a veteran client of Nadiya Ukraine, having secured and successfully repaid twelve loans with a perfect credit history. Currently, Irina is seeking a loan for $1000 to improve her clothing assortment and increase her inventory. With the increased profits, Irina plans to continue developing her business and providing for her family.

loans.use: Purchase inventory and improve clothing assortment

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
For the past seven years, Nataliya has sold cosmetic items and household cleaning products from her kiosk in the central market of Melitopol. A mother of two sons, Nataliya uses her income to support her children, her elderly parents, and her brother. Hard working and sacrificial, Nataliya is committed to improving her family’s future by ensuring the ongoing success of her business. She is communicative and polite, focused on serving the needs of her clients.

Currently, Nataliya is seeking a loan of $600 to purchase additional inventory and expand her variety of merchandise. With the additional profits, Nataliya plans to develop her business further and expand her clientele base. With a perfect credit history, a commitment to the success of her business, and a strong dedication to the welfare of her family, Nataliya represents the ideal client to invest in with micro-finance.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Twelve years ago, Nataliya opened her bakery and candy goods kiosk in the central market of Melitopol. A wife and mother, Nataliya was determined to improve the welfare of her family by contributing to their income. With a personal love for sweets and a keen eye for a business opportunity, Nataliya chose to sell candy and sweets as they are in constant demand. Warmhearted and hard working, Nataliya has successfully developed her business over the past decade and has secured a favorable location at the central market of Melitopol.

Nataliya is a veteran client of Nadiya Ukraine’s lending services and has repaid all loans with a perfect credit history. Currently, Nataliya is seeking a loan for $600 to purchase additional inventory. With her profits, Nataliya plans to continue developing her business and providing stable income for her family.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Ms. Margaret N. is an enterprising lady who has struggled to earn a living for herself and her four children since the death of her husband in 1996. Her children are between ages 17 and 21 years old. Her eldest child who is 21 years old is at the university, while the youngest is in Senior Two.

At the age of 50, Margaret has been operating a food vending business for the past two years.
Following the death of her husband, Margaret worked as a casual laborer in people’s gardens and also made bricks which she used to build a small house on the plot that her late husband had bought.  After completion of the house, she continued making bricks from which she saved some money that she used to start her current business at Kampala veterinary development market. 
She employees two people who she pays on a daily basis.

She now wants to borrow $610 which will allow her to purchase a hinge making machine. This will enable her to increase her earnings. She also says she will be creating job opportunities for her children.

loans.use: Purchasing a hinge making machine

loans.name: Yevgeniy

texts.en:
Yevgeniy is married and has two daughters. He lives in Uzhgorod in the far western corner of Ukraine. Yevgeniy organizes international tours of an Uzhgorod teen dance group called “Dance Corporation of Friends”. This type of business is unique for Uzhgorod. Yevgeniy is known as a talented show-business producer. He has had much experience working with different dance groups and bands over the last 20 years and has gained a good reputation. Yevgeniy is a very determined, hard-working and energetic entrepreneur. His monthly income is about $600.

The business Yevgeniy is involved in is very interesting. It not only allows him to earn a living, but it also produces a positive social impact on the community. Teenagers in his group enjoy what they are doing as they use their talents and gifts in the dance shows. Yevgeniy would like to use this loan to help his dance group go on a successful tour and offer an entertaining show to all those who are interested in Ukrainian folk and ethnic performances.

loans.use: Organize dance tour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Planting pine trees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Planting pineapples and sugarcane

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Set up structures

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Mr. and Mrs. Opoki, aged 57 and 48 years respectively, are a couple that is working closely together to make a better future for themselves and their children.

They have eight children, three of whom are still going to school. Mr. Opoki formally working as a banking assistant but lost his job following the closure of the Peoples owned Uganda Commercial Bank following its privatization around 2001.

With no formal work, the Opokis had to find ways of raising funds to cater for their basic needs as well as educating their children. Using savings from the former employment, he bought a piece of land. Three years ago the couple began a fish business, however the business has been low because they don’t have a freezer to preserve the fish.

Mr. and Mrs. Opoki are planning to borrow $600 to purchase a freezer. This will allow them to buy more fish. With increased income from increased sales, the couple plans to build a house on their plot and also educate their three children who are still in school.

Business for the Opokis begins early in the morning when they go to buy fish at Gaba landing site. The couple then proceeds to fry the fish at mid-day.

loans.use: Purchase a freezer

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Mr. Carlos Vázquez is 47 years old. He is married to Semiona, who is 45, and together they own their own home and work together in their small business. They have 5 children, 4 sons and a daughter. Three of their sons have emigrated to Argentina in search of better work opportunities and monthly send money back to their parents. The other son works for an industrialized soft drink business, and their daughter, who is 16 years old, is still in school.

Carlos owns a grocery store. He started the business several years ago, when his children were young. In the beginning the business required a lot of sacrifice, since he had to get up early to walk a considerable distance to the main street where he could catch the bus to his store. Years later, thanks to the growth of his business, he was able to buy a small truck.

In his store he sells all kinds of necessary products, including rice, noodles, sugar, canned foods, milk products, bread products, etc. He reports that the business is going well thanks to the fact that he is the only convenience store in the area and therefore has no competition.

Carlos would like to request a loan which he will then invest in the purchase of wholesale quantities of products including rice, noodles, flour and oil. This investment will allow him to take advantage of considerable discounts, which in turn will allow him to increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Carlos Vázquez tiene 47 años, está casado con la señora Semiona de 45 años, tienen una casa propia y poseen una microempresa donde trabajan juntos trabajan juntos. Tienen en total 5 hijos, cuatro varones y una mujer. Tres de sus hijos varones emigraron a la Argentina en busca de mejores oportunidades laborales y mensualmente envían dinero ayudar a su padres; el otro hijo trabaja en una empresa industrializadora de gaseosas, la última es una hija tiene 16 años y va aún al colegio.

Don Carlos tiene es una despensa, este negocio lo empezó hace ya varios años, cuando sus hijos aún eran pequeños; al principio le costó mucho sacrificio porque debía salir muy temprano ya que su casa quedaba lejos de la calle principal donde pasaba el bus para llegar hasta el mercado. Luego de varios años, y gracias a que su negocio fue creciendo, pudo adquirir una camioneta.

En su despensa vende todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad, como arroz, fideo, azúcar, productos enlatados, lácteos, panificados, etc.; cuenta que le va bastante bien gracias a que es la única despensa de la zona y no tiene competencia.

Carlos desea solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra al por mayor de productos como azúcar, fideo, arroz, harina y aceite, de este modo podrá conseguir importantes descuentos que lo ayudará a incrementar sus ganancias.

loans.use: Buy sugar, noodles, rice, flour and oil in wholesale quantities

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Ms. Edith is 25 years old, married and the mother of three children of 7, 5 and 2 years of age. The oldest is going to school already. She lives with her husband and children in a house they acquired two years ago. Edith tells us that some years ago, she and her husband were dedicated to agriculture in a far away town, and decided to move to the city of Villa Elisa, in search of better opportunities for the family, since they were only able to obtain produce for their own consumption. Through great sacrifice and hard work, they managed to buy the house they currently own, where Edith set up her business, in order to contribute to the family income and take care of their little children at the same time. Edith runs a grocery store, where she sells basic needs products, such as sugar, milk, bread, flour, etc.; her business is doing well and she wants to continue growing. Edith wants to incorporate to her stock some canned products, such as tomato sauce, tuna and sardines, and beverages in general, which are in great demand among her clients. She is asking for a $400 loan, to be invested in the purchase of such merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Edith tiene 25 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos, de 7,5 y 2 años. El mayor de sus hijos ya va a la escuela. Edith vive con su esposo e hijos en una casa que adquirieron hace dos años. Edith nos cuenta que hace unos años atrás, ella y su marido, se dedicaban a la agricultura en un pueblo muy lejano, y decidieron venir hasta la ciudad de Villa Elisa en busca de mejores oportunidades para su familia, ya que con la agricultura solo cultivaban para su propio consumo. Tras mucho sacrificio y trabajo, pudieron adquirir la casa que poseen ahora y en donde Edith montó su propio negocio, para poder ayudar con los ingresos y a la vez cuidar de sus hijos que aún son pequeños. Edith tiene una despensa, donde vende productos de primera necesidad como azúcar, leche, pan, harina, etc.; su negocio marcha muy bien y ella desea seguir creciendo. Edith desea incorporar a su stock de mercaderías algunos productos enlatados como salsa de tomates, atún, sardinas y bebidas en general, ya que son muy solicitados por sus clientes; para ello solicita un crédito de $400, que invertirá en la compra de los mismos.

loans.use: purchase of merchandise (canned products and beverages)

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Ms. Graciela M. is 39 years old, married and the mother of three children, two of which are still in elementary school, while the oldest is attending the last years of high school. Her children going to school demand a great effort on the part of the family, and they hope they will make it to college. Graciela started her microbusiness 7 years ago, with a small volume of merchandise, which has increased with time; she was also able to acquire some equipment, such as refrigerators, shelves and scales, which have contributed to the good image of her business. Thanks to her long trajectory and great dedication to work, Graciela presently possesses the basic infrastructure required to build up her stock of merchandise, mainly composed of rice, sugar, meat, eggs, produce, etc. In order to do so, she is requesting a $100 loan, which she'll invest in the purchase of merchandise. Graciela belongs to a committee of female entrepreneurs, through which 15 women request solidary loans to invest in their microbusinesses, and meet the credit modality in a responsible way.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Graciela M. tiene 39 años, está casada y tiene tres hijos; dos de ellos están aún en el nivel escolar, pero el hijo mayor ya está cursando los últimos años de la secundaria. Los hijos estudian con un gran esfuerzo de parte de la familia, y esperan que estos lleguen a la universidad. Graciela comenzó su microempresa hace 7 años, con escasa cantidad de mercaderías, la cual fue aumentando con el correr del tiempo; también pudo adquirir algunos equipamientos como refrigeradores, estantes, balanzas, lo cual ayudó a dar una mejor imágen a su negocio. Producto de su larga trayectoria y gran dedicación al trabajo, Graciela ya posee la infraestructura básica para incrementar la cantidad de productos que vende, que entre ellos podemos citar arroz, azúcar, carne, huevos, verduras, etc. Para poder aumentar su stock de mercaderías, solicita el crédito de $100, que invertirá en la compra de los mismos. Graciela forma parte de un comité de mujeres emprendedoras, donde 15 mujeres adquieren préstamos de forma solidaria y los invierten en sus microempresas, cumpliendo responsablemente con la modalidad del crédito.

loans.use: purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Mrs. Graciela R. is 45 years old and is has been married to Mr. Hugo Romero for 25 years. The two have 6 children, all students. Four of them attend primary school, one attends secondary school and their oldest daughter is a student at a university. This brings a lot joy to Graciela and hopes for a great future for her children. Graciela began selling door-to-door and, with a bit of capital, opened a small store from where she sold candy and refreshments. After many years of hard work and saving, she was able to open a store and today sells a variety of basic products such as rice, vermicelli, yerba mate tea, sugar, coffee, milk, breads, etc. As the business grew, so too did her need to increase the size of her store. She would like to invest in adding an extension to the store. She requests a loan of $200 to increase the size of her store. This will allow her to continue to grow and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Graciela R. tiene 45 años de edad, está casada hace 25 años con el señor Hugo Romero; la pareja tiene 6 hijos, todos sus hijos estudian, cuatro de ellos están en etapa primaria, uno en etapa secundaria y su hija mayor ya va a la universidad, lo cual representa una gran felicidad para Graciela pues anhela un buen futuro para sus hijos. Graciela empezó como vendedora ambulante, con un poco de capital; luego monto un pequeño kiosco donde solo vendía golosinas y refrescos. Tras varios años de trabajo y gracias a su buenos ahorros pudo montar una despensa, donde hoy día vende diferentes productos básicos necesarios tales como arroz, fideos, yerba mate, azúcar, café, leche, panificados, etc. Al igual que el negocio fue creciendo, el local fue quedando pequeño, por lo que hoy día se ve obligada a invertir en la ampliación de la infraestructura de su local. Solicita un crédito de $ 200 para poder ampliar su negocio, esto le ayudará a seguir creciendo y aumentar sus ingresos.

loans.use:
Increase the size of her store

ampliación de la infraestructura de su local

loans.name: María Angela

texts.es:
Mrs. María Ángela H. is 31 years old, married and mother of 3 school-aged children. María’s greatest dream is that her children continue their studies and will culminate in one day attending college allowing them to obtain a better life. María has a store which she attends to herself, aside from caring for her children and her home. She began her small business with financial support from her husband who has sold spare parts for automobiles for some time. The reason for starting the business was to increase the family’s income and the business has been gradually growing ever since. María needs $50 loan to invest in the purchase of rice and pastas, which are the two most requested products by her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. María Ángela H. tiene 31 años de edad está casada y madre de 3 hijos, todos en edad escolar. El mayor deseo de María es que sus hijos sigan estudiando y culminar algún día una carrera universitaria que les permita obtener un mejor nivel de vida. María tiene una despensa que atiende ella misma, además de cuidar a sus hijos y los trabajos cotidianos de la casa. Empezó su pequeño negocio hace 5 años con el apoyo económico de su marido quién se dedica a la venta de repuestos para automóviles desde hace mucho tiempo, la razón de ello fue la de ayudar a aumentar los ingresos de la casa, desde entonces ha ido creciendo gradualmente. María necesita un crédito de $ 50 para invertir en la compra de arroz y fideos que son los productos de mayor demanda por sus clientes.

loans.use:
Purchase of rice and pastas

compra de arroz y fideos

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María Báez is 50 years old, separated, and has 3 children. The oldest one is 32 years old and she is a primary school teacher. The second one is 30 and works in a factory that produces plastic articles. The youngest one is 24 and he plays football for a club in the country.

María has had a grocery store in her home for 10 years, where she sells products like fruits, vegetables, bread, dairy, and other daily needs items. She also runs a small restaurant where she prepares food for the employees of a plastic and cardboard recycling firm that is located in front of her house. With these activities she is able to maintain herself and her house where she lives with her oldest daughter.

The business is doing well, and the demand for her products has increased gradually over the last few months. She wants to buy primary needs goods like flour, rice, sugar, and vegetables in large quantities because this way she will be able to get a better price from her providers. For this, she requests a loan of $200 that she will invest in these purchases.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in English:

María Báez tiene 50 años, es separada y tiene 3 hijos; la mayor tiene 32 años que es maestra en una escuela pública, el segundo tiene 30 años y trabaja en una empresa que fabrica artículos de plásticos; el último tiene 24 años y es jugador de fútbol en un club del interior del país.

María tiene una despensa en su domicilio desde hace 10 años y en la misma vende productos como frutas, verduras, panificados, lácteos y otros de consumo masivo. También posee un pequeño comedor donde prepara alimentos para los empleados de una empresa recicladora de plásticos y cartón que está ubicada frente a su casa. Con estas actividades ella logra sustentarse y mantener su casa donde vive junto con su hija mayor.

El negocio marcha muy bien, y la demanda de sus productos ha crecido gradualmente en los últimos meses. Ella desea comprar productos de primera necesidad como harina, arroz, azúcar y verduras en grandes cantidades pues de esta forma obtiene mejores precios de sus proveedores; para ello solicita un crédito de $ 200 que los invertirá en la compra de los mismos.

loans.use: to purchase basic needs items like flour, rice, sugar, and vegetables in large quantities

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
Mr. Tomás S. is 55 years old, and married with Ramona (37). They have 3 children: 2 boys of 10 and 8 years old, and 1 girl of 6. They all go a primary school in de city.

Tomás is a carpenter and has had his own workshop in his home for 24 years. He manufactures doors, windows, closets, and other types of bedroom furniture. Tomás tell us that thanks to his hard and good work, he was able to get a clientèle of mainly regional furniture stores, even in other cities.

Due to an increase in demand, he is requesting help to finance the purchase of supplies like boards, screws, nails, and several different types of wood for the production of furniture. This way he will be able to satisfy the demand of his wholesale clients and generate more income and profits.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

El Sr. Tomás S. tiene 55 años y está casado con Ramona de 37 años, tienen 3 hijos, dos varones de 10 y 8 años respectivamente y una nena de 6 años, todos están cursando sus estudios primarios en una escuela de la ciudad.

Tomás es carpintero y tiene su propio taller en su domicilio desde hace 24 años, fabrica puertas, ventanas, placares y otros muebles para dormitorios. Tomás nos cuenta que gracias a su dedicación y buen trabajo ha logrado formar su clientela, que está formada principalmente por distintas mueblerías de la zona, incluso de otras ciudades.

Debido a la mayor demanda que actualmente tiene por parte de sus clientes, solicita apoyo financiero para la compra de insumos como placas, tornillos, clavos y distintos tipos de maderas para la fabricación de muebles. De esta manera podrá abastecer la demanda de sus clientes mayoristas generándole así mayores ingresos y ganancias.

loans.use: to buy supplies like boards, screws, nails, and wood

loans.name: Liliana Pamela

texts.es:
Liliana Pamela Z. C. is an enterprising young woman. She is 26 years old and is a single mother to two beautiful children. She lives in the Victor Larco district of Trujillo Province, in the department of La Libertad, Perú.

Starting when she was 10 years old, she helped her mother sell milk. When she was 15 years old and was in high school, her mother was injured in an accident and she had to to take care of the business. She also looked for ways to bring in more income because her mother’s medical care was expensive. She started selling beauty products to a neighbor. In this way she was able to cover the costs of her studies and was able to graduate from high school.

When she reached legal age, she began selling beauty products from two well-known brands for which she needed capital in order to buy inventory. She requested her first loan of S/. 300.00 (approximately $95) in the “Las Palmeras” Communal Bank.

One year ago, Liliana began selling products from only one brand and is currently the director of a network of 54 other vendors. To this day she also continues selling milk, but she is thinking of transferring this business to a family member so that she can dedicate herself completely to build her skills so that she can better orient her vendors and customers. With this loan of S/. 1,000.00 (approximately $320) she will buy shelves on which to exhibit and organize her products.

Despite being busy with her many activities, she still finds time to support her community by working with the Parents Association of the Victor Larco Educational Institution, which is where one of her son studies. Liliana dreams about having a modest, but attractive house and being able to give the best to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Liliana Pamela Z. C., es una joven emprendedora, tiene 26 años de edad es madre soltera de dos lindos niños, vive en el distrito de Victor Larco de la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad – Perú

Desde la edad de 10 años ayudaba a su mamá en la venta de leche, cuando tuvo 15 años y estaba estudiando secundaria, su madre sufrió un accidente y ella tuvo que asumir el negocio pero además buscó la forma de llevar mayores ingresos al hogar ya que la enfermedad de su mamá ocasionaba mucho gasto; empieza entonces a ayudar a vender productos de belleza a una vecina de ese modo pudo también solventar los gastos de sus estudios logrando terminar la secundaria.

Al adquirir la mayoría de edad comienza a vender directamente los productos de belleza de dos líneas muy conocidas por lo que necesitaba capital para tener stock y solicita su primer crédito de S/.300 ($95 aproximadamente) en el Banco Comunal “Las Palmeras”.

Hace un año vende los productos de una sola línea siendo actualmente directora con una red de 54 vendedoras a su cargo; hasta hoy continúa también con la venta de leche pero está evaluando transferir ese negocio a un familiar porque quiere dedicarse íntegramente a capacitarse para orientar mejor a sus vendedoras y clientas. Con el préstamo de S/.1,000 ($320.00 aproximadamente) comprará estantes para exhibir y tener ordenados sus productos.

A pesar de realizar diversas actividades se da tiempo para apoyar a su comunidad trabajando en la Asociación de Padres de Familia de la Institución Educativa Victor Larco donde estudia su niño. Liliana sueña con tener una casa modesta pero bonita y darle lo mejor a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy display shelves for beauty products

loans.name: María Yolanda

texts.es:
Mrs. María Yolanda G. D. O. was born in the Usquil district in the Province of Otuzco in the Department of "La Libertad." 20 years ago she left her home community due to health problems, and she has not re-settled there. She is 70 years old, and lives alone with her husband.

Ever since she was young, Maria worked to bring products from her community (fruits, potatoes, herbs, etc) to the bigger cities such as Trujillo to sell in the markets. She is a member of the community bank "Laredo" in the Laredo district of the Trujillo province.

Maria can no longer travel, so now her family sends her products and she sells them in the Laredo market. With a loan of $700, she will purchase fruits and vegetables of the season to continue offering them to her loyal customers.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer

La señora María Yolanda G. D. O. nació en Usquil distrito D. la Provincia D. Otuzco del Departamento D. La Libertad – Perú hace 20 años salió D. su pueblo por problemas D. salud, tiene 70 años y vive solo con su esposo.

DesD. muy joven trabajó trayendo productos D. su pueblo (fruta, papa, oca, hierbas, rocoto, etc.) a las ciudades más grandes como Trujillo y vendiendo en los mercados. Actualmente radica en el distrito D. Laredo D. la Provincia D. Trujillo, y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Laredo”.

Ya no pueD. viajar, sus familiares le envían los productos y ella continúa vendiendo en el mercado D. Laredo. Con el préstamo D. S/. 2,200 ($700 aproximadamente) comprará frutas y verduras D. la estación para seguir ofertando a sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables, and for working capital

loans.name: Maruja Maribel

texts.es:
Mrs. Maruja Maribel Q. J. is 24 years old and lives in the city of Otuzco in the Department of "La Libertad." She makes and sells bread, cakes, cheeses and "quesillos." She launched her business with 200 Peruvian soles in capital (about $60), an amount that did not permit her to produce much. Because of these, she was only focused on selling to the members of her community from her own doorstep.

Maruja knew that outside of Otuzco she could sell a great deal more but she needed more capital. She asked her sister-in-law for advice, and that is how she found the community bank "La Ermita," where she was able to request a loan. She received her first loan for approximately $95 (300 Peruvian soles) that permited her to procude a bit more and begin to travel to sell her products in Trujillo (the departmental Capital), locating herself in the market district of Lareda. To this day she still travels every weekend to sell in the market.

With a loan of $375, she will buy flour, sugar, yeast / baking powder and milk to continue her incremental build-up in production, now that she has a loyal customer base to attend to. Maruja lives with her husband and two youngest children. The entire family helps to bake, and her business has allowed them to purchase a house, a kitchen and a TV, and they are going to continue working as the family also wishes to purchase a car so that one day they are able to transport their goods more easily.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maruja Maribel Q. J. tiene 24 años y vive en la ciudad de Otuzco Departamento de La Libertad – Perú se dedica a la producción y venta de pan, pasteles, quesos y quesillos; inició su negocio con un capital de S/.200 ($60 aproximadamente) monto que no le permitía producir mucho, por eso sólo se dedicaba a vender en su barrio colocando una pequeña canasta en la puerta de su casa.

Ella sabía que fuera de Otuzco podía vender mucho más pero necesitaba mayor capital así es que le pide a su cuñada la presente a las socias del Banco Comunal “La Ermita” para solicitar un préstamo. Recibió su primer préstamo de S/.300 ($95 aproximadamente) lo que le permitió producir un poco más y empezó a viajar para vender sus productos en Trujillo (capital del departamento de La Libertad) ubicándose en el mercado del distrito de Laredo; hasta hoy viaja todos los fines de semana a vender en este mercado.

Con el préstamo de S/.1,200 ($375 aproximadamente) comprará harina, azúcar, levadura y leche para seguir incrementando su producción debido a que tiene muchos pedidos que atender. La señora Maruja vive con su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad y toda la familia ayuda en la producción de pan y quesos con este negocio pudo comprar su casa, cocina y televisor y va a continuar trabajando en él porque quiere comprarse un carro para trasladar sus productos con mayor facilidad.

loans.use: To buy materials, and for working capital

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Teresa de Jesús S. M. is a hard working woman, an example mother, and a faithful servant of her community who is dedicated to improving her own life despite the weight of the challenges she faces.

As a child, Teresa was not given the opportunity to study. She married at an early ago, thinking she would have help to she wanted, but her situation ended up turning sour and she had to run away to live in a new community. As an adult she re-initiated her studies, and together with her children Teresa completed secondary school at the age of 41.

In 1998, Teresa joined the Community Bank, "De La Amistad," located en the "Nuevo Bolognesi" district of Calleria in the Coronel Protillo province of the Ucayali region of Peru.

When she started as a member of her community bank, Teresa received her first loan from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos from 300 Nuevos Soles (approx. $94). This loan helped her to begin her business and permitted her to purchase local fruits such as cocona, camu, aguaje, and glasses to bottle regional fruit nectars. Nine years later, Teresa is now requesting a loan for 800 soles (approx. $250) that she will use for the production of fruit juices and nectars. She is able to produce between 1 and 1.6 cartons a day, which translates to around 40 cartons a month.

Having finally completed her studies, Teresa is now enjoying the grand satisfaction of having been able to educate her 3 children and provide work for other women such as herself.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer

Teresa de Jesús S. M. es una mujer trabajadora, madre ejemplar y fiel servidora de la comunidad, con muchas ganas de seguir adelante pese a las dificultades.

Desde niña no se le dio la oportunidad de estudiar, posteriormente se casa pensando tener apoyo y fue lo contrario, donde tuvo que huir a otro lugar y posteriormente retomar sus estudios juntamente con sus hijos y así concluyó su secundaria a los 41 años de edad.

Desde el año 1,998 integró el Banco Comunal “DE LA AMISTAD” ubicada en el A.H. “Nuevo Bolognesi”, distrito de Calleria, provincia de Coronel Portillo, Región de Ucayali.

Cuando se inicia como socia de este Banco Comunal empezó con un préstamo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles (US$ 94.00 Aprox), esto le ayudó a iniciar el negocio, le permitió comprar frutas como la cocona, camu camu, aguaje y envases para la elaboración de néctar de frutas regionales. Ahora esta recibido un préstamo de S/ 800.00 soles (US$ 250.00 aprox.) con lo que piensa elevar la producción de néctares de 1 caja diaria a 1.6 cajas diarias, eso significaría una producción de 40 cajas mensuales. La gran satisfacción que tiene es haber concluido sus estudios secundarios, educar a sus tres hijos y además que puede dar trabajo a otras mujeres.

loans.use: To purchase materials, and for working capital

loans.name: María Francisca

texts.es:
María Francisca Monzón J. is 49 years old, and a fighter. Born in Cajabamba, a province in the department of Cajamarca, she left her community when she married at the age of 14 in search of a better life for herself and her family. She moved to Chimbote for a short time, but soon decided to relocate to the Otuzco Province in the department of "La Libertad" where she still lives to this day.

11 years ago, Maria's husband abandoned her, leaving her in charge of 5 children, including a deaf child. When her husband left, he took with him all of the merchandise the two of them had built up over the years for the business they had together (selling wool sweaters, ponchos, and artesian clothing). Maria was devastated, and so, in order to meet the needs of her children she sold her sewing machines and other goods she owned. A friend of hers from the same community heard about Maria's situation and invited her to participate in the community bank, "Mujeres del Olivo," where Maria used a loan of 300 Peruvian soles to re- purchase goods and start up her businesses once again.

Today, Maria doesn't only sell wool products. With the solicited loan of $125, Maria will purchase fruits and vegetables to expand her business and sell in Otuzco on Sundays, and in other neighboring communities on Saturdays and Mondays to augment her income.

Maria Francisca is proud to have been able to move forward with her children. She plans on continuing to work at her business with the same energy that she had 11 years ago so that one day she will be able to buy a house for her family to live in.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer

María Francisca Monzón J., es una mujer luchadora de 49 años. Nació en Cajabamba, una provincia del departamento de Cajamarca, emigró de su pueblo cuando se casó a la edad de 14 años en busca de una mejor vida para ella y su familia; luego de vivir en Chimbote por un corto tiempo decidió radicar en la Provincia de Otuzco Departamento de La Libertad – Perú donde vive actualmente. Hace 11 años su esposo la abandonó quedándose a cargo de 5 niños, incluyendo a un niño sordomudo, el esposo se fue llevando toda la mercadería del negocio que tenían juntos (venta de lanas y ponchos y polleras tejidos en telares artesanales), en ese momento desesperada por satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos vendió sus telares y otros bienes que poseía. Una amiga de su barrio conocedora de su situación la invitó a participar del Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Olivo” y con el primer préstamo que recibió compró mercadería y reinició su negocio (S/ 300.00 soles) Actualmente no solo vende lanas, con los S/. 400.00 soles (US$ 125.00) que recibió amplió su negocio, ahora vende también frutas y verduras, los domingos vende en Otuzco y los sábados y lunes sale a vender en ferias de otros pueblos cercanos (Monchacap y Motil). María Francisca se siente orgullosa por haber sacado adelante a sus hijos. Sigue trabajando en su negocio con la misma energía con la que empezó hace once años porque sueña con comprarse su casa.

loans.use: To grow her business through the purchase of fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: José Ángel

texts.es:
José Ángel is an enthusiastic and enterprising man. He is single. Five years ago he started his own business selling cheeses. He only studied as far as secondary school. His lack of education was allowing him to take only poorly paying, temporary jobs. At the suggestion of family members, he started selling these products. He has succeeded in developing himself as a microentrepreneur, and continues to expand his sales area. José's desire to get ahead motivates him to improve the quality of his service and to continue growing his business.

At the moment José needs a loan of $275, which he will use to purchase the merchandise he needs to cover current demand for his products. He commits to repaying the loan in 3 months. Be an important part of José's life and contribute to the development of his business. He sincerely appreciates your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

José Ángel es un hombre emprendedor y entusiasta, es soltero y desde hace cinco años comenzó su propio negocio con la venta de quesos, él solo estudio hasta la secundaria y la poca educación que tiene solo le permitía conseguir trabajos eventuales y poco remunerados, ante la invitación de unos familiares comenzó vendiendo estos productos donde se ha logrado desarrollar como microempresario, incrementando cada vez más su área de ventas. Las ganas que José tiene de salir adelante lo impulsan a mejorar la calidad de su servicio y continuar creciendo con su negocio.

En estos momentos José necesita un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda por sus productos, él se compromete regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de José y contribuye al desarrollo de su negocio, él agradece sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
Maria del Socorro is separated from her husband and has a young daughter. Her daughter was the motivation behind her decision to start her own business selling jewelry three years ago. She must raise her daughter and move the household ahead on her own. Thanks to her love of sales and her desire to improve her daughter's quality of life ,she has invested all of her effort into growing her business. She now has lots of clients and her sales have improved considerably. It has not been easy for Maria to cover all of the household expenses, but the well being of her daughter is her best reward.

In order to fill her current orders, Maria is requesting a loan of $925, which she plans to repay in 6 months. Maria wants to improve the quality of her service and with your help she will be able to do it. Thank you very much for the support and the confidence you place in this business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Maria del Socorro está separada de su esposo y tiene una pequeña hija, que es el motivo por el cual comenzó su propio negocio con la venta de joyería hace tres años, ya que debía sacar adelante a su hija y a su hogar ella sola, así fue como comenzó este negocio que gracias a su gusto por las ventas y a los deseos que tiene de darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija ha puesto todo su empeño por hacerlo crecer, ahora cuenta con muchos clientes y sus ventas han mejorado considerablemente. No ha sido fácil para Maria cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar pero el bienestar de su pequeña es su mejor recompensa.

Para poder surtir todos los pedidos que tiene, ahora Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que espera devolver en 6 meses. Maria quiere mejora la calidad de su servicio y con tu ayuda podrá hacerlo, muchas gracias por el apoyo y la confianza que depositas en este negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia is divorced. She has an 8 year old son and a little daughter who is not yet a year old. She started selling shoes by catalog 2 years ago. At the time, her plan was to help her husband with the household expenses, but family problems presented themselves later, and she divorced her husband and found herself alone with full responsibility for her two children. In order to give them all that they need, Amalia has continued with her business and has incorporated cheese sales into her work, which has yielded very good results.

Moving her family ahead has required all of Amalia's effort but her love for her children motivates her to improve her business every day. She is now applying for a loan of $925 with which she will buy merchandise, with the aim to offer a wider variety of shoes to her clients. She commits to repaying the loan in 6 months. Be an important part of this business. Decide to support her.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Amalia es divorciada, tiene un hijo de 8 años de edad y una pequeña de apenas un año. Ella inició con la venta de calzado por catálogo hace dos años, en ese momento fue para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, pero después se presentaron muchos problemas familiares, se divorció y quedó sola a cargo de sus dos pequeños, para poder darles todo lo necesario Amalia ha continuado con su negocio y ha incorporado la venta de quesos donde ha recibido muy buenos resultados.

Para sacar adelante a sus hijos Amalia ha tenido que esforzarse mucho pero el amor hacia sus pequeños la impulsa a mejorar cada día. Ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecerles una mayor variedad de calzado a sus clientes, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante de este negocio, decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Braulio Brígido

texts.es:
Braulio is 37 years old, married and has 2 children. His earnings as an employee was not enough to cover for his family's basic needs; to gain extra money, Braulio and his wife decided to start a business selling groceries. They set up a small area of their house as their store, and little by little, the couple has been increasing their stock. Now, Braulio and his wife already use up a whole room in their house for the store and they hope to keep growing.

At this moment, Braulio needs a $925 loan to buy more merchandise and keep the store well supplied. This way, he will be able to meet his clients' demands. He promises to repay this loan within 4 months. The well-being of this family is in your hands; help them by contributing to the growth of their business. They will be thankful to you.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Braulio tiene 37 años de edad, es casado y padre de dos hijos. Como el salario que recibía de empleado era muy poco, no podía cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, y para obtener un ingreso extra entre él y su esposa decidieron emprender su negocio con la venta de abarrotes, acondicionaron un pequeño lugar de la casa para realizar sus ventas y poco a poco han estado surtiendo mejor, ahora ya ocupan una habitación completa de su casa para el negocio y esperan continuar creciendo.

En estos momentos Braulio necesita un crédito de $ 925 dólares que empleará para comprar mercancía y surtir mejor su negocio para mantenerse la preferencia de sus clientes, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, ayúdalos contribuyendo el crecimiento de su negocio, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Maria Genara

texts.en:
Maria Genara U. P. is 61 years old and runs a bakery or panadería with her husband. They've been working the shop together since he had a bicycle accident about ten years ago that ended his prior career and forced them to search for a new way to make a living. They start early. At about 11pm they start up the oven. At 12:30 am the baking starts, and by 6:00 am they're ready to sell to the neighbors. If Maria looks tired in this picture, it's because she is. This photo was taken at about 1:00pm.

Maria will invest this loan in flour, sugar, and firewood. She'll go through about 100 pounds of flour in three days. She goes through about 80 pieces of firewood every two days at a cost of about U.$5.50.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar, and firewood

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
For the past ten years, Valentina has operated a kiosk selling seasonal clothing in the markets of Pavlograd, Ukraine. A hardworking mother of two, Valentina has successfully grown her business to establish a stable income for her family.

With rich market experience in the sphere of sales and an enterprising spirit, Valentina recently expanded her business endeavors to offer transportation services. This new endeavor has helped Valentina to establish a wide range of contacts and further expand her business.

Currently, Valentina is seeking a loan of $1200 to construct a new vending kiosk. With the increased profits from owning her own kiosk, she hopes to grow her business even more. Eventually Valentina hopes to purchase a new vehicle for transporting goods from wholesale retailers to her vending facilities, further increasing her profits.

loans.use: Purchase vending kiosk

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
For the past twelve years, Tatyana has operated a kiosk selling kitchenware in the central market of Melitopol. With her husband’s assistance, Tatyana has developed a successful business and a strong clientele base. Tatyana is cheerful and hardworking. With her hard-earned profits, Tatyana supports her daughter’s college education as well as her elderly parents.

An established client of Nadiya Ukraine, Tatyana has repaid all microloans with a perfect credit history. Currently, Tatyana is seeking a $500 loan to re-supply her inventory. With the additional profits, Tatyana plans to expand her profitable business.

loans.use: Re-supply inventory

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Ms. Alejandra is 46 years old, has been married to Mr. Félix Martínez for 30 years. They have seven children, four of which are already married and live with their own families; the other three are still minors, live with them and go to school. The youngest daughter was adopted by the couple when, as a little child, she was abandoned by her biological mother.

Ms. Alejandra and her husband have many sides to them and perform many activities to make a living for their family; Félix raises pigs, sheep, goats and poultry; they also have two cows, which Alejandra and her daughter milk early every morning, so that her husband can sell the milk at the local market.

Along with these daily activities, Alejandra's main craft is knitting. She knits blankets and bed covers, which she sells to the big city stores. She learned this craft, which is typical of the region and most women are dedicated to it, from her mother. Her blankets are sold in different regions of the country and even exported.

Alejandra needs a $75 loan, that she would like to invest in the purchase of colored cotton thread to be used in the production of more blankets for this cold season. She belongs to a committee of female entrepreneurs in her neighborhood, called "Mujeres en Desarrollo" (Women in Development), and composed by 15 partners, who work together and are solidarily responsible for the credits.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Alejandra tiene 46 años de edad, está casada con el señor Félix Martínez hace 30 años, y tiene 7 hijos, cuatro de ellos ya están casados y viven con sus propias familias; los otros tres aún son menores, viven con ellos y van al colegio. La menor de sus hijas fue adoptada por la pareja cuando era muy pequeña luego de que su madre biológica la abandonó.

Doña Alejandra y su marido son multifacéticos, ellos realizan varias actividades para poder sustentar a su familia; Félix cría chanchos, ovejas, cabras y aves de corral; también tienen dos vacas lecheras que Alejandra y su hija ordeñan a la mañana temprano para que su marido venda la leche en el mercado de la ciudad.

Aparte de todas estas actividades que realizan diariamente, el oficio principal de Alejandra es la de tejedora. Ella teje frazadas y cubre camas para luego venderlas a las grandes tiendas de la ciudad. Este oficio lo adquirió de su madre, quien le enseñó las técnicas para realizar el tejido. Este tipo de oficio es típico de la zona y la mayoría de las mujeres se dedican a él; sus frazadas son vendidas en diferentes partes del país e incluso son exportadas a otros países.

Alejandra necesita un crédito de $75, con los que desea comprar hilos de algodón de diferentes colores para poder realizar más frazadas en esta temporada de frío. Ella forma parte de un comité de mujeres emprendedoras de su barrio llamado Mujeres en Desarrollo, conformado por 15 socias que trabajan juntas y responden por los créditos forma solidaria.

loans.use: purchase of colored cotton thread.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro V. is 30 years old and has been married to Maria Sosa for a year. The couple have an 8 month old son who is their pride and joy.

Alejandro has been working since he was very young to support himself and pay for his high school education because his parents could not afford to. He held many jobs and upon graduating high school, he traveled to the capital city of Asuncion to learn a trade that would allow him to start his own business. He enrolled in beauty school and studied to become a hair stylist. After two years of school he graduated and worked as an assistant stylist and barber for several years.

With some savings he was able to put together, he returned to his hometown and opened his own hair salon seven years ago. Today, because of his hard work and talent, he has many clients.

Alejandro is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase an electric hair trimmer and a hair dryer because the current machines are old and he'd like to modernize his salon.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Alejandro V. tiene 30 años se casó hace un año con la María Sosa y tienen un hijo varón de apenas 8 meses que es la adoración de la pareja.

Alejandro trabajó desde muy joven para poder ganarse su sustento y pagar sus estudios secundarios, ya que sus padres no podían hacerlo. Realizó diferentes tipos de trabajos, y cuando culminó sus estudios secundarios viajo a la ciudad de Asunción (capital del país) para estudiar un oficio con el que pueda trabajar y generar sus propio negocio. Fue así como se inscribió en una institución para estudiar peluquería, luego de dos años se recibió de profesional y trabajo en una peluquería como ayudante durante unos varios años.

Con unos ahorros que logró juntar, Alejandro, volvió a su ciudad natal y monto su propia peluquería, que funciona ya hace más de siete años. Gracias a su buen trabajo y esfuerzo ha ganado mucha clientela.

Hoy día Alejandro solicita un crédito de $ 200 para poder comprar una máquina de cortar eléctrica y un secador de cabello, pues las máquinas que tiene actualmente ya están viejas y desea modernizar su peluquería.

loans.use: To purchase an electric hair trimmer and hair dryer

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.es:
Ceferina is 50 years old and married. She has a 9 year old son who is currently in the primary grades in a local public school. Ceferina talks about how the family's priority is making sure that her son continues to study so that he will some day be a professional with better opportunies in life than those his parents have enjoyed. Ceferina and her husband were not able to finish school.

Twelve years ago Ceferina opened her own business. She has a bar where she sells fast food and a variety of beverages. Thanks to the good earnings generated by her business, she has been able to buy herself a house and she has now opened a second location in the municipal market, manned by her husband.

Despite their age, Ceferina and her husband would like to continue their progress. For that reason, they decided to take up their studies again. Ceferina dreams about being able to enter the university and earn a degree; she'd start tomorrow if she could.

Ceferina is applying for a loan of $1000 to invest in the purchase of a refrigerator with glass door for her new location. This would allow her to sell more soft drinks and beer, the products for which she receives the most demand.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Ceferina tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo de 9 años que está cursando sus estudios primarios en una escuela pública de la ciudad. Ceferina cuenta que la prioridad de la pareja es que su hijo siga estudiando para que algún día pueda llegar a ser un profesional y obtener mejores oportunidades en la vida ya que ellos no pudieron culminar sus estudios.

Hace 12 años Ceferina abrió su propio negocio, ella tiene un bar donde vende comidas rápidas y diferentes tipos de bebidas. Gracias a las buenas ganancias que le generó este negocio a podido comprarse una casa y ahora han abierto otro local en el mercado municipal que es atendido por su marido.

A pesar de la edad, Ceferina y su marido desean seguir progresando, es así como la pareja decidió retomar sus estudios y actualmente cursan la secundaria durante la noche en una escuela pública. Ella nos cuenta que la pareja es un ejemplo para sus amigos y familiares que apoyan y felicitan a la pareja por seguir adelante con sus estudios, Ceferina sueña con poder ingresar a la universidad y obtener un titulo el día de mañana.

Ceferina solicita un crédito de $ 1000 para invertirlos en la compra de una heladera con vitrina para su nuevo local, de esta forma podrán vender más bebidas como gaseosas y cervezas, ya que son las de mayor demanda por sus clientes.

loans.use: Buy a refrigerator with a window to  store and display beverages

loans.name: Prisciliana

texts.es:
Prisciliana P. is 35 years old and married; she has a 5 year old daughter. Prisciliana lives with her daughter in a rented house. Her husband emigrated to Argentina a couple of years ago to look for better work opportunities, and he is currently working as a cook in a very busy restaurant in Buenos Aires.

Prisciliana has been working since she was very young. She wasn't able to finish her studies because she comes from a very humble family and her parents and siblings were working to support the family. Her mother was a weaver, like many of the women in the city of Carapegua. She taught Prisciliana the techniques of the craft.

At the age of 20, Prisciliana went to work in the capital as domestic help. After saving for several years she returned to her native city to open her own textile shop. She bought a loom, which she uses to make woven blankets, bedspreads and cotton hammocks. Thanks to her effort and the good work she produces, she now provides woven products to the owners of several stores in the capital, who come to her city exclusively to buy her products.

Prisciliana's dream is to be able to build her own house where she would live with her daughter and her husband, who sends her money from Argentina monthly. She says that once they finish the construction her husband will come back to Paraguay to be reunited with the family that misses him very much.

Prisciliana is applying for a loan of $800, the last of the money her family needs to begin building their home.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Prisciliana P. tiene 35 años de edad, ella está casada y tiene una hija de 5 años. Prisciliana vive con su hija en una casa alquilada. Su marido emigro hace un par de años a la Argentina en busca de mejores oportunidades laborales, y actualmente trabaja como cocinero en un restaurant muy concurrido de Buenos Aires.

Desde muy joven ella ha salido a la calle a trabajar, no pudo culminar sus estudios pues proviene de una familia muy humilde y sus padres y sus hermanos trabajaban para obtener el sustento de la familia. Su madre era una más de las tejedoras de la zona, actividad típica de la ciudad de Carapeguá y fue ella quien le enseño a Prisciliana las técnicas del tejido.

A los 20 años fue a trabajar a la capital como empleada domestica y luego de ahorrar unos años volvió a su ciudad y monto su propio taller de costura. Compro un telar que es el elemento utilizado para tejer frazadas, cubrecamas y hamacas de hilos de algodón. Gracias a su buen trabajo y desempeño ella hoy día es proveedoras de varias tiendas de la capital que vienen exclusivamente a comprar sus productos.

El mayor deseo de Prisciliana es la de poder construir una casa propia donde vivir con su hija y su marido quien mensualmente le envía dinero desde la Argentina, ella cuenta que una vez que consigan terminar la construcción su marido regresar al país para reunirse de vuelta con su familia a la que extraña mucho.

Prisciliana solicita un crédito de $ 800 con los que completará el dinero suficiente para poder empezar la construcción de su casa.

loans.use: Invest in the construction of her own home

loans.name: Channat

texts.ru:
Channat's husband is disabled. 10 years ago he became blind due to a severe illness. Since then it was up to Channat to take care of both her 3 children and her disabled husband. Her skill as a seamstress became the foundation of her business. She sews men's and women's traditional national gowns. The demand is high and peaks especially during national Muslim holidays, during which it is customary to give such gowns to the elderly. Channat buys material from the wholesales market, sews the gowns, and then her sister, who sells leather jackets on the market, helps her sell them. The business is profitable and allows Channat to take good care of her family. The loan that she received from MicroInvest was a welcome boost to her business. She plans to use the next loan to purchase supplies.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer.

У Чаннат муж инвалид. 10 лет назад в результате тяжелой болезни он внезапно ослеп. С тех пор забота о семье и муже-инвалиде легла на плечи Чаннат. У нее 3 детей. Ее профессия портнихи послужила основой для ее предпринимательской деятельности. Сейчас она шьет мужские и женские национальные халаты. Спрос на этот товар очень высокий, особенно в национальные и мусульманские праздники, на которые принято дарить старикам эти халаты. Чаннат привозит сырье для своих халатов с оптового рынка, шьет и потом ее сестра, которая продает кожаные куртки на базарах, помогает ей в реализации халатов. Прибыль от шитья хорошая и достаточна для содержания семьи. Полученный займ в Микроинвест послужил хорошим подспорьем ее бизнеса. Очередной займ она собирается потратить на приобретение сырья.

loans.use: for purchase of raw material

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, 40 years of age, is a widow with two pairs of twins, aged 11 and 13. She lost her husband, who was a veterinary doctor, in 2000. He left behind a four-room house and un-roofed structure that was meant for poultry rearing.

They have two cows which are on zero grazing and at the moment. Margaret and the children cut grass for the cows every day and look after 100 chickens. She is requesting $ 900 to boost her poultry business to five hundred birds and also roof the structures. When this is achieved she will be able to comfortably pay school fees for the children and meet home necessities.

loans.use: Poultry Rearing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of Motorcycle

loans.name: Lubowa

texts.en:
Lubowa is a young man aged 21. He has only his father, who never helped his family with education or start-up capital for business. Lubowa is in a motorcycle transport business in which one motorcycle is cycled among three people in a week. This creates wasted time and hence luck of funds for necessities.

Lubowa is therefore requesting $1200 to purchase his own motorcycle that will be repaid in ten months. This will be his full-time employment. He hopes to save money to buy a plot of land for his home development.

loans.use: Purchase of motorcycle

loans.name: Lovincer

texts.en:
Lovincer N. is a business lady aged 40. She operates a big retail shop. She has been in business for the last nine years.

She has a family of two biological childre; a boy ten years and a girl thirteen, who goes to primary school. Her family also includes four children (two boys and two girls) left in her care by her brother who died of HIV/Aids.

She works with one helper and her husband helps her purchase stock from the wholesalers.

Lovincer is paying a lot of money in rent fees for her home and business premises. Unfortunately, she lacks financial capacity to boost her stock and expand. Therefore she is requesting $ 1200 to buy more stock for her shop that will help her save more over the years to develop her own home.

loans.use: Purchase of stock

loans.name: Eliete

texts.en:
Eliete came with her husband to the Dominican Republic from Haiti 5 years ago looking for work. Because she does not yet know how to read or write and her Spanish is limited, she largely depends on bilingual members of the Haitian community to help her navigate life in Hato Mayor.
