The couple has three children, each of whom is in school back in Haiti and living with family. With what they have been earning in Hato Mayor, they have been able to send money back home on a regular basis. Rony, her husband, works in whatever construction jobs he can find, while Eliete spends the day selling merchandise.

Note: Eliete is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for his or her respective business and will be accountable to each other for repaying his or her share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Buying a good variety of shorts, pants and teeshirts to resell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Without the backing of a working husband, Teresa has worked hard to support her 6 children. From what she has earned with her small business she has slowly been able to improve the family home, eventually adding a well, an outhouse and wall partitions that now permanently separate rooms. She has been impressively able to pay for her children´s uniforms and school supplies and now is pleased to have a son enrolling at the local university. Teresa hopes to expand her business and next save enough to lay a cement floor in her house

Note: Teresa is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for his or her respective business and will be accountable to each other for repaying his or her share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: To buy better quality children´s clothing.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria was born in the Dominican Republic to Haitian parents and so is fluent in Spanish and Creole. Being bilingual, she often helps translate for members of the Haitian community who do not yet speak Spanish well. She has been living in Hato Mayor for 11 years with her family and hopes to eventually build a house of her own. When she´s not working selling clothing, Gloria likes to stay active in her community and chat with neighbors.

Note: Gloria is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for his or her respective business and will be accountable to each other for repaying his or her share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: To buy a better variety of shirts and pants

loans.name: Soam

texts.en:
Mrs. Soam S. is a 47-year-old mother of 3 children. She is a widow and runs a small grocery store in her community, earning around $2 each day. Two of her children work for a garment factory and together make around $80 each month.

Mrs. Soam S. is humbly requesting for a loan $300 to increase her inventory to meet her clients’ needs. She is grateful and appreciative for your trust and support.

loans.use: To purchase more products for her inventory.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Soam Srey has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Lout

texts.en:
Mrs. Lout R. is 50 years old and lives with her husband and her four children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband make their living by making mortar and pestles and selling them. This business activity contributes around $4 each day, while two of their children work at the garment factory and the rest are students.

This loan is necessary for their family and will be used to purchase two oxen help in transporting their products to sell everywhere in their area.

loans.use: To purchase two oxen to help in transporting their products to sell.

loans.name: Ung

texts.en:
Mrs. Ung S. is 48 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She runs a shop at her home selling rice and food to the people in her community, earning around $5 each day. Her husband, meanwhile, is a driver making $5 each day, One of her children is a mechanic earning $6 a day and the rest are students. 
This loan will be used to help her son buy more mechanical tools to operate his business.

loans.use: To purchase mechanical tools to operate a business.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs. Hong S. is a 43-year-old mother of five children and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She sells grocery products to the people in her area, where earns her on average $3/day of income. Her husband and two of her children make ice-cream and sell it at different places in their community. Together, they make up to $8 each day. The rest of her children attend school. This loan will be beneficially used to purchase a motorcycle and a cart, which will enable one of her children to sell ice-cream to make additional income for their family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and a cart to sell ice-cream.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Pov P. is 28 years old  and lives with her husband and four children in Phnom P., Cambodia. She works at a garment factory earning $3 each day, while her husband is a tuk-tuk driver making around $5 a day. Two of her children are students and the rest are too young to attend school. This loan will be beneficially used by her husband to purchase a passenger cart to operate his tuk-tuk business. In the future, this couple would like to own a hardware store in her community so that they can make additional income and build a concrete house for their family.

loans.use: To purchase a passenger cart for her husband to operate his business.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Pov Penh has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Ngheam

texts.en: Ngheam P. is a 43-year-old mother of four school-aged children. She is a market vendor selling vegetables and typically earns around $1. 20 each day, while her husband works as a construction foreman making on average $4 each day. Mrs. Ngheam P. is humbly requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to go to work, so he doesn’t spend too much on his daily public transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Mrs. Leng S. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To supplement her family, Leng S. operates a Karaoke business in her community, where her husband works as a motor-taxi driver. Together, they earn on average around $7 each day. One of her children works in a private company and the rest are students. Mrs Leng is humbly applying for a loan to expand her Karaoke business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

payments.comment: Congratulation! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for interest helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Leng Srey and sustain their business. Your loan has made them different. We do hope that you will continue support the poor entrepreneurs in Cambodia through CREDIT MFI in the future. Best Regard, Vichet Ouch, Kiva Coordinator at CREDIT MFI, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo S. is 32 years old and lives with her husband and her three school-aged children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To support her family’s expenses, Keo S. runs a small store selling grocery products and vegetables to the people in her area, where she earns about $5 each day. Her husband can only make a meager sum each day from working as a teacher. This loan will be beneficially used to expand her business by adding more grocery products to meet her clients’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Mok

texts.en:
Mrs. Mok S. is 25 years old and runs a small grocery store in her community earning around $2/day in revenue. Her husband works as a motor-taxi driver and makes around $2.5/day each day. Mrs. Mok S. intends to use this loan to purchase more grocery products and a motorcycle for her husband to operate a business. 
She and her family are grateful and thankful for your trust and support.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products and a motorcycle for her husband to operate a business.

payments.comment:
Thanks to the successful of her business that is why she can pay off her debt a head of time.
She would like to say thank to all lenders.

loans.name: Real

texts.en: Mrs. Real Phat is 28 years old and lives with her husband and two young children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a farmer earning only a meager income, and her husband works at construction making around $4 each day. This loan will be used to purchase a plot of farmland, and the rest of the money will be used to buy construction tools to help in her husband's work.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland to harvest crops and construction tools.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
My name is Parveen B. and I live in Lahore, Pakistan's second largest city. I have five children—three boys and two girls. All three of my sons currently work as sales assistants. They were not able to complete their studies because of our poor financial condition. I hope the same fate does not befall my daughters, who look forward to going to school every morning.

A couple of years ago I took out a small loan and started a seasonal cloth-selling business. I buy shawls and tailoring fabric from a wholesale market and then sell it door-to-door in the surrounding neighborhoods. This is a very profitable business for me and does not take up too much time either, which means my household duties are not neglected. I would now like to expand my business and do it year-round and seek a loan to help me. I will sell these clothes in the local market or neighborhood.

Parveen B., Lahore.

loans.use: To buy clothes from local market in Lahore and sell them in my neighbourhood.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
I have been sewing clothes on order for a very long time. After my husband’s death, I took out a loan and bought sewing machines for my sons so that they could contribute financially to the family expenses; thankfully, they had been apprenticing a tailor and were competent enough to take private orders. Our income increased considerably.

Now I would like to take out a loan so that my sons can rent a shop where they can set up their tailoring business. I am confident that this way they will get even more orders and my younger children will be able to receive an education. This loan will enable my sons to start their own business.

Rani B., Pakistan

loans.use: To rent a shop for my sons to start their tailoring business

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
All of my six children are working. My husband is a carpenter and I work in a beauty salon. For a long time I have wanted to set up my own parlor, as that way I will be able to generate more income than what I earn in my current job. Being able to earn more means I can reduce some of my children's financial burden in having to support me. I would much rather see them going to school than working to support me. I therefore seek a loan with which I can set up my own beauty salon which I will run in my house.

Nasreen J., Pakistan

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for my beauty parlour

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
A couple of years ago I took out a loan to start my garment business. With help from my three sons, I now run a small boutique where I sell outfits that I design myself. With the profit from my business, I am able to help my husband with the household expenses. We would now like to expand this business. With a larger variety of clothes, I will be able to attract a larger clientele and hence increase our profit. I therefore seek a loan of $350 to expand my business.

Shamim A., Pakistan

loans.use: To expand my garment business

loans.name: Mutribahon

texts.en:
Mutribahon B. is a young business lady. She started her business in 2004 as a trader of of towels, tablecloths and bedclothes. Her mother helped Mutribahon to begin her own business. She gave Mutribahon starting capital of $200. Her mother is a businesswoman, too. She sells different kinds of fabrics in the center of Panjshanbe market in Khujand.

Mutribahon rented a little place outside of a shop. She has one table in her trade place, and she arranges her goods on it. She hangs some of the goods on a rack which she made herself. Over three years she attracted more clients and increased her business capital to $800. But her problem is the condition of her business place. Especially in the autumn and winter seasons, she has risk to losing her health, and her goods become dirty by snow and rain. So she plans to increase her turnover and spend part of her profit building a roof and shelves in her business place.

In the photo, you can see Mutribahon on the left and her sister on the right.

loans.use: Purchasing 12 big towels, 20 small towels, 40 tablecloths, and 10 bed-clothes.

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sunita S., 30 years old, lives in Baghdol, Lalitpur.  Baghdol is a developing city of Nepal and the life style in this region is not so good.  Mrs. S. lives with her husband, brother-in-law and a daughter.  Her husband, brother-in-law and Mrs. S. all work together in their own grocery shop and her daughter is in primary school.

They opened the grocery shop 5 years ago.  Now they seek $150 to invest in their grocery shop to better their income.  They need the loan to purchase groceries such as rice, biscuits, chocolates, and other items to meet the demands of their customers.

Lastly, they want to save money, provide quality education for their daughter and fulfil their basic needs with their income.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
My son and daughter both go to school. Once they have finished high school I would like them to attend college as well. I have been stitching clothes for people from my locality for a long time. I now want to start a proper business with another tailor helping me. I will sell these clothes in the local market or neighborhood. This way I can increase my income and start putting money aside for my children’s college fund. Therefore, I am seeking a $175 loan to buy another sewing machine.

Shamim B.

loans.use: To expand my existing tailoring business

loans.name: Anvarjon

texts.en:
Anvarjon Z. rented one stall in the clothing shop and sells men's shoes. He has been engaged in trade for 6 years. He brings his goods from Istaravshan, Khujand, from the wholesale market. He goes there twice per month and buys goods for $200. Currently the turnover of his working capital is good. He has many clients, because his product is high quality and competitive and meets today's demand.

Presently he sells part of his goods in the open-air place. He works here to attract more new clients. In September he wishes to borrow $400 to purchase 60 pairs of shoes and 20 rucksacks for the coming autumn season.

In the photo you can see him with his little assistant, Farrukh, a pupil of 4 form. Farrukh sells Anvarjon's goods when he goes on the trip to purchase new goods.

loans.use: Purchasing 60 pairs of shoes and 20 rucksacks for the coming autumn season.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
I live in Lahore and work as a cleaner in a large house. My husband works as a gardener for the Pakistan navy in another city. He hardly visits home and sends money only intermittently. I live with my four children in a two-room rented house. My three younger children are able to attend school because of my eldest son, who helps to pay for their school expenses. He has been working in a bicycle repair shop for a couple of years. He now wants to open his own shop so that he can increase his income. I am requesting this loan to help my son set up his own business.

Parveen S., Pakistan

loans.use: To set up a bicycle repair shop

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
My husband and I have been in the tailoring business for a long time now. While I make clothes for the women and children in my neighborhood, my husband takes orders from bigger houses and makes men’s clothes. Together we make a net profit of $250 per month. Last year we took out a loan of $200 to buy new sewing machines.

We are now in need of a loan to put towards the rent for a small shop on the main road so that we can process more orders. We have successfully put our older three children through school and we wish the same for the youngest who is currently in primary school.

Kaneez F., Pakistan

loans.use: To rent a shop to run a tailoring business

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
My husband works hard to send all five of our children to school. I help him when I can with his tailoring business. Last year we took a loan of $170 with which he purchased a sewing machine. Now he wants to hire some help so that he can take more orders and expand his business. With the increased income, we will not have to worry about our children’s education being interrupted. We need this loan to buy another machine and expand my husband’s business.

Sajida J., Pakistan

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine and hire help

loans.name: Mehnaz

texts.en:
My husband has been working as a wholesale dealer of toiletries with a big company for many years. He now wants to start his own wholesale business, as this will bring in more money for our family. He has a lot of contacts and potential clients and is confident that his business will do well. We have an eight-month-old daughter whom we want to educate. If my husband can set up his business before our daughter reaches school-going age, we will be financially stable enough to provide for all her needs. We need this loan to set up our business.

Mehnaz B., Pakistan

loans.use: To start a wholesale business

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
A couple of years back, wanting to improve our living conditions, my husband and I shifted from his village to Lahore, Pakistan's second largest city. My husband started working with a company making Venetian blinds.

Last year we took out a loan so that he could set up a business of his own. He receives many orders for blinds, some from big companies, some from private clients. He has a few people working for him, which means that he can take on these big orders. He would now like to further expand his business, for which we are requesting a loan of $350.

Khalida S., Pakistan

loans.use: To expand our business making Venetian blinds

loans.name: Sorraya

texts.en:
Last year I took out a loan to start a door-to-door garment selling business. I purchase the goods from Faisalabad, the textile mecca of Pakistan, about a two-hour drive from my home city of Lahore. Though the business does well, it does not bring in a regular income because it is only a seasonal venture.

Therefore, I would like to expand my business and work in the summer months as well. I know this plan will work well because my customers keep asking me when I will start selling summer clothes. I am seeking a $350 loan to expand my business.

Sorraya K., Pakistan

loans.use: Expansion of garment business

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
I have four children and all of them go to school. My husband is a chauffeur and I stitch clothes on order for people in my neighborhood. This way both of us are doing what we can to ensure our children are not deprived of their right to an education.

I have many contacts in the surrounding neighborhoods and sometimes I receive too many orders to handle on my own. I would like to expand my business by taking on a helper and thus increase my monthly income. Therefore, I seek a loan of $175 to buy a sewing machine.

Saima S., Pakistan

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Sehar

texts.en:
I have been working in a big beauty parlor for many years and now I would like to open up my own. I have plenty of experience and there is no shortage of clients so I am sure my business will do well. I will obviously start modestly, from my home, but I have bigger plans for the future. My two older children go to school and the younger one will be starting next year. I want my son to become a pilot and my daughter to be an airhostess. I hope I will be able to realize my dreams for them. I need a loan to buy cosmetics and other beauty parlor accessories.  
Seher S., Pakistan

loans.use: Buy cosmetics to start up a beauty salon

loans.name: Anam

texts.en:
I am 22 years old and have been working in a beauty parlor for about six years. My work is my life as I am divorced, without any children. I love what I do and want to make a name for myself in my locality. While I will continue working as an employee at the beauty parlor, I want to open my own salon in my house. I am confident my business will do well as there are many potential clients in my locality. I need a loan to buy cosmetics for my new business.

Anam T., Pakistan

loans.use: Buy cosmetics to set up a beauty salon

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
When I got married, my husband was working in a tire-shop. Over the years, we took out loans and he opened up his own tire-shop. Our income has been steadily increasing, as his business is doing well. We are able to send our two children to a private school, where the standard of education is better than in the public schools. My husband would like to expand his business now and we require a loan to purchase more tires and other accessories.

Nasreen N., Pakistan

loans.use: Purchase tires for our tire-shop

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
My four children have had to abandon their studies because of our financial situation and now both my sons are working to make a living. One of my sons works in a big electronics company and earns $65.57 per month. He wanted to do some part-time work on the side to increase his income. Therefore, he bought a rickshaw (local three-wheeled vehicle) on installments. Now, he needs a loan for the maintenance of the vehicle. This loan can help us increase our income.

Parveen K., Pakistan

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
I am widowed and have two daughters who go to school. Currently I am working as a schoolteacher but my income is not sufficient because of the high cost of living. I want to give a bright future to my daughters. Now I want to open a sewing school. I have a diploma in sewing. I would like to purchase a computerized sewing machine for my school. I need a loan to purchase this machine. By opening this school, I will be able to provide training for the eager girls of my locality and will be able to increase my income.

Yasmin S., Pakistan

loans.use: Set up a sewing school

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
I have four children, three sons and a daughter, who all go to school. My husband is a photographer’s assistant in a well-known studio. We are unable to meet the high cost of living with his current income. I can not work as I have to take care of our small children. My husband would like to buy his own camera so that he can start offering his services at weddings etc. We need a loan to buy the camera. We are hopeful that this way we will increase our income and continue educating our children.

Mariam B., Pakistan

loans.use: Purchase a camera

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
I have three children, all of whom go to school. I am a homemaker and my husband drives a rickshaw (local three-wheeled vehicle). We bought the rickshaw on installments a couple of years ago and it is in need of repairs now. Since the rickshaw is our only source of income, we need to do the maintenance work before its condition deteriorates. For this, we need a loan.

Rehana M., Pakistan

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
All of my four children are in school. I want a bright future for them. I am a homemaker and my husband runs his business of glass/windows from a rented shop. His daily income is about $5 which is not sufficient for our household expenses and the children’s school fees. As our children are growing up, their school fees are also increasing. We need more money than what my husband earns presently, to ensure my children’s education. My husband wants to expand his business for which we require a loan. He will be able to take on larger orders and thus increase our income.

Razia S., Pakistan

loans.use: Expansion of glass/windows business

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
I have been living in Lahore since my birth. I have three sons and one daughter. Two of my sons and my daughter are married and are living independently. I live with my third son. My son wants to open a general store in our house and he needs money to buy commodities for the shop. We live in a busy neighborhood and we think our general store can be successful as there is no store in our area. I need a loan so that we can open a store; this will help us to improve our standard of living. I am too old to work myself.

Zarina B., Lahore.

loans.use: Set up a general store

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
I am a mother of six, three boys and three girls. The boys are done with their studies and are currently working . My husband is a driver and works in a school. My eldest son owns a car which he bought on installments. He uses it for taking kids to school in the morning and in the afternoon.

A year back, one of my younger sons started a garment shop but it did not go quite well and soon we had to close it. Now, he also wants to buy a car and wants to start the same work that his elder brother is already doing. He is sure that he will do well with the car and my eldest son has some clients for his younger brother to help him to start his business. I need a loan to help my son buy a car on installments and start his own work.

Farzana R., Lahore.

loans.use: Purchase an automobile

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en:
I have two children who are too young to go to school but I would like to educate them in the future. Mostly I stay at home to look after my children but in my free time, I work as a beautician and go to the houses of various people who need my services. I am helping my husband to meet our cost of living.

Now, I want to expand my business and increase our income so that I can provide education to my children. For this, I want to purchase some beauty items such as cosmetics for my business. Therefore, I need a loan.

Nagina Y., Lahore

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics for business

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
I am a mother of six, four boys and two girls. All of my children are in school. I’m a housewife and my husband works in a hotel as a part-time driver. He also owns a pickup and uses it for taking some boys and girls to school in the morning and in the afternoon.

We have yet to have a steady income because with each passing day, our daily expenses are increasing. Therefore, my husband and I have decided to go to Peshawar (a city known for its cheap products) and buy blankets and other seasonal cloth from there. He will sell these to shopkeepers in Lahore’s local market and he thinks that our new business will be successful. I need a loan to start our business.

With this increased income, we will be able to educate our children and this will ultimately help us to increase our living standard.

Abida B., Lahore.

loans.use: Start a cloth-selling business

loans.name: Ram Payari

texts.en:
Mrs. Ram Payari Napit, 47 years old, lives in Tangal, Lalitpur.  She lives in a single family household with her husband and three sons.

Her husband, Mr. Badri Man Napit, and her 3 sons make traditional idols.  In Nepal, idol making work is very famous and the demand for idols is also increasing.  They now need money to buy raw materials to make more traditional idols to fulfill the demand for idol.

So, she seeks $300 to buy raw materials for making traditional idols.

loans.use: To buy materials for her work

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en: Mrs. Laxmi S., 35 years old, lives in Tangal, Lalitpur.  She is an active member in her group.  She lives in a single family household with her husband, a daughter and a son.  Her husband, Raju S., makes clothing garments in their own small garment factory and sells them in the local market.  Her daughter is studying in grade 3 and her son is in grade 1.  Mrs. S. makes different types of dolls, like dogs and cats, from different materials.  For her work she is asking for $230 to buy different raw cotton materials.  She wants to meet the demands of her customers by increasing production.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Tara Devi

texts.en:
Mrs. Tara Devi L., 58 years old, lives in Bagdhol, Lalitpur.  She opened her small hotel 2 years ago.  She is selling Newari food in the hotel.

Four years ago, her husband, Dhan Bahadur L., died and now she has to take the whole responsibility for her family.  Her economic condition is poor and not adequate to fulfill the basic needs of her family.  She needs a loan to expand her business to earn more and fulfill her family's basic needs.

She plans to use the loan to buy a refrigerator to sell cold drinks like Coke and juice, as well as cold snacks.

She is living with her daughter and a six month old granddaughter.  She wants to provide quality education for her granddaughter.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for her shop

loans.name: Radika Malla

texts.en:
Ms. Radika Malla T. has two sons and one daughter.  Her older son had completed graduation and now he works in a government office.  Her younger son is in his 3rd year studying BBS, and her daughter is in grade 10.  A few years ago her husband, Mr. Bhairob Malla, died and now she has sole responsibility for her 5 children.

Mrs. Radika already owns a cow and she has been selling milk in the area.  In Nepal pure, fresh cow’s milk is highly valued for its nutrition.

Radika lives in a growing neighborhood and in that area the demand for milk is increasing.  She carries her milk containers and sells door to door daily in the morning and evening.  Because of the rising demand, she wants to buy another cow to increase her production so she is seeking $375.  Radika plans to purchase a jersey cow, which produces more milk than normal cows.

loans.use: To buy a young, milk giving cow

loans.name: Shyama

texts.en:
Mrs. Shyama K., 26 years old, lives in Bhaishipati, Lalitpur.  She lives in a single family household with four members: herself, her husband, a daughter and a son.

Her husband, Mr. Madan K., is a teacher in Ganudaya Boarding school.  Her daughter is studying in middle school and her son is still too young for school.

Mrs. K. started selling cows' milk 3 months ago.  She already owns a cow.  Now she is requesting a loan of $450 to buy another young cow to sell milk in a local area because she lives in a growing neighborhood and in that area the demand for milk is increasing.  In Nepal, people love to drink cows' milk so the demand for milk is increasing constantly.

loans.use: To buy a young, milk giving cow

loans.name: Ganu Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Ganu Chan T., 41 years old, lives in Bhaishipati, Lalitpur.  She has two sons and a daughter.  Both her sons are studying BBS (Bachelor of Business Studies) and her daughter is studying in grade 10.

Her Husband, Mr. Ragu Nath T., opened his electronic repair shop 8 years ago.  Now he needs a loan of $375 to buy electronic repair goods like screws, chips, and various parts for TVs, radios and other electronic goods, so Mrs. T. is asking for her fourth loan to invest in her husband's shop.

All members of her family depend on the shop for income because no other member in her family has a job.

loans.use: To buy electronic repair goods

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mrs. Mina S., 28 years old, lives in Thecho, Lalitpur, Nepal.  She is an active member in her group.  She lives in a joint family household with her father-in-law, brother-in-law, sister-in-law and her husband.

Her husband, Shankar S., is a bicycle mechanic and opened his bicycle workshop 9 years ago.  He does not have enough money to buy materials such as tires, wheels, screws, and other materials for his shop, so she is seeking a loan of $150 to invest in her husband's bicycle workshop. 

All members of her family are totally depended on the shop.  She wants to invest more to earn more to maintain her family and for her own improvement.

loans.use: To buy bicycle repair goods

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
Dorotea is 44 years old, she has been in a relationship for 11 years and has two daughters, Andrea, 11 and Nilda, 9. They live in a settlement with a group of families who were all previously homeless, so this group organized themselves and asked the government to able to live in an area that had not been populated for more than 8 years. Today they all live organized lives and have built their own houses.

Dorotea began her sales with very little capital, in the beginning she only bought sacks of potatoes and with those earnings she began building up a bit of capital. Today, after many years of sacrifice, she owns one of the best stocked pantries in the area.

In the future, she wishes to construct a store for the merchandise that she sells. She is thinking of becoming a provider to the smaller stores in the region. She requests $200 which she will invest in the purchase of more merchandise such as sugar, rice, flour, and oil; in this way she will be able to generate more earnings and save for the construction of her store.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Dorotea tiene 44 años, hace 11 años vive en pareja y tiene dos hijas, Andrea de 11años y Nilda de 9 años. Viven en un asentamiento, ella cuenta que un grupo de familias sin techo se organizaron y solicitaron al gobierno vivir en una zona despoblada hace 8 años atrás. Hoy día todos viven de forma organizada y construyeron sus propias casas.

Dorotea empezó la venta con un muy bajo capital, al principio solo compraba bolsas de papas y con las ganancias de las ventas iba aumentando de a poco su capital. Hoy día, y tras varios años de sacrificio, ella posee una de las despensas más surtidas de la zona.

Ella desea construir más adelante un depósito para las mercaderías que vende, pues tiene pensando ser proveedora de las despensas más pequeñas de la zona. Solicita un crédito de $ 200 que los invertirá en la compra de mercaderías al por mayor como azúcar, arroz, harina y aceite; de esta forma podrá generar más ganancias y ahorrar para la construcción de su depósito.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise such as sugar, rice, flour and oil.

loans.name: Deolinda

texts.es:
Deolinda Colonel is 43 years old, she is married and a mother of two children, 14-year-old Víctor and 16-year-old Dahiana. Her children are in school and they also help her with her business. Víctor Ayala, her husband, has a stand where he sells fruit at city market. Mrs Rosa has been working since she was 7 years old, she used to sell candies like her mother and brothers. She comes from a very humble family, therefore they all had to work to be earn able to earn their daily living. Rosa was only able to study one year since she had to work, for this reason her biggest wish is that her children are able to finish their studies so one day they can have better opportunities in life. Deolinda had different jobs before setting up her business, she has a small grocery store at her house that she opened thanks to a few savings that she gathered through out several years. She sells fruit, vegetables, milk, rice, sugar among others. In the future, she wants to buy a refrigerator to be able to sell cold drinks during the summer time. She is asking for a loan $200 that she wants to invest in the purchase of more goods such rice, sugar, oil, fruit and milk, since they are the products with the biggest demand from her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Deolinda C. tiene 43 años, está casada y es madre de dos hijos, Víctor de 14 años y Dahiana de 16. Sus hijos van al colegio y también ayudan a su madre con su negocio. El marido de Dolinda se llama Víctor Ayala y posee un puesto de venta de frutas en el mercado municipal de la ciudad. Doña Rosa trabaja desde los 7 años en la calle, vendía golosinas al igual que su madre y hermanos, ella proviene de una familia muy humilde, por lo que debían trabajar para poder ganarse el sustento diario. Rosa solo curso un año de estudios pues debía trabajar, eso hace que su mayor sueño sea que sus hijos sigan estudiando para tener el día de mañana mejores oportunidades en la vida. Deolinda tuvo diferentes trabajos antes de montar su negocio, ella tiene una despensa en su casa que abrió gracias a unos ahorros que junto durante varios años. En su despensa vende frutas, verduras, leche, arroz, azúcar entre otros. Desea comprarse más adelante una heladera para poder vender bebidas frías en época de verano. Solicita un crédito de $ 200 que los desea invertir en la compra de más mercaderías como arroz, azúcar, aceite, frutas y leche, ya que son los productos de mayor demanda por sus clientes.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise such rice, sugar, oil, fruit and milk.

loans.name: Blasia

texts.es:
Blasia is 38 years old, she is the single mother of two children who are 10 and 15 years old, both study in a highschool in the city.

Blasia began working when she was very little so as to provide for her humble family. Despite the fact that she has had a lot of problems she is very proud to serve as both mother and father to both of her children. With much sacrifice and strength she was able to obtain her own small store from which to sell sweets, fast food and lunches out of her home to people who work in her area.

The business is coming along very well, she tells us that her clients really like the food that she prepares. Blasia wishes to continue progressing and diversifying the products that she sells, therefore she is asking for a credit of $100 which she will invest the purchase of products of highest necessity such as sugar, rice, flour, and noodles to sell in the store out of her house and in this way help her pantry to grow thereby increasing her income.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Blasia tiene 38 años, es soltera y madre de dos hijos, uno de 10 años y otro de 15, ambos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad.

Blasia trabajo desde muy pequeña, ya que ella proviene de una familia muy humilde; a pesar de que tuvo muchos problemas cuenta con mucho orgullo que es madre y padre para sus hijos. Con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo logro poner un pequeño comedor y ventas de golosinas en su casa, vende comidas rápidas y también prepara almuerzos a personas que trabajan en la zona.

El negocio marcha muy bien, nos cuenta que sus clientes gustan mucho de las comidas que ella prepara. Blasia desea seguir progresando y diversificar los productos que vende, para ello solicita un crédito de $ 100 que los invertirá en la compra de productos de primera necesidad tales como azúcar, arroz, harina y fideos para venderlos en su comedor y así de a poco montar una despensa para aumentar sus ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase of products of greatest necessity like sugar, rice, flour, and noodles to sell from the shop in her home.

loans.name: Amada

texts.es:
Mrs Amada I. is 61 years old. She is married and her husband Apolonio Torales is retired. He used to work as Municipal Inspector at the City Hall. They have four children all already of legal age. Amada has always been an enterprising and sacrificed woman. She studied in spite of the lack of means of her family, and even when she had to look after her 9 younger brothers and sisters, after her parents died when she was 20 years old. Amada is a retired teacher and today she works in the confection of handmade of tablecloths of "encaje ju" a Guarani term (one of two official languages in Paraguay) that means lace done with needles. “Encaje ju” is a typical weave of Paraguay, and it is a beautiful handmade work that takes time and great dedication to make it. At present she sell her products in different cities, since her clients love her work and come up to the city of Carapegúa to buy them. She makes them together with her sister who studied this craft and taught her. Amada is asking for a loan to buy more threads and fabric, since they have received wholesale orders of their tablecloths to export them to neighboring countries like Argentina.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Amada I. tiene 61 años de edad, está casada, su marido se llama Apolonio Torales y es jubilado, el trabajaba como Inspector Municipal en la Municipalidad de la ciudad. Ellos tiene cuatro hijos todos ya mayores de edad. Amada siempre fue una mujer emprendedora y sacrificada, estudio a pesar de las carencias de su familia, y aún cuando quedo a cargo de sus 9 hermanos menores, pues sus padres murieron cuando ella tenía 20 años. Amada es un profesora jubilada y hoy día se dedica al tejido artesanal de manteles de “encaje ju” termino en guaraní (uno de los dos idiomas oficiales de Paraguay) que significa encaje hecho con agujas. El encaje ju es un tejido típico del Paraguay, y es un hermoso trabajo hecho a mano y que lleva cierto tiempo y mucha dedicación realizarlo. Actualmente sus productos se venden en diferentes ciudades, pues sus clientes gustan mucho de su trabajo y vienen hasta la ciudad de Carapegúa para poder comprarlos. Ella realiza estos trabajos junto con su hermana quien estudio este oficio y le enseño a Amanda las técnicas del tejido. Amanda solicita el crédito para adquirir más hilos y telas, pues han recibido pedidos al por mayor de sus manteles para exportarlos a países limítrofes como Argentina.

loans.use: Buy threads and fabric

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Mrs. Francisca is 69 years old, she is already a widow and a mother of 5 children, all young adults and independent. She is a very active and hard-working person in spite of her age. She tells us that the most difficult experience that she had to endure was the death of her husband, who died after a long illness; this situation forced her to spend a lot of money. After this she decided to start a new activity to be able to support her children who were still small then. She has a small store, but her principal activity is selling pork meat. Francisca has her own corral in her house, where he breeds and feed the pigs and then sells them at the city market. Sometimes she gets clients' orders that live in the city of Asunción (the capital that is two hours from Carepegua) Francisca is asking for a loan of $300 that she wants to use to buy feeder pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Francisca tiene 69 años, es viuda y madre de 5 hijos, todos ya mayores e independientes, a pesar de su edad es una persona muy activa y trabajadora. Ella comenta que la experiencia más difícil que tuvo que afrontar fue la muerte de su esposo, quien falleció después de una larga enfermedad, situación que la obligó a gastar mucho dinero; posterior a ese acontecimiento decidió emprender una nueva actividad para poder mantener a sus hijos que aún eran pequeños en ese entonces. Ella tiene un pequeño almacén, pero su actividad principal es la venta de carne porcina. Francisca tiene su propio corral en su casa, donde cría y engorda los cerdos para luego venderlos en el mercado de la ciudad. En ocasiones recibe pedidos de clientes que viven en la ciudad de Asunción (ciudad capital que queda a dos horas de Carepegua) Francisca solicita el crédito de $ 300 que los desea utilizar para la compra de cerdos para el engorde.

loans.use: Buy feeder pigs

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Señora Francisca is 23 years old. She is married to Augusto Barrios. They have a 7 year-old daughter. Augusto has his own mechanic shop.

She weaves/sews blankets and hammocks since she was very young. She used to help her mother. Francisca was very young when she got married. She was only 16 years old when she met her life companion. They lived with her mother not so long ago, but now with their hard work, they live in their own house which they built on their own. They moved to their new home about 8 months ago. They only have a few things they need to do to finish the house. Francisca has always been motivated to move ahead in life and she sees no obstacles. In her free time, she does manicures to the ladies in the barrio, since she is well-known for that as well.

She sells her products in the stores located in the city. Her business is part of the many business that form Microempresas Mujeres en Desarrollo (Mini businesses Helping Women).There are a total of 15 women. They work together and save 10% of their sales. She is requesting a loan to purchase mutl-color threads.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Francisca tiene 23 años, está casada con Augusto Barrios, con quién tiene una hija de 7 años; el señor trabaja de forma independiente como chapista de automóviles en su propio taller. Ella teje frazadas y hamacas desde joven, ya que ayudaba a su madre que también era artesana y realizaba este tipo de tejido. Francisca se casó muy joven, solo tenía 16 años de edad cuando encontró al compañero de su vida y contrajeron matrimonio. Hasta hace poco vivían con su mamá, y ahora gracias al esfuerzo de ambos lograron construir su propia casa, hace 8 meses se mudaron allí y ahora su deseo es terminar los últimos detalles de la casa. Francisca siempre ha buscado progresar y para ella no hay obstáculos, en sus ratos libres también hace trabajos de manicura a las señoras del barrio; ya que también es conocida por esta actividad. Sus productos los vende a las tiendas ubicadas en el centro de la ciudad. Su negocio forma parte del grupo de microempresas Mujeres en Desarrollo, conformada por 15 mujeres, trabajan todas juntas, y generan un ahorro del 10% de sus cuotas, la responsabilidad del crédito es solidario. Hoy, ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos de algodón de diferentes colores.

loans.use: To purchase mutl-color thread

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
Isidora is a weaver. She weaves blankets made out of "poyvi" which is a type of fabric/needlework traditional to Carapegua, the city where she lives. She is married and has 5 children who are all currently in college.

She started weaving about 17 years ago which she believes is a talent she inherited from her mother. Since she couldn't finish school, Isidra had to work at a very young age to survive. She later married Aurelio Britez who is a hard worker and he sells the "poyvi" blankets that she makes by travelling throughout the city.

Aurelio travels with his dad who knows the city like the palm of his hands. He taught Aurelio how to be a good salesman and a good business man too. They travelled as far as Asuncion (Paraguay's capital) once a week to sell blankets to the stores around the capital.

Both Isidra and Aurelio want to one day see all their kids graduate from college and to get a good job without having to suffer or to put up with difficult times in the streets like bad weather in order to feed their family.

Isidora is requesting a loan in order to purchase a vast amount of thread in different colors to meet her clients high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Isidra es tejedora de mantas de “poyvi” un tejido tradicional de la zona donde reside: Carapeguá, ella es casada y tiene 5 hijos todos cursando actualmente sus estudios secundarios. La actividad la inició hace 17 años por que es una habilidad heredada de su madre. Ya que no pudo terminar sus estudios, Isidra, tuvo que trabajar desde muy joven para generar ingreso y ganarse el pan de cada día, luego se casó con Aurelio Brítez, una persona muy emprendedora que se encarga de vender de forma ambulante las mantas de poyvi que teje Isidra. Aurelio viaja con su padre, un antiguo conocedor del rubro, quien le enseño la habilidad en las ventas de estos productos a crédito en los barrios residenciales de Asunción (capital del Paraguay). Es así que Aurelio viaja una vez por semana a la capital a vender las mantas y frazadas a tiendas de la capital. Ambos sueñan con ver a sus hijos terminar sus estudios y adquirir una profesión, sin tener que pasar el duro sacrificio de soportar en la calle frío, lluvia y calor para acercar el pan para la familia. Isidra solicita el crédito pues necesita comprar hilos de algodón de diferentes colores y en grandes cantidades, ya que han aumentado la demanda de mantas de diferentes colores hecha por sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase more thread in multiple colors

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose is 53 years old. He is a widower and he lives in Carapegua. He has 3 children. His wife died about 5 years ago, and his kids were teen-agers and they were all going to school at that time.

Jose's most difficult and the saddest days of his life were the ones he spent with his dying wife since the doctors couldn't detect the cause of her illness, and he had to take her to Argentina to do more tests. Then, 5 months later, his wife died of cancer.

Since then, he has been both a mother and a father to his children, who currently live and work in Argentina. Each month, his kids send him money, but he would like to continue to work as a travelling salesman. Jose sells all types of blankets/bedding and tableclothes which are all handmaD. and are original crafmanship of his native city Carapegua.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

José tiene 53 años, es viudo y actualmente en L. ciudad D. Carapeguá. Tiene 3 hijos; hace cinco años falleció su esposa quedando a cargo D. sus tres hijos adolescentes, todos estudiantes en ese entonces. José cuenta L. experiencia más dura que le toco vivir fue L. agonía que tuvo que pasar junto con su esposa, pues cuando enfermo los médicos no supieron detectar L. enfermedad que tenía y tuvo que viajar a L. Argentina para realizarle los estudios. Luego D. cinco meses, su esposa falleció D. cáncer. DesD. entonces fue padre y madre para sus hijos, quienes hoy día viven y trabajan en Argentina, ellos envían dinero mensualmente para su padre, pero el desea seguir trabajando, y es por eso que realiza ventas D. forma ambulante. José venD. artesanías textiles como frazadas, mantas y manteles que son típicas D. L. ciudad D. Carapeguá. José solicita el crédito para L. compra al por mayor D. cubre camas y frazadas pues ha recibido muchas demandas D. estos productos D. tiendas a las que el provee.

loans.use: To purchase bedding/blankets at whole sale prices

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Señor Jose M. lives in Carapegua. He is married to Señora Ana Caballero, and they have 4 children. Two of them are police officers, one is a math teacher and the youngest is going to college. Señora Ana is a housewife, and Señor Jose is a travelling salesman who sells handcrafts. He has been able to put his children through college doing this job.

Even with these difficult times they went through, Jose has been able to provide for his family. His sales are great, and there is a high demand for the products he sells which are all types of blankets, bedding, clothes such as pants, etc. Aside from his sales, Jose is also a security guard at the local university. He is a security guard during the week, and he's a salesman during the weekend.

His friends and neighbors respect him for his hard work and dedication. Jose wishes to borrow $600 to purchase more merchandise such as blankets, pants and shirts, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor José M., vive en Carapeguá, está casado con la señora Ana Caballero y tienen cuatro hijos, de los cuales dos son oficiales de policía, una es profesora de matemáticas y la última sigue estudiando en la universidad. Su esposa es ama de casa y el señor José es vendedor ambulante de artesanías; con este trabajo ha logrado hacer estudiar a sus hijos que hoy día ya son profesionales. A pesar de las diferentes dificultades que pasaron durante estos tiempos, José ha podido sacar adelante a su familia. Sus ventas son muy buenas, y hay bastante demanda de los productos que ofrece, entre ellos podemos citar frazadas, mantas, cubre camas, pantalones, etc. Además de sus ventas, José, ha conseguido un trabajo como guardia de seguridad en una universidad local, por lo que entre semana trabaja como guardia y sus ventas las realiza los fines de semana. Sus amigos y vecinos lo respetan y admiran mucho por su gran espíritu emprendedor. José desea un crédito de $ 600 para invertirlos en la compra de más mercaderías como frazadas, pantalones y camisas para la venta.

loans.use: To purchase woollen blankets, shirts and pants

loans.name: Librada

texts.es:
Señora Librada is 53 years old. She is a single mother of 4 children. Two of her children live with her. The oldest one is married and has his own house. Her other daughter died of cancer about 2 years ago leaving her 4 children to Librada who is taking care of them.

You can say she has been through a very tough time, but she has been able to move forward and she has been able to take good care of her family. Librada currently sells used clothes and used shoes which she buys at Ciudad del Este, one of the biggest cities in the country which is located about 4 hours from where she lives.

She started with a small side business from home. Thanks to her good-nature, she has been able to multiply her clientele. She currently has two stores. Her main motivation is to provide a good education to her grandchildren which she promised to her daughter when she died.

Librada is requesting a loan to purchase T-shirts, shoes, dress shirts and pants for the summer during the fall time which are less expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Librada tiene 53 años, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos. Dos de sus hijos viven con ella, el mayor está casado y tiene su propia casa; su otra hija falleció de cáncer hace dos años dejando huérfanos a cuatro niños, los cuales viven Librada quien se encarga hoy día de la crianza de los mismos. Puede decirse de ella que ha pasado por muchas pruebas difíciles, pero aún así ha podido salir adelante y darle sustento a su familia. Librada se dedica hoy día a la venta de ropas y zapatos usados que los compra de Ciudad del Este, una de las ciudades más comerciales del país que se encuentra a cuatro horas de la ciudad donde ella reside. Empezó con un pequeño puesto en su casa, y gracias a su ingenio y amabilidad ha logrado multiplicar sus clientes, y actualmente ya cuenta con dos grandes salones de ventas. La mayor motivación de Librada es la de dar una buena educación a sus nietos, para así cumplir con la promesa que le hizo a su hija. Librada solicita el préstamo para comprar remeras, zapatos, camisas y pantalones para el verano que en esta temporada de invierno están de oferta y tienen mejor precio.

loans.use: To puchase all types of clothes

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente B. is 53 years old. He is married to Vicotornia Reyes, 51, and they have 3 children; one of whom is married and lives with his family; the other is an attorney and actually works as Justice of the Peace; while the last one is a journalist who works at a radio station in the capital and is also in school in his fourth year studying law.

Vicente is very proud of his sons as they have all achieved their goals. They all have jobs because they were able to get an education, something that Vicente instilled in them since they were young since he did not have the opportunity to even finish elementary school.

Four years ago, Vicente undertook his own small business with the little savings he had and opened a store that sells all kinds of products of highest necessity such as sugar, flour, milk products, eggs, canned products, etc.

Vicente possess a great entrepreneurial spirit and is a fighter, in addition to tending his shop, he gathers cotton during the harvest season.

Vicente asks for a credit of $1000 to supply his store, as demand has risen in the past few months. Among the products that would be purchased are rice, cheese, canned products, flour, noodles, and meat.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

Vicente B. de 53 años de edad, está casado con Victorina Reyes de 51 años, el matrimonio tiene 3 hijos de los cuales uno está casado y vive con su familia, otro es abogado y trabaja actualmente como Juez de Paz; mientras que el último de sus hijos es periodista, trabaja en una radio de la capital y a la vez es estudiante del cuarto año de la carrera de Derecho.

Vicente está muy orgulloso de sus hijos, pues todos se encuentran realizados, trabajan bien gracias a que culminaron sus estudios, algo que Vicente los inculco desde pequeños ya que el no tuvo la oportunidad de terminar ni si quiera la etapa primaria de sus estudios.

Hace cuatro años, Vicente emprendió su propia microempresa con un pequeño ahorro y abrió una despensa donde vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad tales como azúcar, harina, lácteos, huevo, productos enlatados, etc.

Vicente posee un gran espíritu emprendedor y luchador, además de atender su despensa, en épocas de cosecha de algodón, él se dedica al acopio del mismo.

Vicente solicita un crédito de $ 1000 para surtir su despensa, ya que en los últimos meses ha aumentado considerablemente su demanda. Ente los productos a ser comprados podemos citar arroz, queso, productos enlatados, harina, fideos y carne.

loans.use: For the purchase of more merchandise such as rice, cheese, canned products, flour, noodles, and meat.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Three years ago, Galina started a small business selling personal manicure sets and grooming supplies at one of the busy outdoor markets in Zaporoshye, Ukraine. She tries to maintain an excellent selection of manicure sets and currently has a virtual monopoly for them in the market. Galina is single and has one grown son. Her business, from which she makes around $200-$300 a month in profit, is a very important source of income for her.

Galina would like to see her business continue to expand. She recently was able to purchase her own sales kiosk and eventually hopes to have it remodeled. She has requested a short term loan of $300 to add to her working capital and allow her to purchase additional inventory, expanding the price range of products she has available. Galina has been a good client in the past with Nadiya Ukraine and we look forward to continuing to assist her in the future.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
After working as an employee for another sales business, Elena decided to start a business herself. Two years ago she started a small market venture selling fresh fruits and vegetables. She currently has an excellent sales location for her business at one of the biggest markets in Kherson, located in south central Ukraine.

Elena would like to continue developing her business and has requested a loan of $1000 to help purchase more fresh foods to sell. Her goal is for her business to be financially stable and continue to provide for her needs.

loans.use: Purchase fruit and vegetable inventory

loans.name: Boris

texts.en:
Boris decided to begin a small market business after retiring and finding he needed to supplement his small government pension. He’s now been selling for over a decade and has developed a successful business that allows him to provide for himself and his wife. He currently sells practical clothing items such as socks, underwear and women’s lingerie.

Not long ago, the market where Boris is located had some remodeling done and he was able to move to a bigger selling location. He has requested a loan of $1200 to help purchase additional inventory that he can use to fill new retail space. Boris has been a great client with Nadiya Ukraine, developing a reputation of honesty and responsibility and never being late with his loan payments. We are happy for this opportunity to continue assisting Boris with his business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for expanded sales location

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Señor Juan C. is 56 years old and married to Señora Lucia Portillo, who is 49 years old. She is dedicated to selling processed corn and in this way helps her husband and contributes to the household income. The couple has five children, four of which have taken residence in Argentina. Two of them have already fromed their own families and the other two help their parents economically by sending a little bit of money each month. The youngest of their children is 19 years old and completing his final year of secondary school. He still lives with his parents and has plans to pursue an education at a university next year.

Juan has had his own garage for 17 years, where he makes repairs on bicycles, fixes tires, sells used tires and replacement parts for bicycles. His youngest son helps him with these tasks. Since Juan has a large shed available to him, he has also incorporated furniture sales into his business and is able to increase his income.

The requested loan will be used to buy covers, tubes, and tires for vehicles and also replacement parts for bicycles. This will allow him to offer a greater variety of merchandise and a better service to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. Juan C. de 56 años de edad, está casado con la señora Lucia Portillo de 49 años, ella se dedica a la venta de maíz molido, de esta forma ayuda a su esposo y aporta con los ingresos de la casa. La pareja tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 4 se encuentran radicados en la Argentina; 2 de ellos ya han formado su propia familia y los otros 2 ayudan económicamente a sus padres enviándoles un poco de dinero mensualmente. El menor de ellos, tiene 19 años es estudiante del último año de secundaria, vive aún con sus padres y tiene planificado seguir una carrera universitaria el próximo año. Juan tiene su propio taller hace 17 años donde realiza reparaciones de bicicletas, servicio de gomería, venta de cubiertas usadas y repuestos para bicicletas, ayudado por su hijo menor. Como Juan dispone de un gran tinglado incorporó también a su negocio la venta de muebles registrando así un mayor ingreso económico. El préstamo solicitado será destinado a la compra de cubiertas, cámaras y llantas para vehículos y además repuestos para bicicletas, así de esta forma poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de mercaderías y un mejor servicio.

loans.use: Purchase covers, tubes, and tires for vehicles and also replacement parts for bicycles

loans.name: Maria Laura

texts.es:
Maria Laura is 26 and a single mother. She lives with her aunt and works to support her family. She is well liked and those who know her testify to her good character. For more than three years Maria Laura has been selling cosmetics and leather goods like wallets and purses. She doesn't have a shop but hawks her goods around Santa Cruz and surrounding areas. She goes out of her way to find her customers whatever brands they request, hoping in this way to maintain their loyalty. If she can't fill an order she will find them someone who can. Mostly she sells cosmetics for EBEL and YAMBEL and other brands representing all price points. This is her third loan from Fundacion Agrocapital. Her previous loans--for $300 and $650, respectively--were repaid promptly.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Maria Laura es una persona de 26 años de edad que trabaja sóla para sustentar a su familia, es mamá soltera y vive en la casa de su tía. Es muy apreciada por las pesonas que la conocen por la gran calidad humana que posee. Maria Laura cuenta con una experiencia de más de tres años en el negocio de venta de cosméticos en general y artículos de cuero (carteras, billeteras, etc.). Ella no cuenta con un puesto fijo por lo que ofrece estos productos deambulando por las calles de la ciudad de Santa Cruz y en las zonas aledañas. Maria Laura minimiza el riesgo de la competencia asegurando a su clientela, para l@s que abastece de manera consecutiva todos sus productos y cuando le solicitan cosméticos de otras marcas, ella se sirve de intermediaria con sus amistades para poder satisfacer a sus clientes. En su mayoría trabaja con productos de las líneas de EBEL, YAMBAL, etc., cosméticos que son de variados precios, lo que le permite proveer de los mismos a diferentes estratos del mercado. Este es el tercer préstamo que la cliente saco en nuestra institución, beneficiandose anteriormente con $us. 300.- y $us. 650.-, en ambos casos demostró tener un buen comportamiento ya que sus pagos fueron puntuales.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Catalina De Jesús

texts.es:
Catalina is a divorcée and lives in the city of Guadalupe in the region of Nuevo León. It has been five years she sold cosmetics, which was right after her divorce. She had nobody else to depend on to help her to keep her family going, so she started her own business to cover their living expenses and her children’s education costs. She started selling these products amongst neighbors, but soon increased her sales due to her hard work. Now, she has a large customer base and has also incorporated the sale of food supplements into her business, which has been very well-received by her clients.

In order to grow her business and meet her customers’ demands, Catalina is seeking a loan of $1200 that will be used to purchase more merchandise. She promises to pay this back in 6 months. You can be a fundamental role in the development of this business and help Catalina and her family – she appreciates the confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Catalina es divorciada, ella vive en la localidad de Guadalupe en Nuevo León. Desde hace cinco años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, en aquel momento se acababa de divorciar y no contaba con la ayuda de nadie para sacar adelante a su familia, así que inició su propio negocio para poder cubrir los gastos de su casa y ofrecerle educación a sus hijos. Comenzó vendiendo estos productos entre sus vecinas pero pronto incrementó sus ventas gracias al buen trabajo que realiza y ahora cuenta con una amplia cartera de clientes, también ha incorporado la venta de suplementos alimenticios y ha tenido muy buena aceptación de sus clientes.

Para poder continuar creciendo con su negocio y poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, Catalina está solicitando un préstamo de $ 1,200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte fundamental en el desarrollo de este negocio y ayuda a Catalina y su familia, ella agradece mucho la confianza y el apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Bertha Concepción

texts.en:
Bertha is an entrepreneurial and responsible woman. She has two small children, ages 5 and 7, is separated from her husband and has had to provide for her family all by herself. Her children are in school and it was very difficult for her to make ends meet with the meager salary she received from her previous job. She decided to start her own business selling clothes, cosmetics and accessories three years ago. In the beginning she sold very little, but as she added better quality clothes to her inventory, she gained more customers and her sales increased.

She is requesting this loan in the amount of $925 to purchase clothes for the new season so that she can provide her customers with the latest fashions.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Bertha es una mujer emprendedora y responsable, tiene dos pequeños hijos de 5 y 7 años de edad, está separada de su esposo y ha tenido que sacar adelante a su familia ella sola. Sus dos hijos están estudiando y para Bertha era muy difícil cubrir todos los gastos con el salario tan bajo que recibía, así que decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de ropa, cosméticos y accesorios desde hace tres años, comenzó vendiendo muy poco pero después, al incorporar ropa de mejor calidad, sus clientes se incrementaron considerablemente, afortunadamente ha hecho crecer su negocio y sus ventas han mejorado mucho.

Para poder ofrecer a sus clientes productos novedosos y de esta nueva temporada Bertha está solicitando un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Bertha, ella y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo y la oportunidad que les brindas de mejorar.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela is 43 and hails from a family of six with deep roots in Minero. Her husband works as a driver for "La Chane" Unagro. Together they are raising five children. Four are in school and the oldest daughter, 19, will soon attend a state university. In the meantime she helps her mother in their well-know restaurant. At the moment they rent space in a good location and run a bar, restaurant and billiard hall. Angela has been running the restaurant for a long time. Before that, she sold food she cooked at home. She strives to offer her customers food, drink and entertainment under the same roof. Thanks to her hard work the restaurant has grown and now she needs capital to buy chairs, tables and a freezer. She has an excellent track record with microfinance, having taken out nine previous loans all of which she repaid promptly.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Angela tiene 43 años de edad, su familia está compuesta por 6 personas, mismas que radican en Minero desde hace bastante tiempo atrás. El esposo de Angela trabaja como transportista dependiente de "La Chane" Unagro, juntos velan por la educación y salud de sus 5 hijos, cuatro de los cuales asisten actualmente al colegio, y la Hija mayor que tiene 19 años de edad se encuentra en tramites para entrar a la Universidad estatal, mientras ayuda a su mamá en el restaurante. Actualmente alquila uno de los locales más conocidos de Minero, donde cuenta con una buena ubicación, en este lugar ella ofrece servicios de Bar-Restaurante atendiendo a sus clientes con comida, bebida y juegos de billar. Ella tiene bastante experiencia en el negocio ya que trabaja en el mismo desde hace un tiempo atras, comenzó vendiendo comida en su domicilio particular. Angela hace frente a la competencia del sector al ampliar los servicios que ofrece en su Bar-Restaurante, es decir en un mismo lugar los clientes pueden satisfacer sus necesidades de comida y de entretenimiento. Es gracias a su esfuerzo que el restaurante llegó a crecer, por lo que ahora requiere de capital para poder invertir en la compra de mesas, sillas, un freezer, etc. Angela tiene excelentes antecedentes crediticios, ya que tuvo 9 operaciones de microcrédito anteriores a la presente solicitud y todas las pago oportunamente.

loans.use: To buy furniture for a restaurant.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra is married and has two sons, ages 5 and 7, and a 3 year old daugher. After her daughter's birth, the family's expenses increased; faced with the need for additional income but needing to take care of her small children, Alejandra started her own business selling second hand clothing from her home. She did very well and later began selling new clothing, sports apparel and school uniforms, all of which were very well received by her customers.

During the Back to School period her sales increase dramatically, so she's requesting a loan of $925 to meet her customers' demand and purchase additional merchandise. Alejandra and her family are very grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Alejandra es casada y tiene dos hijos de 5 y 7 años de edad y una pequeña de sólo 3 años. Cuando nació su hija los gastos de su hogar se hicieron mayores, ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra y para no descuidar a sus pequeños hijos, Alejandra inició su propio negocio con la venta de ropa usada acondicionando un pequeño lugar de su casa, afortunadamente sus ventas fueron buenas y poco después incorporó la venta de ropa nueva, ropa deportiva y uniformes escolares obteniendo muy buena respuesta de sus clientes.

En esta temporada de regreso a clases sus ventas se incrementan considerablemente y para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes Alejandra está solicitando un crédito de $ 925 dólares para la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Decídete a ayudar a esta familia, contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Celia

texts.es:
Maria Celia is a hard and responsible worker. She is married, has three sons -two that are 19 years old and one that is 22- and a daughter who is 13 years old. Her husband works as a truck driver and his salary is very low, insufficient to cover all the basic costs of living. For 10 years, Maria started her own business of selling popular local dishes with the support of her husband’s meager salary. Due to the taste and special seasonings, her customer base grew rapidly.

Now, in order to continue growing, Maria needs a loan of $925 to buy supplies, larger pots, tables and chairs, all to improve the quality of service. She promises to repay this loan in 6 months. With your help, Maria will able to grow her business and improve the quality of her family’s life. For this, she is very grateful for your help and support.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Celia es muy trabajadora y responsable, ella está casada, tiene tres hijos de 19, 22 y 19 años de edad y una hija de 13 años. Su esposo trabaja como operador de un camión urbano y el salario que recibe es muy bajo, insuficiente para cubrir todos las necesidades básicas de su hogar, ante esta situación desde hace 10 años Maria inició su negocio de venta de comidas ofreciendo menudo y gorditas con un pequeño financiamiento de su esposo, gracias a su gusto por la cocina y su especial sazón sus clientes fueron incrementándose rápidamente.

Ahora para continuar creciendo Maria necesita un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que destinará a la compra de insumos, ollas más grandes, mesas y sillas, para mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Maria podrá hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, por lo que agradece mucho la confianza que depositas en ella y en su trabajo.

loans.use: To buy supplies and various equipment

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Señor Aníbal Fernández is 39 years old and happily married to Stela, who is 32 years old. She is the lady of the house and has dedicated herself to raising and educating their five children. Their children are 17, 15, 12, 8, and 3 years old. The three older children are enrolled in a high school in the city and the other two are attending primary school.

Seven years ago Aníbal, after realizing how profitable motorcycles garages could be, opened up his own garage with some savings and already has his own business of repairing motorcycles and bicycles. In the city of Carapeguá, the people travel mostly by motorcycle or bicycle, which is what makes the business so profitable.

The requested loan is going to be used to buy replacement parts for the motorcycles, such as pistons, piston rings, gaskets, washers, and brake cables. This way his clients won't have to raise the capital to buy the replacement parts because he will already have them, and this will increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

El señor Aníbal Fernández de 39 años de edad está felizmente casado con Stela de 32 años, ella es ama de casa y se dedica al cuidado y educación de sus hijos cinco hijos. Ellos tienen 17, 15, 12, 8 y 3 años de edad respectivamente; de los cuales los tres hijos mayores se encuentran cursando actualmente la etapa secundaria en un colegio de la ciudad y los otros dos cursando la primaria. Hace 7 años atrás, Aníbal, al darse cuenta de la rentabilidad que daba los talleres de motos, abrió su propio taller con un poco de ahorro con el que contaba y actualmente ya cuenta no solo con un taller sino también con su propio negocio de ventas de repuestos para motos y bicicletas. En la ciudad de Carapeguá las personas se movilizan en motos y bicicletas, lo que hace rentable el negocio. El préstamo solicitado lo va a utilizar en la compra de repuestos para motos como Pistón, aros, junta, reten y fibra de frenos, de esta forma evitará que sus clientes vayan hasta la capital a comprar los repuestos y también aumentará sus ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase replacement parts for motorcycles such as pistons, piston rings, gaskets, washers, and brake cables.

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es:
Maria de la Luz is a divorcée and has custody of her four children. They have been the motivation for her to start her own business selling tamales (a Mexican dish made of minced and seasoned meat packed in dough and wrapped in corn husks and steamed) for eight years. Due to her good service, her sales increased rapidly and now, she can count on her 16 year old daughter to help her meet her customers’ demands. Recently, she has also incorporated the sales of natural products and has had positive results. Maria wishes to give her children further educational opportunities and to make a better future for them, so she works harder each day.

In these days, Maria is seeking a loan of $925 which will be used to buy merchandise of the new products she is marketing. In this way, she will be able to show them to her clients and allow them to become familiar with the goods. She knows the quality of these products guarantees the growth of her business, and she promises to repay this loan in 6 months. You can be an important part in developing this business – Maria thanks you very much for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria de la Luz es divorciada y tiene a su cargo a sus cuatro hijos, ellos han sido el motivo por el cual inició su propio negocio con la venta de tamales desde hace ocho años, gracias al buen servicio que ofrece sus ventas se incrementaron rápidamente y ahora cuenta con la ayuda de su hija de 16 años de edad para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, últimamente ha incorporado la venta de productos naturales y ha obtenido buenos resultados. Maria desea darle a sus hijos la oportunidad de continuar estudiando y forjar un mejor futuro para ellos por lo que se esfuerza más día con día.
