En estos momentos Maria está solicitando un crédito de $ 925 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía de estos nuevos productos que comercializa, de esta manera podrá mostrarlos y darlos a conocer a sus clientes, ella sabe que la calidad de estos productos es una buena garantía para continuar creciendo con su negocio y se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, Maria agradece mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Maria is married and has two children who are 7 and 13 years old. In order to help her husband with the costs of living without neglecting her little ones, Maria started her own business selling stationery and small articles for six years in the area of San Nicolás de los Garza in Nuevo León, where they are originally from. Her husband’s salary is low. Fortunately, though, her business has started to prosper, and now, she has started to sell other products like new clothing and ice cream.

Maria wishes to continue growing and for this, she seeks a loan of $475 which will be used to buy merchandise and enlarge her store. In this way, she will have a more comfortable place and be able to offer better service to her customers. She promises to repay this loan in 6 months. Maria thanks you very much for the opportunity to improve and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria es casada y tiene dos hijos de 7 y 13 años de edad. Para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar sin descuidar a sus pequeños, desde hace seis años, Maria inició su propio negocio con la venta de papelería y mercería en la localidad de San Nicolás de los Garza en Nuevo León, de donde son originarios, ya que el salario que recibía su esposo era muy bajo. Afortunadamente su negocio ha prosperado y ahora ha incorporado la venta de otros productos como ropa nueva y helados.

María desea continuar creciendo y para esto solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía y en la ampliación de su local, de esta manera podrá tener un lugar más agradable y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Maria agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejora y continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise and for renovation

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Maria Paz

texts.es:
Maria Paz is a divorcée and has one son and one daughter, 27 and 25 years old, respectively. They are already married. Maria lives alone and to cover her living expenses, she started her own business six years ago, selling shoes in the area of San Nicolás de los Garza in Nuevo León. Due to her good sales skills, she has managed to rapidly increase the number of her customer and to grow her business. Now she also sells natural products and has very good results with those as well.

Maria is an entrepreneurial woman with a large appetite and ambition to move forward. Now, she just needs a loan of $925 which will be used to purchase merchandise at wholesale prices to meet her clients’ demands. She promises to repay this loan in 6 months. With your help, Maria can grow her business and sincerely thanks you for your generosity and opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Paz es divorciada, tiene un hijo y una hija, de 27 y 25 años respectivamente, ellos ya están casados. Maria vive sola y para poder cubrir sus gastos inició su propio negocio hace seis años con la venta de zapatos en la localidad de San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León, gracias a su gusto por las ventas ha logrado incrementar sus clientes rápidamente y hacer crecer su negocio, ahora también ha incorporado la venta de productos naturales obteniendo muy buenos resultados.

Maria es una mujer emprendedora con grandes deseos de salir adelante, ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda por sus productos y adquirirlos a precio de mayoreo, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Maria puede hacer crecer su negocio y agradece sinceramente tu generosidad y la oportunidad que le brindas.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Dorita

texts.es:
Dorita O. is 28 years old and married to Guillermo Benítez, who is 30 years old. They both come from very humble families. They have a young son who studies at the public high school in the city. They live in their own home that they obtained with much sacrifice.

They both work in a warehouse where they sell all kinds of important primary ingredients like sugar, meat, flour, noodles, etc. They are dedicated to selling poultry since it's a very profitable product, which has already helped improve their families daily quality of life.

For lack of capital, they left this business and now are thinking of returning to the business by raising and selling chickens. They have been contracted by a big, local supermarket to provide a constant supply of chickens. They are already prepared to sign a contract for their first year. This is why they are requesting a loan of $500 that they will invest in buying birds to fatten and begin to fulfill their contract with the supermarket.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Dorita O. tiene 28 años, ella está casada con Guillermo Benítez de 30 años. Ambos provienen de una familia muy humilde. Tienen un hijo menor de edad que estudia en un colegio público de la ciudad. Viven en una casa propia que adquirieron con mucho sacrificio. Ambos trabajan en la despensa donde venden todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como azúcar, carne, harina, fideos, etc. Ellos se dedicaban anteriormente a la venta de aves, pues es un rubro muy rentable que les ha ayudado a toda la familia a mejorar cada día el nivel de vida. Por motivos de falta de capital, dejaron ese rubro y hoy día tienen pensado volver a iniciarse en la cría y venta de aves (pollos). Han sido contactados por un supermercado grande de la zona para que les pueda proveer de los pollos de forma constante, y están en tratativas con la empresa para firmar contrato, de esta forma proveer de pollos durante un año inicialmente. Por este motivo, solicitan el crédito de $ 500 que los invertirá en la compra de aves para el engorde y así empezar a proveer al supermercado que los contrato.

loans.use: Buy chickens.

loans.name: Nery Liduvina

texts.es:
My name is Nery H. and I have been selling tortillas for five and a half years. Here you can see me in my newly remodeled stand. It used to be wooden but now it is made of cinderblocks. My daughters help me in the shop. We sell tortillas to people from the neighborhood and surrounding area. Right now I need to buy firewood, corn and salt. Thanks to this business I can support my family and put my daughters through school.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Mi mombre es Nery H., me dedico a la venta de tortillas tengo mi negocio hace 5 años imedio. Como ustedes puede ver remodele mi negocio ya que antes era de madera con la ayuda de ustedes he podido hacer mi negocio de bloques. En el negocio tengo la ayudade mis hijas para vender a mis clientes ya que son mis vecinos de mi colonia y otras personas que que viven al rededor de la colonia. Ahora nesecito comprar mas productos como: Leña, maiz y sal. Gracias a este negocio he podido ayudar a mi familia y mis hijas con su estudio.

loans.use: To buy corn, salt, lye and firewood.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Ms. Beatriz, 64 years old, is married to Mr. Luis Medina, 67 years old, who is dedicated to agriculture. The couple has two grown-up children, who live on their own. They live in a house they acquired with effort and hard work. Twelve years ago, Beatriz set up a grocery store and, with great sacrifice, watched it grow over time. Among other things, she sells candy, sodas, dairy and canned products, produce, etc. Some years ago, she was victim of a robbery that depleted her stock and forced her to start over; nonetheless, thanks to good sales, her business managed to recover. She wants to continue growing and to diversify the products she offers; specifically, she wants to sell meats and, for this purpose, she needs to acquire a butcher’s electric saw. The cost of this equipment is $600 and she is requesting a loan for this amount, which she’ll timely pay on a monthly basis.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Beatriz, de 64 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Luis Medina, de 67 años, quien se dedica a la agricultura. La pareja tiene dos hijos ya mayores y que viven de forma independiente. Viven en una casa propia que adquirieron gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo. Hace 12 años, Beatriz abrió su despensa que, con mucho sacrificio, vio crecer. Ella vende entre otras cosas golosinas, gaseosas, lácteos, productos enlatados, verduras, etc. Hace unos años atrás sufrió un robo que la dejó casi sin mercaderías, por lo que tuvo que empezar de nuevo y, a pesar de ello, el negocio pudo reponerse pues las ventas son buenas. Hoy día ella desea seguir creciendo y diversificar los productos que vende. Específicamente, ella desea vender carnes y para ello necesita comprar un serrucho eléctrico especial para carnicerías. El costo de esta máquina es de $600, por lo que solicita un crédito, que pagará puntualmente, en forma mensual.

loans.use: Purchase of a butcher's electric saw.

loans.name: Masafat

texts.en:
Masafat is a low-income, vulnerable young man. He is single and lives with his parents in the village of Saatli in the south-central area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus.

Masafat has three pedigree cows already but the income they produce is too low to support his family. That’s why he decided to apply to Norwegian Microcredit's Saatli branch for a $500 loan to buy one more pure-bred cow to make his monthly income higher. In the Caucasus region, the price of a good cow is about US$ 800-1000, but Masafat has some savings to add to the amount of the loan to make up the purchase price.

loans.use: To buy one more pedigree cow

loans.name: Ogtay

texts.en:
Ogtay is a low-income, vulnerable person. He is married with three children and lives with his parents in the village of Saatli in the south-central area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus.

Ogtay has four pedigree cows and he goes to Saatli daily and sells some milk there with his mother (she is in the picture), but the income from four cows is too low to support Ogtay's family. That’s why he decided to apply to Norwegian Microcredit's Saatli branch for a $500 loan to buy one more pure-bred cow to make his monthly income higher. In the Caucasus region the price of good cow is about US$ 800-1000, but Ogtay has some savings to add to the loan to make up the purchase price of the cow.

loans.use: To buy one more pedigree cow

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia works as for a cleaning service in the Viru Viru airport in the city of Santa Cruz. She has been married for 13 years to Mr. Valerio Apaica, who works as a bricklayer in Warnes. Together they take care of their four children, aged 12, 10 , 8 and 5. All of the children are in school, except the youngest, who stays with his mother, even when she has to go to work. The family lives in two small rooms right now, becuse Cecilia's parents live with them. They need to find financing with which to build 3 additional rooms, so that their children can live more comfortably.

Cecilia is a regular full time employee of the cleaning business. She has worked for the same company for more than 5 years, and her husband has always had work as a bricklayer for various construction companies. There is competition for cleaning jobs, since many people do that kind of work, but Cecilia stands out for her experience and the effort she puts into her work.

The loan will be used to build the 3 additional rooms the family needs. The cost of the construction will depend on the particular requirements of the job and the construction company. The family has an excellent credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer

Cecilia trabaja como operaria en la empresa D. limpieza Tote´s en el Aeropuerto D. Viru Viru en la ciudad D. Santa Cruz, esta casada hace 13 años apróximadamente con el señor Valerio Apaica quien se desempeña como albañil en Warnes. Ambos mantienen a sus cuatro hijos D. 12, 10, 8 y 5 años respectivamente, todos los niños asisten a una escuelita fiscal a excepción del último que queda a cargo D. la madre D. Cecilia cuando ella tiene que trabajar. La familia vivía en dos cuartitos, debido a que ahora los padres D. Cecilia viven con ellos se vieron en la necesidad D. buscar financiamiento para construir 3 cuartos mas, esto a fin D. dar comodidad también a sus hijos.

Cecilia es empleada fija D. la empresa D. limpieza, cuenta con más D. 5 años D. antigüedad en Tote´s, por otra parte su esposo también siempre se dedicó a trabajar como albañil en diferentes construcciones. Existe una competencia media en el sector debido a que hay personas que también se dedican al mismo rubro pero la experiencia y esfuerzo que pone Cecilia en su trabajo la distingue D. otras personas.

El financiamiento es para la construcción D. los 3 cuartos mas que necesitan, el costo D. los mismos es variado ya que depenD. al requerimiento D. la obra y D. los proovedores D. material D. construcción. Tiene antecedentes crediticios excelentes.

loans.use: Enlarge her home

loans.name: Carmelia

texts.es:
Hello. My name is Carmelia R.. I have had this small grocery store for three years. To boost sales I need to stock up on products for my customers. This business pays my family's electric and water bills and for medicine. I have a goal of remodeling the shop this year. I will be very grateful for your help.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Hola min ombre es Carmelia R., tengo este pequeño negocio de una pulperia hace 3 años, ahora necesito comprar mas productos para poder un mejor servio y asi poder incrementar mis venta. De este negocio ayudo a mi familia con gasto de energia electrica agua y medicamentos. Tengo una meta para este año es remodelar mi negocio, les agredeseré mucho su ayuda.

loans.use: To buy soap, sugar, beans, bread and snacks.

loans.name: Denia Edith

texts.es:
For four years I have had a small shop selling new and used clothing for both children and adults. I am a single mother and this shop lets me provide for my two daughters ages 3 and 11. Right now I have customer requests to fill and need to buy more merchandise. These orders are from my best customers and I want to satisfy them.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada y nueva de niños y adultos, tengo este negocio hace 4 años. Con este negocio ayudo a darles una mejor vida a mis hijas tengo una niña de 3 años y una de 11 años, soy madre soltera. Ahora nesetito comprar mas ropa ya que tengo varios pedidos pendientes de mis mejores clientes, por lo cual no les quiero quedar mal. Tambien quiero darles un mejor servicio.

loans.use: To buy children's clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve the appearance of his shop

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia has a grocery business or neighborhood store in her home. She also offers rooms for rent. Her family is maD. up of herself and her husband, who collaborates with her in both businesses. The couple's children are grown now and no longer live with their parents.

Florencia's neighborhood store is one of the oldest of the area; she has 26 years of experience in the store. She has competition, since there are similar stores in the neighborhood, but she has two advantages: her location and how long she has been in business. She has a very good client following.

The loan will be used to purchase cement, wood and other construction materials needed to finish rooms that will be rented to third parties.

This is Florencia's sixth loan. She has shown herself to be a very serious and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Florencia tiene un negocio D. abarrotes o tienda D. barrio en su domicilio, paralelamente ofrece cuartos en alquiler. Su familia está compuesta por ella y su esposo quién le colabora en ambos negocios, los hijos D. esta pareja son mayores y ya no viven con ellos.

La tienda D. barrio D. Florencia es una D. las mas antiguas D. su zona ya que cuenta con mas D. 26 años D. experiencia. La competencia del negocio es media debido a la cantidad D. negocios similares en el barrio, pero lo que le favorece a Florencia es la antiguedad y ubicación del negocio, ella cuenta con muy buena clientela.

El crédito es para la adquisición D. cemento, madera y otros materiales D. construcción que necesita para concluir unos cuartos que tienen el objeto D. ser alquilados a terceras personas. La presente solicitud es la sexta D. Florencia, tiempo en el cuál demostró ser una persona muy seria y responsable.

loans.use: Finish rooms to be rented

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Hello. I have been selling tortillas for four years. Right now I need corn, lye and firewood in order to stay in business these coming months. I have a good customer base that includes restaurants and people from the neighborhood. I also plan to remodel the shop. With earnings from this business I help my husband with the household expenses including the cost of our childrens' schooling.

Translated bya Kiva volunteer.

Hola, tengo este negocio de venta de tortillas hace 4 años. Ahora nesecito comprar; maiz, leña,cal, para poder vender estos meses.Tengo una buena cliente ya que le vendo a peños restaurantes y a mis vecinos. Tambien tengo planes de hacer una remodelacion en mi negocio. Con este negopcio ayudo a mi esposo con gastos de mensuales de nuestros hijos ya que ellos estan estudiando en la escula.

loans.use: To buy corn, lye and firewood.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
I have been selling tortillas for 5 years. My daughters help me tend the shop and make deliveries. The business pays for their schooling. Right now I need to buy corn, milk, lye and salt. I would be grateful if you could help me keep this business running.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Yo me dedico a la venta de tortillas hace 5 años, Tengo la ayuda de mis hijas para atencion a mis clientes y llevarselas a sus hogares. Con este negocio pago los estudios de mi dos hijas. Ahora nesecito comprar maiz, cal, lecha, sal. Ya que me he quedado sin producto. Les agradeseiria si me puden ayudar para poder vender estos meses.

loans.use: To buy milk, corn, water, lye and salt.

loans.name: Mariela Pamela

texts.es:
Mariela is 29 years old and has a 5 years old son. She currently lives at home with her parents, where is is developing a bookstore / bazaar. Mariela's husband left his family when he went to Spain to find better employment opportunities, but unfortunately, he never returned and doesn't send any money from Spain.

Mariela has been working in her bookstore for 5 years. In order to make best use of the retail space, she also sells presents. She counts with the help of her mother, who takes care of the store when Mariela has to go out to buy products to restock the bookstore.

In her neighborhood, there is no competition and this is the only bookstore / bazaa. This helps a lot and enables her to earn a good income.

With the current loan, Mariela wants to buy presents of 5 Bs to 50 Bs., architectural books of 20 of 200 Bs, and other materials for the bookstore.

Her credit history is excellent. Mariela has shown both to Agrocapital as well as to other financing institutes to be a responsible person with a good repayment history. Please note that the photo with this loan description shows Mariela separate from her business. The latter is because Mariela wasn't home when we went to make the picture: only her mother was.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original loan description in Spanish:

Mariela tiene 29 años y un hijito de 5 años de edad, actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres donde desarrolla el negocio de la librería-bazar. El esposo de Mariela dejo a su familia para viajar a España y encontrar mejores oportunidades de trabajo, lamentablemente no volvió y tampoco envía dinero desde España.

Mariela trabaja en su librería desde hace 5 años, también vende regalos en el mismo lugar a manera de aprovechar el espacio y la clientela, ella cuenta con el apoyo de su madre, quien atiende el negocio cuando Mariela tiene que salir a comprar productos para reabastecer la librería.

En la zona no existe competencia es la unica librería-bazar, esto le beneficia en gran medida ya que percibe buenos ingresos.

Con el presente crédito Mariela comprara regalos entre 5 Bs a 50 Bs, material de arquitectura entre 20 a 200 Bs y otras variedades más de materiales de librería. Sus antecedentes crediticios son excelentes, Mariela demostró tanto en Agrocapital como en otras financieras, ser una persona responsable en cuanto al pago de sus cuotas. Se hace notar que en la foto adjunta la librería y Mariela están separadas debido a que cuando se fue a sacar la foto del negocio Mariela no se encontraba en el mismo, solo se ubicó a la madre.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the bookstore

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.es:
I have had this small grocery store for two years. I had to work very hard and make many sacrifices in order to open the store. I am poor and older and the store is my livelihood. My children help me tend shop and it pays for their schooling. Right now I need to stock up on groceries to sell.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Tengo este pequeña pulperia hace 2 años, ahora la voy a surtir de varios productos con las compra que voy hacer. Con este negocio es mi trajo y lo he hecho con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificios ya que soy una apersona pobre y mayor de edad. Tengo el apoyo de de mis hijos que me ayudan a vender con este negocioles les ayudo tambien en sus estudiso.

loans.use: To buy groceries like bread, eggs, rice, beans, instant soup, condiments and snacks.

loans.name: Marcela Yamileth

texts.es:
For the last five years I have been making tortillas and selling them from door to door. My customers appreciate that I will either deliver to them or they can come to me. I am a single mother with three small children. I can support them now, but I want them to finish school.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Mi negoico es hacer totillas y venderlas ambulante en las calles. hace 5 anos que vendo tortillas. Tengo muy buenos clientes ya que voy personalmente adejarlas a sus hogares o ellos llegan donde yo estoy hubicada. Tengo 3 hijo pequeños los cuales estan en la escula y soy madre soltera. Con este negocio les doy una buena vida a mis hijos pero quiero que ellos terminen su escula.

loans.use: To buy milk, corn, lye, hand towels and cooking pans.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: Adama Mansary is a mother of five children.  She is married to a subsistence farmer whose income is insufficient to meet the family expenses.  At sixty years of age, Adama is still strong.  She runs a business of selling essential food items in the small village of Fadugu in Sierra Leone.   She supplements her husband’s meager income from the farm, especially during the rainy season.  Before Adama’s previous loan, she found it difficult to expand her business as a greater portion of the profit was used for family expenses.  Adama proudly said that with her previous loan, she made good profits and was able to meet all of her children’s school requirements in the last semester.  She is requesting a loan of $175 to be able to purchase her stock at wholesale prices.

loans.use: Expansion of food items for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase and improve her product offerings

loans.name: Maria Bersedaba

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Maria Bersedaba N.. In my neighborhood they call me Mrs. Marillita. I am a wholesaler of achiote, also known as Aploppas, pepper, curry, safflower and soybean. This small business venture is four years old and it helps pay for my medication and my family's food. At this time, I need to be able to purchase more grains in order to fullfil customer's orders.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Hola, minombre es Maria Bersedaba N., pero en mi vecindario me conosen como Doña marillita. Yo tengo la venta de varios condimentos como; achote, pimienta, curri, asafran, chrrus de soya, estos productos los vendo por mayor. Este pequeño negocio lo tengo hace 4 años, el cual me ayuda para poder comprar mis medicinas de la presion y alimento parami hogar. Ahora nesecito comprar mas ya que tengo varios encargos.

loans.use: compra de churros de soya, condimentos como: achote, especias curri, anis, y otros

loans.name: Ibrahim Sorie

texts.en: Ibrahim Sorie B. is a petty trader.  He owns a shop at the Fadugu main market in Sierra Leone. Ibrahim is forty years old and married with four children.  His business is the only source of income for the family.  He also takes care of seven other members of his extended family.  Before his first loan, Ibrahim had a small table shop.  His previous loans enabled him to expand his business and build the small store from the profits.  He will complete his repayments at the end of August, and would like another loan of $350 to further expand his business.  Ibrahim said the only bright future for the children under his responsibility is to provide them with an education.  His main expenses are the school fees and requirements.

loans.use: Petty trader

loans.name: Marie Peter

texts.en: Marie Peter K. is fifty-eight years old, and a mother of eight children.  She runs a small, local industry of wine production and she has been doing the business for a long time.  Before the loan, Marie could not produce more than 10 gallons of wine per week and she could not save to expand the business.  With her previous loan, Marie was able to employ three workers and increase her production from 10 gallons of wine to 25 gallons. Her market has also extended to the nearby village.  Marie is requesting a loan of $350 to improve the quality and quantity of production to meet her customers' demands. She sells on wholesale.

loans.use: Expansion of winery

loans.name: Sorie

texts.en: Sorie T. is a petty trader who owns a shop in Fadugu village in Sierra Leone.  He is the chairman of the Traders Union for the entire chiefdom. Sorie is married with five children.  Originally, Sorie operated his business as a partnership with two colleagues.  With his previous loan, Sorie decided to separate from the partners and started his own grocery business.  He is now requesting a loan of $350 to expand it.  Sorie said that he used the profit from the previous loan to put up the small kiosk for the business and needs more loan capital to increase the stock.

loans.use: Growth of his grocery business

loans.name: Yakuba

texts.en: Yakuba M. is twenty-nine years old and married with two children.  He started his business when he was twenty-one years old after the death of his father.  Being the eldest child in his father’s family, he took sole responsibility for the family.  Deprived of formal education by his father, Yakuba believes, that to break the poverty cycle he should educate his two brothers and his children.  He uses the profit from the previous loan for paying school fees and repairing the roof on their home.  He would like another loan to expand this business.

loans.use: Expand petty trading business

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed K. was born in Kasompe, a few kilometers away from Fadugu.  He migrated to Fadugu village to establish his business.  Mohamed is twenty-seven years old and married with two children.  He runs a small shop in Fadugu village in Sierra Leone.  He is requesting a loan of $175 to expand his grocery business.

loans.use: Expansion of his grocery business.

loans.name: Alpha Umaro

texts.en: Alpha Umaro J. is a petty trader in the village of Fadugu in Sierra Leone.  He is thirty-two years, married with three children.  With his previous loan, he was able to increase his stock and earned additional income for family expenses, especially school requirements and food.  He is requesting another loan to expand his business and maximize his profits.

loans.use: Expansion of his grocery store business to maximize profits

loans.name: Myriam

texts.es:
Ms. Myriam, 44 years old, is from the city of Carapeguá; she is married and has five children: three school-age boys, one attending high school and the oldest going to college and working at a financial institution to pay for her studies. Her husband has run a lathe shop for more than fifteen years. They lived in a rented house until they managed to build their own, thanks to loans they obtained. In order to help her husband and taking advantage of her studies, Myriam opened a hair salon, but this business didn’t do well due to the great competition and had to be closed. To face their great needs, she then opened a grocery store and she proudly relates that she’s presently doing really well. She sells basic needs products, such as sugar, milk, pasta, oil, carbon, etc. She wants to continue making progress and expanding her business. In order to diversify her stock and offer canned products, fruits and vegetables, eggs and cheese, she is requesting a $400 loan.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Myriam es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, tiene 44 años de edad, es casada y tiene cinco hijos, tres varones en edad escolar, uno cursando actualmente sus estudios secundarios y la última que ya va a la universidad y trabaja en una entidad financiera para costear sus estudios. Su marido tiene una tornería hace más de quince años. Vivían en una casa alquilada por mucho tiempo hasta que construyeron su propia casa gracias a créditos que le fueron otorgados anteriormente. Myriam, con el deseo de ayudar a su marido con los gastos, abrió una peluquería, pues ella había estudiado pero no le fue bien por la gran competencia que tenía y cerró el negocio. Como la necesidad era grande, abrió una despensa para poder así tener otros ingresos, y hoy día cuenta muy orgullosa que le va muy bien. En la misma vende productos de primera necesidad, como azúcar, leche, fideos, aceite, carbón, etc. Desea seguir progresando y expandiendo su negocio y comprar más variedad de productos para la venta, entre ellos productos enlatados, verduras, frutas, huevos y queso, por lo que solicita un crédito de $ 400.

loans.use: Purchase of canned products, eggs, cheese and produce.

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en: Amadu B. J. is forty-five years old, married with six children.  Amadu established his business with start-up capital borrowed from a friend with a high interest rate.  He could not realize the benefit as he was working to repay the high interest.  Amadu could send only two of his children to school.  With his previous loan from SMT, his business expanded and he was able to send two more of his children to school.  He is optimistic that he will educate all of his children if he gets more loan funds to expand his business.

loans.use: Expansion of grocery store stock

loans.name: Alpha Tailor

texts.en: Alpha Tailor J. is a tailor engaging in sewing and selling of clothes and other tailoring materials and items.  This has increased his customer base.  He is fifty yearsold and married with six children.  Alpha is assisted by two of his children in managing the business.  Together they make clothes both for men and women in the village and he employs two other tailors whom he pays on a contract basis.  He is requesting a loan of $175 to develop his business into a boutique.

loans.use: Expansion of tailoring business into a boutique.

loans.name: Yambo

texts.en: Yambo M. is a widow and a mother of four children.  Her husband died twenty-three years ago leaving her full responsibility of his children. She  engages in the buying and selling of agriculture produce.  Yambo buys the products from farmers in wholesale and sells them to her customers on retail.  Through her business, she is able to educate her children.  One of her children has joined the college and Yambo hopes to see him through.  She is therefore requesting a loan to expand her business and to renovate their family home.  Her future plan is to develop a oil palm plantation for her children.   Yambo is forty-five years old.

loans.use: Expansion of agricultural produce business.

loans.name: Amadu Bamkolo

texts.en: Amadu Bamkolo K. sells fuel and lubricant in the village of Fadugu in Sierra Leone.  He is forty-eight years old, married with three teenage children.  With his previous loan, Amadu increased his stock and used the profit to diversify his business.  He purchased a goat and sheep and he plans to establish animal husbandry that will include cows.  He is requesting a loan of $175 to increase his fuel business and to begin his dream.

loans.use: Increase fuel business for future diversification of the business.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul J. is thirty-five years old.  He learned his profession as a cattle farmer from his employer when he was 18 years of age.  From his meager  salary, he managed to save some after three years of work. With the savings, he then purchased three goats to resell after fattening them.  In addition to the animals, he also buys and sells agricultural goods to raise more profit.  With his previous loans, he purchased two more animals.  He sold five sheep and goats and purchased two young calves which he is rearing to sell.   His aim is to own cows.  He is requesting a loan of $350 to purchase two more cows.  He said, with the cows, his family will have milk and his wife can make yogurt to sell for more income.  The profit from the selling of agricultural products will be to repay the loan.

loans.use: Increase cattle stock and yogurt production

loans.name: Fatmata Tity

texts.en: Fatmata Tity C. is forty-five years old.  She is married with four children. She produces and also buys and sells palm oil to traders in Freetown. She owns a store in her residence in Fadugu village.  Before her previous loan, Fatmata worked as a middle person who buys the products from the producers and sells them to traders from Freetown and Makeni.  Realizing a small profit, Fatmata started selling the palm oil directly to retailers in Freetown and Makeni. She said by selling to retailers directly, she makes double the profit.  She is requesting another loan to expand her business.  This will improve the status of her family, she added.

loans.use: Expansion of palm oil production and wholesale business.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel has 7 years' experience in selling seafood, which he learned from his father who took him to work with him from a very young age. Miguel learned and mastered the trade as he gained more experience. He decided to work on his own since he was married and needed to be able to cover the expenses for his household. He works from 4 am to 11 am every day with his wife and a relative who helps them remove the meat from crabs so that later it can be put into tubs and sold.

Miguel wants a loan to be able to invest in different types of seafood. This is his second loan with our program. He hopes that he can give his brother work with the income generated. Miguel is married, 23 years old, and has a daughter six months old. He hopes to be able to earn enough to have his own home, since he now lives with his parents.

loans.use: Invest in other types of seafood

loans.name: Issa

texts.en: Issa B. comes from Kamaloh village of Mombali district, but lives in Magburaka in the northern part of Sierra Leone.  He lives with his wife and four children.  He is thirty-five years old and owns a bicycle spare parts shop.  With his wife, Issa has to work hard to meet the family expenses, especially school requirements and food. The shop is their sole source of income.  To expand his business, Issa is requesting a loan of $350.

loans.use: Expansion of stock for bicycle repair shop

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en: Yeabu Z. K. is forty-seven years old, married with three children.  She is from Magburaka town of Northern Sierra Leone.  Her husband is a petty trader in the same town and she runs a stall of locally made handicrafts and ink for tye and dye. Yeabu’s income supplements her husband’s micro business income to meet the family’s expenses.  She said her income is used to purchase food and her husband’s income is for school fees, medical and other expenses.  Their plan is to build a family house.  Yeabu is therefore requesting a loan of $175 to expand her business.

loans.use: Expansion of handicrafts business

loans.name: Aminata Tico

texts.en:
Aminata Tico is married with four children. She is forty-eight years old and was born in Malongbo village of Magburak in Northern Sierra Leone. Aminata's husband is a watch repairman whose income is irregular. Aminata owns a market stall, selling essential commodities such as salt, rice, palm oil, etc.

A previous loan allowed Aminata to increase her inventory and her profit to the point where she was able to meet some of the family’s expenses. “It is a relief to me to see my wife’s success and know that she is able to meet our children’s school fee requirements,” said Aminata’s husband. With a loan of $175 this year, Aminata thinks she can further improve her business.

loans.use: Increase the stocks of food items for her market stall

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en: Abibatu B. runs a business selling both imported and local rice and oil  wholesale.  50% of her goods are obtained on a credit basis where the price to her is higher than when the goods are purchased with cash. This cuts into her profit. Abibatu's previous loan provided her some capital and she would like to continue to use her own capital to purchase as much as possible on a cash basis.  She is requesting a loan of $350 for that purpose.

loans.use: Purchase rice and oil for her wholesale business with cash so as to increase profits

loans.name: Ya Marie

texts.en: Ya Marie K. is forty-nine years old, widowed, with eight children.  She lost her husband during the civil war in Sierra Leone.  She runs a small store selling utensils and stationery.  Since she is the only breadwinner, most of her profit goes to family expenses especially school requirements.  With her previous loan, Marie included stationery in her inventory.  She is now requesting another loan so as to have more capital to maximize profits when schools re-open.

loans.use: Increase inventory in her utensils and stationery shop

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed B. is married with eight children.  He is forty-nine years old and works as a petty trader.   He runs a shop selling costume jewelery and cosmetics that has enabled him meet some of the family expenses.  B.’s wife is also engaged in the business of selling spices in the same town of Magburak in Sierra Leone.  According to B., it is not easy to feed eight mouths and other extended family members. His previous loan increased his income and he would like another loan of $175.

loans.use: Increase stock of cosmetics for his shop

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab B. is a native of Mgburaka town.  She is married with four children.  At thirty-seven years of age, she runs a small business selling utensils.  Zainab told us she had been able to increase her stock with her previous loan and would like to receive more loans so as to do the same.  Like many mothers in Sierra Leone, her hope is to provide her children with the best education.  Zainab is assisted by her husband in purchasing inventory from Freetown or The Republic of Guinea.

loans.use: Increase business stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in different styles of clothing

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos F. is 25 years old. He is single and doesn't have any kids. He lives in San Estanislao, a town that is about 5 kilometers away from the city of Santani. He owns a 15 hectare field where he raises cows for milk production and sales.

He worked with his father since he was really young. His father also raises farm animals. Three years ago he became independent and started with two cows that were given to him by his father. Nowadays he has eight Dutch cows.

He manages his own inn. His cows produce 90 liters of milk daily. He rises very early in the morning in order to milk the cows. He then travels to the city on his motorcycle to sell the milk. Carlos is also a physical education teacher at a local school.

Carlos is young and is very entrepreneurial. He wishes to continue progressing. Today, he is requesting a $1000 to invest in the construction of a better cow shed since the one he currently has is very precarious. He wants to construct a better and bigger cow shed since he has plans to continue expanding his business and purchase more cows in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos F. tiene 25 años, es soltero, no tiene hijos, vive en San Estanislao un pueblo que queda a 5 km de la ciudad de Santaní. Tiene un campo de 15 hectáreas donde cría vacas para la producción y venta de leche.

Trabajo al lado de su padre desde muy joven, su papá también se dedica a la cría de animales de granja. Hace tres años se independizo y comenzó con dos vacas que le dio su padre y hoy día ya cuenta con ocho vacas holandesas.

El es administra su propio tambo, sus vacas producen 90 litros de leche diarios, el se levanta bien temprano por las mañanas para ordeñar las vacas y luego va a la ciudad en su motocicleta a venderlas. Además de esta actividad, Carlos es profesor de educación física en un colegio de la zona.

Joven y emprendedor, Carlos desea seguir progresando. Hoy solicita un crédito de $ 1000 para invertirlos en la construcción de un mejor galpón, pues donde ahora tiene a sus vacas es muy precaria y desea construir uno mejor y más grande ya que tiene pensado seguir ampliando el negocio y adquirir más adelante más vacas.

loans.use: construct a cow shed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Locale improvement.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Make his home into a restaurant

loans.name: Iliana

texts.es:
Business Description

Iliana has sold chickens and clothes for one year. She buys chickens on foot from different aviaries in the town in order to later sell them in local shops. She also sells children’s clothes, blouses etc. She began the business using a little money which her husband gave her from the salary he earns. She works at her business every day from 7am to 5pm.

Loan Use

Iliana wants a loan in order to buy clothes: she already has orders from clients and as a result wishes to invest in this line and satisfy the demand of the customers she already has.

Personal Information

Iliana is 22 years old: she is married and has two young children, one of whom is in school. Her husband works as a messenger in a business where he receives a monthly income that allows him to meet their household bills: he is excellent source of support for his wife. They currently live in her father’s house, who gave her part of the house as an inheritance. She hopes to expand her business so that in time with the income they will be able to build their house little by little and secure a better future for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Iliana lleva 1 año dedicada a la venta de pollos y ropa, ella compra el pollo en pie en diferentes avícolas de la ciudad para posteriormente venderlos en las tiendas del sector. Además vende ropa de niños, blusas etc. Ella inicio el negocio con un dinerito que su esposo le dio del sueldo que el gana. Su negocio lo atiende todos los días de 7:00am hasta las 17:00pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Iliana desea el crédito para comprar ropa, ya que tiene pedidos de sus clientes por ello desea invertir en esta línea y poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes que tiene ahora.

Información Personal

Iliana tiene 22 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad de los cuales uno esta en la escuela. Su esposo trabaja como mensajero en una empresa donde percibe un ingreso mensual que le permitir solventar los gastos de su hogar. El es un soporte muy bueno para su esposa. Actualmente viven en casa de su papá que le dio como herencia una parte de la casa. Ella aspira crecer su negocio y a su vez con sus ganancias ir construyendo poco a poco su casa y brindarles un mejor futuro para sus hijos.

loans.use: To expand her clothes-selling business

loans.name: Anatila

texts.es:
Business Description

Señora Anatila has 10 years of experience in this business. She began to work when she separated from her husband. She began her diner with money which she received from a job where she worked for eleven years. From this she renovated her house so that the diner could operate from there. She works from Monday – Friday from 6.30am to 3pm selling lunches and on Saturdays and Sundays she sells snacks too. On the weekends her two daughters help her in the restaurant.

Loan Use

She will invest the loan in the purchase of utensils for the diner: she already needs to replace those she already owns because they’re not sufficient to satisfy her customer demand.

Personal Information

Señora Anatila is a single mother: with effort she has helper her children and now all of them are of age and help her with household bills. Her two adult daughters work with her on the weekends. Her house is made of cement and is two stories high, although is is currently under construction and not yet finished. She has always acted as both mother and father to her children. Señora Anatila’s ambition is to establish another restaurant site in an area further away from her house so that one of her daughters could work there too. She works everyday with great effort in order to better herself and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Anatila tiene 10 años de experiencia en esta actividad. Ella empezó a trabajar a raíz que se separó de su esposo. Inicio el comedor con un dinero que recibió de un trabajo donde ella laboró por 11 años. Desde entonces acondiciono su casa para que funcione allí el comedor. Ella trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 6:30am hasta 15:00pm vendiendo almuerzos y los sábados y domingos vende meriendas también. Los fines de semana sus 2 hijas le ayudan en el negocio.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra utensilios para el comedor ya que tiene que renovar los que ya tiene porque no son suficientes para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

Información Personal

La Sra. Anatila es madre soltera, con el esfuerzo de ella ha ayudado a sus hijos y ya todos son mayores de edad y le ayudan con los gastos del hogar. Sus dos hijas mujeres son quienes los fines de semana trabajan con ella. Su casa es de 2 pisos de cemento. Aun esta construyéndola ya que no esta acabada. Ella siempre ha sido padre y madre para sus hijos. El deseo de la Sra. Anatila es poner otro local de comida en un sector mas alejado de su casa para que una de sus hijas trabaje también allá. Ella cada día trabaja con mucho esfuerzo para superarse ella y sus hijos.

loans.use: Improve her resaurant with utensils and other repairs.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Business Description

Julio has 8 years of experience in this field. He began working for his father and brother where he was able to acquire the necessary skills. Little by little from his work he began to make a profit. With this he began to buy his tools. He decided to open his own business on a separate site, which is currently rented. His brother helps to serve his clients. He works everyday of the week from 6:30 in the morning until 7 at night. Hi business is based in a place where there is good demand for his service.

Loan Use

He will use the loan to buy mercandise for his business. He is thinking of buying a compressor, in order to improve the level of service offered. He also has orders for bicycles, and he hopes he will be able to satisfy this demand with the investment he will be able to make using the loan.

Personal Information

Julio is married. He has two children: of these, one is already studying. His wife works from home as a seamstress. In this way she generated anoterh income for the home. A short time ago he took out a loan with which he bought a second-hand truck: he uses this to make chartered journeys. And when he has the time, he also spends time selling fruit from his car. He hopes to increase his income in order to give his family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

h4>Descripción del Negocio

Julio tiene una experiencia de 8 años en esta actividad. Se inicio trabajando para su papa y hermano de donde pudo adquirir el conocimiento. Poco a poco de su trabajo logro hacer un capital. Con el que comenzó a comprar sus herramientas. Decide poner su propio local. Actualmente es arrendado. Su hermano les ayuda con el servicio a los clientes. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 6:30 hasta las 7 p.m. Esta ubicado en un lugar donde tiene buena demanda.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de mercadería para su local. Piensa comprarse un compresor mejorando de esta manera su servicio. Además tiene pedidos de bicicletas. Espera poder satisfacer la demanda que tiene con la inversión que realizara.

Información Personal

Julio es casado. Tiene 2 hijos. De los cuales uno ya estudia. Su esposa trabaja en casa realizando trabajos de costura. De esta manera genera otro ingreso para el hogar. Hace poco tiempo realizo un préstamo con el que se compro una camioneta de segunda. En la que también sale a realizar fletes. Y cuando tiene su tiempo se dedica a la venta de frutas en su carro. Espera poder mejorar sus ingresos para darle una mejor vida a su familia.

loans.use: To buy work materials and tools.

loans.name: Inés

texts.es:
Business Description

Inés has a business selling perfume, cosmetics and costume jewelry. She provides the merchandise to her customers after they order it. Inés attends to her customers every day of the week from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.

Loan Use

Inés is asking for a loan to purchase merchandise in greater quantities and greater variety. Demand for her products has increased since there is an increasing number of people to whom she provides this merchandise. Naturally, Inés earns more per item -- having a greater profit margin -- when she is able to purchase in larger quantities. She also tells us that in this way she does right by her clients and can even pass on some of the savings to them.

Personal Information

Inés is 36 years old. She is a widow and has four children. She sees in her business the chance to provide a source of greater income for her family. It is Inés’s wish that her business continue to grow in order to increase her income and be able to provide food, education and greater security (both financial and in the home) for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Kenney Molloy, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Inés tiene negocio de venta de: perfumes, cosméticos y bisutería. Labora entregando estas mercaderías por pedidos. Inés nos dice que atiende a sus clientes todos los días de la semana desde las 8: AM a 20: PM.

Uso del Préstamo

Inés solicita el crédito para la compra de más productos su demanda se ha incrementado por motivo de que ella atiende un grupo de personas a quienes les provee de esta mercadería. Así Inés genera mayores ganancias por el margen de utilidad que obtiene a mayores compras. También nos dice que de esta manara cumple con sus clientes y da oportunidad de que otras personas también ganen.

Información Personal

Inés tiene 36 años 4 hijos es viuda y vio en este negocio su fuente de ingresos. Los anhelos de Inés es poder seguir creciendo con su negocio para así tener mas ingresos y poder darle a sus hijos. Alimentación, educación y seguridad en su hogar.

loans.use: Provide greater variety and quantity of merchandise

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Description of theBusiness

Lucila has had a little Pharmacy practice for the last four years. She attends to her customers every day of the week from 8 am until 10 pm. Lucila sends medications such as: pills, painkillers, liquid serums, and various antibiotics.

Use of the Loan

Lucila is asking for a loan in order to purchase medications in accordance with her customers' demands. She also needs to purchase a sliding door to increase the security of her practice.

Personal Descripton

Lucila is 39 years old and has a 12 year old son. Her husband work as a vendor of shoes and supports her store. She desires to continue building her life and knows that in order to do this, she must expand her Pharmacy practice. Then, she would be have better security at home.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Lucila tiene pequeño negocio de farmacia desde hace 4 años. Atiende a sus clientes todos los días de la semana de 8: AM 22 PM . Lucila vende medicamentos como: Pastillas Apronax, Pankreoflac, Ranitidina, Suero Oral, Antibióticos varios.

Uso del Préstamo

Lucila solicita el crédito para comprar mas medicamentos y cumplir con su demanda, también necesita comprar una puerta corrediza para dar mejor seguridad a su local.

Información Personal

Lucila tiene 39 años 1 hijo de 12 años. Su esposo trabaja como vendedor de calzado y se apoyan en la atención de su negocio. Tiene anhelo de seguir construyendo su vivienda e indican que para esto tienen que incrementar más su negocio de Farmacia. Y así poder dar mayor seguridad en su hogar.

loans.use: Invest in medications

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria T. is 36 years old. She is single and has a one year old son. She lives with her sister at a rented house. She told us that her son is her greatest joy and motivation to go forward.

Two years ago she opened a clothes store in the Santani municipal market. She mainly sells kids clothes and female underwear. She told us that the business is going really well. There's plenty of demand from her clients because of the good quality and service that is provided.

Maria wishes to continue progressing and extending her business. She is planning to start selling shoes for both ladies and gentleman. Therefore, she requests a $500 credit which she will invest in purchasing these products to sell at her store.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

María T., tiene 36 años, es soltera y tiene un hijo de 1 año, ella vive con su hermana en una casa rentada. Nos cuenta de que su hijo es su mayor alegría y motivación para seguir adelante. Hace dos años abrió un negocio de venta de ropas, en el mercado municipal de Santaní, ella vende principalmente ropas para niños además de ropa interior para damas. Nos cuenta que el negocio marcha muy bien, tienen bastante demanda de parte de sus clientes gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos y la buena atención que brindan. María desea seguir progresando y ampliando el negocio, por lo que tiene pensado vender calzados para damas y caballeros; para ello solicita un crédito de $ 500 que los invertirá en la compra de estos productos para la venta en su negocio.

loans.use: purchase shoes for ladies and gentleman

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of more medicine and display case

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Mrs. Edith G. has a store where she sells products wholesale. She opened the store three years ago with money she received thanks to her husband who works for a charter bus company. In her store she currently sells rice, gas for domestic (home) usage, chicken and shrimp.

She would like to invest her loan in adapting and enlarging the area where she sell sher merchandise. In reality, the quantity she orders and the space she has is very small.

She is 36 years old and has a son. Her home is made of cement and her dream is to enlarge and widen her store to attract more attention from customers.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Señora Edith tiene una tienda donde vende productos al por mayor , ella empezó su negocio hace tres años con un capital gracias a la ayuda de su esposo que trabaja en una camioneta haciendo fletes, en el negocio actualmente le ayuda su esposo y sus clientes fuertes son las tiendas del sector, vende arroz, gas domestico, pollo y mariscos.

Uso del Préstamo

Quiere invertir su crédito en adecuar un local para su mercadería ya que en la actualidad por la cantidad de pedidos que aumentan y el espacio que tiene le es muy corto.

Información Personal

Tiene 36 años y un hijo, su vivienda es de cemento y su meta es crecer y ampliar su local para una mejor atención.

loans.use: Expand and widen her place of business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more merchandise and rice for her business

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Mrs. Martha P. has a store she opened seven years ago with money thanks to the traveling sales of candy [a confectioner's shop]. Her husband helps in her shop and little by little her profits have risen.

She needs to purchase more merchandise and to fully stock her store as the area where the store is located is very commercial.

She is 43 years old and has two sons, one of whom studies in a nearby establishment. Her home is made of rods and her dream is to expand her store each and every day.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Martha tiene una tienda que empezó hace siete años con un capital gracias a la venta de confitería ambulante en su negocio le ayuda su esposo y últimamente también ha incrementado con un pequeño comedor sus ganancias

Uso del Préstamo

Necesita comprar mas mercadería y de esta manera tener surtida su tienda ya que el lugar donde esta ubicada es muy comercial

Información Personal

Tiene 43 años y dos hijos uno de ellos estudia en un establecimiento cercano, su vivienda es de caña y su meta es ampliar su tienda cada dia mas

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Business Description

Sra. Maria has a small grocery store that she started about 2 years ago with some money she had saved by selling food/snacks some time ago. Her husband helps her around the store in the evenings since he is a a teacher. Today her store is very busy since her store is located near a bus stop.

Loan Use

She needs a loan to purchase more merchandise and to purchase bottle water since it is very much needed in this area and it helps to increase her sales.

Personal Information

She is 30 years old with two children. One of them is currently in school. Her house is made out of concrete & reed. Her goal is to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Maria tiene una despensa que inicio hace dos años con un capital producto de las utilidades que obtuvo de la venta de comida, en el negocio le ayuda su esposo en las tardes y por la mañana labora como maestro constructor. Hoy su tienda es muy visitada ya que esta cerca de una estación de buses.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el crédito por que va a invertir en mercadería y en la compra de botellones de agua ya que en el sector es muy necesario y sus ventas son elevadas

Información Personal

Tiene 30 años y dos hijos, uno de ellos estudia en un establecimiento cercano su casa es de construcción mixta, y su meta es crecer en su negocio

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise & bottle water

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Business Description

Jenny began her business 3 years ago. She sells basic necessities for the home and personal hygiene items. She provides direct customer service every day from 6am to 10pm.

Use of the Loan

Jenny needs this loan to invest in greater quantities of new merchandise and to expand into items for home cleaning. This way, she can offer a greater variety of new products to her clients.

Personal Information

Carmen is 27 years old. Her husband works as a day laboroer. Jenny began her business with a small amount of capital that she saved from the money her husband gave her to set aside. Her home is made of cane and wood, with an earthen floor. She hopes to grow with her business and in this way improve her situation and provide a suitable home for the child she hopes to have.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Jenny inicio su negocio hace 3 años. Los productos que vende son: viveres de primera necesidad y de limpieza personal. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 6am-a -10pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Jenny necesita del préstamo para invertir en la compra de más y nuevos víveres así como también artículos de limpieza para el hogar .De esta manera ofrecer nueva variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Carmen tiene 27años. Su esposo trabaja como jornalero. Jenny inicio con un pequeño capital que logro obtener ahorrando de lo que su esposo le daba a guardar. Su casa es de caña y madera el piso es de tierra. Aspira crecer junto con su negocio. Para de esta manera lograr mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda brindar un hogar digno para su futuro hijo que esta pensando en tener.

loans.use: To buy merchandise in bulk and invest in new products.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Business Description

Ricardo began his business 7 years ago. He sells black galvanized round tubes and square tubes in 3 and 4 inch sizes. He provides direct customer service every day from 8am to 5pm.

Use of the Loan

Ricardo needs this loan to invest in more new materials in a variety of sizes. This way he can offer his clients new options.

Personal Information

Ricardo is 54 years old. His wife helps him with the customers. Unfortunately they cannot have children, but they are motivated to take care of their parents. They began their business with loaned capital. They run their business out of their home. Ricardo hopes to grow with his business and in this way improve the condition and maintenance of his home.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Ricardo inicio su negocio hace 7 años. Los productos que vende son: Tubos redondos galvanizados y tubos cuadrados de color negro de 3 y4 pulgadas. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 8am-a -5pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Ricardo necesita del préstamo para invertir en la compra de más y nuevos materiales de varias medidas. De esta manera ofrecer nueva variedad a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Ricardo tiene 54años. Su esposa le ayuda en la atención. Lamentablemente no pueden tener hijos. Razón que les motivo a velar por el bienestar de sus padres. Su negocio lo inicio con capital prestado. El cual lo tiene ubicado en su casa. Aspira crecer junto con su negocio. Para de esta manera lograr mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y la mantención de su hogar.

loans.use: To invest in a greater quantity of products to sell.

loans.name: Isel

texts.es:
Mister Isel A. is 39 years old and is married to Teodolina, who is 34 years old. They have two sons. The older one is seven and the younger one is 10 months old. They live at a house together with Isel's older brother, who is single.

Isel is a hair stylist. He opened his own hair salon 15 years ago. It is one of the busiest hair salon's in the area due to its good location and excellent work. In addition to the salon, Isel sells beauty products such as creams, shampoo, makeup, etc. Isel's wife is in charge of this business.

Isel's wife has been needing to re-stock every week due to the excellent sales. Isel wants to enlarge his beauty product business because it is very profitable. Therefore, he requests a $650 credit which he will use to purchase products such as creams, hair dyes, soaps, shampoo, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Isel A., tiene 39 años el está casado con Teodolina de 34 años. Tienen dos hijos varones, el mayor tiene siete años y el menor tiene diez meses. Viven juntos en una casa junto con el hermano mayor de Isel que es soltero. Isel es peluquero, abrió su propia peluquería hace ya 15 años, gracias a su buena ubicación y excelente trabajo es una de las peluquerías más concurridas de la zona. Además de su peluquería tienen su salón donde vende productos de belleza como cremas, shampoo, maquillajes, etc., este negocio es atendido por su esposa. Gracias a las buenas ventas que tiene, cada semana renueva su stock de mercaderías que son llevados hasta el propio local por sus proveedores. Isel desea ampliar su negocio de ventas de productos de belleza pues le deja muy buenas ganancias; para ello solicita un crédito de $ 650 que los utilizará para la compra de mercaderías como cremas, tintes para cabello, jabones, shampoo, etc.

loans.use: Purchase creams, hair dyes, soaps, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise at bulk prices.

loans.name: Claudina

texts.es:
Business Description

For the past 9 years, Claudina and her husband have dedicated themselves to the business of brick production and sales. They have two employees. They also run a small general store that carries basic necessities and her husband also makes baked goods that they sell at their store.

Use of the Loan

They need this loan because they want to buy more raw materials to use over the winter and be able to have better prices for their clients. They will use part of the loan to buy more merchandise for the store.

Personal Information

Claudina is 56 years old and has 3 children, one of whom is in school. Her home is made of cement and she enjoys a stable family life. Her main goal is to develop her business to secure the education of her children.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Claudina y su esposo se dedican a la elaboración y venta de ladrillos este negocio lo tiene hace 9 años con ellos trabajan dos obreros mas. Además ellos actualmente tiene también una pequeña despensa donde vende productos de primera necesidad y su esposo hace panes que pone a la venta en la misma despensa

Uso del Préstamo

Ellos necesitan el crédito porque ha pensado en comprar mas materia prima para así tener un resguardo para el invierno y así poder tener mejores precios y para sus clientes. Otra parte del crédito lo utilizaran para comprar mas mercadería para la tienda

Información Personal

Ella tiene 56 años y tres hijos de los cuales uno estudia su casa es de cemento y tiene estabilidad familiar. Su principal meta es de poder progresar en su negocio para asegurar la educación de sus hijos

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Business Description

Eduardo and his wife run a computer center where they offer internet access, photocopy services, printer cartidge refills, and computer repair and sales. The business also includes a soda bar area and fast food sales.

Use of the Loan

He needs this loan because he hopes to buy more computer parts in bulk to provide better prices and products for his clients. He will also use part of the loan to open another location which he will run with the help of his nephew.

Personal Information

Eduardo is 36 years old. He has one child in school. His home is made of cement and he enjoys a stable family life. His main goal is to grow his business to provide for the education of his children.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

El Sr. Eduardo tiene junto con su esposa un centro de computo donde ofrece los servicio de Internet, fotocopiado, recarga de cartuchos de impresoras y reparación y ventas de repuestos de computadoras. Además en el local que el alquila tiene también un soda bar donde vende comida rápida

Uso del Préstamo

El necesita el crédito porque ha pensado en comprar mas repuestos y partes de computadoras a precio de mayorista y así poder tener mejores precios y buenos productos para sus clientes. Otra parte del dinero lo usara para adecuar otro local donde va a abrir otro centro que va a atender con la ayuda de un sobrino de el

Información Personal

El tiene 36 años y un hijo que aun estudian su casa es de cemento y tiene estabilidad familiar. Su principal meta es de poder progresar en su negocio para asegurar la educación de sus hijos

loans.use: To buy new and replacement parts for computers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a classroom  for a computer

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Business Description

Don Gustavo has a brickmaking business close to his home which he established twelve years ago. He works with his brother and two other workers. At present, he makes all kinds of mud blocks which he sells at the best price to material depositors for construction.

Use of the Loan

Don Gustavo needs this loan to buy more raw material so he can manufacture more bricks and secure their sale this winter - when prices for his product tend to go up.

Personal Information

Don Gustavo is 57 years old and has one daughter who studies. He lives in a stable cement house. His goal is to expand with brick manufacturing by taking on more workers and so be able to show greater financial gains and give a better future to his children and grandchildren.

Descripción del Negocio

Don Gustavo tiene una ladrillera cerca de su domicilio la puso hace doce años. Con el trabajan un hermano y dos obreros mas. En la actualidad fabrica todo tipo de bloques de barro que vende a precio de mayorista a los depósitos de materiales de construcción.

Uso del Préstamo

El necesita el crédito para comprar mas materia prima para fabricar mas ladrillos y así asegurar la venta para el invierno que suele ponerse mas caro el producto.

Información Personal

El tiene 57 años y una hija que estudian su casa es de cemento y tiene estabilidad familiar. Su principal meta es de poder tener una ladrillera con mas obreros y así poder tener mejores ganancias y darle mejor futuro a sus hijos y nietos

loans.use: To buy more raw materials

loans.name: Florbia

texts.es:
Business Description

Mrs. Florbia has a very well located business where she sells groceries and basic necessities. Recently she has opened another store in a more comercial area, where she sells propane gas for home use and jugs of water.

Use of the Loan

She needs this loan to buy merchandise and she needs to expand one of her business sites to install an area for stationery and paper that has been requested by her clients.

Personal Information

She is 39 years old and has three school age children. Her home is made of cement. She enjoys a stable home life. Her main goal is to develop her business for the future of her children and grandchildren.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Florbia tiene una despensa muy bien ubicada donde vende abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. Actualmente han logrado poner otra tienda en un sector muy comercia, ellos vende también gas de uso domestico y botellones de agua

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar mas mercadería y además necesita ampliar uno de sus locales para poner una línea de producto de papelería que han sido solicitados por sus clientes.

Información Personal

Ella tiene 39 años y tres hijos que estudian su casa es de cemento y tiene estabilidad familiar. Su principal meta es poder progresar en su negocio para así futuro a sus hijos y nietos

loans.use: To buy merchandise and expand her store.

loans.name: Blanca  Azucena

texts.es:
My name is Blanca P., I bake and sell tortillas. I have run this business from my home for four years. All my customers live in my neighborhood I sell them tortillas in the first part of the day and, in the afternoon, I continue to sell them around the colony. This business helps me pay for my family expenses and my children's education. Currently, I need to purchase corn, lime and milk to cover demands for the next months - I have nothing left in stock at this time.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Mi nombre es Blanca P., me dedico a la hacer tortillas y a la venta. este negcoio lo tengo hace 4 años en mi casa. Mis clientes son todos los de la comunida, las tortillas la genta las compra en mi negocio o yosalgo por la tarde a vender por la colonia. Con este negocio me ayuda para poder a portar a mi familia con los castos mensuales y estuidoos de mis hijos. ahora necesito comprar mas maiz, cal y lecha para estos meses ya que me he quedado sin producto.

loans.use: Compra de maiz, lecha, cal, sal.

loans.name: Justa Benita

texts.es:
Justa Benita M. D. G. is 59 years old, is a widow, and has 4 children. She lives in the Centro Poblado D. Huanja, district of Jangas, in the province of Huaraz. Her main occupation is agriculture and the foods she harvests are for household consumption. She has been weaving since she was 15 years old, and works at weaving and selling ropes. She sells them in the markets that take place on Wednesday and Sundays in the in the province of Carhuaz, which is a ½ hour walking distance followed by a ½ hour by car. With this income she provides for her household. She belongs to the “La Flor D. Retama” Communal Bank, which is part of the Movimiento Manuela Ramos that works in her community. She has requested a loan of S/. 300.00 ($95.00), to be paid back in 4 months, for the purpose of buying thread. Thread is the raw material for making multiple-use ropes.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Ella es la Señora Justa Benita M. D. G. D. 59 años D. edad, viuda, tiene 4 hijos, vive en el Centro Poblado D. Huanja, distrito D. Jangas, provincia D. Huaraz. Su actividad principal es la agricultura y sus productos D. la cosecha es para autoconsumo, desD. hace 15 años se dedica al tejido y venta D. sogas, lo venD. en la feria que se realiza los miércoles y domingos en la provincia D. Carhuaz que esta aproximadamente a 1/2 hora D. camino a pie y 1/2 hora con carro desD. su comunidad. Con estos ingresos mantiene su hogar. Ella pertenece al BC comunal “La Flor D. Retama” promovido por el Movimiento Manuela Ramos que funciona en su comunidad, solicitó un prestamos D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles ($ 95.00) pagaderos en 4 meses, para la compra D. hilos que es la materia prima para hacer las sogas para uso múltiple.

loans.use: To buy thread for making ropes

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
Mrs Nidia S. is 52 years old. She is separated and has three children: they are 32, 25 and 23 years old, respectively. The older one does not live with her any more. The other two work and study at the university. She is very proud of her children because they are very responsible and studious. Nidia has been selling products from her home for 22 years. She lives at a good location right at the center of town. She sells primary need products such as vegetables, drinks, milk products, bread, etc.

Nowadays, demand has grown, since Nidia's store has progressed both in quantity and quality. Nidia wishes to continue growing her business. Therefore, she wants to purchase plenty of merchandise.

She requests $800 which she will use to purchase wholesale canned food, meat, bread products, flour, oil and noodles to get important discounts.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nidia Sánchez tiene 52 años, es separada, y es madre de 3 hijos; ellos tienen 32,25 y 23 años respectivamente. La mayor ya no vive con ella, los otros dos trabajan y estudian en la universidad, ella se siente muy orgullosa de sus hijos pues son muy responsables y estudiosos. Nidia tiene una despensa en su casa hace 22 años, posee una buena ubicación pues se encuentra en el centro mismo de la ciudad. En su despensa vende productos de primera necesidad tales como bebidas, verduras, lácteos, panificados, etc. Hoy día la demanda se ha vuelto más grande, pues la ciudad ha crecido y progresado y Nidia desea seguir creciendo a la par; para ello desea comprar mayor cantidad de mercaderías y así ir ampliando el negocio. Solicita el crédito de $ 800 que los utilizará para comprar productos enlatados, carne, panificados, harina, aceite y fideos en grandes cantidades, así de esta forma también podrá conseguir importantes descuentos.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale canned food, meat, bread, flour, oil and noodles

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is originally from Monterrey, Nuevo Leon and is married. He started his own business selling clothing and linens to be able to provide for his wife and children, because his previous job did not pay enough to support the family. He later began to sell furniture on credit, and because of the convenient payment terms he offered, he was able to gain many customers. He currently has two employees who help him provide quality service to his customers.

Pedro is requesting a loan in the amount of $650 which he will use to buy additional inventory to help him meet demand. He will repay this loan over a period of 5 months. Pedro and his family thank you for your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Pedro es originario de Monterrey, Nuevo León y está casado, para obtener los recursos necesarios para su esposa e hijos inició su propio negocio con la venta de ropa y blancos, ya que en su anterior empleo recibía un salario muy bajo y era insuficiente para cubrir sus gastos familiares, poco después incorporó la venta de muebles a crédito y gracias a las facilidades de pago que ofrecía, sus clientes se incrementaron considerablemente, ahora cuanta con la ayuda de dos empleados para poder cubrir su demanda y mejorar la calidad de su servicio.

Para poder continuar creciendo con su negocio Pedro está solicitando un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para tener una mayor variedad de productos y cubrir los pedidos que tiene, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 5 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y decídete a apoyar a Pedro, él y su familia agradecen mucho tu generosidad.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Luís Roberto

texts.en:
Luis Roberto has two sons, ages 10 and 13. He lost his job four years ago and was unable to find steady employment. Having to provide for his family, he started selling food on the streets, setting up a small stand on a main avenue. Little by little he increased the types of food he sold and was able to get ahead and provide for his family.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of $475, to be repaid over six months, to buy building materials to build a permanent food stand where he can continue to grow his business. Luis and his family thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Luís Roberto tiene dos hijos de 10 y 13 años de edad, desde hace cuatro años perdió su empleo y le fue muy difícil conseguir otro trabajo, ante la necesidad de obtener lo necesario para su familia Luís inició su propio negocio con la venta de comidas, instalándose en una de las avenidas principales ahí comenzó a vender sus productos y poco a poco fue incrementando la cantidad de comida que vendía, gracias al buen trabajo que realiza ha logrado sacar adelante su negocio y a su familia.
