En estos momentos Luís necesita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la en la compra de material para hacer un puesto para tener su negocio fijo y pueda continuar creciendo con su negocio, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Contribuye a mejorar la vida de esta familia, decídete a apoyar a Luís, él y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy building materials for a food stand

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.en:
Evangelina has run a small grocery store for the past 20 years. She started this business because, as a single mother, it was very difficult to find a job that allowed her to care for her three children. She has never relied on anyone else, managing to raise and educate her children on her own. She started out selling just a few products and through her hard work was able to expand her inventory and grow her business.

Today, Evangelina hopes to further expand her business and meet her customers's demand with additional merchandise. For this, she's requesting a loan in the amount of $550 to be repaid over a period of 6 months. She thanks you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 20 años Evangelina se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, inició su propio negocio porque es madre soltera y para ella era muy difícil conseguir un empleo y de alguien cuidara a sus tres hijos. Nunca ha contado con el apoyo de nadie peor de esta manera ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos y pagar sus estudios, empezó vendiendo muy pocos productos y gracias al buen trabajo que realiza pronto logro incrementar su variedad y mejorar su negocio.

Ahora Evangelina desea darle un nuevo impulso a su negocio y para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes está solicitando un préstamo de $ 550 dólares, mismos que se compromete a devolver en 6 meses. Ella sabe que con tu ayuda mejorará mucho su negocio y agradece sinceramente el apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Dolores María

texts.en:
Dolores is a single mother to five children. They are the reason she started her own business selling cosmetics in Creel, Chihuahua. To provide for them, she began doing catalog sales, which allowed her to work from home and take care of her youungest children. She eventually began to offer other products and because she loves sales and enjoys working with people, she has been very successful in her business.

She currently has a large number of orders that she needs to fill and she is requesting a loan of $825, to be repaid over a period of 6 months, to meet those obligations. It has not been easy for Dolores having sole responsibility for her family, but with enthusiasm and hard work she has been able to reach her goals. With your contribution, you can help her continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Dolores es madre soltera, tiene cinco hijos y ellos han sido el motivo por el cual inició su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos en la localidad de Creel, Chihuahua de donde son originarios. Para sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles todo lo necesario Dolores comenzó con las ventas por catálogo ya que esta actividad también le permitía estar al cuidar de sus pequeños, poco a poco ha incorporado la venta de otros productos y gracias a su gusto por las ventas y a su carácter que le facilita relacionarse con los demás ha hecho prosperar su negocio.

Ahora tiene muchos pedidos y para poder surtirlos Dolores necesita un préstamo de $ 825 dólares que ofrece regresar en 6 meses. No ha sido fácil para Dolores tener tanta responsabilidad ella sola, pero con entusiasmo y mucho trabajo ha logrado alcanzar sus metas, hoy puedes ser parte de estos logros, contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, gracias.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.en:
Hermenegildo lives in the town of Creel in Chihuahua. He's married and has two small children. From a very young age, Hermenegildo has worked as a carpenter. Faced with a lack of employment in his town, he decided to start his own carpentry shop in a converted room in his home. Today, thanks to his many years of experience and high quality work, he's become a well known carpenter and his business has grown.

To improve both the quality and efficiency of his work, he is requesting a loan in the amount of $275, to be repaid over a 6 month period, to buy tools. He thanks you for providing him the opportunity to improve his family's living conditions and to grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Creel en Chihuahua vive Hermenegildo, él es casado y tiene dos pequeños hijos. Desde muy pequeño Hermenegildo se dedica a realizar trabajos de carpintería y ante la falta de empleo en la localidad decidió comenzar su propio taller acondicionando una habitación de su hogar, gracias a la experiencia que tiene realiza trabajos de muy buena calidad y poco a poco se ha dado a conocer y ha hecho crecer su negocio.

Para mejorar la calidad de su servicio y realizarlo en un tiempo menor Hermenegildo está solicitando un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de herramienta, él ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Ayuda a Hermenegildo a mejorar la vida de su familia, contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, él agradece sinceramente la ayuda que puedas brindarle.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry tools

loans.name: Pedro Humberto

texts.en:
Pedro Humberto is originally from the town of Creel in Chihuahua. He works as a tourist guide and driver, offering trips around the beautiful tourist sites in the area. Because he knows this area very well, his clients are able to enjoy beautiful locales, eat local foods and buy local arts and crafts. Pedro is married and has two children who help run the business. Together they have been able to improve their services and grow the company.

To avoid breakdowns and accidents, Pedro is requesting a loan in the amount of $275, to be repaid over a period of 4 months, which he will use to pay for maintenance and repairs to his work van. He and his children thank you for your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Pedro Humberto es originario de la localidad de Creel, Chihuahua, él se dedica a ofrecer paseos por los hermosos lugares turísticos de la localidad, con la experiencia que tiene conoce muy bien el lugar y en sus recorridos sus clientes pueden apreciar el paisaje, disfrutar de las comidas típicas y de sus artesanías. Pedro está casado y tiene dos hijos que se dedican a este mismo negocio, juntos han logrado mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrecen y hacerlo crecer.

Para evitar cualquier tipo de accidente que pudiera ocurrir, ahora Pedro está solicitando un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de uan refacción que necesita su camioneta, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio, Pedro y sus hijos agradecen mucho tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: To pay for work van repair

loans.name: Norma Velia

texts.en:
Norma is married and has three daughters. Her husband works as a truck driver transporting logs, but his salary isn't enough to cover the family's basic needs. As a result, Norma started a business preparing and selling foods from her home. With her daughters' help, she has been able to move her business forward and the quality of her products has earned her many customers.

Norma is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 to buy a cooking stove, which will allow her to prepare her foods in less time and contribute to the continued growth of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma es casada y tiene tres hijas, su esposo se dedica a la transportación de de troncos de madera pero el salario que recibe es muy bajo, insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, por esta razón Velia comenzó su propio negocio con la venta de comidas en su hogar, con ayuda de sus hijas ha logrado sacar adelante su negocio y gracias a la buena calidad de los productos sus clientes se han incrementado.

Para poder mejorar su servicio, Norma necesita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de una estufa, esto le permitirá realizar sus comidas en un menor tiempo y continuar creciendo. Se parte de los logros de Norma y decídete a apoyarla, ella y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To purchase a cooking stove

loans.name: Mirna

texts.en:
Mirna is 28 years old. She started her business two years ago selling brand new baby apparel, but because this turned out to be too expensive, she was not able to sell much. She then tried her hand at selling used clothing that a relative helped her buy in Reynosa and then sell in Linares. This business has done quite well and she now sells these clothes in a market in her city.

Mirna is requesting a loan in the amount of $250 to expand her business by selling "Talibanes", which are sausage tacos similar to a hot dog, but wrapped in a tortilla instead of a bun. These are a very popular food item and there is great demand. She will repay the loan over a period of 4 months. Mirna thanks you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Mirna tiene 28 años de edad, ella empezó con su negocio hace dos años, anteriormente se dedicaba a vender bolita, después empezó a vender algo de ropa para bebe (ropa nueva) pero como esta ropa es muy cara, casi no tenía las ventas que deseaba y no era rentable y mejor pensó en traer ropa de segunda mano de Reynosa con un familiar que se la consigue y ella la vende en Linares, esto ya es mucho mejor. Su negocio en la actualidad ya le esta funcionando muy bien por que ahora también vende en un mercado de su ciudad.

Mirna está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 250 con el cuál tiene en mente ampliar sus ventas, en el mercado ofreciendo la venta de comidas de los “Talibanes” que son tacos de salchicha como si fueran hot Dog pero en tortilla, ya que estos son la novedad y tienen una buena demanda, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 4 meses. Ella te agradece mucho el apoyo que le brindas para mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and supplies

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.es:
Ms. Victoriana Rolón is 46 years old. She is married to Mr. Eladio Maldonado who is 62 and works in agriculture, he has a 10-hectare property which he inherited from his parents where he cultivates principally watermelons, corn, and potatoes, among other things. They have an older daughter who lives with them. Their granddaughter goes to school near the house. Victoriana adores her granddaughter who is the happiness of the home.

Victoriana has her own house where she opened a store eleven years ago. At the beginning, it was just a kiosk which she made with very little capital, but with time it has been expanding and progressing until today. Among the things she sells are oil, flour, milk, and also fruits and vegetables from her husband's own little farm.

She hopes to increase her inventory of merchandise, to have greater income and earnings, so she is requesting a loan of $600 which they will invest in wholesale purchase of canned goods, sugar, coffee, and drinks.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

La señora Victoriana Rolón tiene 46 años, está casada con el señor Eladio Maldonado que tiene 62 años de edad, el se dedica a la agricultura, posee una propiedad de 10 hectáreas que heredo de sus padres donde cultiva principalmente sandías, maíz, papa, entre otros. Tiene una hija mayor que vive con ellos. Su nieta va a la escuela que queda cerca de la casa, Victoriana adora a su nieta quien es la alegría de la casa.

Victoriana tiene casa propia y en la misma abrió una despensa hace ya once años; en sus inicios era solo un kiosco que lo habilitó con muy bajo capital, con el tiempo fue ampliándose y progresando hasta el día de hoy. Entre las cosas que vende en su almacén podemos citar aceite, harina, leche, también verduras y frutas que son de la propia chacra de su esposo.

Sueña con poder aumentar su inventario de mercaderías, para poder tener mayores ingresos y ganancias, para ello solicita un crédito de $ 600 que los invertirá en la compra al por mayor de productos enlatados, azúcar, café y bebidas.

loans.use: wholesale purchase of canned goods, sugar, coffee, and drinks

loans.name: Gloria Amada

texts.es:
Hello. My name is Gloria Amada F.. I sell cheese pastries and fried pork chunks with beans, which is a traditional dish in my country and are very tasty. This dish is served with cabbage, tomatoes, shred-ed cheese and peppers. I have many customers because my pastries are very appreciated in my neighborhood. I have been in this business for four and a half years. I use the business' income to help my husband cover the cost of raising our children.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Hola, mi nombre es Gloria Amada F., me dedico a la venta de pupusas de quesillo, chicarron y con frijoles. esta es como mida tipiaca de mi pais las cuales son deliciosas, como a compañante llevan rrepocho, tomate, queso rallado, y chile. Tengo bastantes clientes ya que son muy famosas mis pupusa en mi vecindario. Este negocio lo tengo hace 4 años imedio. Con este negocio ayudo a mi esposo con los gastos familiares que tenemos mensualmente de nuestros hijos.

loans.use: Compra de masa para hacer pupusas, quesillos, choriso, frijoles aceite, platos, servillestas. Repollo, tomates, cebollas y chiles.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is married and has three sons; the oldest is 23 and is also married. The younger sons are 20 and 14 years old and still live at home. His wife helps run their small grocery store. It was her idea that he start this business to supplement the income he earned as an electrician, as that job was of a seasonal nature and not very steady. He started out running a small snack stand with very few products but has since been able to expand his offerings.

Pedro is requesting a loan of $925 to expand his business and purchase more inventory, as this will help him attract and retain more customers. He will repay this loan over a period of 6 months. Pedro and his family thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Pedro esta casado y tienen tres hijos, de los cuales uno, el mayor de 23 años de edad ya está casado, los otros dos tienen 20 y 14 años de edad respectivamente y dependen de él; su esposa lo ayuda en el negocio, que es de venta de abarrotes en general. Él inicio con su negocio por sugerencia de su esposa para poder mejorar sus ingresos ya que el trabajaba como eléctrico y muchas veces ese trabajo es muy variable y por temporadas no tiene trabajo. Empezó con su negocio hace 5 años atrás, empezando con muy poca mercancía pero que con el paso del tiempo a podido ampliar sus productos a ofrecer, ya que inició como un tipo snack (dulces y refrescos).

Pedro está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 925 para poder ampliar su negocio y surtirse de mercadería para así poder mantener y atraer más clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Él y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le brindas para continuar creciendo con su negocio y así poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: To buy inventory

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramón F. is 37 years old, and he is married to Liz Balbina, who is 23. They are the parents of a little boy three years old who is their happiness. They live in their own home at a company called Ycua Ti-i, located 5 km from the city of Santaní. It is a 20-hectare property of very good pasture.

Ramón works in agriculture, especially cattle ranching. He has 12 Dutch cows who produce 120 liters of milk daily, which are sold in the mornings at the markets in the city center. He also works buying and selling cattle. He started in this line of work over ten years ago and has given work to many young men in the area.

Because the work of raising and selling cattle generates good earnings, Ramón wishes to increase the quantity of animals. For this he is requesting a loan of $1000, which they will invest in the purchase of bull calves for fattening and later sale.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Ramón F. tiene 37 años, está casado con la señora Liz Balbina que tiene 23 años, ellos son padres de un pequeño niño de tres años que es la alegría de ambos. Ellos viven en una casa propia en una compañía llamada Ycua Tu-i ubicado a 5 km de la ciudad de Santaní. Es una propiedad de 20 hectáreas con muy buena pastura.

Ramón se dedica a la agricultura y especialmente a la ganadería, tiene 12 vacas holandesas que producen 120 litros de leche diariamente que son vendidas en su totalidad por las mañanas en los comercios del centro de la ciudad. También se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno. Comenzó a trabajar en este rubro hace más de diez años y ha dado trabajo a muchos jóvenes de la zona.

Como el rubro de cría y venta de animales vacunos genera una buena ganancia, Ramón desea aumentar la cantidad de animales; para ello solicita un crédito de $ 1000 que los invertirá en la compra de terneros para el engorde y posterior venta de los mismos.

loans.use: to buy bull calves

loans.name: Eudelio

texts.es:
Eudelio C. is a single man, age 46, and he lives with his parents and his two children, who attend school. The older is 11 years old, and in addition to studying he helps his father with the business in his spare time.

Eudelio has his own home and has owned a brick factory for 25 years. He inherited the business from his father, and he has all the necessary equipment, such as mixing machines, wood tables, four molds and an oven with a capacity of 15,000 bricks. He has a great number of customers, and in recent months there has been a considerable increase in the demand for his products.

He needs this loan to buy large quantities of firewood, and in this way increase his production to be able to meet all the demand.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Eudelio C. es un hombre de 46 años, soltero, y vive con sus padres y dos hijos suyos que van a la escuela, el mayor tiene once años y además de estudiar ayuda a su padre en su negocio en sus tiempos libres.

Eudelio tiene casa propia y posee una fábrica de ladrillos desde hace 25 años; el negocio lo heredo de su padre y tiene todo el equipamiento necesario como máquinas amasadoras, mesa de madera, cuatro moldes y un horno con capacidad para 15.000 ladrillos. Posee una gran cantidad de clientes, y en los últimos meses tuvo un aumento considerable en la demanda de sus productos.

Necesita el préstamo para comprar grandes cantidades de leñas, de esta forma aumentar su producción para poder abastecer todas sus demandas.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of firewood

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Ms. Gabriela is 72 years old, married, and lives with her husband Carlos Zarate. Her children are already grown and live in their own homes with their families. She has had a grocery store for almost 30 years. First she worked selling natural, refreshing remedies at the municipal market in her city, and with this humble labor she enabled her children to study. Over time, she put together some savings and opened her grocery store, which has been generating more and more income and expanding with the passage of time. Thanks to her good management and excellent customer service, she is able to compete with new businesses which have opened in the area. Even though she never finished school, she is a woman who knows how to manage her income. She wants this loan to diversify her stock, which is why she is requesting $400 to buy more canned goods, treats, milk, bread, noodles, flour, etc.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer) La señora Gabriela tiene 72 años ella es casada y vive con su marido Carlos Zarate, sus hijos ya son mayores y viven todos en sus casas propias junto con sus familias. Ella tiene un despensa hace casi 30 años. Primeramente se dedicó a la venta de remedios refrescantes y naturales en el mercado municipal de la ciudad, con su humilde labor hizo estudiar a sus hijos, con el tiempo juntó unos ahorros y abrió su almacén fue generando cada vez mayores ganancias y ampliándose a medida que paso el tiempo. Gracias a su buena administración y excelente trato a los clientes, puede hacer competencia a los nuevos negocios que se abrieron en la zona. A pesar de que ella no culminó sus estudios es una mujer que sabe manejar sus ingresos. Ella desea el crédito para diversificar su stock, por lo que solicita $ 400 para comprar más productos enlatados, golosinas, leche, panificados, fideos, harina, etc.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, treats, milk, bread, noodles, flour, etc.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto P. is 35 years old, he is married to Raquel Urunaga who is 25, and they have a little boy who doesn't go to school yet. They live and work together in a place called Jejuí, in the district of Santaní, a city located 320 km from the country's capital.

He as had a carpentry shop for three years. His wife has a secondhand clothing store. He makes all kinds of furniture, such as tables, chairs, and more. He has customers in different cities, such as furniture stores. He needs to buy more wood to fill all the orders he has received in the last months, for which he is requesting a loan of $600 to invest in the purchase of various kinds of wood.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Roberto P. tiene 35 años, el está casado con la Raquel Urunaga que tiene 25 años, ellos tienen un hijo pequeño que aún no va a la escuela. Viven y trabajan juntos en una compañía llamada Jejuí, un distrito de Santaní, ciudad dista unos 320 km. de la capital del país.

Posee una carpintería desde hace tres años, su señora posee una tienda de venta de ropas de segunda mano. El realiza todo tipo de muebles como mesas, sillas, placares entre otros. Posee clientes de diferentes ciudades tanto particulares como mueblerías. Necesita comprar más maderas para poder abastecer todos los pedidos que ha recibido este último mes, por lo que solicita $ 600 para invertir en la compra de maderas de diferentes tipos.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Mrs. Suon S., a 34-year-old mother of three children, lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She makes her living by growing crops and raising pigs, and earns around $2/day. Her husband works on the farmland with his wife, and also works as a taxi driver whenever he is free.

The couple wants this loan to purchase feed for their pigs.

loans.use: To purchase feed for pigs.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Mrs. Lay P. and her husband sell vegetables and bananas at an open air market. Together, they generally make around $4 each day. Mrs. P. is 35 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.

This couple plans to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle so that it will be easy for them to transport their vegetables to and from the market. Some of the money will be used to buy more vegetables to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to transport their produce to the market.

loans.name: Nghem

texts.en:
Mrs. Nghem N. and her husband work very hard on their farm growing vegetables and making palm sugar to support their family. They earn an average of $3 each day.

Mrs. N. is 49 years old, and has five children. One of her children works as a goldsmith, another one is a tailor, and the other children attend school.

This loan will be used to purchase goldsmithing tools for her son to operate his business.

loans.use: Purchase goldsmith's tools

loans.name: Bahadur

texts.en: Mr. A. is a vulnerable low income person. He is married with three children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Bahadur and his wife (she is shown in the picture) run the family business together. Bahadur sells milk in Saatli town, while his wife takes care of their only cow. The income from one cow is too low to support the family. In the Caucasus region the price of a good cow is about $800-1000 USD. But Bahadur has some of his own money to add to it. That’s why he applied for a $450 loan to buy one more pure-breed cow to make his monthly income higher.

loans.use: Mr. Abbasov would like to buy another cow for his farm.

loans.name: Mirgafar

texts.en: Mr. H. is a vulnerable low income person. He is married with three children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Mirgafar and his son (he is shown in the picture) run the family business together. Mirgafar sells milk in Saatli town, while his son takes care of their cows. The income from two cows is too low to support the family. That’s why Mirgafar applied for a $500 loan to buy one more pure-breed cow to make his monthly income higher. In the Caucasus region the price of good cow is about $800-1000 USD. But he also has some money of his own to contribute.

loans.use: Mr. Hashimov would like to puchase another pedigree cow to sell its milk.

loans.name: Alim

texts.en: Mr. K. is a vulnerable low income person. He is married with three children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Alim and his son (he is shown in the picture) run the family business together. Alim sells milk in the Saatli town, while his son takes care of their cows. The income from one cow is not enough to develop the farm. That’s why Alim applied for a $500 loan to buy one more pure-breed cow to make his monthly income higher. In the Caucasus region the price of good cow is about $800-1000 USD. But Alim has some of his own money to contribute.

loans.use: Mr. Khuseinov would like to buy a pedigree cow to sell its milk.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a Resident of Makangarawe in the Temeke District of the Dar Es Salaam Region. She has been in the poultry business for the past four years and it grows each day. She recently completed payment on a loan of USD $1,000 to YOSEFO, her local MFI.

She keeps both layers and a broiler, and she is now able to supply hotels and restaurants around Tameke area with poultry. Hilda also is an agent of INTER CHICK, a Dar Es Salaam based company which supplies chicks. Hilda also runs a pharmacy for veterinary medicine. She is in need of USD $1,200 to expand her business, buy more medicine for the pharmacy and buy more chicks.

loans.use: Buy more chicks for her poultry business

loans.name: Identity

texts.en: The entrepreneur is 38 years old and has a mini-market in Kirkuk. He applied for the loan of $1200 to purchase more goods for the shop and develop his shop. He has four children, and all of them are in school. He wants to increase his income and enhance his standard of living. He also wants to develop his business.

loans.use: Purchase more goods for the shop

loans.name: Identity

texts.en: The entrepreneur is 27 years old and has a hair salon. She works and helps her husband to cover the housing and family expenses. She applied for the loan of $1000 to purchase new equipment  for her business. She is looking to increase her income and well as develop her business.

loans.use: Purchase new equipment

loans.name: Identity

texts.en: The entrepreneur is 37 years old and has an electric goods shop in Kirkuk. He applied for the loan of $1200 to purchase new goods for his shop. He lives with his mother and father. Both of them are not working. He wants to develop his shop and increase his income and enhance his living standard.

loans.use: Purchase more goods for the shop

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Mrs. Phan D. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and six children. She sells fish at an open-air market. Her husband works as a horse-cart driver (a passenger cart pulled by a horse). Together, they earn around $5 each day. Three of their children work at the garment factory and the others are students.

This loan will be used to purchase a horse to pull the passenger cart.

loans.use: Purchase a horse to pull passenger cart.

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhoeun S. N. is 32 years old and lives with her husband and two school-aged children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works in a theatre as an actress, and earns around $1.50 each day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, and he makes about $2.50 a day.

This couple will use this loan to buy a motorcycle for her husband to operate his taxi business. They will also purchase small fish to raise in their small pond to supplement their income.

loans.use: To purchase fish to raise in her pond and another part of the money is used to buy a motorcycle for her husband to operate his business.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Chhoeun Sok Na has successfully repaid this Kiva loan.

Thanks to your investment, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to help finance their small businesses and support their families. We hope you will continue your support on Kiva.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Nu

texts.en:
Mrs. Nu L. is a 59-year-old mother of six children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband work on their plantation growing crops and earn around $2 each day. One of her children is a tailor and another is a grocer.

Mrs. Nu L. is humbly requesting a loan of $500 to buy seeds and fertilizer to expand her plantation.

loans.use: Purchase seed and fertilizer to expand her plantation.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en:
Daniela P. is 55 years old and is married to Amado Benitez, 58, from the city of Ybycuí. They live together in a house that they worked really hard to acquire. They have one son who is 23 years old and currently studying in the university.

Daniela and Amado are retired. Soon after their retirement in 2005, they started their copetin, a small food shop, in order to finance their son's college education. They are very proud of their son and only wish the best for his future.

Their copetin is located in the Municipal Market. They are very hard workers and work long hours everyday. They dream that their son will have his own room at their house to start his business. With the loan, they plan on buying a refrigerator.

loans.use: Purchase refrigerator.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene Medina, 29, is married to José Núñez, 39. They have two children, and the eldest is in second graD.. They both come from a very humble family who also sold chipas. Chipa is a very typical type of corn bread in Paraguay. Starting from a young age, Jose worked with his parents beginning early in the morning to bake the chipas. Now, Marlene works with her husband in their chipa business.

Marlene wakes up early in the morning to make the chipas. Later, Jose is in charge of selling them in the streets on his bike. AsiD. from his chipa business, he also sells lottery tickets in order to increase his income. In this way, Marlene was able to pay for her studies at the university. She has a degree in Social Science, but she has not been able to make use of her degree due to the lack of jobs.

Marlene hopes to increase their chipa sales in order for their business to advance further. She is in need of the loan in order to buy an amasadora (mixer) in order to speed up their production and improve the quality of their products.

loans.use: To buy an mixer and purchase starch.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana C., who is 42-years of age, is married to Teodolfo Blano, 47. They have two sons who are studying in school. They acquired their own house through many years of hard work. Teodolfo works as a security guard for a company in Ybycuí, while Juliana works at home in their despensa (grocery store). She sells domestic and food products at the despensa.

The despensa began with a small amount of capital that Teodolfo was able to acquire, and they started increasing their merchandise slowly over the years. For example, they sell rice, sugar, pasta, and oil. With the despensa, Juliana is able to help support the family so that their sons can continue their studies.

They hope to get a loan in order to purchase a freezer to be able to provide the best quality of products to their clients. They plan to expand their salon and to purchase more merchandise for the despensa.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, flour.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Mr. Eusebio is 44 years old, and he is married to Nilsa Caballero, age 44, who is an educator. She teaches at one of the schools near their home, and through that activity she contributes to the support of their household. They have two children and one niece whom they care for since she became an orphan. All of them attend school. Eusebio tells us that those three are the happiness of the house.

Eusebio has a butcher shop, which he inherited from his father who worked there for a long time. Many of the necessary elements were purchased by his father, such as a commercial freezer, a saw, a scale, and others. Since he already had the necessary elements, he decided to continue with this work. With the help of his wife, and the good fortune to have a clientele already formed, the business has proceeded well and has grown in recent times. Thanks to this he can give a worthy life to his family and a good education to his children.

Mr. Eusebio is requesting a loan in order to buy a high-capacity electric saw, since the one he has got damaged and the necessary repair is difficult to get.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

El Sr. Eusebio tiene 44 años de edad, está casado con Nilsa Caballero de 44 años, quien es docente, ella enseña en una de las escuelas cercanas a su domicilio y con esta actividad también aporta para el sustento del hogar. Tienen dos hijos y una sobrina que quedo a cargo de ellos luego de quedar huérfana, todos estudian y van a la escuela, Eusebio nos cuenta que los tres son la alegría de la casa.

Eusebio tiene una carnicería, la misma la heredó de su padre quien por mucho tiempo se dedicó a ella; muchos de los elementos necesarios ya los había comprado su padre, como ser heladera comercial, serrucho, balanza y otros.

Ya que contaba con los elementos necesarios decidió continuar con este trabajo con la ayuda que le proporcionaba su esposa, con la suerte de contar con una clientela formada, el negocio marcha bien y a crecido en los últimos tiempos; gracias a esto da una vida digna a su familia y una buena educación a sus hijos.

El Sr. está solicitando el préstamo para poder comprar un serrucho eléctrico de mayor capacidad, ya que la que tenía se averió y el repuesto necesario es difícil de conseguir.

loans.use: to buy a high-capacity electric saw

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en: Kadie M. is married with three children.  Her husband is a taxi driver and his income can only provide the family with a bag of rice, said Kadie.  Kadie sells smoked fish in the town of Magburaka.  Her previous loan enabled her  to have her own capital since she had to pay the installments on a monthly basis.  "I am able to make a profit and feed my children twice a day," said Kadie.  She is requesting another loan of $175 to increase her stock and have more time to attend to the business and her children.

loans.use: Increase her fish stock for selling in the village

loans.name: Ye Marie

texts.en: Ye Marie S. is married with two children.  As an orphan, she could not continue with her education and was forced to marry at an early age.  At twenty-eight years old she runs a business of selling bowls.  She learned trading from her adoptive mother whom she is now taking care of.   With her previous loans, she diversified her business by including rubber bowls.  She would like to include other types of utensils such as spoons and saucepans to attract more customers.  She is therefore requesting a loan of $175.

loans.use: Diversify types of kitchen utensils to increase business

loans.name: Umu

texts.en: Umu B. is married with six children.  Her husband is also engaged in petty trading in the town of Magburaka in Sierra Leone. The couple is working hard to meet their family’s expenses.  Umu started her fish business with a small amount of capital from her husband and her previous loan.  She is able to purchase the fish from the wholesaler in cash and build her capital.  Umu said, “both of us are working hard to educate our children and to build a family home in the future".  She is requesting another loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase more fish for selling in her village.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa K. grew up in Mapaytho Village of Magburaka in Sierra Leone.  As a forty year old mother of four, she learned trading from her mother. Teresa then moved to Magburaka town with her husband where she started a business selling palm oil.   All of the four children are in school and the business is the sole source of income as the husband is unemployed.  Teresa’s previous loan enabled her to expand her business and she would like another loan for the same purpose.

loans.use: Expansion of her palm oil business to increase her income.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en: Madam Rugiatu B. is thirty years old and married with four children.  Her husband is a primary teacher whose salary is insufficient to meet the family's expenses.  To supplement her husband’s salary, Rugiatu runs a palm oil shop where she sells to retailers on wholesale.  With the previous loan, she increased the capacity of her business.  She is requesting more loans to purchase 55 gallons of palm oil to meet the demand of her customers and double her profit.

loans.use: Increase wholesale items for sale.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en: Amie K. is forty-nine yearsold and married with four children.  She runs a business of selling utensils and her business is the only source of income for the family. Amie said that, with her previous loan she was able to increase her income and the family's livelihood has improved.  She can now buy half a bag of rice a month for the family.  Amie still wants to expand her business and extend the service to nearby villages.  Her husband will assist her to carry her business to village markets.

loans.use: Increase her business by offering more types of utensils for sale.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en: Mariatu is thirty-seven years old and widowed with four children.  Her husband was killed during the civil war in Sierra Leone.  She is the sole breadwinner for her four children.  Mariatu sells plastic shoes in the town of Magburaka.  It is the easiest business to start because it needs a small amount of capital.  She started with a capital of $50 which she borrowed at 50% interest from an expensive money lender.  She increased her capital base after her previous loan and would like to diversify her business.  She said a loan from SMT will be of great help for her business and the family.

loans.use: Diversify her shoe shop to attract additional business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim K. is fifty years old and married with six children.  He is a tailor and also sells some materials.  With the previous loan, he managed to stock his shop with the needed materials such as zippers, buttons, and embroidery threads for designing . This new stock enabled him to get more customers and income.  He would like another loan to purchase one more embroidery machine and employ another tailor to increase his productivity.

loans.use: Increase productivity of his tailoring business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata K. and her husband are both petty traders.  With four children, the twenty-five year old mother runs a small business of selling plastic shoes.  “The reason for both of us running petty trade is to meet our family’s life needs and save for the future of our children’s education”, said Fatmata’s husband.   Fatmata is determined to expand her business and develop her own capital.  She is therefore requesting a $175 loan.

loans.use: Expansion and diversification of shoe selling business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata C. is forty yearsold and married with six children.  A hardworking woman, Aminata contributes financially toward her family's well being. She sells food staples in the town of Magburaka in Sierra Leone and was able to repay her first loan successfully.  She increased her stock by purchasing onions and wheat flour with the previous loan.  Aminata needs another loan to expand her business to increase her profit.

loans.use: Increase food staple items for selling.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en: Mariatu K. is thirty-three years and married with three children.  She sells food stuffs in the town of Magburaka.  From her business, she is able to earn enough income to pay her children’s school fees and other family expenses.  The previous loan increased the volume of Mariatu’s business and she would like to take out another loan of $175 for the same purpose.

loans.use: Increase her supply to earn more income.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en: Thirty-three year old Abibatu C. is married with five children.  Through her business, she is able to contribute immensely towards her family's well being.  Her previous loan improved her business. She owns a stall of grocery items in the Magburaka town market.  She used the previous loan to purchase peanuts and also produces peanut butter.  Abibatu said, “with the loan, I am able to make a profit of $15 a week compared to $5 before the loan”.   To make more profits, Abibatu is requesting a loan of $200.

loans.use: Increase grocery stock at her market stall.

loans.name: Dina Elisa

texts.es:
Ms. Dina Elisa Sánchez García is 38 years old and lives in the Roma Annex of the district of Ascope, state of La Libertad, Peru. She works selling breakfasts in the mornings from 7 to 11, and at night she takes out a cart with treats and a grill with meat skewers to the plaza in her community. With her first loan of approximately $95 she returned to this business after having left for a year to go to Lima and work with a relative. Now she is very happy because this business allows her to be close to her three children and educate them since she is a single mother and lives alone with them.

The work she's done allows her time to work with her community as president of the Mothers' Club "Arbol de Vida" (tree of life).

Ms. Dina hopes to have her own home, for this reason she wants to serve her customers better and better so she can increase her income. With the loan she will receive for approximately $250, she wishes to buy a stove for preparing the breakfasts.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

La señora Dina Elisa Sánchez García Tiene 38 años de edad y vive en el Anexo Roma del Distrito de Ascope en el Departamento de La Libertad - Perú se dedica a la venta de desayunos de 7 a 11 de la mañana y por la noche saca una carretilla con golosinas y una parrilla con anticuchos para vender en la plaza de armas de su comunidad. Con su primer préstamo de S/.300 ($95 aproximadamente) en el B.C. ”Romanas Luchadoras” retoma este negocio después de un año de haberlo dejado para ir a Lima a trabajar con un familiar vendiendo menú. Ahora se siente muy contenta porque su negocio le permite estar cerca de sus tres hijas y educarlas ya que es madre soltera y vive solo con ellas. Pese al trabajo que realiza se da tiempo para colaborar con su comunidad presidiendo el Club de Madres “Árbol de la Vida” La señora Dina sueña con tener su casa propia, por eso quiere atender cada vez mejor a sus clientes para que pueda incrementar sus ventas; con el préstamo que recibirá de S/.800 ($250 aproximadamente) desea comprar una cocina para la preparación de los desayunos.

loans.use: To buy a stove (equipment)

loans.name: María Fermina

texts.es:
Maria Fermina C. C. is 61 years old and studied only up to the third grade in primary school. She lives in the District of Victor Larco in the Province of Trujillo, Department of Liberty, Peru. When she became a widow 26 years ago, she assumed all on her own a business in raising and selling animals as well as milk. With this business she educated her four children, who today are independent. Her daughter invited her to participate in the B.C. "Las Palmeras," which she accepted with a great deal of fear because she had no experience with credit, and solicited her first loan of 300 Sol (approximately $95) with which she purchased small pigs to raise and then sell. She was very good in the business of raising and selling pigs, but today she has decided to stick with cattle, ducks, and turkeys because pigs are a lot of work. In addition to raising these animals she distributes the milk which her cattle produce to her clients every day. With the loan of 1,200 Sol (approximately $380) which she will receive, Maria will buy food for her animals.

Translated by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

María Fermina C. C., tiene 61 años de edad y solo estudio hasta tercer grado de primaria. Vive en el Distrito de Victor Larco en la Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad – Perú. Cuando enviudó hace 26 años asumió sola su negocio de crianza y venta de animales así como venta de leche, con este negocio educó a sus cuatro hijos los que hoy son independientes. Su hija la invitó a participar del B.C. “Las Palmeras” aceptó con mucho temor porque no tenía experiencia en créditos y solicitó su primer crédito de S/.300 ($95 aproximadamente) con los que compró cerdos pequeños para criarlos y luego venderlos le fue muy bien en el negocio de los cerdos pero hoy ha decidido solo criar ganado vacuno, patos y pavos porque los cerdos dan mucho trabajo. A parte de criar estos animales distribuye a sus clientes, todas las mañanas, la leche que producen sus vacas. Con el préstamos de S/.1,200 ($380 aproximadamente) que recibirá comprará alimento para sus animales.

loans.use: Purchase of food for cattle, ducks, and turkeys.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu K. is thirty years old, married with four children. She runs a business selling vegetables, chili peppers, and beans. Chili pepper is the most important ingredient in every Sierra Leonean food, and farmers earn a good income from growing them.

With her previous loan, Mariatu was able to purchase three bags of chili peppers and sold them within a week. This means a $25 profit every week. Mariatu would like to embark on wholesale activities and is requesting a loan of $200 for that purpose. This will enable her to purchase seven bags of chili peppers per week, so her profits will increase accordingly.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables in bulk for resale

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
Abu K. is twenty-seven years old, married with one child. He buys baskets of fish and supplies them to retailers in Magburaka Market. Since he is an elder son in his father's family, he takes care of his brothers, sisters, and mother in addition to his own family. As a breadwinner, he works hard to see that he makes enough income to meet household expenses.

With his previous loan, K. was able to make a $20 profit weekly. With additional loans of $200, Abu will increase his profit. He is also planning to save some money to enable his wife to develop another business to further increase family income.

loans.use: Expansion of fish-selling business

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Rugiatu K. is forty-five years old, married, and has three children. She has been running a fish business for a long time but could not progress due to a lack of capital.

With her previous loan, Rugiatu managed to pay cash for two baskets of fish, and that earned her a good profit. She has successfully completed the repayment of her previous loan and would like to take more loans of $175 after the national election in September. Fish is the main food and one of cheapest foods in Sierra Leone. Rugiatu’s aim is to make more profit and diversify her business.

loans.use: Increase her stock of fish so that she can earn more income

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim S. is forty-eight years old and runs a fish wholesale business in Magburaka town. He has been running the business for a long time. Ibrahim is married with four children. He normally distributes the fish to his customers (retailers) in various villages and collects the payments every week.

Ibrahim has many customers who have asked him to supply fish but he could not meet all their demands. He needs to raise more funds to increase his outreach and is requesting a loan of $200.

Ibrahim said, “I did not have a chance for education, and the best thing I can give my children for their future is education.” Ibrahim is determined to educate his children. He plans to build a family house, too. He has acquired land.

loans.use: Meet customers' demands by having more fish to sell wholesale

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul K. T. is forty-eight years old and married with four children. He supplies fish to the market women in the outskirts of Magburaka town.  The business is the sole source of income for his family.  In addition to his immediate family, Abdul takes care of his parents and some cousins. He has successfully repaid his first loan and would like to take another to increase his stock.

loans.use: Increase his stock of fish for wholesale to market vendors

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu K. is twenty-five years old and married with two children. She is married to an electrician whose salary is irregular. She started her business of selling chili peppers in the outskirts of Magburaka town to supplement her husband’s salary.

Mariatu has been running the business for the past eight years. With her previous loan, she was able to increase the volume of her business. She would now like a loan of $175 to buy more bags of chili pepper to stockpile for the dry season when they will be scarce. She says there is more profit during the dry season than now.

loans.use: Purchase chili peppers to stockpile and sell during the dry season for a higher price

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu C. is married with three children. She is forty-seven years old and sells utensils. Her husband is also a small business owner in the same town, Magburaka.

Kadiatu's business expanded after her first loan. Although the loan amount was quite small, Kadiatu is grateful. She is now requesting another loan to further expand her business.

loans.use: Increase her business and expand her operation

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu B. is forty years old and married with four children. She sells fish in the open-air market in Magburaka. She also takes her business to the village market on special days.

Kadiatu's previous loan enabled her to buy two baskets of fish at a time, thus increasing her profit. As she will complete her previous loan repayments in August, she would like to take out another loan to further expand her micro-business.

loans.use: Purchase more fish to sell in the village market

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma B. is thirty years of age and married with three children. She earns her living by selling dried fish. From her business income, Emma is able to contribute to the upkeep of the family. Her previous loan enabled her increase her capital. She is now requesting a loan of $175.

Emma says, “Having completed repaying my loan, I now have made some money as my business capital. With more loans I will be able to build my own capital."

loans.use: Increase her stock of dried fish

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie C. is thirty-nine years old and married with seven children. She has been in the same business for fourteen years; she was in exile in the Republic of Guinea during the civil war in Sierra Leone. Marie says that with her previous loan she was able to puchase new utensils for her business.

After completing her current loan repayment in the first week of September, Marie would like more loans to buy ingredients such as oil and rice, etc. wholesale. This will enable her to make more profit and build an appropriate shelter for her business.

"There is high demand for food service," said Marie. Most of the traders in the market eat from her restaurant and she always sells all the food she has cooked each day. "From my earnings I am able to take care of my children’s school fees which are the most important item of my family expenses," Marie said proudly.

loans.use: Increase her stock of ingredients to enable her to cook more food for sale each day.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Mabinty T. is married with two children. This twenty-five-year-old mother runs a small business selling cosmetics in Magburaka town in Sierra Leone. Many Sierra Leoneans start out their business by taking goods on credit from the Lebanese merchants, and the cost of these goods is always high. This leaves traders like Mabinty with very little profit and they have a very hard time building their own capital as they have to make cash repayments daily or weekly.

The previous loan from SMT enabled Mabinty to begin building capital for her micro-business. She is requesting another loan of $350 to further enhance her business.

loans.use: Increase her inventory of cosmetics

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en:
Yeabu T. was born in Mangoro village near Magburaka in the northern part of Sierra Leone. She is forty-five years old and married with four children. She owns a store on the outskirts of the town where she sells palm oil.

Yeabu's husband rents a motorbike to provide services for passengers and shares the profit with the motorbike owner. His income is insufficient to support their family. Her previous loan allowed Yeabu to help take care of her family, especially paying school fees and medical bills.

Yeabu would like to expand her business to generate more income so that she and her husband can purchase a motorbike to use for their family business. This loan of $175 will go to purchase 50 more gallons of palm oil and with time will enable Yeabu to earn a good profit .

loans.use: Purchase additional palm oil to sell in her shop

loans.name: Lidya

texts.es:
Lidia V. V., divorced, mother of two school-age children, has been the President of the Asociación Divino Amparo, an association of Pro Mujer, for the past 8 years. She works making and selling articles of clothing and selling sewing machinery.

She started out with a small loan of 50 Bs., which she invested in the purchase of groceries and food for her own consumption. Later she received a larger loan which allowed her to buy fabric and other materials, with which she started her business.

At present Lidia is the owner of two stores where they make and sell clothing and sports wear, located in the Rodríguez market in the city of La Paz. She also has two shops in El Alto, operated by her employees.

Lidia needs capital in order to buy materials for her work, such as fabric and especially American fasteners, which she will use to improve to quality of her products and in that way increase her income.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Lidia V. V., divorciada, madre de dos hijos en edad escolar, es Presidenta de la Asociación Divino Amparo, socia de Pro Mujer hace 8 años, se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir y a la venta de maquinaria de costura.

Ella comenzó con un pequeño crédito de 50 Bs. que invirtió en la compra de víveres y alimentos para consumo propio. Posteriormente accedió a un crédito mayor que le permitió la compra de telas y otros materiales, con los que pudo dar inicio a su trabajo.

Actualmente Lidia es dueña de dos tiendas de confección y venta de prendas de vestir y ropa deportiva, ubicados en el mercado Rodríguez de la ciudad de La Paz, además tiene dos tiendas en plena ceja de El Alto, atendidas por sus dependientes.

Lidia necesita de capital para poder acceder a la compra de material de trabajo, como ser telas, y principalmente los cierres americanos, con los que podrá mejorar la calidad de sus prendas y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos.

loans.use: Lidia needs capital in order to buy materials for her work, such as fabric and especially American fasteners, to improve the quality of her products and increase her income.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena P. Alcón, divorced and the mother of 8 children, has been a member of Pro Mujer for 7 years. Her principal work is the collection and recycling of plastics.

Before this, she used to work selling jackets, which she made herself. She quickly discovered that a better way to generate income was the buying and selling of this merchandise. Since she was very young, she learned the art of sewing, and she walked through the streets carrying her products.

At present, Elena only works collecting plastics for recycling, an activity she does along with her youngest daughter. Her objective is to put together capital to travel to the city of Cochabamba, in order to purchase a greater quantity of plastic products for resale, and in that way generate greater resources for her family.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Elena P. Alcón, divorciada y madre de 8 hijos, es socia de Pro Mujer hace 7 años, su actividad principal es la recolección y reciclaje de plásticos.

Anteriormente su actividad era la venda de chamarras, que ella misma confeccionaba, de pronto descubrió que la mejor forma de generar ingresos era la compra y venta de esta mercadería. Desde muy niña aprendió el arte de la costura, y deambulaba por las calles, cargada de sus productos.

Actualmente Elena solo se dedica a la recolección de plásticos para su reciclaje, actividad que realiza colaborada por su hija menor. Su objetivo es reunir capital para poder viajar a la ciudad de Cochabamba, con el objetivo de lograr mayor cantidad de plásticos para la venta y de esta manera generar mayores recursos para su familia.

loans.use: Her objective is to put together capital to travel to the city of Cochabamba, in order to purchase a greater quantity of plastic products for resale, and in that way generate greater resources for her family.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia Y. works making clothing and other items out of leather, such as jackets, wallets, and other accessories which she sells on Tumusla Street in the city of La Paz.

Ever since she was very young she worked at this trade, learning the art from her parents. Lidia intends to turn her life around, now that she has two children to support.

At present Lidia is an exporter of leather clothing and accessories. Her articles are taken to Puerto Suarez in Brazil. For this reason, she she must complete a certain number of items per day. That's why she already has two employees helping her with the work.

Lidia needs capital in increase her acquisition of materials, which is the only way she can fill the demand for exportation. Only in this way can she increase her income and her quality of life, by establishing her work and making it into a business enterprise.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Lidia Y. se dedica a la confección y costura de prendas en cuero, como ser chamarras, carteras y otros accesorios que vende en la calle Tumusla de la ciudad de La Paz.

Desde muy niña que se dedica a este rubro, aprendiendo el arte de sus padres, Lidia intenta darle un giro a su vida, puesto que ahora tiene dos hijos que mantener.

En la actualidad Lidia es exportadora de prendas y accesorios de cuero, sus prendas son llevadas a Puerto Suarez en la república de Brasil. Para esto, ella necesariamente debe cumplir con un número de prendas confeccionadas por día, por esta razón es que ya tiene dos dependientes que le colaboran en el trabajo.

Lidia necesita de capital para incrementar la adquisición de materiales, que es la única manera de poder cumplir con la demande que la exportación le exige. Solo de esta forma podrá mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, logrando establecer su negocio y convertirlo en una empresa.

loans.use: Lidia needs capital to increase her acquisition of materials, which is the only way to meet the demand for exportation.

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
Justa C., mother of three children, has been a member of Pro Mujer for 3 years. She belongs to the Mujeres del Futuro (Women of the Future) association in the Villa Adela neighborhood.

She works making clothing and other articles out of silk. All her work is handcrafted, made by hand and with a sewing machine. At present she brings all her products to the city of Oruro, where she has the necessary contacts to sell her products. Sometimes she works by special order, but generally she has buyers who wait for her arrival.

At present, Justa is responding to a great demand for clothing, working day and night, which is the only way to fill the demand of her customers. For this reason, she needs capital in order to buy more basic materials. This is the only way she can work peacefully, knowing she will fill the orders from her buyers.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Justa C., madre de tres niños, es socia de Pro Mujer hace 3 años, pertenece a la asociación Mujeres del Futuro de la zona de Villa Adela.

Se dedica a la confección de artículos y prendas de ceda, todos sus trabajos son artesanales y realizados a mano y una máquina de coser. Actualmente lleva toda su producción a la ciudad de Oruro, donde ya tiene los contactos necesarios para poder vender sus productos, en ocasiones trabaja a pedido, pero generalmente tiene ya compradoras que esperan la llegada de Justa.

Actualmente Justa responde a una gran demanda de prendas, trabajando día y noche, la única forma de cumplir con sus clientes. Por tal motivo, ella precisa de capital para poder comprar más materia prima, solo de esta forma podrá trabajar con la tranquilidad necesaria, de saber que va a cumplir con sus compradores.

loans.use: To buy more basic materials so she can work peacefully, knowing she can meet the needs of her buyers.

loans.name: Sergio Ramon

texts.en: I have a small store of used clothes. With this business I support my family and pay the school fees for my children. I have had this business for 10 years in the city of Comayaguela. This is a good location because I have very good clients, people of very low resources who cannot go to buy new clothes. I sell: shirts jeans, shorts, sweaters, pajamas, blouses, dresses. At this moment I need to buy clothes because I do not have a lot of product in stock.

loans.use: Purchase bales of used clothes

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
Dionisia M. is the mother of 8 children, all school-age, and has been a member of the Asociación Futuro of Pro Mujer for four years. Dionisia and her husband work running a mechanic workshop, where they offer metalwork, motor repair, and painting.

In addition to this, she works selling food products, such as dried meat and cheeses, which she brings from the Asunta region and sells at street fairs and markets in the area.

Unfortunately, these two activities do not result in sufficient income to support her large family. For this reason, Dionisia needs capital in order to buy a public transport vehicle (minibus). With this and a membership in a transporters' syndicate she will improve her income without the need to sacrifice her husband, who bears a great deal of the burden of work.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Dionisia M., es madre de 8 hijos, todos en edad escolar, perteneciente a la Asociación Futuro de Pro Mujer, y socia con una antigüedad de 4 años. Dionisia se dedica junto a su esposo, a la atención de un taller mecánico, donde se prestan servicios de chapería, reparación de motores y pintura.

Paralelamente a esto, ella se dedica a comercio de productos comestibles, como ser el charque de res (carne deshidratada), y quesos que trae de la región de la Asunta, para venderlos en ferias y mercados de la zona.

Lastimosamente estas dos actividades no resultan suficientes para la subsistencia de su numerosa familia, es por eso que Dionisia necesita de capital para poder realizar la compra de un vehículo de transporte público (minibús), con el cual y mediante la afiliación de algún sindicato transportista mejorará sus ingresos sin la necesidad de sacrificar al esposo, quien lleva en las espaldas una gran parte de la carga laboral.

loans.use: Dionisia needs capital in order to buy a public transport vehicle (minibus).

loans.name: Ximena

texts.es:
Ximena L. Zambrana, married and mother of 7 children, has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years, and is treasurer for the Asociación Cielo Azul (Blue Sky Association) of Villa Adela.

Ximena works buying and selling mobile telecommunication equipment, especially selling cellular telephones. She is not a wholesaler, rather she is an occasional seller who benefits from some contacts in offices and businesses to be able to sell her merchandise. In some cases it is her husband, who works in student transport, who sells equipment to students in the upper years of private high schools in the Southern part of the city of La Paz.

At present, Ximena has an urgent need for capital, in order to be able to increase her stock of merchandise. One of her daughters is having health problems, and needs an operation to remove a tumor. She needs as soon as possible to put together through sales of her products the necessary amount to cover the cost of this intervention.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Ximena L. Zambrana, casada y madre de 7 hijos, pertenece a Pro Mujer hace dos años, y tesorera de la Asociación Cielo Azul de Villa Adela.

Ximena se dedica a la compra y venta de equipos móviles de telecomunicación, principalmente a la venta de teléfonos celulares, ella no es mayorista, sino es vendedora ocasional, aprovecha algunos contactos en oficinas o negocios para poder vender su mercadería, en algunos casos es el esposo, quien trabaja en transporte escolar que logra la venta de algunos equipos a estudiantes de últimos cursos de colegiuos privados de la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz.

En la actualidad, Ximena precisa con urgencia de capital, para poder incrementar en algo su mercadería, puesto que por cuestiones de salud una de sus hijas debe ser sometida a una operación para la extracción de un tumor, por tanto necesita lo antes posible llegar a reunir mediante la venta de sus productos el monto necesario que cubrirá los gastos de la intervención.

loans.use: Ximena has an urgent need for capital, in order to be able to increase her stock of merchandise. One of her daughters needs an operation to remove a tumor.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.en: I have a small business of zapateria (shoe store), where I repair and make leather and rubber sandals. This business I have been having it for 9 years. Thanks to you I have been able to improve. Now for my shoe store I need to buy leather, rubber, threads, nails etc. With the utilities that the business gives me I help my family.

loans.use: To buy leather, glue, threads, etc

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria is a widow and has three children, the oldest of whom is already married. Since she became a widow, she alone has had to take charge of the expenses of her household and her children's school, and in order to obtain sufficient resources she started her own business making and selling bread in Creel, Chihuahua, her hometown. Her children help her distribute the bread to shops and find new customers. Fortunately, the high quality of Victoria's products and their special flavor has helped her increase her sales.

In order to continue expanding her business, now Victoria needs a loan for $750, which she will use to buy basic materials to increase her production and meet the demand from her customers. She promises to repay this amount in 6 months. Help Victoria improve the quality of life for her family by contributing to the growth of her business. She is sincerely grateful to you.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Victoria es viuda y tiene tres hijos de los cuales el mayor ya está casado. Desde que enviudó tuvo que hacerse cargo de los gastos de su hogar y de la escuela de sus hijos ella sola y para obtener los recursos suficientes comenzó su propio negocio con la elaboración y venta de pan en Creel, Chihuahua, de donde es originaria. Sus hijos le ayudan a repartir el pan en las tiendas y a buscar nuevos clientes, afortunadamente la buena calidad de los productos que elabora Victoria y su especial sabor le ha ayudado a incrementar sus venta.

Para poder continuar creciendo con su negocio ahora Victoria necesita un préstamo de $ 750 dólares que empleará en la compra de materia prima para incrementar su producción y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Ayuda Victoria a mejora la calidad de vida de su familia contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, ella te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam Asipiazu works selling articles of clothing, sportswear, sweaters, and jackets. She buys merchandise locally and distributes it to her customers. At the same time, she is a beauty consultant for stores that deal in cosmetics.

Three years ago she started with this business, which is generating income for her, but not enough to support her three children. At present she lives in the Tembladerani neighborhood of the city of La Paz, living in just two rooms with her children.

Miriam needs capital in order to continue with her business, primarily to pay for her merchandise up-front, since buying on credit ends up costing more and reduces earnings, and for that reason she can't generate enough to support her household.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Se dedica al negocio de la venta de prendas de vestir, deportivos, chompas, chamarras, compra mercadería local y la distribuye entre su clientela. Paralelamente a esta actividad, es consultora de belleza de empresas que se dedican al rubro de la cosmética.

Hace tres años que se dedica a esta actividad, la que le esta generando ingresos, pero no los suficientes como para subsistir con sus tres hijos.

Actualmente vive en la zona de Tembladerani, en la ciudad de La Paz, ocupando solo dos piezas, con sus hijos.

Miriam A., precisa de capital para poder seguir con su negocio, pero principalmente para poder adquirir su mercadería al contado, puesto que al crédito le resulta más costoso, le reduce las ganancias, y por tanto no genera lo necesario para poder llevar el sustento a su casa.

loans.use: Miriam needs capital in order to continue with her business, primarily to pay for her merchandise up-front, since buying on credit ends up costing more and reduces earnings, and for that reason she can't generate enough to support her household.

loans.name: José Raúl

texts.es:
José Raúl (in the center of the photo) is originally from a place called Creel in the state of Chihuahua. He is married and has three small children. His wife is a nurse and works in a town near Creel. To take care of his little ones and obtain the resources the family needs, José started his carpentry workshop next to his house. Fortunately, the good work he does has helped him increase his sales and now, in order to fill all the orders, he uses the help of two employees.

In order to imoprove the quality of his service and to offer more detailed work José needs tools, for which he is requesting a loan for $475, which he promises to repay in 6 months. Be an important part of the development of this business and help this family. They thank you very much for your generosity and support.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

José Raúl (al centro de la foto) es originario de la localidad de Creel en el estado de Chihuahua, está casado y tiene tres pequeños hijos, su esposa es enfermera y trabaja en un pueblo cerca de Creel, para estar al cuidado de sus pequeños y obtener los recursos que necesita su familia José inició su taller de carpintería al lado de casa. Afortunadamente el buen trabajo que realiza le ha ayudado a incrementar sus ventas y para cubrir sus pedidos ahora cuenta con la ayuda de dos empleados.

Para mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece y brindar trabajos más detallados José necesita de herramienta, para lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y ayuda a esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: To buy tools

loans.name: Dunia Maria

texts.es: I have been making and selling tortillas for three and a half years. I have a loyal customer base among my neighbors.   With this business I support my two children so they can go to school.  This is the only means of support we have.

loans.use: To buy corn, lime, firewood and water.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery Durán is a widow and mother of six children and for the past 25 years she has been a merchant of "Arica" products in La Paz. She is dedicated primarily to bringing clothes to her town, where she also sells other types of merchandise, but mainly shoes.

On one morning like so many others on her trip to Arica, Mery was taking care of her merchandise, and the night before there was intense snowfall in the city of El Alto. It had made the sidewalks of the streets quite slippery, and unfortunately Mery didn't pay necessary caution, and she slipped. Due to bad luck, she fell on her head and fell into a terrible coma that lasted three days.

Presently, Mery is recovering from her grave accident, which has not prevented her from worrying about the future of her children, yet still causes her to stagger and walk very slowly. Mary is in need of capital to be able to purchase a truck, with which she hopes to travel to the border to buy her merchandise and in this way reopen her shop, which will be a business that her children can inherit.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Mery Durán, es viuda y madre de 6 hijos, y hace 25 años es comerciante de productos Arica La Paz, se dedica al comercio principalmente de ropa, lleva ropa a esa localidad, y de allá trae todo tipo de mercadería, principalmente calzados. Una mañana de tantas previas a su embarque a Arica, Mery preparaba su mercadería y sus efectos personales, noche antes, cayó una intensa nevada en la ciudad de El Alto, lo que provocó que las aceras de las calles se encuentren sumamente resbalosas, lastimosamente Mery no tomo las previsiones necesarias y resbaló, con tan mala suerte que logró caer de cabeza, ingresando en un coma profundo de más de tres días. Actualmente Mery se recupera de tan grave accidente, lo que no impide que siga pensando en asegurar el futuro de sus hijos, aun tambaleante y de caminar muy pausado, Mery precisa de capital para poder acceder a la compra de un camión, con el cual pretende viajar a la frontera para la compra de mercadería, y de esta forma aperturar una tienda, de esta forma heredar su negocio a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase a truck that will enable her to reopen her shop for her kids.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel is 59 years old and he is married to 57-year-old Daniela Acosta, she is retired and they have 3 children who are 34,30, and 26 years old. They live in their own house together with one of their children who suffered a car accident and he was left paralyzed. The others two live independently, one is already married and other works and goes to the university. The couple used to live in a town near to the city where they had been working in agriculture, until they decided to move to the city where agriculture wasn’t profitable. For this reason they decided to open a grocery store in 2003. This business has allowed them to support their children to finish their studies. Their son suffered the accident two years ago and since then they have had him under special care. Miguel dreams that his son will recover completely one day. The grocery store is located in the same house where they live, and they have a very good clientele.They are asking for a loan of $500 that they will use to buy wholesale products like oil, sugar, corn and canned products.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Miguel de 59 años de edad está casado con Daniela Acosta de 57 años, ella es jubilada y tienen 3 hijos de 34,30, y 26 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia junto con uno de sus hijos que había sufrido un accidente de tránsito y quedo con parálisis. Los otros dos viven de forma independiente, uno ya está casado y el otro trabaja y va a la universidad. La pareja vivía en una localidad cercana a la ciudad donde se dedicaban a la agricultura, hasta que decidieron mudarse para la ciudad por lo que el rubro de agricultura ya no era rentable, es así que decidieron abrir una despensa en el año 2003 con la cual han podido lograr que sus hijos terminen sus estudios, hace dos años que su hijo sufrió el accidente y desde ese entonces lo tienen bajo cuidado especial. Sueña que su hijo pueda recuperarse totalmente algún día. La despensa está ubicada en la misma casa donde viven, y poseen muy buena clientela; desean poder surtir más su mercadería por lo que solicitan un crédito de $ 500 que lo utilizarán para la compra al por mayor de aceite, azúcar, maíz y productos enlatados.

loans.use: Buy wholesale products like oil, sugar, corn and canned products

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
Narcisa Lopez is 48 years old. She is married to Reinaldo Gonzalez, and they have 3 children. They own their house which Narcisa inherited from her father. One of their daughter migrated to the United States due to the bad economic times in the country.

In order to be able to start her own business, she counted with the help of her daughter, who migrated to the United States. Her daughter sent them money and this way they were able to have the sufficient funds to open up their own business in 1995. At first, she opened up a kiosk, but with time the business started to grow and now they have a good size store fully stocked.

Thanks to the earnings they make from the store, they are able to have a better quality of life. With their savings, they have been able to purchase a truck. Her husband travels from house to house selling fruits and vegetables.

Since this has turned out to be a great business venture and sales have increased, she would like to purchase a wide variety of fruits and vegetables in huge quantities for her husband to sell. This is the reason why she is requesting a loan in the amount of $600 to purchase apples, oranges, bananas, pineapples, tomatoes, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Narcisa L., tiene 48 años de edad, está casada con Reinaldo González y tienen tres hijos. Viven en una casa propia que heredó de su padre. Una de sus hijas tuvo que emigrar a Estados Unidos debido a la crisis económica por la cual atravesaban. Para poder abrir su negocio contó con la ayuda de esta hija que se fue a trabajar a los EE.UU. quien les envió el dinero para dicho efecto en el año 1995. Abrió en principio un pequeño kiosco, y con el tiempo gracias a los buenos ingresos el negocio fue progresando paulatinamente y hoy día ya cuentan con una despensa bien surtida.
