Gracias a los buenos ingresos que le genera su despensa han logrado mejorar su calidad de vida. Con unos ahorros que juntaron compraron una camioneta y su marido se encarga de vender casa por casa las mercaderías como frutas y verduras. Como el negocio marcha bien, y da buenos resultados las ventas que realiza su marido, ella desea comprar en grandes cantidades mayor variedad de frutas y verduras por lo que solicita el crédito de $600 para comprar pomelos, naranjas, bananas, piñas, tomates, etc.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit such as apples, pineapples, oranges, bananas, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona is 40 years old and is a single mother to a 22-year old son. A few years ago, Ramona had to travel to Argentina, a country bordering Paraguay, in search of better job opportunities. There, she worked as a maid and, after saving a little money, returned to her country to open her own business.

She opened a small grocery store in a room in her home and, because it is in a good location and there is little competition, she has many customers. She wants to continue to make progress and later expand the size of her store.

She is requesting this loan to purchase additional inventory for her shop - fruits, vegetables, flour, oil and rice.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Ramona tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 22 años. Varios años atrás, Ramona tuvo que viajara a la Argentina (país limítrofe con Paraguay) en busca de mayores oportunidades de trabajo. Trabajo como empleada domestica, y luego de ahorrar un poco de dinero volvió a su país para abrir su propio negocio. Monto una despensa en su propia casa, y gracias a su buena ubicación posee una gran cantidad de clientes ya que en la zona hay muy poca competencia. Ella desea ir progresando de a poco y más adelante ampliar el negocio construyendo un salón más grande. El préstamo que solicita será destinado para la compra de más mercaderías para su despensa, tales como frutas, verduras, harina, aceite y arroz.

loans.use: To buy fruits, vegetables, flour, oil and rice.

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.en:
Mr. Silvestre Caceres is 34 years old, single and the owner of a small butcher shop and grocery store. Due to financial circumstances, he was unable to pursue a college degree, but he made a decision to move forward with his life regardless of the circumstances. He started out with a small stand where he sold fast foods, such as hamburgers, hot dogs, empanadas (meat-filled turnovers) and soft drinks. With much sacrifice, he was able to buy a lot and build a modest house where, after a few years, he opened a small butcher shop and grocery store.

Today he has many clients who buy from him because of his good service and low prices. Silvestre would like to continue to expand his business, where he sells, among other things, sweets, candy, meats, dairy products, vegetables and soft drinks. He is requesting this loan to purchase items like rice, sugar, coffee, flour and canned goods at wholesale prices, which will allow him to generate more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Silvestre C. tiene 34 años de edad, es soltero y es propietario de un negocio dedicado al rubro de la carnicería y despensa. Por cuestiones económicas no pudo seguir una carrera universitaria, pero a pesar de ello el decidió seguir adelante. Empezó con un pequeño kiosco donde vendía diferentes tipos de comidas rápidas como hamburguesas, panchos (hot dogs), empanadas y gaseosas. Con mucho sacrificio compro un terreno y edifico su casa, y luego de varios años pudo abrir en su casa su propia despensa y carnicería.

Hoy día cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes, por el buen servicio, y precios bajos. Silvestre desea seguir creciendo. Entre los productos que vende podemos citar, golosinas, carne, lácteos, verduras, gaseosas, etc. Solicita el préstamo para comprar mercaderías al por mayor como arroz, azúcar, café, harina y productos enlatados, pues de esta forma conseguirá mejores descuentos que lo ayudará a aumentar su ganancia.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise, such as rice, sugar, coffee, flour and canned goods, at wholesale prices

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda Rossana P. T. is 25 years old and has a 2-year old daughter. She has a small store located in her house where she sells stationery, notebooks and cosmetics. She just started her business a year ago. This is her first business and it has been a huge success. She decided to start her business in order stay at home because she did not want to leave her house to work. With her store, she is able to stay at home and take care of her daughter at the same time.

Her husband works long hours in a factory and Hilda usually gives part of her loan to him so he can buy equipment for his job. Without her previous loan, Hilda would not have been able to successfully run her store and support her family because her daughter was sick for a while which caused her to incur more expenses. She reinvests the income she earns each week in her business. Thus, the previous loans she recevied gave more capital to work with and she was able to survive a tough time in her life.

She purchases her merchandise from San Lorenzo and Mercado 4, a market that sells very cheaply-priced products. She travels on an hour-long bus ride to purchase her merchandise. She is hoping to receive another loan to buy more stationery, especially notebooks since the school year has started again after its winter vacation.

loans.use: Buy notebooks.

loans.name: Anibal

texts.en:
Anibal A. M. is 48 years old and his wife is 39. They have four children who are students and help them with their business. They make pan de miel, which is similar to pound cake. It is usually eaten for breakfast or as an afternoon snack, commonly sold in the streets. Starting at 6 in the morning, Anibal and his wife begin preparing the pan de miel to distribute to four other people who help them sell around Itá. They also travel to other cities carrying baskets filled with pan de miel to sell in San Lorenzo and Asuncion, which are both an hour's bus ride away.

It takes Anibal and his wife four hours each day to complete baking the pan de miel. Anibal has a motorcycle that he uses to sell his pan de miel, and also to deliver the pan de miel to the houses of the vendors that work for him. They usually sell about 300 each day.

Anibal was working at a factory three years ago, but was left unemployed after it closed down. His brother-in-law, who also produces pan de miel, showed him how to start his own pan de miel business. Now Anibal and his wife bake everyday using the brick oven they built outside their house. Anibal and his wife are hard workers who take advantage of every opportunity to increase their income. Aside from the pan de miel business, they also own a pig and plan sell in within a couple of months after it gets bigger. With this Kiva loan, Anibal will buy more ingredients to make pan de miel, which includes flour, oil, honey, sugar, milk and eggs.

loans.use: Purchase flour, oil, honey, sugar, milk, and eggs.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio G., 38, is a hard worker and has various sources of income. Besides owning a despensa (Spanish for 'pantry') with his wife, he also buys and sells coal. His wife helps him with the despensa, which they started after they got married about ten years ago. They sell all types of products at their despensa, including bread, drinks, pasta, sauces, brooms, carrots, and cleaners. They are open everyday from 5 in the morning until 7 at night and purchase their merchandise from the market in Itá. They sold very few products when they first started their despensa. However, over the years, they have been able to expand their despensa. Thanks to the loans they have received, they have been able to increase their inventory and business.

Antonion also owns farm animals: chickens, pigs, and cows. He owns over 40 chickens, 5 cows, and 2 pigs in his backyard. He is requesting a $1,000 loan to maintain his farm animals, purchase coal in large quantities to resell, and to purchase more merchandise (drinks, sugar, pasta) for his despensa.

loans.use: Maintain his farm animals and to purchase coal.

loans.name: César

texts.en:
Cesar M. Gimenez, 30, is the father of two children. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. He started his business fixing and changing bus tires five years ago. He changes about 15 tires a day and charges US$3 per tire. He buys his tires from a factory closeby and has one other person helping him with his business.

Before Cesar began his business, he used to work for another auto shop. However, he is very happy that he decided to begin his own business. He has been able to increase his income. He is seeking a loan to purchase more tires to keep his business running.

loans.use: Purchase tires.

loans.name: Estanislaa

texts.en:
Estanislaa Georhina B. started her despensa (Spanish for 'pantry') two years ago. She is 29 years old and has a 9-year old child who is in 4th grade. Before she started her despensa at her house, she sold food and merchandise in the streets. Then she decided to work from her home in order to be closer to her child.

Estanislaa's husband, Bienvenido, 34, works with her at the despensa. They purchase their merchandise from vendors who come to their house to sell and also from the market in Itá. At their despensa, they sell all types of products: vine, beer, pasta, oil, bread, pastries, candy, milk, corn. Estanislaa has a lot of business everyday, mostly people from her neighborhood.

Estanislaa is very thankful for the help from Fundacion Paraguaya. Her business has grown a lot since she first began. With previous loans, she has been able to increase her inventory. She now needs a loan to buy more merchandise, in particular, sugar and drinks, to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase sugar and drinks.

loans.name: Eteulina

texts.en:
Eteluina started her business creating planters and urns four years ago. She works in the backyard of her house with the help of husband. Eteluina and her husband create about 60 planters each week, varying in size and shape. It takes about 2 hours to complete each load and they usually can make seven in each load. If the weather permits and it does not rain, they can finish their work for the week within three days. They use the sun and the wind to dry the cement.

Eteluina and her husband are suppliers for a few companies. Every week they fill up a truck to deliver the urns to their clients in other cities.

Eteluina and her husband are also parents of five children. One of their children is working in Spain and the other four occasionally help them with their work. Before starting their business, they worked selling outdoor wear clothing, such as Champion. They are in need of a loan to buy sand to use in their mixture to create cement.

loans.use: Purchase sand.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys Avelina A. Carballo works in her house as a hair stylist. She offers a variety of hair services: perms, hair coloring, cuts, blow-drying, and highlights. She has fewer clients in the winter, but during the summer, she has many clients each day. For example, now in the winter, she sees about 5 customers per day.

Gladys, 37, is the mother of three children, aged 18, 11 and 2. She began her business in her house 10 years ago, but started working at age 17 with her mother. Gladys is currently constructing a new building that costs her US$1600. It is located in front of her house, and she plans to move her current working area into the new building where she will place her new salon and also a small snack store. She wants to sell fast food and drinks, such as empanadas, milanesa, and sandwiches.

She is very happy that her business has been successful enough that she can expand further. With her loan, she wants to finish the construction of the salon and her small food shop. She also needs to install security bars in order to prevent robberies.

loans.use: To finish construction of a new hair salon.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel R. Cabrera, 40, is the mother of two children, aged 12 and 5, and is also expecting a baby in the following months. She sells all types of vegetables and fruits in her horse-drawn cart. She works everyday from 6 to 11 in the morning. She travels around the neighborhood selling mantioca, onions, carrots, peppers, apples, and mandarins. The type of vegetables and fruits that she has in her cart varies each day, depending on what she purchases from the market in Itá.

Before she started selling vegetables and fruits 12 years ago, Isabel used to work as an employee in peoples' homes. However, she is very content with her current source of income and is working as hard as possible in anticipation of her baby, who is due in a few months.

Isabel is seeking a $100 loan to use as capital to purchase her vegetables and fruits from the market. Due to the nature of her business, she does not have much capital twith which to purchase her products in larger quantities.

loans.use: Purchase mantioca, onions, carrots, and peppers.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael M. Tobal is a tailor specializing in men suits. He started working as a tailor at age 18 and has been working in this field for the past 25 years. He works from home but is an employee of Riojana, a store in Asuncion. He has been working with Riojana for 20 years now. Ismael has four employees who work for him from their own houses. He supplies about 35 suits each week to Riojana. Riojana supplies him with the fabric and Ismael gets paid for his labor per suit.

Ismael, 44, is married and the father of four children who are all studying in school. He is a hard worker and an entrepreneur. He began his micro enterprise as a one-person business, and now has four other people working for him. Without a loan, he would not have been able to hire his employees and expand his production. Now he is able to supply more suits to Riojana than when he first began his job as a tailor.

Ismael is in need of a $200 loan to use as capital to purchase needles, thread and sewing equipment. He hopes to expand his business in the future, possible hiring another employee.

loans.use: Purchase needles, thread, sewing equipment

loans.name: Juan Domingo

texts.en:
Juan Domino A. Franco, 34, started his business seven years ago. After high school, he studied for two years specializing in automobiles. He is an electrician for all types of vehicles, including trucks, cars, and buses. Most of his clients are passers-by. He usually has more clients when it is cold out, and less when it is warm out. It takes him approximately two hours to finish his work on each vehicle.

Juan is also the father of 4 children, 3 of whom are students. His wife is a licensed nurse, but currently unemployed because there are very few available jobs in her field. For now, she stays at home to look after their children.

With the help of his loan, Juan will be able to pay for rent for his business as well as purchase more wrenches and small parts to fix cars.

loans.use: Purchase wrenches and to help with rent.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar P. and his wife have a stand along the highway Acceso Sur where they work every day. They sell all products that contain honey which includes syrup, pan de miel, and other types of sweet products. They wake up at 6 in the morning to travel to set up their stand and usually work until 6 at night. Weekends are their busiest days. The number of people that buy from them each day varies. Most of their customers are people that pass by on the highway.

Before starting their stand, La Paraguayita, they used to make their own products to sell at their house. Now, they simply buy their products from Oscar's father-in-law's factory, Fruteria Paraguari, to resell.

Oscar is very happy with his business and thankful for the opportunities that his previous loan has provided him. Due to the nature of his business, his capital is very small. Thus, with his new loan, he seeks to invest in his business and be able to buy his merchandise in larger quantities. He is also thinking of new ways to expand his business and perhaps to build a sturdier stand.

loans.use: Buy pan de miel, syrup, and other honey products.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona A. P., 23, works as a hairdresser. This October will mark four years since she started her salon. She began working as an employee for another salon, but then decided to work for herself. She currently works by herself in the salon but plans to hire another person to help her out by the end of this year.

She works everyday except on Sundays from 8 in the morning until 6 at night. Sometimes, she stays till as late as 8pm to finish working on her customers. At minimum, she sees about 5 clients each day with Saturday being her busiest day.

Ramona used her previous loan to invest in her business. For example, she used her last loan to purchase two new beige rotating chairs for the salon. Her new project is to remodel her counter. She wants to buy a new counter so her equipment is more accessible. This is important especially with the arrival of the summer season, which is her busiest season.

loans.use: To build a new counter for her hairdressing salon.

loans.name: Sinforiano

texts.en:
Sinforiano O. Sosa, 41, is a married father of four children. In addition to owning a despensa (Spanish for 'pantry'), he has about 30 chickens and 1 pig. He bought the chickens about four years ago and plans to buy more from San Lorenzo in the following months. Each day his chickens produce about 25 eggs that he sells in his despensa.

Sinforiano sells a variety of food and household products such as sugar, rice, oil, bread, cookies, candy, drinks and soap at his dispensa. With the help of his wife, Sinforiano has been able to successfully run his business for the past five years. His wife is a seamstress and a haircutter.

Sinforiano is seeking a loan to expand his business. He plans to buy sugar and rice for his despensa; purchase more chickens to increase his profit margin; and to buy another pig by the end of the year. Every six months Sinforiano buys a new pig to resell in the future after it has grown. He also needs to buy more lettuce to feed his chickens.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, chicken, lettuce

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia Graciela A. Carballo, 31, is a mother of two children aged 12 and 9. She owns a despensa (Spanish for 'pantry') in her house where she sells products such as wine, tomato sauce and pasta. In addition to her despensa, she just began to sell meat a week ago in order to increase her earnings. She purchases the meat from the market and then prepares the meat for its various purposes. She prepares and sells the meat that is used for milanesa, a popular sandwich, and also for other dishes. Thus far, her meat sales have been very successful because she has many clients who purchase the meat from her despensa.

In a way, Venancia is continuing a family business as her mother used to own a despensa and after she closed hers, Venancia decided to open a despensa of her own. It has been just two years since Venancia started her despensa. Before this, she was a housewife and took care of the children.

Venancia is seeking a $300 loan to purchase merchandise from the market in Itá for her new business.

loans.use: Purchase meat.

loans.name: Maria Andrea

texts.en: I have a small business selling perfumes and creams. I have this business in my house. I am a hawker. I visit offices and my neighbors. They are clients than I have. Now I need to buy products to be able to increase my sales in these months. With this business, I help my husband with the expenses that we have with our children.

loans.use: Purchase lotions, creams, and gels for the body and the face.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana Maria is 44 year old and has been with her husband Leonardo for more than 20 years. They have 5 children. Both Ana Maria and Leonardo work cultivating a small farm, which they've have done for more than 25 years. They grow all types of vegetables such as tomatoes, cauliflower, lettuce and other types of greens.

Every day they get up very early. At 3AM, Ana Maria drives to the produce market in the capital to sell their products, while Leonardo takes care of the daily work on the farm. Ana Maria is very proud of the work they've done, and grateful that they've been able to acquire the comforts they have in their home, not to mention that they've built a comfortable and cozy house thanks to their efforts.

They have made good use of the loans since today it's very difficult without the extra help. In this case, the loan will be used to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides that they need for their business.

Ana María tiene 44 años y está en pareja con Leonardo de 47 años. Viven juntos hace más de 20 años y tienen 5 hijos. Tanto Ana María como Leonardo se dedican al cultivo de la chacra, actividad que desarrollan hace más de 25 años. Cultivan todo tipo de verduras como: tomates, acelga, coliflor, lechuga y otro tipo de hortalizas. Todos los días se levantan muy temprano pues Ana María se dirige a las 3 a.m. al mercado de abasto que queda en la capital a fin de comercializar sus productos, mientras que Leonardo debe dirigirse a la chacra para realizar sus labores diA.. Ana María manifiesta que está muy orgullosa del trabajo que realiza debido a que gracias al mismo ha podido adquirir todas las comodidades con que cuenta su hogar sin olvidar de mencionar que han construido también, gracias a dichos ingresos, una confortable y acogedora casa. Siempre han recurrido a los préstamos debido a que hoy día es muy difícil trabajar sin la ayuda de los mismos. En esta oportunidad el crédito lo utilizarán para la compra de abonos, semillas e insectidas que serán empleados en sus cultivos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Buy fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Angélica is 46 years old and a single mother of 3 children. They are already grown and only one still lives with her.

She has had a small grocery store in her own home for over 20 years. Angélica says that from a very young age she had to go out and work because she came from a very humble family. She worked as a domestic employee in family homes until she was able to get other work selling food in a small stand which she set up in a strategic location in the city of Itá. Nonetheless she had to close that business due to the fact that she was the victim of various assaults, and from there she decided to install the small grocery store that is now in her home.

Now she has a very established clientele, which is why she has decided to continue with her little business because, as she herself states, the income she obtains with the sales help her to live peacefully and without worries.

She needs a loan to diversify her shop more, buying merchandise like: sugar, rice, noodles, flour, oil, etc.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer) Angélica tiene 46 años, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, todos ya son mayores de edad y solamente uno de ellos vive con ella.

Posee una pequeña despensa que funciona en su casa propia desde hace más de 20 años. Angélica comenta que desde muy pequeña tuvo que salir a trabajar debido a que provenía de una familia muy humilde. Trabajaba como empleada doméstica en casas de familia hasta que pudo conseguir otro trabajo vendiendo comestibles en un pequeño copetín que instaló en una zona estratégica de la ciudad de Itá. Sin embargo tuvo que cerrar dicho negocio debido a que fue victima de varios asaltos y fue allí que se decidió a instalar la pequeña despensa que ahora funciona en su casa.

Ahora ya cuenta con una clientela muy bien formada por lo que está decidida a continuar con su pequeño negocio debido a que, según ella misma manifiesta, los ingresos que obtiene con las ventas le ayudan a vivir tranquila y sin preocupaciones.

Necesita de un préstamo para surtir mejor su despensa comprando mercaderías tales como: azúcar, arroz, fideo, harina, aceite, etc.

loans.use: To buy sugar, oil, flour, rice, etc.

loans.name: Mirna Lila

texts.en: Hello, my name is Mirna Lila R.. I sell portfolios and knapsacks. I have been in this business for 8 years. I run this small business in my house. I have attracted my clients by visiting offices where I sell my products. With the income that I have from my business, I help my family with our monthly expenses.

loans.use: Purchase portfolios, knapsacks and briefcases

loans.name: Anibal

texts.en:
Anibal is 37 years old and has lived with his 48 year old common-law wife, Nelly, for about 20 years. Nelly is a seamstress who makes clothing to order. The couple have an 11 year old daughter who attends the 5th grade.

Anibal makes slingshots from a workshop in his home and he sells them wholesale to retail shop owners. He has been in the business for 12 years, having learned this trade after losing his job in a horse tack shop. Since he didn't attend school, he needed a trade that would allow him to support his wife and daughter, and he thanks God that he's done well.

He gets up at 4 AM every day and works well into the evening to fill the orders he receives each week. When the work proves to be more than he can handle, his wife and daughter help him out.

He is requesting this loan to buy hides, which are the main raw material he uses to make the slingshots, as well as rubber bands, which he would get a lower prices if he had enough capital to buy them wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Anibal tiene 37 años. Vive en pareja con Nelly de 48 años desde aproximadamente 20 años. Su pareja es modista y confecciona ropas sobre pedido. La pareja tiene 1 hija de 11 años de edad que está estudiando el 5to. Grado de la escuela primaria. Anibal se dedica a la fabricación de resorteras que luego vende a los comerciantes que retiran la mercadería de su propia casa. Hace 12 años que se dedica a la misma actividad, aprendió el oficio luego de quedarse sin trabajo ya que anteriormente trabajaba en una talabartería. Debido a que no cuenta con estudios tuvo que buscar una profesión con la cual poder salir adelante y lograr mantener a su esposa e hija y gracias a Dios le va bien en su trabajo actual. Todos los días se levanta a las 4 a.m. y trabaja hasta muy entrada la noche para poder cumplir con la demanda que tiene todas las semanas, cuando ya no puede sólo con el trabajo, le ayudan su esposa e hija en la tarea de fabricar las resorteras. Solicita un préstamo para comprar de las curtiembres los restos de cuero que utiliza como materia prima para la fabricación de sus productos, además de adquirir también las gomas que comprando en cantidad le ofertan a un mejor precio.

loans.use: To purchase hides and rubber bands

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos is 35 years old. He married Dionisia 2 years ago, though he adds that they have lived together for the past 15 years. His wife is 36 years old. She is a housewife who dedicates herself to raising their three children, ages 13, 6, and 3 years old. Their oldest son is in 8th grade and their second son will soon be in first grade.

Carlos is a mechanic and runs a shop out of his house. He learned the trade at another shop, until he had the opportunity to begin his own business.

He mentions that a year ago, his wife underwent surgery and he had to sell some of his equipment to pay for her medical care. Once the family overcame that situation, he was able to return to his work thanks to much effort and dedication. He dreams of opening a larger shop where he can better attend to his clientele and incorporate the sale of parts for all types of vehicles.

He always uses loans to invest in the purchase of tools. This time, he needs to buy soldering equipment which will cost approximately $300 USD.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos tiene 35 años, está casado con Dionisia hace 2 años pero comenta que conviven juntos desde hace 15 años aproximadamente. Su esposa que ahora tiene 36 años es ama de casa y se dedica al cuidado y la educación de sus 3 hijos de 13, 6 y 3 años respectivamente. El mayor de sus hijos cursa el 8vo. Grado de la secundaria y el segundo ya va al primer grado de la primaria.

Carlos es mecánico de profesión y tiene un taller mecánico que funciona en su casa propia. Comenzó trabajando en un taller ajeno en donde aprendió todo lo que sabe hasta que tuvo la oportunidad de montar el suyo propio.

Comenta que hace un año su esposa tuvo que ser intervenida quirúrgicamente razón por la cual tuvo que vender varias de sus herramientas para costear todos los gastos que demandó dicha intervención. Una vez superada dicha situación logró remontar nuevamente su trabajo, gracias a mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Sueña con levantar alguna vez un tinglado en donde podrá atender mejor a su clientela además de incorporar la venta de repuestos para vehiculos de todo tipo.

Siempre recurre a los préstamos los cuales invierte en la compra de herramientas, en esta oportunidad necesita adquirir una soldadura cuyo costo es de aproximadamente U$S 300.

loans.use: To buy tools.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora is 42 years old, she is married to Isabelino Marín, and they have two children, ages 19 and 17 respectively. The older studies Psychology at the university, and the younger is still attending high school.

Flora is the proprietor of a beauty salon which she operates in a rented location. She has worked in this field for 21 years. She says that after she finished high school, because she came from a very humble family, she did not have the opportunity to study for a career at the university, but nonetheless her mother paid for a beauty school course which she succeeded in finishing with much effort, thus acquiring her profession.

Due to the enormous cost of the education of her children, she must redouble her efforts to obtain sufficient income to cover them. That's why she is open every day, whether it's raining, cold, or hot, and even on holidays.

She has always used loans to invest in the beauty salon. This time she is requesting a loan to buy articles such as: dyes, shampoos, gel, and creams, and also to renew the elements of her work such as: hair dryer, curling iron, scissors, etc.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Flora tiene 42 años, está casada con Isabelino Marín y tienen 2 hijos, de 19 y 17 años respectivamente. El mayor estudia en la universidad la carrera de Psicología y el menor aún está siguiendo la secundaria.

Flora es propietaria de una peluquería que funciona en un local alquilado, se dedica a la misma actividad hace 21 años. Comenta que al terminar la secundaria y debido a que provenía de una familia muy humilde no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera universitaria, sin embargo su madre pudo pagarle un curso de peluquería que logró terminar con mucho esfuerzo, adquiriendo así la profesión.

Debido al enorme costo que demanda la educación de sus hijos debe redoblar esfuerzos para obtener los ingresos suficientes para costearlos, por tal motivo abre todos los días, así llueva, haga frío o calor, además de los días feriados.

Siempre recurrió a los préstamos para invertirlos en su peluquería. En esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo para comprar artículos como ser: tinturas, shampoos, gel, cremas además de renovar sus elementos de trabajo como ser: secador de pelo, planchita, tijeras,etc.

loans.use: To buy dyes, shampoo, hair dryer, etc.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 48 years old and is married to Roberto, who is 49. They have been together for 25 years and have raised six children who are their pride and joy and their reason for being.

They met when they were very young and even back then worked selling clothing, sheets and blankets. They still have the same business and nowadays their children help out as well. They are pleased with their income so far, as it has allowed them to build a small but comfortable home and to furnish it with furniture and electric appliances.

They have always invested the proceeds of their loans in merchandise and they plan to use this loan to purchase sheets, blankets, etc. to meet increased demand.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Genara tiene 48 años y está casada con Roberto quien actualmente tiene 49 años de edad. Hace 25 años que viven juntos y han logrado criar a 6 hijos que son su orgullo y razón de vivir. Se conocieron cuando eran muy jóvenes y ya desarrollaban la venta de articulos de todo tipo como ser: sábanas, frazadas, ropas de temporada, etc. Hoy día continúan realizando la misma actividad y sus hijos le ayudan con la tarea. Están muy conformes con las ganancias que obtienen con sus ventas pues gracias a ellas han logrado construir una pequeña pero acogedora casa, además de adquirir todos lo necesario para equiparla como ser los muebles y electrodomésticos. Siempre recurrieron a los préstamos para invertirlos principalmente en la compra de mercaderías. En esta oportunidad necesitan el crédito para comprar más mercaderías como sábanas, frazadas, etc. debido a que tienen mucha demanda de las mismas.

loans.use: To purchase blankets and sheets

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is 29 years old and is married to Benjamin, who is 34 years old. Their 9 year old son attends primary school. Benjamin works in agriculture and contributes to the household costs with his earnings from the produce sales. Hilda has a small shop in the municipal market where she also sells used clothing She has been doing this for 7 years. They do not have their own house. They live in their parents house and dream about building their own one day.

Hilda did not have the opportunity to study because her family has few resources. That's why she sacrifices so much day after day so that her son lacks nothing, and has the opportunity to get a university education. She manages an average of 20 clients she attends to daily, as well as occassional clients. She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock the store, such as rice, sugar, noodles, flour, cheese, cooking oil, etc. This will allow her to improve her shop and be able to attract a greater number of customers.

Hilda tiene 29 años, está casada desde hace 3 años con Benjamín que tiene 34 años. Ambos tienen un hijo de 9 años que está estudiando el 4to. Año de la primaria. El esposo de Hilda es agricultor y aporta a los ingresos del hogar con las ganancias que obtiene de la venta de los productos que saca de sus cultivos. Hilda posee una pequeña despensa que funciona en el mercado municipal de Itá y además vende ropas usadas. Hace 7 años que se dedica a la misma actividad. Aún no posee casa propia, vive en la de sus padres y sueña con construirla algún día. Comenta que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar debido a que provenía de una familia de escasos recursos, es por eso que día a día se sacrifica para que a su hijo no le falte nada y tenga la oportunidad de acceder a una educación universitaria. Maneja un promedio de 20 clientes que atiende por día que son fijos y otros tantos ocasionales. Desea acceder a un préstamo para comprar mercaderías como: arroz, azúcar, fideo, harina, queso, aceite, etc. para surtir mejor su despensa y así poder atraer una mayor cantidad de clientela a la misma.

loans.use: To buy oil, sugar, cheese, noodles, etc. for her store.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José R. is 41 years old, and he is married to Silvia López, age 40. They have been together for more than 20 years, and they have raised three beautiful children ages 18, 16, and 4 years respectively. The two older children, in addition to studying, help José and Silvia with their daily work.

José works cultivating crops of all kinds such as: tomatoes, lettuce, beets, etc. He does not own his own land, which is why he has to rent a field to raise the crops. He has done this work for around 6 years, along with his wife who is is unconditional support in all the work he undertakes.

José hopes to some day acquire his own land, so he will no longer have to pay the cost of rent. For now, he is requesting a loan to buy a motor pump, which costs approximately $200, because he wants to construct an artesian well, which is fundamental for this type of activity.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

José R. tiene 41 años , está casado con Silvia López que tiene 40 años de edad. Hace más de 20 años que están juntos y han criado a 3 hermosos hijos de 18, 16 y 4 años respectivamente.Los dos hijos mayores, además de estudiar también ayudan a José y Silvia en sus labores cotidianas.

José se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas de todo tipo como ser: tomates, lechugas, acelgas, etc. No posee tierra propia en donde cultivar por lo que debe alquilar una a fin de llevar a cabo dichos cultivos. Se dedica a la misma actividad hace como 6 años junto con su esposa quien es su apoyo incondicional en toda tarea que él emprende.

José sueña con adquirir alguna vez su tierra propia a fin de no tener que pagar más el costo que le demanda el alquiler.

Por ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de una motobomba cuyo costo es de aproximadamente U$S 200 debido a que desea construír un pozo artesiano que es fundamental para este tipo de actividades.

loans.use: To buy a pump.

loans.name: Herminio

texts.en:
Herminio is 45 years old and is married to Cristina, who is 40. He says they've been happily married for 17 years and have two children, ages 14 and 16, who attend school.

Herminio founded the San Blas School Transportation company with a group of friends 12 years ago and ever since has worked driving students to and from school, Monday through Friday in the mornings, afternoons and evenings. During school vacations, he drives other passengers, such as local hospital workers. He also runs a small electrical supply store from his home, as he's an electrician by trade.

Thanks to the income generated through his hard work, he was able to build a home where he and his family live comfortably. He dreams of owning a second minibus and will one day pursue a loan to make that dream a reality.

For now, he is requesting a loan to replace the 6 tires in his minibus, which cost about $170 each.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Herminio tiene 45 años, está casado con Cristina que tiene 40 años de edad. Comenta que está felizmente casado hace 17 años y que tienen 2 hijos de 14 y 16 años respectivamente. Ambos viven con ellos y están estudiando la secundaria. Herminio fundó hace 12 años la empresa de transporte escolar San Blas con un grupo de amigos y desde entonces se dedica a transportar a los alumnos desde sus casas hasta sus lugares de estudio y viceversa. Dicha actividad la realiza de lunes a viernes de mañana , tarde y noche. Cuenta que en época de vacaciones escolares transporta otro tipo de pasajeros como ser los funcionarios de un hospital de la zona. También cuenta en su domicilio con un pequeño negocio de venta de materiales eléctricos ya que Herminio también es electricista de profesión. Gracias a su trabajo y a los ingresos que ha obtenido con él logró construir su casa propia en la que viven cómodamente él y toda su familia. Sueña con que algún día pueda comprar otro minibus y para ello espera acceder a un crédito a fin de llevar a cabo dicho proyecto. Por el momento necesita de un crédito debido a que desea cambiar las cubiertas de su transporte, el mismo lleva 6 de ellas y cada una le estaría costando aproximadamente US$ 170 cada una.

loans.use: To purchase new tires

loans.name: Mirna Lila

texts.es:
My name is Mirna Lila R., and I have a business selling purses and backpacks for children. I have had this business for 8 years. I sell at offices and to my neighbors in my community. My best customers as the young people that work in offices. With the income I get from the purse sales, I help my husband with the monthly expenses we have in our household.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer) Mi nombre es Mirna Lila R. tengo un negocio de venta de carteras y mochilas para niños. Este negocio lo tengo hace 8 años. Yo vendo a las oficinas y a mis vecinos de mi comunidad. Mis mejores clientes son las jovenes que trabajan en oficinas. Con los ingresos que tengo sobre la venta de cartera ayudo ami esposo con los gastos mensuales que tenemos en nustro hogar.

loans.use: To buy purses and backpacks for children.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Aida is 36 years old. Her partner, Roque, works in masonry. They have 2 children of 9 and 8 years, respectively, and both go to school. Aida comes from a very humble family, which is the reason why she began to work at the age of 13 as a nursemaid to help provide basic sustenance for her already large family. Being very young she already had many responsibilities, such as household chores and work, and because of this she had to put aside her studies while having only an education up to the first year of primary school. Aida invests herself in the sale of jewelry in the Municipal Market of the city of Itá, an enterprise which has developed over 10 years to account for a large clientele. She works every day so that her family will not want for bread and so that her children have the opportunity that life denied her, that her children should have access to a university career and that they be well prepared for life. She needs this loan to increase her stock of merchandise, that is, to buy more hoops, hairbands, rings, bracelets, clasps, etc. At this time, her sales have already increased and she requires money to carry out further purchases.

Translated by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

Aida tiene 36 años, está en pareja con Roque quien se dedica a la albañilería. Tienen 2 hijos de 9 y 8 años respectivamente, ambos hijos van a la escuela. Aida proviene de una familia muy humilde motivo que la llevó a comenzar a trabajar a la edad de 13 años como niñera para ayudar al sustento familiar ya que su familia era muy numerosa. Siendo muy joven ya tenía muchas responsabilidades, tanto con las labores del hogar como en el trabajo, debido a eso tuvo que renunciar a sus estudios teniendo una educación solo hasta el primer año de la primaria. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de bijouterie en el Mercado Municipal de la ciudad de Itá, actividad que desarrolla hace aproximadamente 10 años contando ya con una gran clientela. Trabaja todos los días para que de esta forma a su familia no le falte el pan de cada día y para que sus hijos tengan esa oportunidad que la vida le negó, que es el que sus hijos tengan acceso a una carrera universitaria y que sean personas de bien. Necesita el préstamo para ampliar su stock de mercaderías, es decir para comprar más vinchas, pulseras, anillos, hebillas, etc. ya que en estos tiempos las ventas han aumentado y requiere de dinero para llevar a cabo sus compras.

loans.use: Purchase of hoops, hairbands, rings, bracelets, and clasps.

loans.name: Cirilio

texts.es:
Cirilo is 47 years old. Josefina, his partner of 25 years, is 42 and together they have two children ages 15 and 19. Josefina has worked as a domestic for six years and uses her meager earnings to help with household expenses. Cirilo makes slingshots to sell. He has been doing this for 15 years and is proud to have built his own home and purchased a motorcycle with the profits of his labor. He tells the story of how his older brother urged him to leave his low-paying job as a day laborer to pursue his craft full-time. These slingshots are much in demand and sell well in local stores. Cirilo hopes he can open a shop in his own home, that his wife can leave her low-paying job to tend it and that together they can increase their household income.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Cirilo tiene 47 años, está en pareja con Josefina que tiene 42 años. Hace 25 años que viven juntos y tienen 2 hijos de 19 y 15 años respectivamente. Josefina trabaja hace ya 6 años como empleada doméstica en una casa de familia, percibe un pequeño salario con lo que ayuda a Cirilo con los gastos del hogar. Cirilo se dedica a la fabricación y venta de resorteras, hace 15 años que desarrolla la misma actividad y comenta con orgullo que gracias a este oficio logró construir su casa propia, además de comprarse una moto con la cual sale a vender sus productos. Comenta que se inició en el negocio por insistencia de su hermano mayor, debido a que Cirilo era anteriormente albañil de oficio, pero que dicha actividad no le generaba ingresos constantes debido a que conseguía trabajos muy esporádicamente. Posee mucha demanda de sus productos que luego comercializa en las despensas y supermercados de la zona. Tiene como proyecto abrir una pequeña despensa en su domicilio, negocio que estará a cargo de su pareja, a fin de que la misma deje de trabajar como empleada doméstica y también para obtener mayores ingresos con qué afrontar los gastos diarios que demanda el hogar.

loans.use: To buy leather and rubber to make slingshots.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara is a woman who lives in free union with her partner who gets out of debt working as a solderer in a blacksmith's. They have no children and she began her business to help her partner with the family expenses and at times to be able to come to form a patrimony for them both. She started her business four years ago, begininning with a small investment because of which she had little merchandise, but little by little she reinvested her profits in the business and grew to provide herself with more supply of products to offer in her shop.

Sara is requesting a loan of US $1,100 to recondition her business and suplly it with merchandise to be able to offer greater variety of products to her customers, offering to repay the loan in 6 months. She and her family thank you for the support that you give her to be able to expand, better and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Sara es una mujer que vive en unión libre con su pareja, quien se desempeña trabajando como soldador en un negocio de herrería, ellos no tienen hijos y ella empezó con su negocio para ayudar a su pareja en los gastos familiares y a la vez para poder llegar a formar un patrimonio para ambos. Ella inició con su negocio hace ya cuatro años atrás, empezando con una pequeña inversión por lo que tenía poca mercancía, pero poco a poco fue reinvirtiendo sus excedentes en el negocio y fue creciendo haciéndose de más surtido de productos que ofrecer en su tienda.

Sara está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 1,100 para acondicionar su negocio y surtirlo de mercancía para poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le das para poder ampliar, mejorar y crecer con su negocio.

loans.use: Remodelación

loans.name: Eradio

texts.en:
Eradio is a hard-working man; he's married and his wife helps out in his business selling steak tacos, pirate tacos and hamburgers. They have three small children, whose ages range between 11 and 2 years old. His two brothers-in-law also help with the business.

He started this business to obtain a better income and provide a better standard of living for his family and an education to his children. He had worked for a company for 2 years and didn't earn enough to make ends meet. A year ago he obtained a home loan through a cooperative, Infonavit, and got a small home. There he set up his small business with a small investment, with the dream of being the first in the community.

Eradio is requesting a loan in the amount of $475 to remodel his small business stand and to buy supplies. He will repay this loan over a period of 6 months. Eradio and his family thank you for helping them meet their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Eradio es un hombre muy trabajador, esta casado y su esposa lo ayuda en el negocio que es la venta de tacos de bisteck, piratas y hamburguesas. Ellos tienen tres pequeños hijos, los cuales están en la escuela aún teniendo el mayor de 11 años de edad y el menor que no va a la escuela 2 años de edad. En su negocio también colaboran con el sus dos cuñados. Él empezó con su negocio para tener un mejor ingreso para su familia y poder mejorar su calidad de vida, así como educar a sus hijos, era empleado hace años en una empresa y su sueldo no le alcanzaba para cubrir sus gastos. Hace un año gracias a los créditos de vivienda Infonavit recibió su casita y fue ahí donde inició su negocio con la ilusión de ser el primero en la colonia, el cual lo hizo con una pequeña inversión al inicio.

Eradio esta solicitando un préstamos por US $ 475 para acondicionar su negocio y comprar mercancía como enseres, etc, además de algo de materia prima para el mismo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Él y su familia están muy agradecidos por el apoyo que le das para poder salir adelante con su negocio y poder lograr las metas que se propone.

loans.use: Remodeling of business space

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús is an entrepreneurial man and lives with his partner in common-law union. They have three children, one of which helps him in the business in addition to a relative who also collaborates in the production and sale of steamed breakfast tacos. He began his business to help with household expenses and at the same time to cover the costs of study of his children and their basic upkeep. He began his business 18 years ago by selling tacos in both his house and on a highly-trafficked street, counting for himself already an almost fixed clientele.

Jesús is asking for a loan of $650 to buy a burner with 4 grills which will help by allowing him to give better attention to his clients as well as be able to make more tacos in less time. He is offering to repay the loan in 6 months. He and his family thank you very much for the help which you give him in being able to follow through in creating his business and being able to continue with it in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

Jesús es un hombre emprendedor y vive con su pareja en unión libre, ellos tienen tres hijos, de los cuales uno de ellos le ayuda en el negocio, además de un familiar que también colabora con el en la elaboración y venta de tacos mañaneros al vapor. Él empezó con su negocio para ayudarse con los gastos de su hogar y a la vez poder cubrir los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos y manutención de los mismos. Empezó con su negocio hace ya 18 años vendiendo tacos en su casa y vende en una avenida muy transitada, contando ya con una clientela casi fija.

Jesús está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 650 para comprar un quemador de 4 parrillas el cual le servirá para poder otorgarle mejor atención a sus clientes y además poder hacer más tacos en menos tiempo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Él y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que le das para poder seguir con el crecimiento de su negocio y poder continuar con el mismo.

loans.use: Purchase of work equipment

loans.name: Rosa Lila

texts.es:
I have a business selling "baliadas", buttery tortillas filled with beans. I have run this business for ten years and my baliadas are famous in my neighborhood of Villa Nueva. At this time I need to buy flour, eggs, oil, beans and plantains. I count on this business to support my family.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Yo tengo un negocio de venta de baliadas (tortillas de harina con frijoles y mantequilla). Este pequeño negocio lo tengo hace 10 años en colonia Villa Nueva. Mis baliadas son muy famosas y tengo una buena clientela. Ahora nesecito comprar; harina, huevos, aceite, frijles, platano etc. Este negocio es el que me el sustento diario para poder mantener a mi familia.

loans.use: To buy flour, beans, oil, plantains and dairy products.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is married with four children, all of whom have already married. Her husband is retired and their income cannot cover all of their household expenses. So two years ago on a friend's recommendation Yolanda started her business selling cosmetics through a catalog. Her first clients were family and friends and now through word of mouth she has a growing clientele that requests a lot of cosmetic products. With her business Yolanda now can bring home the extra income necessary that's needed to improve she and her husband's quality of life.

Yolanda is applying for a US$475 loan to buy products for her clients' pending orders, thus keeping her clients and maintaining a good reputation for future recommendations.

Yolanda and her husband are grateful for the support you give in helping her continue and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

Yolanda es una mujer casada y tiene 4 hijos los cuales todos a la fecha están casados, su esposo es una persona jubilada y por lo tanto sus ingresos no cubren el gasto familiar, motivo por el cual ella tuvo que iniciar con su negocio de venta de cosméticos por catálogo, el cual inició hace dos años por recomendación de una amiga. Sus primeros clientes eran sus amistades y familiares, ahora ella ya tiene una clientela la cual ha se ha ido incrementando por recomendación de otros clientes, y le solicitan muchos productos, con su negocio Yolanda ahora puede traer el ingreso extra al hogar que le hace falta para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su esposo.

Yolanda está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 para poder surtir los pedidos pendientes que tiene de sus clientes y así poder retenerlos y quedar bien para mejores referencias, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su esposo agradecen el apoyo que le brindas para poder continuar con su negocio y crecer con el mismo.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 52 years old and has lived with 60-year-old Arsenio Marin for 35 years. The couple have one son who's married and has a daughter of his own, who Gloria and Arsenio care for.

Gloria has a business selling foods like empanadas (turnovers filled with ham and cheese, corn, beef, chicken, etc.) and croquettes (made of ground beef, egg and vegetables). She makes these at home and sells them to wholesale customers who in turn resell them to the public. She also caters special events such as birthdays, baptisms, etc.

She was only 12 years old when she started working and could not finish school, instead helping her mother to make and sell empanadas. That is how she came to learn the trade by which she still makes a living today.

Her husband helps with the family's expenses by selling leather handicrafts. They lead a very humble life but lack for nothing because of their daily hard work.

She is requesting a small loan to purchase flour, meats and eggs and also firewood, which she uses as cooking fuel, at wholesale prices, to be used in the manufacturing of empanadas and croquettes.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria tiene 52 años y está acompañada con el Sr. Arsenio Marín de 60 años desde hace 35 años. La pareja tiene 1 único hijo que ya está casado y a su vez tiene una hija también que se queda a cargo de Gloria y su esposo. Gloria se dedica a la venta de comestibles como: empanadas y croquetas (comidas rápidas muy consumidas en el Paraguay, elaboradas a base de carne molida, huevo y verduras. Las empanadas pueden ser de jamón y queso, choclo, carne, pollo, etc.) que elabora en su domicilio y son retiradas por sus clientes que luego las vuelven a revender. También elabora dichos productos sobre pedido cuando hay algún acontecimiento como cumpleaños , bautismos, etc. Comenzó a trabajar desde los 12 años aproximadamente, por tal motivo no pudo terminar sus estudios, debiendo ayudar a su madre en la elaboración y venta de empanadas, fue así como adquirió el oficio que desarrolla hasta hoy día. Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar gracias a los ingresos que obtiene de la elaboración de productos artesanales en cuero. Llevan una vida muy humilde pero a la vez sin que les falte nada, todo eso gracias al esfuerzo y trabajo diarios. Necesita de un pequeño préstamo para comprar insumos que utiliza en la elaboración de sus empanadas y croquetas como ser: harina , carne, huevo y también la leña con la que cocina dichos alimentos. Esto se debe a que cuando compra en cantidades le sale más barato todo.

loans.use: To purchase meats, flour, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is married and lives in the town of Cadereyta in Nuevo Leon. After getting laid from his previous job and finding it difficult to find employment, the family's expenses started to accumulate and he started his own business selling sweets and fried foods.

That was 18 years ago. Little by little he started stocking more products and based on his customers requests added items such as soft drinks and videogames.

Manuel is requesting a loan in the amount of $925, to be repaid over 6 months, to remodel and expand his shop, allowing him to offer better service to his customers. He and his family thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Manuel es casado y vive en la localidad de Cadereyta en Nuevo León, después de que lo liquidaron de su anterior empleo y al ver la dificultad para encontrar otro trabajo, las deudas familiares comenzaron a acumularse y para poder cubrirlas inició su propio negocio con la venta de frituras y dulces desde hace 18 años, poco a poco fue surtiendo mejor y a petición de sus clientes fue incorporando la venta de otros productos, como refrescos y el servicio de máquinas de videojuegos.

Para darle un nuevo impulso a su negocio ahora Manuel está solicitando un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la remodelación de su tienda para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, no lo pienses más, Manuel agradece sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: Remodeling of his shop

loans.name: Mirna Edit

texts.en:
Mirna is married and has four children. Her husband is retired, but because his pension isn't enough to cover the family's expenses, Mirna started a business four years ago selling notions and gifts. She started with a small investment and little by little stocked a greater variety of products. She now sells a variety of paper and dry goods, along with movie rentals, which have had great results.

Mirna wants to take advantage of the back to school season to increase her sales. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 to purchase merchandise, to be repaid over 6 months. Mirna and her family thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Mirna es casada y tiene 4 hijos, su esposo es jubilado y con la pensión que recibe era insuficiente cubrir todos los gastos del hogar, por lo que desde hace cuatro años iniciaron su negocio de venta de novedades y regalos, empezaron con poca inversión y poco a poco han ido surtiendo mejor su negocio e incrementando la variedad de productos que ofrecen, incorporando artículos de papelería y mercería, ahora también han ofrecen la renta de películas obteniendo muy buenos resultados.

Mirna quiere aprovechar esta temporada en la que es el regreso a clases para incrementar sus ventas y necesita comprar mercancía para lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 1,200 que se compromete a devolver en 6 meses. Decídete a apoyar a Mirna, ella y su familia agradecen mucho la oportunidad que le brindas.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Othman

texts.es:
For eight years I have had a small shop in Comayaguela where I sell used clothing. Many people can't afford to buy new clothing and they come to me instead since they know I keep my prices low. The money I earn from this business lets me support my family and see to it that my two children can finish school.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Yo me dedico a la venta de ropa usada, tengo una pequeña tienda en la ciudad de Comayaguela, este negocio lo tengo hace 8 años. Tengo muy buenos clientes porque tengo buenos precios ya que hay muchas personas que no se pueden comprar ropa nueva. Con este negocio mantengo a mi familia y ayudo amis hijos para que terminen sus estudios.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael is married and his wife is a stay at home mom. They have 6 children between 31 and 20 years of age. It was very difficult to find a job when Rafael got married, so he started his own business to be able to offer to his family a patrimony and to provide everything they need. Previously, he used to work at an upholstery workshop in another city where he learned his craft, which helped him start his business in the city of Linares 30 years ago. First, he used to work at the yard of his house and soon after he built a room for his own upholstery workshop. Three of his children work with Rafael in the family business and together have made it grow. Now, he is requesting for a loan of $925 that he will use to buy raw materials that he need in the production of his work, like fabrics, threads, staples, etc. He promises to repay the loan over a period of 6 months. Be part of this business and contribute to its growth, Rafael and his family are very grateful for your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Rafael está casado y su esposa se dedica al hogar, tiene 6 hijos entre 31 y 20 años de edad. Cuando Rafael se casó le fue muy difícil conseguir un empleo e inició su propio negocio para poder ofrecerle a su familia un patrimonio y darles todo lo necesario, anteriormente trabajaba en otra ciudad en una tapicería y ahí aprendió este oficio, lo que le ayudó a comenzar su negocio hace 30 años en la localidad de Linares en Nuevo León. Primero trabajaba en el patio de su casa y poco después construyó una habitación para dedicarla solo a su tapicería. Tres de sus hijos colaboran con Rafael en el negocio y juntos lo han hecho crecer, ahora él está solicitando un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de materia prima que necesitan en la elaboración de su trabajo, como telas, hilos, grapas, etc., él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte de este negocio y contribuye a su crecimiento, Rafael y su familia agradecen mucho tu generosidad.

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es:
Martha is from Merida, Yucatan. She is married and has a 17-year-old son and two daughters who are 24 and 18 years old. Her husband is a tire technician. In order to be able to help with the family’s expenses and her children’s school tuition, Martha started helping one of her sisters who was working at the local street market four years ago. Later, she decided to become independent and started her own business selling clothes and toys. Little by little she started buying a greater variety of articles. Thanks to the good work she has done, she has managed to make her business grow. At present, Martha needs a loan of $475 that she will use to buy merchandise to cover the demand of her clients and to keep on growing like until now. She promises to repay the loan over a period of 4 months. Be an important part in the development of this business, Martha and her family are sincerely grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha es originaria de Mérida, Yucatán, es casada y tiene un hijo de 17 años de edad y dos hijas de 18 y 24 años. Su esposo es llantero y para poder ayudarlo con los gastos del hogar y pagar las colegiaturas de sus hijos, desde hace cuatro años Martha comenzó a ayudarle a una de sus hermanas que vendía en un tianguis, después decidió independizarse e inició su propio negocio con la venta de ropa y juguetes, poco a poco fue surtiendo una mayor variedad de artículos y ha hecho crecer su negocio gracias al buen trabajo que realiza. En estos momentos, Martha necesita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, Martha y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: María Adela

texts.es:
Maria Adela is married and has a 25 year-old daughter. Due to the lack of employment that exists in the country, it was very difficult for her husband to find a job. In order to pay their debts, he began selling plants at the principal intersections of the town of Progreso, in Yucatán, which is where they live. Maria Adela helps him in his business and thanks to their effort and the good work they do, they were able to put a small nursery in their home. That is where they take care of the plants and where they also sell garden accessories.

Due to the experience that Maria Adela has gained, she knows that they are about to enter into a busy sales period, and she wants to stock the business well in order to cover the demands of their customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of $475.00, which she will pay back in 5 months. Help this family by contributing to the growth of this business. Maria thanks you very much for any help you are able to give her.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, a Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Adela es casada y tiene una hija de 25 años de edad. Ante la falta de empleo que hay en el país a su esposo le fue muy difícil conseguir un trabajo y para solventas sus deudas, hace catorce años, comenzó a vender plantas en los cruceros principales de la localidad de Progreso en Yucatán, de donde son originarios, Adela le ayuda en su negocio y gracias al esfuerzo y buen trabajo que los dos realizan pudieron hacer un pequeño vivero en su casa, ahí es donde están al cuidado de las plantas y también han incorporado la venta de accesorios para jardín.

Con la experiencia que ha adquirido Maria sabe que está por comenzar una buena temporada de ventas y quiere abastecer su negocio para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes, por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares mismo que regresará en 5 meses. Ayuda a esta familia contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, Maria agradece mucho cualquier apoyo que puedas brindarle.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 46 years old and lives with Eugenio, a furniture refinisher, with whom she has four children, ages 26, 22, 16 and 11. The two oldest are married and the two youngest still live at home and attend school. She went to work as a maid to help her mother when she was 16 years old and never finished school, having many obligations and no time for studying.

For the past two years she has been running a small grocery stand from her home. With her partner's unconditional support, she has been able to make ends meet and provide for her children what she was unable to pursue herself - a college education.

She belongs to a group called Solidarity Women's Committee, along with 20 other women who support each other and serve as guarantors' for each other's loans.

Julia is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise to stock her small grocery stand with items like noodles, yerba (similar to green tea), sugar, rice, sweets, soft drinks, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia tiene 46 años, está en pareja con Eugenio que se dedica a lustrar muebles y con quien tiene 4 hijos de 26, 22 , 16 y 11 años respectivamente. Los dos hijos mayores ya están casados mientras que los dos menores viven con ella y aún siguen estudiando. Empezó a trabajar a los 16 años como empleada doméstica para ayudar a su madre, eso le impidió culminar sus estudios ya que tenía muchas preocupaciones y poco tiempo para dedicarle al estudio. Actualmente tiene un pequeño kiosko que funciona hace 2 años en su domicilio, con la ayuda incondicional que recibe de su pareja consiguió salir adelante y de esta forma brindarle a sus hijos todo lo que la vida le impidió, es decir el poder terminar una carrera universitaria. Ella forma parte de un grupo denominado Comité Mujeres Solidarias integrado por 20 mujeres que responden solidariamente por los créditos a los que acceden a través de dicho comité. Julia necesita de un préstamo de U$S 150 para de esta forma poder surtir su pequeño negocio con mercaderías tales como: fideos, yerba, azúcar, arroz, golosinas,bebidas, etc.

loans.use: To purchase candy, soft drinks, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Julia Margarita

texts.es:
Julia is 35 years old and has a domestic partner. She has a 14 year old daughter and two sons that are 7 and 9 years old. Six years ago, Julia started a business selling natural juice to support herself and her partner ,since he's been living on a low pension. Upon her customers' requests, Julia started to sell soft drinks, which was successful. Now she sells articles and trinkets and some clothing. Due to her savvy sales skills and desire to provide a good education for her children, Julia works even harder day to day.

Currently, she is seeking a loan of $475 which she will use to buy more merchandise to keep her business well-stocked and thus, offer good service. She promises to repay the loan in 3 months. The well-being of her family is in your hands. Make the choice to help Julia - she and her family are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia tiene 35 años de edad, vive en unión libre, tiene una hija de 14 años de edad y dos hijos de 7 y 9 años. Hace seis años Julia comenzó a vender jugos naturales para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar ya que él está pensionado y recibe un ingreso muy bajo, poco después, a petición de sus clientes, Julia incorporó la venta de refrescos obteniendo muy buenos resultados, ahora también vende artículos de mercería y un poco de ropa, gracias a su gusto por las ventas y al deseo que tiene de que sus hijos puedan tener una buena educación Julia se esfuerza día con día por mejorar su negocio.

Ahora esta solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para tener bien surtido su negocio y ofrecer un buen servicio, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, decídete a ayudar a Julia, ella y su familia te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela is 22 years old and the mother of two young children, 2 and 3 years old. She is a single mother and can't count on anybody else to help her and her family. In search of better opportunities, she moved to the states of Quintana Roo, in the Yucatan. To obtain the necessary resources and care for her children, she decided to start her own business selling clothing. Thanks to the help of a loan, she has been able to grow her business.

Carmela has had to work very hard, but the love she has for her children motivates her day after day. To continue growing her business, Carmela is requesting loan of $925 so that she can muy more merchandise wholesale, and offer better prices to her clients. She has agreed to repay this loan in 5 months. She and her children need your support, and very much appreciate your help.

Carmela tiene 22 años de edad, es una madre muy joven de dos pequeñas de 2 y 3 años de edad, está soltera y no cuenta con la ayuda de nadie para sacar adelante a su familia, en busca de mejores oportunidades se mudó de Quintana Roo a la localidad del Progreso en Yucatán, aquí para obtener los recursos que necesitan y a la vez estar al pendiente de sus niñas decidió comenzar su propio negocio con la venta de ropa, donde gracias a las facilidades de pago que ofrece ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio.

Carmela ha tenido que esforzarse mucho pero el amor hacia sus hijas la motiva a seguir día con día. Para continuar creciendo con su negocio Carmela está solicitando un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía a mayoreo para poder ofrecer buenos precios a sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 5 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Carmela, ella y sus pequeñas necesitan y agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.es:
Leoncia is 57 years old, and has been married for 30 years to her husband Juan Tomas, who is 59 years old. They have two sons who are already married with children.

Leoncia has been selling food snacks in a market for 30 years. She sells fast food such as empanadas, tortillas and meat cutlets, which are very popular with the people who visit the market each day. She gets up at 5AM and serves her customers all day, stopping only late in the day after all the business has been done. She doesn't take days off for personal reasons or for holidays, every day she is at work, as she has done for the past 30 years.

Her husband works in a shop and helps with the household costs. They have their own house and many of the comforts to live well. However, a loan will enable her to buy things like meat, bread, flour, eggs, etc, in bulk, so that they can earn more profits.

Leoncia tiene 57 años, está casada con Juan Tomás de 59 años hace 30 años aproximadamente. El matrimonio tiene dos hijos varones mayores de edad que a su vez ya están casados y con hijos. Leoncia se dedica a la venta de comestibles en el mercado de Itá desde hace 30 años. Vende comidas rápidas como empanadas, tortillas, milanesas, etc. que son muy solicitadas por las personas que acuden diariamente a dicho lugar. Se levanta muy temprano, a las 5 a.m.ya se encuentra atendiendo a su numerosa clientela en su puesto y se retira muy entrada la tarde cuando ya todos los demás negocios han cerrado también. No conoce de días de lluvia, frío o feriados, todos los días acude sin falta a su lugar de trabajo como hace 30 años atrás. Su esposo trabaja como sereno en un taller y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Cuenta con casa propia y todas las comodidades necesarias para un buen vivir. Manifiesta sin embargo que el dinero no le alcanza por lo que debe recurrir a un préstamo para la compra de carne, panificados, harina, huevos, etc. en cantidad a fin de que le salga más barato.

loans.use: Purchase meat, flour, eggs in bulk

loans.name: Avelino

texts.es:
For 38 years, Avelino has offered his service as a taxi driver. He is from Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, is married and has three children 15, 17 and 20 years of age. He started out renting the vehicle to work, but thanks to the savings that he was able to accumulate he came to acquire his own taxi. Recently he finished up the modernizing of his one and is paying for a second vehicle.

Right now Avelino is requesting a loan for $925 that he will employ in the repair and maintenance of his taxi in order to offer better service to his customers and to continue growing as a small business owner. He pledges to repay this amount in 6 months. Help this family by supporting Avelino; he is very grateful for your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 38 años Avelino ofrece sus servicios de taxista, es originario de la Monterrey, Nuevo León, está casado y tiene tres hijos de 15, 17 y 20 años de edad. Comenzó rentando el vehículo para trabajar, pero gracias a los ahorros que pudo acumular logró adquirir su propio taxi, recientemente acaba de modernizar su unidad y esta pagando un segundo vehículo.

En estos momentos Avelino está solicitando un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la reparación y mantenimiento de su taxi para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y continuar creciendo como microempresario, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Ayuda a esta familia apoyando a Avelino, él agradece mucho tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: Repair and maintenance of his taxi - Reparación y mantenimiento de su taxi

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia G. is 49 years old, and has been married for 18 years to Sergio Oporto. They have two children, 14 and 17 years old, who live with them and study at school. Lidia has worked as a seamstress for more than 31 years, and has had a small business selling merchandise from her home for two years. She is a hardworker and has sacrificed a lot since the work left her little time and she had to stop her studies.

Today, thanks to the support she has received from her husband, she has been able to progress forward and give her children the opportunity she never had, to study and one day get a university degree. Lidia is part of a group of 20 hardworking women, who work together to pay back the loans received through this committee. She needs $200 to buy fabric, threads, buttons, zippers, etc. which she will use in her home business.

Lidia Giménez tiene 49 años de edad, está casada con Sergio Oporto hace 18 años , con quien tiene 2 hijos adolescentes de 17 y 14 años respectivamente, ambos viven con ellos y están estudiando en la secundaria. Lidia se dedica a la costura hace más de 31 años y tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de mercería que funciona hace 2 años en su domicilio. Es una mujer sumamente sacrificada ya que desde los 13 años empezó a trabajar. Debido a que el trabajo le dejaba poco tiempo tuvo que dejar los estudios. Hoy día gracias al apoyo que recibe de su esposo puede sacar adelante a sus hijos y los mismos tienen la oportunidad que ella no tuvo que es la de estudiar y lograr algún día un título universitario. Lidia forma parte de un grupo conformado en su totalidad por mujeres que se denomina Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, que está integrado por 20 personas muy trabajadoras y responden solidariamente por los créditos a los que acceden a través de este comité. Ella necesita U$S 200 para la compra de telas, hilos, cierres, botones, etc. que pondrá a la venta en la ya mencionada mercería de su propiedad.

loans.use: Purchase thread, buttons, fabrics.

loans.name: Luz Marlene

texts.es:
Lourdes, 23, is partnered with Alberto Duarte with whom she has two children, a 3-year old toddler and a 7-month old baby. She was only able to attend school to the 6th grade because her family had very little and she had to help provide for them. She wasn’t like other children her age because the necessity of helping to provide for a large family required that she go out and sell fruits and vegetables on the street for the very little money it provided.

She regrets that she wasn’t able to stay in school but today she works with her partner, Alberto, selling lottery tickets and candy on the buses that travel up and down the streets of the capital. She also operates a small kiosk in her house.

She needs the loan to buy merchandise for the kiosk--candy, cigarettes, soft drinks, cookies, etc.—so that she will no longer have to go out on the increasingly dangerous streets of the city and so that she can stay at home and care for her two small children who need her very much.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Lourdes tiene 23 años, está en pareja con Alberto Duarte con quien tiene 2 hijos, uno de 3 años y el otro de 7 meses. Sólo pudo asistir a la escuela hasta el 6to.
