Grado, ya que provenía de una familia de escasos recursos, teniendo tan solo 8 años ella nunca fue como otros niños de su edad, ya que por la necesidad de la familia ya que eran numerosos tuvo que salir a trabajar en la calle vendiendo frutas y verduras para de esta forma poder aportar un poco de dinero para ayudar a su madre.

Ella lamenta el no haber podido estudiar, pero hoy día trabaja con su pareja en la venta de cartones de juegos de azar y caramelos en los colectivos que hacen sus recorridos por las calles de la capital. También posee un pequeño kiosko que funciona en su domicilio.

Necesita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para su kiosko como ser: caramelos, cigarrillos, gaseosas, galletitas, etc. para de esta forma no tener que salir a trabajar ya que cada día la vida por las calles es más peligrosa y poder quedarse en su domicilio a cuidar de sus pequeños hijos que la necesitan mucho.

loans.use: Buy lottery tickets for re-sale.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita R., 50, is a single mother of 2 children who are, respectively, 31 and 16 years old. The oldest is married and independent; the youngest is still in school and, according to Margarita, is her main reason for living. She’s a woman who gave up a lot to provide for her large family, a family with few resources, and she didn’t have the opportunity to finish school because had to begin working to help her family when she was only 8 years old. Margarita has had a small grocery store in her home for 3 years, one of the busiest in the area. She uses the income that she gets from the store to pay for her son’s schooling.

Margarita is a member of the “Comite de Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Committee of Entrepeneurial Women), also called “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (Working Women), made up of 20 women who stand solidly behind the loan. She’s asking for $150 to buy pasta, flour, cookies, candy, meat, etc. to increase the range of merchandise that she can sell.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Margarita R. tiene 50 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 31 y 16 años respectivamente. El mayor de los hijos ya es casado e independiente, el menor de sus hijos está estudiando aún y ella manifiesta que es su razón de vivir. Es una mujer muy sacrificada, proviene de una familia muy numerosa y de escasos recursos, no tuvo la oportunidad de terminar sus estudios ya que con tan solo 8 años empezó a trabajar con sus padres ayudando a su familia y demás hermanos. Margarita tiene una pequeña despensa en su domicilio desde hace 3 años, el mismo es uno de los negocios más concurridos de la zona. Los ingresos que obtiene con sus ventas los utiliza para pagar los estudios de su hijo.

Ella forma parte de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras denominado Mujeres Trabajadoras integrado por 20 mujeres que responden solidariamente por el préstamo. Solicita un préstamo de U$S 150 para ampliar su stock de mercaderías con la compra de fideos, harinas, galletitas, golosinas, carnes, etc.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for sale.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria, 59, is a single mother of 7 children who are, respectively, 37, 32, 31, 25, 23, 20 and 18 years old. All of her children make a living selling lottery tickets, work that she too has done for around 10 years. As a single mother, with many responsibilities, she had to face the difficult task of raising her children alone and necessity required that she go out and work. She never had a chance to finish school because she came from a poor family and from a very young age, she had to work to help her parents. She now works selling lottery tickets on the buses that go up and down the streets of the capital.

A neighbor introduced her to the Fundacion Paraguaya’s “Comite de Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Committee of Women Entrepeneurs) and she began to join the meetings of the Comite in her neighborhood. Thanks to the help that she gets from Fundacion loans, she can buy more lottery tickets for sale. She needs the loan to buy larger consignments of tickets so that she can get better margins and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

María tiene 59 años, es madre soltera de 7 hijos de 37, 32,31,25,23,20 y 18 años respectivamente. Todos sus hijos trabajan en la venta de cartones de juego de azar, actividad a la que ella también se dedica hace como 10 años. Desde muy joven se vió en la necesidad de tener que salir a la calle a trabajar ya que es madre soltera y con muchas responsabilidades debido a que debió afrontar sola la difícil tarea de criar a sus hijos. Proviene de una familia muy humilde, por tal motivo no pudo acceder a una educación escolar ya que desde muy joven se vió obligada a trabajar para ayudar a sus padres. Hoy día se dedica a la venta de cartones de juegos de azar en los colectivos que recorren las calles de la ciudad capital.

Por intermedio de una vecina se enteró del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya y comenzó a participar de las reuniones de un Comité de su barrio. Gracias a la ayuda que ella obtiene de los créditos emitidos por la Fundación puede comprar más cartones para vender. Necesita el crédito para comprar más cartones ya que cuando retira a consignación el margen de ganancias es inferior, en cambio cuando tiene la posibilidad de comprarlos obtiene mayores ganancias.

loans.use: Buy lottery tickets for re-sale.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria, 62, has been separated for 25 years. She says that of her two children, one is deceased and the other, a 33-year old daughter, is a teacher with whom she lives. She makes a living making cigars (that are similar to Cuban cigars), work that she’s been doing since she was 10 years old. She said that she learned the trade from her parents who taught her how to do it. Thanks to the income that she’s made from the production and sale of cigars, she was able to solve the problem of how to educate her daughter who is now a wonderful teacher. She also managed to build her own house and make it comfortable for them. This is a hard-working woman who had to sacrifice a lot when she separated and took on the job of educating her daughter alone.

She needs a loan to buy tobacco in bulk so that she can get discount pricing.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

María tiene 62 años, está separada hace 25 años. Comenta que tuvo dos hijos de los cuales uno falleció y le queda una sola hija de 33 años que es docente y que vive con ella. Se dedica a la fabricación de cigarros (parecidos a los habanos), actividad que lleva a cabo desde los 10 años de edad. Comenta que aprendió el oficio de sus padres que le enseñaron cómo hacerlo. Gracias a los ingresos que obtuvo con la fabricación y venta de dichos cigarros pudo solventar la educación de su única hija quien hoy en día es una flamante docente. También logró construir su casa propia y hacerse de comodidades. Se trata de una persona muy trabajadora y sacrificada ya que a raiz de su separación tuvo que hacer frente a la difícil tarea de educar sola a su hija.

Necesita de un préstamo para la compra de fardos de tabaco que consigue a menor precio si compra en grandes cantidades.

loans.use: Buy tobacco at discounted pricing.

loans.name: Máxima

texts.es:
Maxima R., 42, is separated and has 3 children who are, respectively, 20, 11 and 10 years old. The oldest of her children is a police officer who has worked in the capital for a year and helps her with household expenses. She says that thanks to her efforts and hard work, her daughter has been able to enter that profession.

Maxima has worked for more than 25 years selling “menudencias” (the internal organs—livers, intestines, hearts, etc.—of cattle and pigs that are widely consumed in the country) and she has a well-established customer base of around 30 people that buy from her daily along with other customers who buy from her occasionally. She works everyday, getting up very early and working until approximately 5 p.m. when she returns home. She works rain or shine. She’s very proud of her work and thanks to her income, she has been able to build her own house and to buy little luxuries like a television, stereo equipment, a freezer, etc.

She’s asking for the loan so that she can buy more merchandise because there have been days when she’s run short of stock to sell and she wants to ensure that she always has plenty to sell in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Máxima R. tiene 42 años, es separada , tiene 3 hijos de 20, 11 y 10 años respectivamente. La mayor de sus hijos es policía urbana y trabaja en la capital desde hace 1 años y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Comenta que gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo logró que su hija pueda acceder a dicha profesión.

Máxima se dedica hace más de 25 años a la venta de menudencias (son los órganos internos de vacas y cerdos como hígado, tripa, corazón, etc que son muy consumidos en el país), posee una clientela muy bien formada de aproximadamente 30 personas que le compran todos los días, además de otros clientes ocasionales. Trabaja todos los dias, se levanta muy temprano y está en su puesto de trabajo hasta las 17 hs. p.m. aproximadamente, hora en que emprende la vuelta a su hogar . No conoce de sol ni de días de lluvia. Está muy orgullosa de su trabajo ya que gracias a los ingresos que obtuvo con él pudo construir su casa propia y tener todas las comodidades del hogar como ser televisor, equipo de sonido, heladera, etc.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de más mercaderías debido a que hay días en que escasea y debe comprar de manera anticipada para tener siempre en stock.

loans.use: Buy stock for re-sale.

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.es:
Sra. Ricarda Sanchez, 50, has been married to Feliciano for 19 years and they have 4 children who are, respectively, 32, 26, 24 and 22 years old. The two oldest children are married and independent and the two youngest live with her and work to support the household along with her husband who works in a stone quarry in the city. She’s a woman who gave up a lot because she had to begin working at 15. She came from a poor family and decided to drop out of school and begin working so that she could help her parents.

For more than a year, she has worked selling “remedios refrescantes” (a traditional tonic) that are used in “terere” (a traditional herb-based drink) that is widely consumed in Paraguay. Hers is a precarious position but she’s a woman who doesn’t know weariness or illness because she’s been able to help her children get ahead with the help of her income and the unconditional support of her husband.

Ricarda is a member of a group of women called “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (Working Women) that is made up of 20 women who stand solidly behind the loan. She’s asking for a $200 loan that she plans to use to buy candy, soft drinks and food that she will sell along with her popular remedios refrescantes.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Ricarda tiene 50 años, está casada hace 19 años con Feliciano con quien tiene 4 hijos de 32, 26,24 y 22 años respectivamente. Los dos hijos mayores ya son casados e independientes y los dos menores viven con ella, ambos trabajan y aportan al hogar junto con su marido que se dedica a trabajar en una cantera (explotación de piedras) de la ciudad. Es una mujer muy sacrificada ya que empezó a trabajar a los 15 años, ya que provenía de una familia muy humilde y decidió dejar el colegio y empezar a trabajar para de esta forma ayudar a sus padres.

Desde hace más de un año trabaja vendiendo remedios refrescantes que son utilizados en el tereré que es una bebida fría muy consumida y tradicional del Paraguay. Tiene un precario puesto, es una mujer que no conoce de cansancio ni enfermedades ya que gracias a su trabajo y el apoyo incondicional de su marido pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Ricarda forma parte de un grupo de mujeres denominado Mujeres Trabajadoras, integrada por 20 mujeres que responden solidariamente por el préstamo. La Sra. Ricarda solicita un préstamo de U$S 200 pues planea vender caramelos, gaseosas y comestibles a la par de seguir vendiendo sus remedios refrescantes que tienen gran aceptación.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for re-sale.

loans.name: Ursina

texts.es:
Ursina, 43, is married to Fausto, a 46-year old construction worker. The couple have 8 children, the oldest of whom is 23 years old and the youngest, 5 years old. Ursina says sadly that her children were unable to continue their studies after high school because they couldn’t afford a university education and they had to look for jobs to support themselves.

Ursina owns a small grocery store that she operates in her house; she also earns income from a small food stand, selling traditional dishes, at a municipal market in the city of Ita. She only goes to the food stand on Saturdays, Sundays and holidays but she works at her grocery store everyday. Her husband, Fausto, helps her with household expenses with his earnings from construction jobs.

She says that she has always turned to lending for investments in her business. She invested the first loan that she managed to get in the construction of a small addition at the front of her house that she now uses for her grocery store. She needs a loan to buy merchandise—rice, sugar, oil, flour, cheese, etc—to better stock the store.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ursina tiene 43 años, está casada con Fausto que tiene 46 años y es constructor. La pareja tiene 8 hijos, el mayor de todos tiene 23 años y el menor 5 años. Ursina comenta con tristeza que una vez que sus hijos terminan la secundaria ya dejan de estudiar, debido a la imposibilidad de costear los estudios universitarios por lo que deben buscar una profesión con la que puedan mantenerse.

Ursina posee una despensa que funciona en su casa propia, además cuenta con un pequeño puesto de venta de comidas típicas en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Itá. A dicho puesto solamente va los dias Sábados y domingo y los días feriados, mientras que en su despensa atiende todos los días. Su esposo Fausto le ayuda con los ingresos del hogar aportando con las ganancias que obtiene en su trabajo como constructor.

Comenta que siempre recurrió a los préstamos para invertirlos en su negocio, el primer crédito al que logró acceder lo invirtió en la construcción de una pequeña casilla frente a su casa, en dicha casilla funciona su despensa. Necesita de un préstamo para comprar más mercaderías como : arroz, azúcar, aceite, harina, queso, etc. a fin de surtir mejor su negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for re-sale.

loans.name: Virila

texts.es:
Virila, 46, has been happily married to Nelson Acosta, 52, for 27 years. He works installing antenna towers for cellular telephone service. The couple had 4 children. Virila says sadly that one of them died after a long and painful illness from which the child suffered for almost two years. Because of this situation and because her husband didn’t have a steady income then, she had to go out to sell empanadas door to door. The work gave her the opportunity to meet lots of people and, as a consequence, she was able to get a place for a canteen at a local school. She’s been building the business for 6 years.

She’s always turned to loans to buy the things she needs for the canteen: a stove, microwaves, a refrigerator, etc. These appliances are basic to her daily work. On this occasion, the loan will be invested in buying a freezer that costs $300 if paid in cash.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Virila tiene 46 años, está felizmente casada hace 27 años con Nelson Acosta quien tiene 52 años. Su esposo se dedica a montar torres de antenas para telefonía celular. El matrimonio tuvo 4 hijos y Virila comenta con tristeza que uno de ellos falleció a causa de una larga y penosa enfermedad que lo tuvo postrado por casi dos años. Debido a esta situación y a que los ingresos de su esposo no eran muy constantes en ese entonces, ella tuvo que salir a vender empanadas casa por casa. Este oficio le dió la oportunidad de conocer a mucha gente y fue así que consiguió ubicarse como cantinera en una escuela de su comunidad. Hace 6 años que desarrolla dicha actividad.

Siempre recurrió a los préstamos para ir adquiriendo principalmente elementos de trabajo tales como: cocina, microondas, heladera, etc. Estos electrodomésticos son fundamentales en su trabajo diario. En esta oportunidad el crédito será invertido en la compra de una congeladora cuyo costo en el mercado es de U$S 300 al contado.

loans.use: Buy a freezer for canteen business.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Mrs. Suon P. is 42 years old and lives with her ailing husband and seven children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To supplement her household, Suon P. works very hard in a garment factory, and earns around $3 each day. Two of her children are employed at a garment factory and generally make $100 each month. Her other chilren attend school.

Mrs. Suon P. humbly requests a loan of $300 to purchase pigs to breed and sell for additional income.

loans.use: Purchase pigs to breed

loans.name: Meak

texts.en:
Mrs. Meak S. is a 40-year-old mother of 3 children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Mrs. Meak Saron works in a theatre as an actress, and earns around $1 each day. Her husband works as a policeman and typically makes about $1.50 a day.

Mrs. S. will use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband, so he can work part-time as a taxi driver to generate more income.

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle to operate a business.

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Mrs. Lun K. L. is 25 years old, married with 1 child. She lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, and works at a garment factory, earning around $6 each day. Her husband works for a private company as a security guard and typically earns $1 to $2 each day.

Mrs. Lun K. L.' s husband would like to start a taxi service in their area. Mrs. L. requests a loan of $1000 to purchase a car so her husband can start a taxi service.

loans.use: Purchase a simple car to start a taxi service.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Your Kiva loan has been paid back ahead of time.

Thanks to your support of entrepreneurs like Lun Kim Leang, small businesses around the world have access to low-interest loans that are used to help their business.

We hope you will continue loaning through Kiva and CREDIT MFI.

Best regards,
Isadora Tang
Kiva Fellow,
Cambodia

loans.name: Sildus

texts.en: Mr. A. is a vulnerable low income young man. He is single and lives with his parents in the village of Saatli town of the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Sildus has four cows already but income from them is not enough to make investments in his business. That’s why he decided to apply for a $500 loan. Sildus will add some of his own money to this amount to renovate his cattle shed completely.

loans.use: Mr. Ahadov would like to renovate his cattle shed.

loans.name: Hafiz

texts.en: Mr. K. is a low income vulnerable person. He is 46, married with two children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Hafiz sells milk in the Saatli town. The income from the two cows he has is too low to support the family. That’s why he applied for a $500 loan to buy one more pure-breed cow to make his monthly income higher. In the Caucasus region the price of a good cow is about $800-1000 USD. But Hafiz has some of his own money to contribute.

loans.use: Hafiz would like to buy a pedigree cow to sell its milk.

loans.name: Mohlat

texts.en: Mr. K. is a low income vulnerable young man. He is 23, single and lives with his parents in the village of Saatli town of the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Mohlat has two pedigree calfs to breed and then sell but income from them is too low to support his family. That’s why he decided to apply  for a $500 loan to buy two pure-breed calfs to make his monthly income higher. In the Caucasus region the price of a good calf is $250-300 USD. In half a year Mohlat intends to sell the breeded cows for $1000 USD each.

loans.use: Mohlat would like to buy two calfs to breed.

loans.name: Imran

texts.en: Mr. K. is a low income vulnerable person. He is 42, married with two children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Imran has 14 years of  experience in this business. He serves clients in his barber shop with higher quality than other barbers in the area. But this business demands investments from time to time to modernize equipment to deal with hard competition. That’s why Imran applied for a $500 loan to buy an arm chair which prices vary from $300-500 USD.

loans.use: Imran would like to renovate his barber shop.

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en: Mr. B. is a low income vulnerable person. He is 51, married with four children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Shahin sells milk to the Saatli people and local milk processing factory. The income from one cow is too low to support the family. That’s why Shahin applied for a $400 loan to buy one more pure-breed cow to make his monthly income higher. In the Caucasus region the price of good cow is about $800-1000 USD. But Shahin has some of his own money to contribute as well.

loans.use: Shahin would like to buy one more pedigree cow to sell its milk.

loans.name: Tob

texts.en:
Mrs. Tob C. works selling vegetable at an open-air market and earns an average of $2.50 each day. Her husband works as a tailor and generally makes around $ 6.50 a day.

She is 43 years old and has three children. Three of her children are married and live separately from them.

Mrs. Tob C. wants to use this loan to add a greater variety of vegetables to meet the growing demands of her customers. She will also use some of the loan to repair her house.

loans.use: Expand the variety of vegetables to meet the growing demands of her customers.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Mrs. Nila S., 27 years old, lives in Bholdhoka, Lalitpur.  She lives in a joint family household with her father-in-law, mother- in-law, her husband, sister-in law, brother-in law and a daughter.  The economic condition of her family is very weak.  They are unable even to fulfill the basic needs of her family and can't provide better education for her daughter.

Her husband, Suresh S., is a driver for a private office and her daughter is studying in grade 6.

Mrs. S. opened her vegetable shop one year before to improve the living standards of her family.  Now she seeks $150 to buy more vegetables for her shop.
 
Her family's economic condition is very poor, so Mrs Nila would like to grow her business continually and uplift the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for her shop
